review_text: As soon as you step inside, you‚Äôre enveloped in a warm welcome! The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between modern flair and a sultry vibe that instantly captivates you. Each dish that arrives is an explosion of flavor, with every course surpassing the last in deliciousness. The service? Absolutely phenomenal! The team moves with impeccable harmony, making every moment of your experience truly unforgettable.

If you can afford the place, it is well worth it. Located inside the Urban hotel, the restaurant looks very modern and is very stark, with concrete and wood paneled walls and tiles on the floor and not much decor overall. To be honest, this is not a romantic place to take a loved one to a quiet meal, as the dinner is basically a show that will require all your attention and senses. But what a show it is! We picked an 11-course meal, which was delivered by three very knowledgeable and attentive waiters over two and a half hours. It would be too long to describe every dish, so I'm posting the menu with the photos. While some dishes were better than others, none were bad and all were impressively tasty and amazingly good. Great job Yassin et al. We had a fantastic evening.
The CEBO offers excellent creative and yet ‚ÄúSpanish‚Äù food which truly deserves the Michelin star. All of the dishes have these subtle and warm flavors which make you happy.

Amazing experience. We had the 16 course tasting menu and it was an absolute treat. Endless wonderfully crafted plates, explained with passion. The chef presented one to us too. Paired wines are excellent. Incredible service. Really enjoyable experience.

When in Madrid. That‚Äôs me, I‚Äôm in Madrid. Great little spot i found online. Great atmosphere, makes you feel like you‚Äôre a local. Food was decent. Great portions. Got some beef thing that was really good and crunchy. The goat cheese was fabulous. Overall, the tapas were good, not outstanding but solid. Could totally see this as a great spot for friends to go to have a chill afternoon or drinks at night. Was pretty tired after a flight when I was here so keep that in mind. Madrid!

An Amazing Little Hidden Spot, I Highly Recommend You Go Here They Don't Make Your Usual Tapas Its Creative Exciting And Overall Incredible Value. How This Place Is Not Got Huge Cues I Don't No. We Had To Wait Around Only 15mins. The Team Are Incredible And Make You Feel So Welcome. I Highly Recommend The Cod With Prawns I credible Mouth Watering Dish, Also The Corn Squid So So Tasty And A Must. I Had 4 Dishes To Share And It Was The Perfect Amount I Could Have Tried There Entire Menu. I Can't Wait To Come Back. Also Don't Leave Without Trying There Sangria White & Red. Service Is Amazing And A Credit To Madrid.

One of our favorite spots in Madrid. Everything is just right here, from the friendly welcome and service to the cuisine. The staff really put their hearts into looking after the well-being of the guests. Something that can no longer be taken for granted today. We are already longing for our next visit.

Amazing food and a good variety of uniquely cooked dishes. Very distinct from other restaurants we‚Äôve been to. The slow cooked pork cheek was the highlight of the lunch, whereas the salad was sweeter than we expected.

Super yummy food with a very hospitable restaurant owner/chef. You're welcomed with a warm smile from the host and even warmer and fresh bread. They have a lot of vegetarian options and each dish is cooked and presented to perfection. If you're in Madrid or plan to visit, highly recommend you should try this restaurant for at least one of your meals.
Great food in central Madrid. The meat was really good. The staff was welcoming and helpful. I would recommend this place.
a super restaurant! from the atmosphere to the food! everything is super good and of high quality. the staff is extremely friendly! it's totally worth going!

I go with my husband and son to dine last Saturday.  Raquel and her team is really nice, warm and considerate.  We deeply appreciate their service level such as replaced all our dishes for every dish to ensure we can enjoy the best taste of each dish.  What are wonderful night we have in Madrid!  Thank you all of you and of course the food is high value to their price.

Hidden gem! I had the tenderloin special that was fantastic. Super cute restaurant and the staff was so sweet and kind. It was also nice that it was just half a block off the rowdy main restaurant street and able to have an upscale feel vs the crowded and chaotic places on the other street.

This bar will be in the top 50 bar in the world soon. Their cocktail program is really innovative and blends nature, terroir locale and custom liquor in a candidly simple but extracting complex flavors. Pretty phenomenal job by their team. My only suggestion to this phenomenal team and place would be to absolutely work on their ambience - I mean the interior vibe and furnishings they need to reflect their superior craft and thoughtfulness as well as playfulness, which doesn‚Äôt come through - if they do this they will be soon at the top of the world. All the best to you guys you are phenomenal and it was an absolute pleasure to experience your craft. Absolutely loved it

A place I would describe chic and cozy with a great selection of (small) dishes, well balanced and unusual. We ordered the ratatouille (absolutely delicious), the octopus curry (same), the potato salad and taco. We closed with a cheese plateau. The service wt the table was impeccable. The cocktails and the wine surprised us with the unusual mixed and quality. On Friday evening was not that busy. Great light and materials use in the interior. Nice attention to details (furniture, cutlery, dishes). Worth another visit when we are in Madrid.

user_id: As the first restaurant in this successful chain
restaurant_id: Rosi La Loca is small but mighty
rating: boasting fantastic food
review_text: a lively ambiance
date: and creative drinks. The dishes are served on unique
source_user_name: out-of-the-box plates that look just as incredible as they taste.

review_text: This very unique Alice in Wonderland-themed restaurant is bursting with charm and creativity. It took us several attempts to secure a reservation, but it was absolutely worth it. The place is incredibly cool, fun, and vibrant. The service is outstanding‚Äîtruly exceptional‚Äîwith super friendly staff and entertaining presentations. The food is delicious; We tried the squid, rice, and feta salad. This lively spot is definitely a must-visit, so be sure to make a reservation in advance.

The decoration is so cool that I honestly thought it might be just another tourist trap, but the food turned out to be really delicious & beautifully presented. I Love how they add their own touch to every item on the menu, plates that you might have had in  other places before feel different. The service is also great & the waiters are so attentive and nice.

One of the most unique restaurants I have ever been to. It is a full package, from start to finish. Really unique atmosphere and menu. Although the menu had a select number of options, they were all unique and tasted great (we tried the tortilla, bravas, croquetes, gyoza). I would also recommend the cocktails! The prices were also fair for the portion sizes and quality. Overall, a must-try place in Madrid ü§ó
Perfect meal to end our trip in Madrid. Everything is just right.  Ribs and steak are juicy. Prawn is cooked at the perfect time. I am totally recommend the place. the bread is also good.
Nice place üëå nice food nice staff. Sadly I couldn't eat much as heat was horrible outside and I go off food, but my friend did and said it was super yummy. I only had a ceviche and it was so good.

Amazing!! The dishes have a wonderful mix of flavors. We got the meatballs with almond sauce which was very unique, and the fish was very light and tasty. The service was also excellent. So friendly and welcoming to us as foreigners. Highly recommend!!

What a wonderful place!! I regularly visit Madrid for work and will make sure this is my regular go to! The atmosphere is so vibrant, warm and fun. The staff are the friendliest people, they will go above and beyond for you. The food is simply flawless. Well executed dishes with exceptional flavour. This restaurant is the hidden gem of Madrid!
Excellent food, buzzy location. The paella and scallops were the best, followed closely by the Han croquettes. Jose was our server and took good care of us. Would highly recommend!

Que guay. No clue if I spelled that correct. Raining pretty hard and found this spot. Was pretty tired, almost fell asleep on their couch.  Ordered some food. The food was alright to be honest. It was good, don‚Äôt get me wrong, but I wasn‚Äôt super impressed. The meat was pretty chewy but some of the dishes like the shrimp dish I had were solid. Paia, the dish with seafood, also have no clue if I spelled that right, was solid. First time I had that dish in Spain. Great atmosphere. Overall, great atmosphere but mediocre food. Give it a 5.8 which means 2.9 so practically 3 stars.

Best tapas place I‚Äòve been to so far! The waiters were very friendly and quick with the service. We ordered the pimentos, baby squid with salad, patatas bravas and the pan-fried eggplant. Everything was delicious and fairly priced. The chocolate cake was also very good. It has a great atmosphere with lots of film posters hanging on the walls. I recommend this place!
Loved this restaurant! We discovered it on our last day in Madrid and loved the food and service. They were also kind enough to give us 4 free shots which were delicious. Highly highly recommend!

Excellent food and service. Nice atmosphere. We went early 7.30pm and no wait. We paid ‚Ç¨55 and had a lot of food. Will definitely come back soon! The torrijas for dessert were delicious. Calamares were nice (full plate). Tomato salad was not good. Quality of the tomato üçÖ needs to improve.
The best tapas restaurant so far tried in Madrid. Got gifted Torrija quemada, is very tasty. Next time going to Madrid will revisit this restaurant again!!
Located in the heart of Madrid, this restaurant is serving a good selection of meat. We ordered picanha, the food was good, but not wooow. The service is friendly.
Flor was awesome! Recommended to have my steak medium well vs. well done and it did not disappoint! Best steak we‚Äôve had so far in Spain.

What a restaurant! The best one we could find in Madrid. Lovely staff and the food is just unbelievable how good it is. We paid ‚Ç¨16,90 for empanadas as a starter, steak, chips, dessert and one drink (beer, wine or soft drink). At the heart of Madrid. Couldn't recommend it enough.

The set meal was a hit and miss. The chicken empanada was good but the flank beef was not great. Tasted a bit bland on the inside. The chicken Caesar salad was amazing though. The portion was big and the chicken was pretty delicious and tender. Definitely get the chicken over the beef. Service was quite average.
nice food, perfect location and great service.I am very satisfied.

We went there two times. The first time we had only drinks which where so good that we had to come back and try the food. Both times everything was amazing and the food lived up to our expectations. The place pays attentions to both taste and presentation. Each member of the staff was attentive and helpful. A must if you are a fan of cocktails. We will certainly come back to our next visit to Madrid! (Friendly advise: if you would like to eat there it is wise to make a reservation in advance since it is busy almost every day)

Went for dinner on a whim with my father. Best meal in Spain. The service was amazing, possibly the best we‚Äôve ever had ever haha. Angie our waitress was amazing and really helped us with recommendations! So pleasant and welcoming. The food was second to none. Come hungry, because you‚Äôll want to try everything on the menu. Super impressed and if we are ever back in Madrid we will make a mad dash to this restaurant first thing. Thank you to Angie and the staff!

Excellent Spanish restaurant serving all the classics. Iberian ham, paella, blood pudding sausage, various cuts of cured beef/pork all on the menu. Sangria was on the expensive side but was very good. Service was quite attentive and wait time was great.

This restaurant is a must in Madrid! Food was spectacular. We arrived without a reservation at 8pm and they made some accommodations for us. Juanjo, our waiter, was exceptionally great with recommendations and always so charming. The food quality was excellent. We had the tomatoes and the ham for starters as well as the veal for dinner. You do not want to miss this place. Put it on your list!!!

It is absolutely a hidden gem, I tried their tasting menu and every dishes was great, especially the smoked suckling pig, its the best I had in Spain! Staff are very engaging and will explain every dishes, with perfect English as well! Overall I enjoyed the dinner very much! It costs ¬£50 which is a great deal!

This is our second visit and somewhere we will ensure we visit every time! The value, quality and experience is outstanding! A highly recommended restaurant if your looking for top class service the head chef always comes to visit your table and his vision for his menu is so on point highly recommend the stake, burger and prawns from hell! The wine list is well thought out but we recommend one of the magnums of red wine if in a group of 4! The atmosphere is lovely decorated with local art and ornaments.

great restaurant! very tasty and very fast, which is rare for Madrid! waiter Vincent is a very cool guy! I advise everyone to go here! we were delighted with the cuisine and the level of the restaurant! the staff is superüëçüëç shrimp with garlic is a masterpiece!üí™

Best Ribeye in Europe! Being a boy from Texas, and living in Europe it‚Äôs hard to find a real steak except when in Madrid. Pampa Beef is the best I have had! Perfect size and cook. The staff are amazing! My favorite place in all of Europe. Come get a steak and sleep like a baby!

Incredible ribeye at an incredible price.   The steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly.  Better than most expensive steakhouse I go to in Silicon Valley, California.  And Ramses service was excellent.    Recommend this place highly

I really liked the Iberian pork quesadilla, it  was amazing! Also really filling, so it's more than enough as a main course. The people working here were really nice and helpful. They had an English menu and could speak it very well, which came in handy for us, who can't speak Spanish. The atmosphere is also really nice, one of the best places I've eaten this vacation!
Excellent food, fun atmosphere; even vegan options!  Wow water a great suprise as we were walking home from a day at the Museum.

Fantastic spot for authentic Mexican food with unbeatable quality and prices! Every dish is packed with flavor, and the portions are generous without breaking the bank. The best part? You can leave your mark by writing on the walls, adding to the restaurant‚Äôs fun, vibrant atmosphere. Perfect for great food and a unique experience!

Nice atmosphere and tasty food. Portions are a little bit small though. Recomended for a casual evening with drinks and something to eat. On the tables are small QR codes, through them they ask you to leave review, spin the wheel and see your gift. In order to spin the wheel they ask you for your name, mail and phone number, but remember that when you spin a wheel there is always a possibility to not win anything!!!

Excellent food, is nicely served. The taste of every dish is perfect matching and exactly how it has to be. Some dishes we even had to repeat. Highly recommended restaurant üëå Obviously Michelin recommended because it is worth it üëå

A must visit while in Madrid! The birria was some of the best I have had and the soft shell crab with the sweet and sour (vinegar, something sweet, habanero) was exquisite. Service was fast and super attentive. Make sure to reserve and confirm with the restaurant.

An incredibly stylish place, with courteous, polite, and very nice staff that really like after you. The food is sophisticated and complex, yet simple and tasty, with prime ingredients that shine through each dish. We had the wagyu sirloin carpaccio, the Kampachi, the pork belly, the octopus and the shrimps plus 2 cocktails to start with, the Venenosa and the other ( I forgot its name ) was a Mexican take on a Negroni. Both excellent! We had a nice Godello to accompany our food, and a divine chocolate cake with mescal at the end ! They also have a great rooftop bar, and that is also a marvellous space that needs to be seen and experienced! I highly recommend it!

This was my second time here and it was amazing. They cater to gluten free diet restrictions and the gluten free bread is fabulous. I did not feel like I was settling by having a gluten free meal. The service is amazing and the atmosphere is beautiful. The food is well prepared and thoughtful.

Fantastic French restaurant. One of the best beef Wellington I've ever eaten. This has to be booked in advance 2 days before. Also good wine choice. A must if you're visiting Madrid. Can't wait to go again next time we are in Madrid.

Delicious French food at Bistroman. Interior design is beautiful and service is friendly. Favourite dishes were the duck breast and the escargot. Cr√®me brule here is awesome. Recommend for special occasions
The best French cuisine in Madrid, every dish as an art. And thanks to the restaurant to made our day is the best day ever! Favorite place in Spain and always return ‚ô•Ô∏è recommend 100%
Cool place to make a stop and have a drink, they do carry their own local wine which is good to try, you can also get a table inside although the place is fairly small.

Stopped by for a quick bite. Ordered the starters plate, with different meats and nice cheese. Decent prices for the location. 4 stars on food because the bread was on the hard side and one of the meats wasn't tasty enough in our opinion.

Very good food, very nice service as well. It's a traditional bar, with some hearty food and good wines as well. Portions are relatively large, so you can take half portions when available! Good for a big lunch, but you might go into a food coma after the amount of food and how heavy it can be! Decor is nice as well, really fits the style of the bar

Hands down, the best burger we‚Äôve ever had! From the perfectly seasoned patty to the fresh toppings and toasted bun, every bite was incredible. The flavors were perfectly balanced, and you can tell they use high-quality ingredients. On top of that, the service was friendly, and the atmosphere made the experience even better. If you‚Äôre a burger lover, this place is a must-visit! They even gave us free glasses of prosecco on Valentines day üíò‚≠êÔ∏è

My steak burger experience was pleasant. Vicente y Dennis did such a great job helping us throughout the night and making sure we were satisfied with everything we ordered. Would totally recommend to anyone looking for great Spanish drinks, steaks meals, and a good ambiance.

Very cool and nice burger restaurant. They serve different types of burgers. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. The atmosphere is great. The food are very delicious and very tasty. Special thanks for our hostage Vicente. He was really nice and helpful with his advice and recommendations.

The burger was absolutely delicious, cooked perfectly with a great balance of flavors. The service made the experience even better Abdellah was incredibly kind, attentive, and ensured everything was just right. A great spot for a satisfying meal!

What a great experience.   We ordered the 16.50‚Ç¨ platter.  Everything was great!   Everyone ordered a different option so it gave us a sample of the restaurants offerings.  Glass of house wine included.   One of our best meals on this trip.

The chorizo sausage was tasty but the grilled chicken was fatty and greasy. Fries were also greasy and they were thin style. Wait for food was quite long even though the restaurant was almost empty. I‚Äôm sure that the rice pudding was not homemade, straight out of a can. I ordered separate items and realised later that I had basically ordered the set meal, and then I noticed my meal was exactly the same as a person sat next to me, the same size portion, but they had ordered the set meal. When paying the bill the waiter tried to argue that mine was bigger but it wasn‚Äôt true. I could have ordered two set meals and had double the amount of food for almost the same price that I paid (‚Ç¨29.90 vs 2x‚Ç¨16.50). Won‚Äôt be back, low equality food and low quality service. Not recommended

We had dinner here two nights ago. We ordered the Tomahawk steak and shared it between 4 people. They bring a little barbecue to the table and you cook the meat to your liking. Really good concept. Steak was delicious and I think for that size, it is really good value for money. Highly recommended!

Wow, the fried cod fish was fantastic! Prices was ‚Ç¨1.90 per piece. There is always a line but it went quickly. You can dine in but have to queue at another line which is different from the takeout. We also had the Croquette which was good too. Overall, it is worth the short wait.

The queue was insanely long to get into this place and once you get in you will understand why. The fresh cod was truly amazing, so flavorful and the fish croquettes were similar too. The staff are so lovely here too. Definitely go and try it.

The food here is really good‚Äîflavorful and fresh, with adequate prices that make it worth every penny. The staff is friendly and welcoming, which added to the pleasant experience. However, I'm giving one star less because we had to wait a bit too long to get the menu, even though the place wasn‚Äôt busy at the time, cutlery was missing. Despite that, I would still highly recommend this restaurant
Decor and atmosphere are amazing in the evening. Selection the drinks is mediocre. Selection of the food is good and food looks great but the taste is just ok.

The ambiance of the restaurant is amazing, with plenty of tables on the terrace. We waited over 10 minutes to be seated, despite having a reservation. The menu offers 12 starters, but 3 of the items we wanted to order were unavailable. The oxtail risotto was delicious, but the rice was inconsistently cooked, with some grains fully done while others remained crunchy. The lemon pie was really tasty.
A very family like restaurant with traditional Spanish food, the owner told introduced very detailed recipes and origin of each cuisine.

This place is a gem! Such flavorful homemade food. It was a very enjoyable and fun experience getting to try dishes from the castilla la mancha region of spain, that I had never been exposed to before, living in Madrid. We especially enjoyed the morteruelo, pisto and migas del pastor. The price is fair for the amount of food you get to try. You‚Äôll walk out stuffed.

This a ver special place. Few table. Lot of people that want to go in. The deal is a travel in the marchera typical cuisine. But also the travel in the history of cooking. The many can look not fancy but the taste is very good. Each meal goes with a lot of history. Lunch was 2.5h. Wine was excellent. This is a must to do.
Nice pub with good food and a chilled ambient. The waiter from Venezuela is a very nice guy and brings amazing energy to the place. Food is good, price is too. Nothing memorable as a restaurant. 7/10

Incredible meal! Everything was delicious- the tortilla, garlic prawn, the pork, croquetas and padron peppers. And the service was excellent!! 5 stars. Virgilio really took good care of us. We will be back!

The restaurant, located near Plaza Mayor, offers a fantastic spot with a lively atmosphere. It‚Äôs a popular place, The food was enjoyable, although there was a slight hiccup when my husband‚Äôs order was unavailable‚Äîunfortunately, this was communicated 20 minutes later. Despite this, it‚Äôs worth visiting for the vibrant ambiance and the experience!

The atmosphere in the restaurant was very pleasant. The restaurant is really big and has a lot of seats, but during dinner everything was full. The food is very tasty, we ate paella. However, we ordered a salad that was completely tasteless. They charged us 12 euros. for that salad. I have all the praise for the staff and regardless of the salad, I recommend that you come.

We visited Spain for the first time and wanted to find amazing culinary experiences that weren't just tourist traps that were famous because of social media. We had this on our first day and it was so good that it was hard for others to compare. Each dish was unique and their use of different ingredients was truly inspired, as each element of the dish came together to form a single extremely deep flavor. Everything was so good that we could never choose a favorite. We were so impressed that so much food of such a high caliber was prepared by only 3 chefs in a tiny kitchen. We asked for wine recommendations and loved all of them. Service was very friendly and prompt in general. Comparte really provided an amazing experience for us.

Fantastic neighborhood Bistro with impeccable technique, great food and value for money. I was afraid the 9 course tasting menu would be too much for one person but it was just right. I was lucky to get a seat at the counter so I could see the "dance" in the kitchen. Make sure you make a reservation!

We had a 9 course tasting menu and it was extremely nice. We also had expert advice from the sommelier who advised on an excellent Palomino, and that really accompanied our tasting menu very well. The quality of everything was excellent. The only dish of the 9 courses that I personally did not like was the Topinambur. In my opinion this dish did not do anything special at all, and it was not up to par with all the other delicious dishes that we had( special mention to the Steak Tartary, the Albondiga de Pato, the pulpo asado, and the Molleja with beurre blanch, all outstanding !). The prices are very low for this type of restaurant , so it is worth booking in advance and go! And next time I will have the 11 dishes tasting menu !

This has to be one of my favourite restaurants in Madrid. Great favourite with the locals too. For me it's the Cocido Madrile√±o stew that brings me back again and again, but the tripe (callos) and the bean stew (fabada asturiana) and the wines(!) are all wonderful. Great atmosphere and not expensive.
Opp's, we went to the wrong restaurant!   No regrets!  Food and service was excellent.  Portion sizes were HUGE!  We ordered far to much!  Everything exceeded our expectations.

Good location and service. The food amount is great too. We ordered two dishes, stew beef tail and triple Madrid, one tomato salad. It turned out to be very full for us. The ox tail is soft. The triple Madrid is a mixture of beef and beef stomach.
The owner is quite THE character! üëçüèª. Always in a good vibe. The food was delicious. I had the cocido madrile√±o. Table next to mine had the Huevos Rotos. Will come back.

ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! The reviews were not lying about this place it was spectacular. The pasta is just what we were craving and we loved that we were able to create it ourselves. The service was also incredible. Sara, was great and she provided us with wine options and took very good care of us. I also loved the aesthetic and atmosphere of the restaurant. Really wonderful place. Highly recommend in Madrid!

Loved this place! The food was absolutely delicious and more or less reasonably priced, except for the 2,95‚Ç¨ for fresh Parmesan. The waitress was super nice and friendly. The atmosphere is cozy, perfect for a date night or small get together with friends. They don‚Äôt sit more than 4 people so keep that in mind, and also make sure you make a reservation! Almost impossible to walk in. Micaela and Noa.

This place had an incredible concept of you choosing how and what your pasta should be made of. The choices are great, our waiters was very helpful and the food was really enjoyable. Also everything tasted fresh. If you‚Äôre nearby it‚Äôs definitely one to go for.

A must-try restaurant at the Center of Madrid. Food are well-presented and delicious! Instagram able place and the staff led by Oscar are so accommodating. Look at the photos below! They are so appetizing. Definitely, will come back!

I really wonder why this place has such a high rating. The restaurant is really good, but I can‚Äôt say it‚Äôs fantastic. The service was great, we liked the wine list, but in general it‚Äôs very touristic and overpriced. Their special is meat variety, and I tried better meat before for better price. The bread, eggplant and artichokes were delicious.
Their paella is so generous with seafood. Every scoop surely has a lot of meat in it. The ambiece is 10/10 and the staff were all amazing!
This was a very good experience. Prices are very reasonable, portions were big, food was good, staff was very friendly and attentive.

Nice restaurant around the old town. The service is good, the waiters don't speak English but do their best to communicate with customers. The paella marinera is very good. The meat for two is ok, the meat is slightly chewy. The is even enough for three persons. The menu is in English and Spanish.

nice restaurant and environment; was there for lunch time; i was not impressed by the food; i tried the paella, which look rewarmed and not that fresh. The schrimps were overcooked. Beer was fresh and Service was ok.

Completely scammed by the good comment. Not fully occupied at the dinner time and majority are foreign tourist. The skirt steak was completely awful, can't even chew and many tendons to be broken. It seems that it has been a problem for so many years. The free Iberian ham and the fries were okay as they do not require techniques to cook. The beef was totally a disaster.

A small yet hidden gem kind of place on Madrid. We had the best Sangria (so far) and a delicious pallela de mariscas. The staff was friendly and welcome. I highly recommend if you are willing to feel the real taste deal in Madrid.

This place is an absolute gem! The highlight of the menu is their salmon and avocado tartare ‚Äì fresh, flavorful, and perfectly balanced. The presentation was stunning, and every bite melted in my mouth. The atmosphere is cozy yet sophisticated, making it a great spot for both casual and special occasions. The staff was attentive and friendly, ensuring a seamless dining experience. If you‚Äôre a fan of high-quality ingredients and creative dishes, this is a must-visit. Highly recommended

This turned out to be my favourite place for my trip to Madrid. Came here first for dinner and a few days later for lunch. Had excellent food choices both times. Their Sangria probably looked and tasted the best amongst all that I had. Their Prawn Risotto really sets the bar and there is a good chance I may have to live with poorer tasting Prawn Risotto the rest of my life, unless I return. The baby squids are a must.

This delightful Spanish restaurant offers an amazing dining experience. The food is simply incredible, and the customer service is top-notch! Although the restaurant is small and can get crowded, we were fortunate enough to be seated quickly once it was our turn. Despite the initial wait, our order arrived promptly, making our dining experience even more enjoyable.
Amazing place, great food! Bacala con tomate is my fave. Ordered it three times in four day stay in Madrid. Vine was great also!
Everything was perfect. The food was deliciously seasoned with generous portions. Affordable prices, good atmosphere, kind staff. Best meal I've had so far in Madrid!

This is our first time in Madrid and our last day. From all restaurants that we have been, this is the best one so far: food was delicious, good price, and good service. I wish I could come here every week.

We tried to come here on a Friday evening around 9pm but left after 20 min. We then tried again at 12.30 on Sunday and were able to get a table at the bar area quickly. The croquettes, callaos, and Russian salad were delicious and full of flavor. But the snail dish was overly salted. Still it was a great experience eating at a restaurant with so much history.

We had our first dinner here and enjoyed the great food. The service was awesome too and they made us feel welcome. They made good recommendations for the food. We will definitely come back for another round. We had to wait a bit to get a table but it was definitely worth it!

Casa Alberto is a historic bar and restaurant since 1827. I was recommended to visit this place. The restaurant is beautiful. However the service is VERY VERY ULTRA BAD. The worst in the world. I asked the waiter for recommended food to eat, he just ignore me, and asked me to choose anything. Very rude attitude and racist. I ordered the pepper with shrimp and cod topas, it was good. I also ordered the veal meat balls but very disappointed. The meat balls are dried and not tasty. I will not go back there to waste my money
A must-go restaurant in the center of Madrid! The service was great and the food was very delicious!!! Very traditional flavors!
Super delicious! A friendly restaurant offer great food and drinks! Fresh draft beer and nice Sangria!!!

A fantastic Spanish restaurant! The squid was especially delicious, and the sangria was absolutely amazing. Interestingly, we ordered two glasses, and they tasted slightly different‚Äîone had a more tangy flavor. The service was fast and friendly, and the food arrived quickly. We don‚Äôt speak Spanish, but the staff were very patient and kindly waited for us to translate. Highly recommended!

user_id: I recently dined here and had a generally pleasant experience
restaurant_id: but with one major letdown. The ambiance was cozy
rating: the service was friendly
review_text: and most of the food was enjoyable
date: especially the empanadas and the Old Fashioned. The empanadas were perfectly flaky and packed with flavor
source_user_name: and the Old Fashioned was expertly crafted with just the right balance of smoothness and warmth.

user_id: However
restaurant_id: the real disappointment was the paella. I had high expectations for this dish
rating: but it fell far short. The flavors were bland
review_text: and the texture was off
date: lacking the rich depth and vibrant seasoning that make a good paella stand out. It was surprising
source_user_name: especially considering how well the other dishes were prepared.

review_text: Wait staff is a bit rushed but don't take it personally, they just have a lot to do... Food is worth the effort to find this place. I ordered the oxtail and my wife got the lamb off the set menu. Holy geez... Everything was great and the price was great too! (17 euros for her set: seafood paella to start, lamb steak then chocolate mousse). We're going back to Madrid in a few days and we'll be going here again.

This place was recommended by my hotel. Great food and the price was inexpensive! I had their menu of the day and it was amazing! I was served with first course, second course, a bottle of soda and homemade cheesecake! All for 20‚Ç¨.

Fatigas del Querer offers a vibrant atmosphere with traditional Spanish vibes, but my experience was mixed. The tomato soup was quite unusual, with a tangy taste that felt more like it was made from sour tomatoes rather than fresh ones, which wasn‚Äôt to my liking. On the bright side, the jam√≥n was excellent ‚Äì rich in flavor and perfectly prepared. The staff was friendly, and the ambiance was enjoyable, but the food quality varied. Worth a visit, but choose your dishes wisely.

This place does not quite justify its high rating. The food is average, though the portions are generous. The prices are quite high‚Äî‚Ç¨29 for octopus seems excessive. The staff is very attentive, and the service is excellent, but there is room for improvement in the kitchen.

Very good Restaurant! I had the flank steak with salad for 18‚Ç¨ + coke for 21.50‚Ç¨. It was very delicious and the team is very friendly and gives positive vibes. The steak was cooked well and the salad included beetroot, tomatoes & corn. As a side you get bread, cheese and for the steak a kind of salsa of onions. Everything was just great and I can highly recommend to go here if you want a good ambient and food ü´∂üèΩ
Huge portions but the food itself is pretty mid. Just very heavy and greasy and steak a bit stiff

Perfect! Highly recommend the lunch menu - absolutely delicious and excellent  price! The service was great, the waiters were kind and entertaining! We were worried that it might be too touristy, but the taste is genuinely good, and the atmosphere -very spanish!

This place has been on my radar for years. I stopped in for lunch on a busy Sunday but was a little early. Managed to get a great table just inside past the bar. The classic Spanish dishes here are authentic and delicious. Garlic shrimp and rabo de toro both cooked and presented perfectly! A selection of tapas from the bar makes the meal complete. Also, plenty of wine to choose from. Service is professional. As we were finishing, the place was full, so go early and enjoy.

Just perfect. Authentic Spanish experience. The food is delicious, the wine great too, and the service friendly by real pros who care about their profession and traditions. We ate tapas standing at the bar, and were the only tourists in the whole restaurant (non-Spanish ones anyway!) Very reasonable prices for the quality.

Some reviews say the ox tail has no flavour. Definitely not the case. It‚Äôs definitely subtle but very flavourful. Favourite dish for my Fianc√©. The baby cuttlefish was my favourite. Good service and good atmosphere.

If you are looking for authentic Spanish dishes, this is a good place to go to. We stumbled on this place by luck, and we were pleasantly surprised with how amazing all the food was, so much so that we wanted to go back... Definitely recommend!!!

We had a fun meal here along with some wine. The service was friendly and funny and the place was almost full. Standout for us was the order of large prawns that may have been a special. They were delicious. Potatoes with mackerel was enjoyable too. Fried boquerones (anchovies) - can't go wrong! The creamy rice with shrimp was fine but would not order again. A solid choice for a quick and good meal plus overall reasonable price.

Authentic and flavorful. We dined at Lambuzo on our recent visit to Madrid. The atmosphere is always light and friendly with their great staff. The food is amazing. Prawn and basil cigarettes, oxtail burgers, and creamy rice dishes were our favorites. The desserts are also incredible. Thanks as always to Luis for being a great host. Lambuzo is a must visit for us when in Madrid. In a city with great gastronomy, Lambuzo stands out!
Just what you want from a local Madrid bar! It is in the centre of the city yet modest, welcoming, with decent pricing and lovely staff. We loved our evening there.

Thank you to the kind waiter who made the experience so welcoming to Madrid! As a solo traveler, this was definitely a lively and warming place for quick tapas and a drink. The patatas bravas were amazing.

Very Spanish experience, affordable actual TAPAS place where u buy a drink and get a tapa. It had meat on it and I am vegetarian but my friend ate it. Only downside is they only accept cash. Wine was decent. Very nice servers. I‚Äôll be coming back!

Great place if you are looking for a typical taberna! They have several small tables inside and a few outside. We really enjoyed the atmosphere, the food and the music! The service was fast even if the place was packed. Nice menu with some items that you don‚Äôt find everywhere. We started with two beers and they brought us two pinchos. Absolutely recommend if you are in the area!
My safe place in Madrid! I love to eat late at night here and we‚Äôre always welcome here. Staff are amazing and the place is cozy and typical.
Superb Tapas bar the meatballs were simply awesome with great flavor and a wonderful sauce! One of the best Tapa we had in our 5 day Madrid stay!

The ambiance is quite pleasant but it is a very small place. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is no English on the menus, I recommend you to research in advance. The food was also delicious but I can't say we liked it very much. Thank you

A highlight of our Madrid trip. The food was sensational at this quaint tapas bar. Service was excellent and attentive. The empanadas and the homemade meatballs were delicious and a big standout. It felt like an authentic Spanish tapas experience and we were so happy to try it. Thank you!
Outstanding atmosphere. Small local bar with affordable drinks. Great accompaniments. Highly recommend for those not looking for those fast-food or high end places.

Amazing place! Suggested by local colleague and it‚Äôs a gem! Incredible food, a huge variety of small tapas/dishes. Everything it‚Äôs tasty. The atmosphere is amazing, the drinks are great. Although it‚Äôs in gran via the place is only visited by locals. Went there twice and will definitely come back!

Your standard ‚ÄúTourist  restaurant ‚Äú good drinks and tapas a bit overpriced, but beware of the details on your order , had to return 2 burgers because we ordered them ‚Äúwell done ‚Äú in Spanish no language barrier excuse applies, check out the picture . ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è. If you are in a hurry or need something quick , good choice, otherwise try something not in the gran via

No frills tapas restaurant where we got 5 delicious tapas and 2 drinks for ‚Ç¨35. Everything was great including the food and service. We especially enjoyed the tortilla and the fried cuttlefish (both ‚Ç¨4.75) Would recommend!

Just had dinner here. Seafood Paella for 2. Delicious and the el Aguila beer and house red provided appropriate support. The staff were very attentive and friendly, planning on going back tomorrow for the A Precio de Menu, it looks like great value.
We ordered the Vegetal Paella and it was delicious. The staff was friendly. Seems to be popular among locals.

I was excited to try authentic Spanish cuisine‚Äînot just tapas, but a proper Spanish meal. Unfortunately, I have mixed feelings about this place. Overall, I found it overpriced, with small portions. The meat was served with fries‚Äîare fries really a staple of Spanish cuisine? The lamb chops and veal were overly salty, making them hard to enjoy. Service was just okay; I ordered two different types of wine, but they poured the same one into both glasses. The atmosphere had potential, but the plastic bags on the windows took away from the experience.

The dining experience offers a delightful array of options to please any palate. However, while waiting for our orders, we were served appetizers that we did not order, and we assumed they were complimentary.  We were surprised to find that three sets of these appetizers were included on our bill. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüòÖüò¢

Ordered the octopus, suckling pig and grilled sea bass. The sea bass was delectable and of a reasonable price. The suckling pig was juicy and tender, melting in your mouth with a crispy top. Unfortunately the octopus did not meet expectations as we found it to be too soft and lacked chew. Nonetheless, a enjoyable experience

This place was recommended in our hotel and was so worth it. We wanted to try the cochinillo and this place was exceptional. Good service, very quick and the cochinillo was very juicy with a crispy crust. We called about an hour in advance to make a reservation and sitting was quick upon arrival.
Very geat loabster Paella. Sangria also very good. Staff give us a warm welcome. Mixed Starters Plat coud be improved. Ham Slices were not thin enough. But no worries. Nice delicious food.
Loved this place! Food was great and drinks were awesome! We had 8 people and they seated us very quickly without reservations

Very good experience and quite reasonable price for the location. Always a queue in front of the restaurant. It is well note that group of 2 get the table faster than bigger group. We spent a lunch and a dinner here. Both served by Sharon, very attentative and sweet. Food is amazing. Mussels and Fish are super fresh. We can feel the sweetness and freshness in every bite. Tapas style. Paella also great. It s such a hidden gem üíé in the middle of Madrid.

Went Tonight For Some Tapas, EveryBody Dressed Up For Carnival In Madrid, Great Music Great Atmosphere. Steak Tartare Is A Must Aswell As The Tuna The Baby Squid Was Not To My Liking No Seasoning. Otherwise I Highly Recommend This Place

Seriously was our favorite place to eat gluten free tapas. They were amazing.  They do get busy but wait until they can help you and you can get seated.  Promise it's worth it.  Their house vermouth is amazing. We bought 2 bottles by bring home with us.  They offer both gluten free and regular, make sure you specify.  And ask when they bring it to you that it is gluten free, especially when they are busy.  On one visit our order didn't come out gluten free so we needed to leave pretty soon since since bites were had, but they were busy and the server felt bad. Still go, just follow up with your order.  Such delicious dishes.

I visited Taberna La Concha back in November, during a 2 day Madrid Food Tour with my friend. This place was the first that we've set our feet in. A small, cozy bar with a soul and friendly staff. Great Selection of authentic tapas, which were probably the best I've ever had in my entire life. Their Callos a'la Madrile√±a (Madrid style tripe) are out of this world! Oh, and the homemade Vermut is a total must, while visiting La Concha!!!

It was an amazing experience to eat in this enchanting place. It‚Äôs in a great location, Plaza Santa Ana, and the prices are incredible. We were attended by a wonderful waiter, Aldair, and he was super nice and attentive. The food was amazing and the portions were generous and fair. I will 100% recommend the service and the food!

This was the best experience in Madrid. Food,atmosphere ,view,sun everything us perfect,but the best thing is service in this beautuful tapas bar. The best of all is Mellisa beautiful young lady that serve us 2 times,she did everithing to make our lunch the best experience ever. She is a dimond of this restaurant ,polite,nice ,beutiful allways smiling and she made us table in full restaurant. Thank you Mellisa for every thing. We will come back for sure.

Was looking for something unique and this place delivered great food, atmosphere and service.  Egglant, mozzarella, sun dried tomato and arugula salad was outstanding.  Entrec√¥te was tender and prepared perfectly.  Crispy fries too. Coconut ice cream‚Äîso good.  My server, Jimena, was patient and kind.

Great food and service. Amazing atmosphere so make sure you find a table oustide on a sunny day! Manuel the one who was in charge of our table was super friendly and welcoming. Definitely coming back to visit this place!

The food was amazing and the service incredible! I‚Äôm learning Spanish and when I told the waitresses, both engaged with me and helped me feel comfortable speaking! I will definitely be back again üòä.
Delicious food (try the eggplant and the croquettes, they are really good üëçüèº! The staff is amazing and the ambiance is cool. üÜí

Nice small tapas restaurant. We ordered some patatas bravas and fried squid calamari. Patas bravas was ok, but fried squid calamari feeld like it wasn't cooked enough. Services were very nice and also sangria was good enough. Is a nice option if you want to drink something after a long walk on the streets.

Had the most wonderful evening here. The tapas was the best we've ever had and the staff were so lovely and attentive. Jose-Luis even helped my son and I practice our Spanish. A really great, authentic Spanish experience on the cutest little street in Madrid. I would highly recommend for couples, families or really any group.

Authentic Spanish food in the heart of Madrid! The staff was welcoming and friendly. The food was delicious, especially the seafood paella and patatas bravas. The portions were generous, and the prices were reasonable. I recommend this place!

The service is excellent, thanks to C√©sar who was very kind from the moment we arrived, we felt very welcomed! We tried the paella, and it was absolutely delicious‚Äîone of the best we‚Äôve ever had. The atmosphere was relaxed, with no pressure, and the prices were fair for the quality offered. We definitely recommend this place and will be back soon!
Great place to eat Tapas and a delicious Paella. Lots of locals and great service. The Papa‚Äôs Bravas were out of this world.

I have celebrated my birthday twice here already, it is like travelling to Asturias without leaving Madrid. When I show up, and this happened already the third time I was there I was treated like I came home. There is always a space and the food, oh the food. Their signature sauce is made with cabrales blue cheese. That together with the chicken fingers is such a win. Yesterday we ordered extra fries because we couldn't bring ourselves to leave any sauce unconsumed. Sometimes there is a chupito (shot) on the house when you pay, and I always leave planning my next visit that says enough.

Nice atmosphere and excellent food at great price/quality ratio. You can experience the cider here and how you have to put it from the bottle in the glass, it‚Äôs especially fun with friends. The best is to visit this pace during the weekdays as during weekends it‚Äôs super full and it affects the service.

Great ambience and service!!! Menu of day good value but skip seafood dishes. Spanish dishes and stews are hearty and flavorful. Get dish with French fries as they are very good! 11 euros for beer two large dishes and coffee.
I just loved the Spanish tradition in the Taberna Los Angeles. You feel surrounded by locals and accepted as interesting tourists.   You could not want for more,

I found this bar on Google Maps and popped in. The food was delicious and an amazinh big hit. The combination of ingredients was top-notch, using the flavor of the ingredients while also appealing to the sense of texture and appearance. It was about 80 euros for two people. Considering the price, it was very satisfying. I'd like to visit again.

Great food, high quality and fresh, cocktails were also very nice and with big and fun glasses. The only issues was the time to ger the food ans cocktails (30min for 2 cocktails and almost 1 hour for the food and none of our foods arrive at the same time). I think they had a staff issues but they didn‚Äôt really explained anything.

One of the best - if not *the* best - meal I've ever had. Cool place. Lovely staff. Completely stood out. I've travelled a fair bit, 30 different states in the US, all over Europe. When people ask me my favourite meal, this is the first that comes to mind.

Incredible tapas bar!! The servers were so attentive and kind, we were 5 people and didn‚Äôt have a reservation (would highly recommend booking a reso if you can) and they were so accommodating for us! The food was phenomenal and they were able to accommodate for a celiac diet as well! Easily the best croquettes and king prawn tacos, the beef cheek and rice (gluten free) was also incredible, cocktails were fantastic. The service was above and beyond - they were very busy as it was a Saturday night but this did not stop them from providing exceptional service! We finished the evening with free shots for the table! One of the best restaurants of our entire trip! If you are in Madrid, you cannot miss this restaurant, I know I will absolutely be back next time I am in Madrid.

Very nice tapas spot that extends quite far to the back! The king prawn tacos were really tasty and the service was great, very attentive. They even gave me a complimentary nice little shot at the end, they also have a nice selection of cocktails!

In the very top of my list of Madrid tapas places. Of course it is very crowded because it has such a good reputation. The pimientos, chorizo and mushrooms are outstanding. The have excellent wine and beer options and the staff is incredibly friendly given the unbelievable workload they have.

user_id: If you‚Äôre looking for an unforgettable dining experience in Madrid
restaurant_id: this traditional eatery in the city‚Äôs bustling center is an absolute gem. From the moment you step inside
rating: you‚Äôre welcomed with warm hospitality
review_text: but what truly sets this place apart is the outstanding service from the bartender‚Äîundoubtedly the best! Her attention to detail
date: friendly attitude
source_user_name: and expert recommendations make the experience even more special.

review_text: A very popular tapas restaurant. Luckily, when we went there was no queue. We would recommend the pork innards. It‚Äôs very delicious!
The atmosphere is so Madrid! My family and I loved it here. Fast service, great food, really amazing experience. Make sure you try the blood sausage!

Fresh and good tapas at a very good price. I always go when I am around downtown. They have a pretty good sider for 6 euros the bottle and they will serve you none stop free tapas. The bartenders are very nice. I am very happy that a bar like this can still be found so close to downtown.
Great bar with generous tapas given. Been coming for years, always a nice stop.

This is as local as it gets. Free tapas with the purchase of beer.  Small and crowded when we went but 100% worth the experience.  We ordered tintos de Verano and got patatas bravas, rice, and sausages.

if you are looking for a local place with a distinctly Spanish atmosphere, then this is the one. a very simple and traditional Madrid pub that continues to be unique with its tradition of free tapas. still mostly local visitors, despite its great popularity. The service is very pleasant and simple. all are the same

Amazingly delicious tapas! The place looks small and full when you enter but go in anyway. They have more place at downstairs. It is a very local place and they don‚Äôt have English menu. You need to use translation tools to order also :) the vegetarian options are limited but so delicious! The one with caramelised onion is a bless for the mouth!!

Taberna Almeria is a worthy stop when you're traversing La Latina. It's a neighborhood bar that serves great pinchos and you're usual bar drinks. They give you an extra pincho when you get drinks too.
Amazing tapas 10/10 best tapas in Madrid !! But the waiter wasn‚Äôt amazing so 4/5 ! Still highly recommended ! Bacalao ahumedo is the best !!!
Delicious Tostas! S√∫per busy the food is great

What a brilliant find! We came here hoping to have some cheese and wine, and stayed for much longer than we anticipated because the service, the food, the wine, the atmosphere, the decor was phenomenal. The server (the one with the Keith Haring tattoo) was amazing, attentive and full of zest! I also had a Spanish omelette with padron peppers and it was by far the best omelette I have had in Spain so far. Highly recommend stopping in here!

The best casa in Madrid. Real local food, excellent wines, absolutely perfect service. Don't hesitate to visit and enjoy delicatessen. If you have to wait for table, just wait - it's definitely worth. One of the rare places which I really want to visit again.

How lucky we were to stumble upon this little gem. We had no idea of where we were or what we were going to find. Casa Gonzalez is a wonderful, quaint shop that sells Iberic ham and other specialties, cheeses, wines, Olive oils, etc. It looks much like a butcher or deli shop, but also features some tables where you can sit and enjoy a nice meal. The place is small, yet very popular with the locals especially. The service was wonderful and personable, the food very fresh and interesting, and the wine selection is very impressive, all for a very reasonable price. We had an Iberic charcuterie plate, a cheese plate, wines and a very enjoyable time. It was all delicious and perfect.

Casa Gonz√°lez is a super Deli and wine store with a small area to have small plates made either their own deli products. It is an incredible experience for anybody wanted to try good Spanish wines with selected cheeses and cured meets like Spanish ham.

Given the location, this place is a fantastic find! Maybe a little understaffed, but nonetheless very friendly and fast service! And the food is great and reasonably priced too üòä Would highly recommend the pan con tumaca ‚Äì was my favourite out of the things we ordered!
We ate here last night and our server is the only one who spoke English. He was amazing. The food was freshly cooked and was really good! We would come back again.

Stopped in last nice as it was close to our hotel. Quaint little spot with a cool vibe. Cold Estrella on tap and we had the tosta de jamon and the seafood platter. The squid was done perfectly, the calamari was tender and the anchovies were delicious. The meal was very affordable for the area.
I believe this is a chain tapas restaurant. We made a quick stop to use their restroom and decided to grab a drink. It was clean and service was good. Nothing really special.

user_id: I opted for the premium wine pairings
restaurant_id: which turned out to be well worth the steep price. 11 wines
rating: most Spanish
review_text: all beautiful
date: and several absolutely outstanding. I knew one wouldn‚Äôt suit my taste
source_user_name: and the sommelier gladly found a substitute.

review_text: At Coque, diners embark on a meticulously curated four-part culinary journey crafted by the Sandoval brothers. The experience commences in the cocktail bar, where guests are greeted with inventive snacks and a signature drink. The second act unfolds in the wine cellar, boasting an impressive selection of over 3,000 labels curated by sommelier Rafael Sandoval. The journey continues into the kitchen, offering an intimate glimpse into the creative process of chef Mario Sandoval and his dedicated team. The finale takes place in the elegant dining room, where ma√Ætre d‚Äô Diego Sandoval ensures impeccable service. The 15-course tasting menu showcases innovative dishes such as hoisin-glazed razor clams and lobster tartare infused with green chilies, exemplifying Coque‚Äôs commitment to culinary excellence.

Top restaurant. The service was spectacular, the premium wine package is worth it. THE FOOD was delicious, great presentation and explanation on every plate. I have allergies to shellfish and they were able to accommodate me perfectly. Worth every penny.

Truly one of the best restaurant experiences I‚Äôve ever experienced. A unique presentation of food that was immersive and truly out of this world. Started with a great appetizer and cocktail paring. Traveled into their wine cave with more pairings. Was brought into the kitchen to try more bites and ended up sitting down for some amazing courses and ending with a fabulous dessert. Everything was full of flavor and truly superb. Definitely recommend!!

I‚Äôve been to Coque in June  2023. Beautiful restaurant very chic and their wine cellar is stunning but too bad I don‚Äôt drink. I advised at reception I prefer non alcoholic beverages. I was served a very nice cocktail and some amuse bouches it was very good I was so excited for other courses but I was disappointed they served me a champagne with alcohol right after my mocktailü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è then their homemade beerü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èthen they served me a shabu shabu I was so excited cuz I‚Äôm a Japanese chef but it was so wrong since their broth for shabu shabu was vinegar. I‚Äôm in shocked. And the thing shock me most was shrimp carpaccio with srirachaü´£ and sriracha taste exact like sriracha we buy from supermarket. As a Japanese chef i love cooking and food so much I‚Äôve travelled all over the world to get inspiration and admire creations of other chefs but at Coque. Presentations are beautiful also ambiance but it‚Äôs missing flavour and creation. I feel like I‚Äôm paying to come here for a food show not to experience a exceptional culinary.

We just finished our dinner at Paco Roncero restaurant, everything was delicious, I am very impressed with each dish which had so many different flavors mixed perfectly. From each dish you can tell chef is very creative and bold, he definitely not played safe with his dishes that give us a ‚ÄúWOW‚Äù taste! I have eaten so many Michelin star restaurants, this one definitely on the top list! Thanks Chef Paco Roncero! See you next time! I don‚Äôt understand why it‚Äôs still 2 star, it‚Äôs better than 3 star in New York City for sure!

Exquisite food, service, and attention to detail. We enjoyed puzzling over how these creations were built, then teased out the complex flavors. There were 8 courses to the meal, with about 27 different individual dishes. Curiously, the desserts had a strong savory profile, some of which worked surprisingly well (beet and black garlic). Service was gracious without being stuffy. We enjoyed the Spanish wine pairing, which provided a couple very pleasant surprises.

Step into the vibrant world of the Casino De Madrid and discover the extraordinary Paco Roncero Restaurante! Here, you‚Äôll be welcomed by a phenomenal team dedicated to guiding you on a thrilling culinary adventure with their exquisite tasting menu. Each dish is a masterpiece, but it‚Äôs the appetizer courses that are truly unforgettable, leaving you in awe of their creativity and flavor. Get ready for an exhilarating dining experience that will tantalize your taste buds like never before!

It is a sensational experience of tastes, aromas, flavors and colors, in an exceptional presentation, with perfect attention to details. We were impressed by each type of food, the atmosphere and impeccable service. Fantastic!
exquisite food with great price to value lunch menu on Thur and Fri. I enjoyed every dish and the portion is not too big but enough. Setting is beautiful and service is very good too.

Honestly, it was the worst meal I had in Madrid. I‚Äôve eating at Michelin star restaurants before and this had the worst service and food I‚Äôve had. From the moment we walked in, the greeting was lukewarm and we waited for around 10 minutes from the moment we sat down to getting service. The food was disappointing to say the least. One of the dishes was a slice of beef seasoned with just salt‚Ä¶ like yes it was cooked perfectly but I don‚Äôt see how this is of caliber of 2 stars.

user_id: Our tasting menu included standout dishes like the 7-day Lubina
rating: Pich√≥n Koji
review_text: and a mind-blowing Mochi de Cebada
date: all paired with El Enemigo 2019. The balance between vegetarian dishes and those featuring meat or fish was impressive

review_text: Great experiences! Just WOW. Had 16 courses menu with a wine pairing for too. Molecular kitchen can seem to be small portions but at the end of the dinner I was so full! Different varieties of different tastes combinations‚Ä¶ must try this 2 stars Michelin star restaurant when in Madrid.

Spectacular dining experience at DSTAgE, it was wonderful to watch the theatre of the chefs preparing each dish and to learn about each plate from staff. Every bite was magical and was a memorable experience to celebrate our visit to Madrid.

We celebrated my wife and daughter birthday there. The atmosphere and service were excellent. We ordered tasting menu. The food was perfect except the last dish , rock of lamb. It was not hot, barely warm, and totally tasteless. Overall, we had a good experience in this Michelin star restaurant.

Saddle Madrid was one of the best dining experiences I‚Äôve had! We had the tasting menu which was exceptional. Our favorites were the eel, prawn, lobster, mackerel, pumpkin flower, and rack of lamb. We also had the cheese board and good wine! The staff were exceptional. The ambiance was beautiful and I will now play birds chirping in my bathroom, lol. What really sealed the deal was the printed thank you and menu we received at the end! Thank you for a memorable dining experiences! Chef‚Äôs kiss!
Saddle in Madrid was outstanding! The staff‚Äôs attention to detail was top-notch, and the mushrooms and veal sweetbreads were next-level delicious. Can‚Äôt recommend it enough!

Nott the restaurant that i was feel to taste in our experice of michlen star . Bread was cold like they made one day before . And the food that we taste nott the perfect one. Butt overall it was an experience . The think that impressed was the menu of the wine outstanding and they waiter's and sommelier really cool guys .

Our evening at Alabaster in Madrid, spurred by a friend's glowing recommendation, turned into a delightful culinary adventure. We opted for the tasting menu, where each dish came with its own story‚Äîsome told beautifully through artful plating, while others left a bit to the imagination. But here‚Äôs the twist: what some dishes lacked in presentation, they more than made up for in flavor. Each bite was a revelation, with rich, layered tastes that danced on the palate. The unexpected contrast between the visual and the taste made the experience all the more intriguing. Alabaster is the kind of place that reminds you‚Äîsometimes it‚Äôs what‚Äôs inside that truly counts. I‚Äôm glad we took the leap and explored this hidden gem, where flavor reigns supreme. Definitely worth a visit for those who appreciate substance over style!

Ordered the tasting menu and had pleasant and knowledgable servers (they can speak English). It is truly an excellent meal when dessert is my least favorite course (even with cold broccoli served with the beef). Each course was different from the last and was just the right amount of food to leave not hungry and feeling fine. Would definitely return.

We got the tasting menu, and it was delicious! They made sure everything we got was dairy free, and the dessert was phenomenal. The staff were all very friendly and happy to explain each course. We couldn‚Äôt finish the wine pairings because the pours were so generous üòÖ

Amazing presentations, impeccable attention to details down to the shoes of the waiters. Very nice ambiance and amazing flavours. The only problem I have is that the food is on par with most michelin restaurants I have visited , but the price is just not worth it. Same quality and bold flavour combinations you will get in many michelin star restaurants for half the price. 450 euros ( drinks not included) per person for the menu is not justified.

The dishes were flavourful and very playful.  I‚Äôm not the biggest fan of the setting  just because it is difficult to get attention from service team but it does give a feel of privacy, and it does reflect the chara of the chef very well.  There were a lot of food but every dish was nicely explained throughout graphics and words which make the experience more enjoyable.  This is probably one of the more bold ones in terms of flavour and he did it superbly.

What an experience! We were lucky to be able to reserve tables for seven people. The staff managed to arranged so that our tables were in the same curtain area. Staff were very nice and accommodating. Food came with a very interesting concept. Some menu had a nice drawing and story before that dish was served. There were at least 15 courses during the three hour section. We now know why the place got 3 Michelin stars and ranked 4th in the world!
Food smells and tastes delicious. Lavish atmosphere. Attentive services. Better than many 3 star Michelin restaurants that I have tried.

Michelin star restaurant with a nice tasting menu. I really liked how extravagant the place looked. It really is dignified. We had a very big tasting menu that was just excellent but I do have few comments. It could have been far more interesting. But this is not the best Michelin experience I had. There was a very bad dish in the end which was milky and with meat and honestly it made me feel slightly bad. But overall it was great and the caviar tasting was exceptional!

I don‚Äôt go often to Michelin restaurants, this is my 2nd one ever. I was visiting Spain for a conference, decided to treat myself. I was pleasantly surprised by the combination of artfulness and taste in almost every dish on the tasting menu. I‚Äôm not a big seafood lover but very much enjoyed the mostly seafood menu. The staff was very professional and accommodating. The one area that might be a personal preference is the accommodation. It was very elegant, but I was the only guest in the indoor area for nearly an hour or longer. Most guests were seated in the garden outside. I‚Äôm sure there are internal rules to follow about seating arrangements but it did make my experience a little cold and isolating. Other than that, i thoroughly enjoyed the food

I would give it 4 stars. Why? If you go to places like Gueyu Mar in Asturias o a Elkano en Getataria, you get a higher quality without the high prices, but ‚Ä¶. It‚Äôs Madrid, I understand. Since  1911 is a product restaurant that‚Äôs trying to be an elevated restaurant, I ‚Äòd recommend others like Smoked Room in Madrid, Campero in Barbate or Pepe Vieira in Galicia‚Ä¶if you want a more sophisticated cuisine, before  Dessert 1911. Again, it‚Äôs not a bad place, it‚Äôs a great meal, but you don‚Äôt get good value here, it‚Äôs just a good meal, not a superb one like in afore mentioned places.

user_id: Highlights from the menu include the Ecugis Smoked Salmon
rating: Classic Seafood Salad
review_text: Grilled Palamos Red Prawn
date: and the Baby White Bean Stew with Squid. Each dish was crafted with care
source_user_name: showcasing the freshest ingredients and expert preparation.

review_text: We loved this experience. And we like everything from restaurant‚Äôs design to delicious food . Cozy atmosphere and friendly personal . Thank you very much and will see soon . üíûüíû

Highly recommended! What a surprise to enter this beautifully-designed, modern space from an otherwise rundown backstreet. Outstanding seafood-based seasonal set menu from the Pescader√≠as Coru√±esas team. Excellent service from friendly staff. Must book far, far in advance!

The food was excellent! We had requested a nice table in advanced , hoping for the old world charm the restaurant is known for, to celebrate an anniversary but was seated in the modern wing of the restaurant next to a projector, so not exactly what we had hoped for. The service was decent, but our waiter also dissapeared for a long time and we had to go look for someone to settle the bill. Went in with high expectations and left a bit disappointed.

The food at this restaurant was absolutely exquisite, and the service was great, making for an overall wonderful dining experience. The ambience is incredible, creating a perfect atmosphere for a memorable meal. However, be aware that the restaurant is only accessible by stairs, which can be challenging if you have a stroller or any kind of mobility issues. Despite this, the experience was well worth it, and we would still give it a 5 out of 5!
The waiters were the kindest! Very attentive and helpful to make choices. The food was delicious! Price-wise, it is really worth it 10000%. They even prepared a little attention for my birthday.
Wonderful experience, we arrived as the last table straight from the airport and had the opportunity to try a lot of different options still. All dishes are unique with a Spanish touch.

We had a wonderful experience thanks to Cedric! He was incredibly kind, always smiling, and made us feel so welcome throughout the night. (It was our first experience) His guidance and attentiveness truly elevated our evening and my birthday night.A fantastic service‚Äîthank you!
Let‚Äôs talk about everything, MENU 125‚Ç¨ per head, wine 68‚Ç¨, two persons final bill 331‚Ç¨ , but you will leave the restaurant counting the days GO BACK, the best JAPO in Madrid

The food was absolutely delicious and I want to especially point out that the sommelier did a great job pairing it with the finest selection of Sake! Japanese Mediterranean fusion, excellent combination. A top recommendation and I will definitely come again

Great experience. We had the tasting menu with the ‚ÄúSenaorial‚Äù wine pairing, and enjoyed it fully. Food was delicious, wines very interesting and helped to get the most out of each plate, and service was top-notch.
Great food . They have a great looking space. The tasting menu was just the right quantity . The somm is great !

Excellent hotel restaurant! Moral of the story? Service, service, service. This restaurant and adjoining hotel have the most attentive staff I've experienced in memory. The food was good, but when you have staff that are committed to you enjoying your experience, it elevates everything. I have stayed at the Principal on both my trips to Madrid and will do so again on my next trip. Highlight was the Brioche and almond ice cream dessert.

Absolutely outstanding experience from start to finish! The ma√Ætre d‚Äô was incredibly attentive, making us feel warmly welcomed and cared for throughout our visit. The entire staff was genuinely kind, professional, and eager to accommodate every request. The food was nothing short of extraordinary‚Äîeach dish beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. The ambiance complemented the meal perfectly: elegant, inviting, and wonderfully comfortable. Highly recommended for anyone seeking an unforgettable dining experience. We will certainly return!
The views are breathtaking and the food is great. You have to go with time because the service is a little slow. I recommend booking in advance and enjoy the indoor dining room and outdoor terrace

The food was truly excellent, lovely fresh bread to start and I recommend cod croquettes and hake. We also had the mille fuille for dessert which was delicious. We were slightly disappointed with the view but the service was top notch

Fantastic place. Super attentive, approachable, and professional staff. The dishes were excellently executed, with attention to detail. Quality/price ratio is unbeatable. Produce is fresh and cooked to perfection. I don‚Äôt put five stars because there‚Äôs always some room for improvement, and this restaurant has much potential. They already have a Sol Repsol, the Spanish version of the Michelin Star. I would also note that the restroom is accessible and at the same level of the restaurant (no stairs) so it‚Äôs perfect for elderly people. There‚Äôs also an electric elevating platform at the lobby for climbing the few stairs in case of not being able to walk or finding it difficult. Again, the staff at the hotel lobby is super attentive, and will go the extra mile to help customers. Highly recommended.
Tasty dishes with nice presentations. Prices in accordance to the area and the level of service. Nice and attentive staff. Large and good wine selection. Minimalist decor, Nordic style. Recommended!

What a treat! The food, the service, everything. The fish soup was exceptional, as was the oxtail cannelloni. We wanted something new so took the squid and fish balls which were lovely. The rice with clams was also delish, although would have preferred with slightly less sauce. Must visit!
Very stylish and delicious restaurant! Friendly staff, fast service and incredibly delicious food. We took the testing menu.

Beautiful restaurant and really great service. A classic in Madrid. I enjoyed the food but was not wowed by it. The star dish (not shown on the photos) is the callos - very good smoky flavour. The beef Wellington is also quite good. It is an expensive restaurant where most dishes start at 28+ euros. Starter portions are small but I do recommend sharing the wellington as it is a heavy dish.
Classy and classic. Worth a visit. Take the recommendations. Come early for the tasting menu.

Great food, great service. Very good sommelier. The only negative is that prices are a little steep. Depending on the choice. What I probably enjoy the most was the choice of wine that was adapted to both fish and red meat. We were 5, 3 of us chose fish but we all wanted a single wine. We had a great Pe√±a de Gredos. I can only recommend it. But be prepared to spend.

We were able to sit on the balcony and enjoy the beautiful views. The food was great, but I'd argue not the best I've had in the area. Very reasonable price for the experience you get being on a rooftop. The octopus & oxtail lasagna were probably the best dishes we had and the brownie was the best dessert. Would recommend sitting outside if you have the option!!

user_id: We ordered calamari as appetizer
restaurant_id: oxtail lasagna and squid ink rice 2 entrees. It's quite disappointing that both entrees are too salty
rating: not just a bit salty
review_text: it's way too salty. The texture of the dishes are good
date: and  they were flavorful. If it tune down the saltiness by half we would probably enjoy them very much. But maybe it was just a bad batch

review_text: We ate here on our last night in Madrid and were very happy we found it! We made a reservation in advance for right when they opened and got the best seat in the house. From our table we could look out the window and see the Royal Palace and had an amazing view of the streets of Madrid. Everything we ordered was delicious and the service was friendly and fast. We had a great experience!

I had a disappointing experience at this restaurant. Terrible service and tasteless food. I ordered grilled octopus, which, as you can see from the photo, clearly wasn‚Äôt grilled at all. The mashed potatoes tasted like freeze-dried potato. The staff not only didn‚Äôt bring the QR code menu, but also wouldn‚Äôt come to the table unless we raised our hands to call them. This google rating is not accurate.

Best restaurant we went in Madrid. Outstanding food, made with best available ingredients. Impressive wine selection. Chef was very kind and flexible offering for serving all dishes for share at no extra cost.
Easily one of the best restaurants in Europe , definitely in Spain , this place is straight forward Genuine food , a rare dining gem

This slighty understated restaurant is not easy to spot among the many other restaurants in streets of Madrid. I was lucky to learn about it from a wine dealer nearby and loved it. It is about FOOD and WINE - spiced with good ambience. The Spanish kitchen is not one I have much experience with - but quality work in a kitchen never lies. Style of this restaurant seems rather traditional - and thank you for that. Even the most highly regarded restaurants og the new age, will struggle to outperform honest and geniue food at its best. I beleive La Buena Vida is a good example of that.

The Spanish Stew was delicious! This meal came with so much food that was all great I left super full and pleased with my meal. The Beef Wellington was perfectly cooked and I would recommend it. This was one of my favorite meals in Madrid and I recommend checking it out!

user_id: Because was crowded decided to take it pastry away ... we love the blueberry muffins
restaurant_id: the habana cake was a bit dry... but still taste was good... so we went back for a Roscon de reyes
rating: we love it as it has not dry fruit
review_text: only almonds
date: Was soft

review_text: We ordered Pate en croute, Iberian ham as starters. The Iberian ham is top quality and tastes welcoming in the mouth.
