The Legendary Madrid Stew is good to try out as it‚Äôs pretty unique in Spanish cuisine. The soup which is part of the stem is excellent. The meats are not so tasty as they were used to make the soup. The service was very good in every detail except the waiters didn‚Äôt check whether the customers need anything from time to time. Overall it‚Äôs a good fine dining experience.

Enjoyed the Valentines menu. The food was magnifico! Especially liked the Venison Wellington and mashed potato "cappuccino". Our server, Ivana, took excellent care of us while giving us some advanced Spanish lessons. The atmosphere is perfect for a romantic dinner. Cannot recommend this restaurant more.

The restaurant has an elegant decor, ideal for business and romantic dates. excellent serving of dishes and serving with exquisite cutlery. All the dishes from the restaurant menu are a great combination of high quality products and the chef's skill. Attentive and friendly staff. I would like to mention the Breakfasts separately - they are organized at the highest level.

The garden is absolutely enchanting and utterly exclusive. The seasonal cuisine is exquisite.we had artichokes prepared masterfully, turbot in a delicious sauce and a light pistachio dessert that tasted like heaven. The wines chosen by our extremely charming and affable waiters Jorge and Jesus were perfect ( a silky Godello and Abadia Retuerta selection). Beautiful evening and a secret treasure in downtown Madrid! Highly recommended
The service was amazing and we completely fell in love with ooze waitress. The food in the tasting menu was really interesting and worth to try. Amazing place to spend romantic evening

We had a dinner with 12 people and the server was Ale. She was really kind, and also could speak english. I had order steak, paella and the other things and all of them were really good. Highly recommend

What an amazing and delicious  experience! This 2 times Michelin star winner restaurant has a great service and food. Our sever Giancarlos went above and beyond he treated us like we were royalty and not only that, we went with our little picky eaters and crafted a great delicious meal for them. To finished our experience the chef Tito served us our last plate! The food was amazing, we ate a large variety of plates and each one had an unbelievable flavor.

Very limited choices of food. Small portions. Cheapest wines start from ‚Ç¨30 and they taste like acid. I can buy much better wine in the nearby grocery store for just ‚Ç¨5. The overpriced paella they served was half-burnt and stuck to the pan. When we notified our waiter about this he very impatiently told us that that is how paella supposed to be. Very overrated and extremely overpriced place.

We were surprised and delighted with our lunch here - the dining room is beautiful, and quiet enough for conversation. The food was absolutely excellent, with every course just perfect. The lubina was some of the best we've had anywhere. We had great service and loved the seafood here, one of our new favorite places in Madrid!

Today I had a very good and satisfying meal at this restaurant. The waiters are all very handsome. Miguel is handsome and courteous. I had seafood paella, white wine, water, and bread with hummus dip. All the food and drinks are very good. The paella tasted so good and I finished it all, supposed to be for 2 persons ! The r service is good too. Restaurant is beautiful

A really nice lunch after a walk in the botanic garden. Many choices of starters and many types of paellas. We ordered grilled cuttlefish which was incredible and the other fried starters were also good. The paella was quite big and the seafood cooked well. Really recommend it!

Great place in a nice area, with very fast serving. We took seafood paella and it was amazing. They helped us get a table even if we didn‚Äôt make a reservation in advance. Good wine, nice atmosphere. This is a must in Madrid

Quaint restaurant with fresh made to order paella.  Reservations recommended if you really want to try authentic paella.  Spinach salad with cured duck, calamari, chicken, rabbit, duck paella, apple crumble, cheesecake.everything was delicious.  Wait staff was attentive and efficient.

This restaurant was everything I hoped for and more!  I read that it was delicious food in a homey and welcoming environment, so as a solo female traveler I thought it would be a nice place for my final meal in Madrid before returning home. It was perfect, exactly as I imagined! The sisters who own the place were perfectly hospitable and so kind the whole night, and we had wonderful conversations about the food (in the style of Rioja, where they grew up) and many other things. They were very patient with my grammatically "creative" Spanish. The food and wine were incredible - all very flavorful without being too heavy. I am so happy I came here, I cannot recommend it more highly!
Love the food, the best Paella I had out of 4 places. Amazing lady that runs it. Great orange juice - I recommend.

This restaurant is featured in a Japanese guidebook. As expected, it is a high-quality restaurant with delicious food and good service. The paella has an exquisite texture of rice and seafood broth. The omelette is fluffy. We ate and drank until we were full, and the cost of 90 euros for two people was also great.

Beautiful ambiance, and the best gazpacho and paella I‚Äôve ever had. Our Spanish host said the taste is like what her mother makes, which is the highest praise indeed. Special mention to Lina, our wonderful waitress who took such good care of us.
Amazing paella. Delicious starter and dessert. The staff was all super nice. Had a great experience here. Will come back again

Lovely atmosphere and service. There was a line before it opened, which was a good sign. We felt lucky to get in without a reservation. The padron peppers were delicious and the vegetarian paella very filling.

I‚Äôd like to express gratitude to everyone at St James making my dinner today so special - from the initial welcoming and meal/drink recommendations to cooking and eventually serving - anchovies and vermouth, paella with the sole fish, spanish Baileys and desserts as compliments - everything was top-notch and was above my expectations! Muchas gracias! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Best cocktails I‚Äôve ever had!
Thank you Denise and the rest of the staff for great service‚Ä¶

Excellent service.  Very unique dish.  We had traditional paella, stingray fish and smoked octopus salad.  Complimentary mint liqueur and blueberry liqueur are very good.  Finally, THE one restaurant provided a place for bags and jacket.üëç

Loved this place. Came for an anniversary dinner and the service was incredible. Luis and Hugo were amazing. They checked in with us, made sure we ordered early, and even gave us a little ice cream treat at the end! We sat outside on a cold rainy day, but we were warm AND dry. Highly recommend the vegetarian paella!

Absolutely phenomenal meal! The Iberican pork paella was off the charts, and one of the best dishes my wife and I had on our 2 and a half weeks in Portugal and Spain. The cheesecake was incredible! It was almost like a cheesecake flavored custard with the smooth, silky texture! Highly recommend this place if you're in Madrid!
The croquetas were the best I‚Äôve had after living almost 2 years in Spain. Paella was great. Cheesecake was the best I‚Äôve had. Service was excellent. Definitely recommend.

From the moment we entered, we were well taken care of. Staff is very friendly and readily available to help. The food was outstanding.  We had the Gentlemen's Seafood Paella, and it was amazing! Hearty mix of seafood to rice. Beautiful experience!!!!!

We booked El Pato Mudo for our final evening in Madrid and we were not disappointed. The service was fantastic and the kind gentleman went through the menu with us and explained things in detail. The fried aubergine for starters were a delight, so fresh and sweet with a hint of honey. The rice was perfectly cooked and so full of flavour. The restaurant had a nice feel to it and we've said we'd definitely go back to try a different paella. Delicious

This restaurant is a true treasure! The paella was absolutely amazing‚Äîrich, flavorful, and perfectly cooked with the ideal balance of ingredients. The tapas were equally outstanding, each dish offering unique, delicious flavors. The ambiance was warm and inviting, and the service was impeccable. If you‚Äôre looking for authentic and unforgettable Spanish cuisine, this is the place to go. Highly recommend!

What a great evening at El pato mudo with the family! Our friendly waiter Diego, and all of the dining hall staff made sure we enjoyed our dinner. The paellas were excellent. Highly recommended restaurant in Madrid!
Great food right off Plaza Mayor! The "paella totally prepared" tasted wonderful, and the downstairs brick cellar restaurant is cheerful and cozy. Also, the sangria is awesome!

Really great service, food and location! We didn't think we would get anything this tasty and authentic IN Plaza Mayor! We had a pitcher of Sangria (so tasty), croquetas de jamon, choricitos, pimientos de padron, chicken fingers, and torrijas for 85‚Ç¨!! Great worry free stop if you want a place to soak it all in while at the Plaza!

Me and my partner came here a few nights ago for dinner and really enjoyed our meal. We were served by Jose Luis, who was a great host and very friendly. He went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our meal and we could not have been happier. We also really enjoyed the atmosphere, and location of the restaurant. Would definitely recommend to others!
Our food was good and priced fairly. We had a problem with our chicken fingers, and they quickly removed them from our bill. Our server was very nice and professional.
Discovered by accident and worth the try. Excellent food quality (freshness) and taste. Service is warm and attentive too, spot on!
Paella for ONE person available (seafood, 19 euro). Strong umami flavor omg.
I love it. I really recommend it. Las croquetas and las papas bravas are the best üëå and la paella ü•ò out of this world

For our last dinner in Madrid, we tried this small Spanish-Filipino restaurant called Arco Pinoy, a restaurant in the middle of Madrid that is jointly owned by a Spanish and a Filipino. The chef was from Marikina and the server was an Italian scholar/full time student at University of Europe. The food was very good and tasty. The Paella and Gambas were very traditional and Spanish style.  The Pinoy dishes did not disappoint and were also very very good.  The crispy pata was very crunchy and juicy inside. The lumpia and sinigang were just like how I imagined them when I ate at Marikina. The combination of dishes complimented each other. We also received excellent service from the friendly crew. We enjoyed our experience very much and I highly recommend this place.

Worst meal ever, makes eating become torture, even hardly to swallow. 34 Euros Black seafood rice with only several shrimps and shells in it, simply not worth it. But the service is fine to be honest.

Stumbled on this quaint place while looking for a place to grab some paella on Valentine's Day.  The paella was absolutely delicious and was super glad that we found La Paella Real. Arrived soon as they opened and was able to get seated without a reservation.  The timing was perfect as people started coming in afterward.  Ordered the special which included starters (grilled squid, salad and olives), a chocolate dessert and a pitcher of sangria.  Everything was superb including the service. Would've easily paid more but super great value!

We had our early dinner here, started with break, served sanglia beverages and white wine. The squid was decent and the leftovers oil used to dipped into the bread. Mushrooms was a bit salty and the cheese ball not my favourite. The rice was flavourful.

This my first time in Madrid and the receptionist of my hotel, tip me to come to this restaurant to taste a nice paella! I saw some others reviews saying things that I think are not true. The waiter really professional and kind, gave us an exceptional service! The restaurant has a short menu, but it's because the plates you find are really nice! If you come to Madrid please visit La Paella Real!

Oh my, this was the best visit we made in Spain, hands down. If you love seafood and would like to try Spanish-style seafood, this is the spot. We ordered squid dish, and enjoyed it so much, we had to order more portions of it. Even gazpacho was flavorful. Drinks were great too.
very good experienceÔºÅ the food was so nice and dilicious. seafood very fresh and tasty. Also the staff are kind and friendly. Definitely 5 starsüòäüòäüòä

Superb experience. Located In the heart of Madrid, we had a fabulous dinner. High quality products (as usual in all locations of El Barril). One of my favourites in the city center. You can‚Äôt miss it.
This restaurant has the best seafood menu. I had fresh oysters, grilled squid, and grilled octopus in that order. It paired really well with Mara Mouar wine

We went there on a Thursday for lunch and we were a party of two we found a reservation as late as 2 hours before our preferred time since it‚Äôs the weekday but it was crowded so i highly recommend making reservations especially during the weekend I think it will be more crowded. The staff were attentive and spoke English enough to get our order and also to accommodate us comfortably. Food was delicious and cooked to perfection. They will charge you for the bread and starters but trust me it‚Äôs worth it. The last two sweets we were not charged for it but it was really good. Oysters were really good. If you‚Äôre visiting Madrid with a special one or your family who enjoys seafood I do highly recommend this place!
Hotel recommended this seafood restaurant and found great. Services, atmosphere and food are excellent and worth to go again.

We ordered seafood paella and seafood soup.  The seafood paella was average, $28 per person and minimum order two.  The seafood was so dry except the big shrimp one on the top was ok.  The seafood soup was good, I like it.  Overall, we didn't like it for this price don't worth it.

Good atmosphere and delicious paellas. We ordered Paellas with red prawn. It has mild taste which is eat to eat and well-cooked. At the end, the staff also brought as 2 tiny pieces of chocolate cake which is enough to have a happy meal
All dishes were simple but delicious, especially labor clams. The restaurant recommended us a good wine with seasonal price.

We were referred by hotel staff for local food. The dishes were okay except the clams were delicious. The waiter had very little English vocabulary and we found we were sold for a razor clam dish but never came. They adjusted the bill after we pointed out the mistake. Overall the price was high , the quality was not great. Maybe we didn‚Äôt order their best dishes. The wine cellar is cool, though.

The grilled razor clams were amazzzzing! Unfortunately they were out of oysters ü¶™ The staff is friendly and service is swift. Complimentary mussels are given with your drink‚Ä¶the only thing I thought a bit odd was that a microwave is used to heat them up. There‚Äôs indoor, outdoor and bar seating available. A bit on the pricier end, but what we had was good. It‚Äôs a cozy vibe where the chef came around to greet the tables.

The food and service at this place are great. It is an expensive place, but it is worth it to celebrate something important and give yourself a good treat. We ate razor clams, shrimp, octopus, among other things from the sea, and grandma's cake!

Best place we have ever been to in the world. Visited from USA and the owner was so wonderful. He introduced us to such great wines. He gave us food to pair with each wine. Everything about this place was amazing. We visited 3 times in our 3 days there!
Great fresh seafood and more importantly, wonderful service always with a smile! Came twice during my visit.  Will definitely come back!

My favourite spot in the market, fresh and tasty scallops ideal with a crisp white wine. Service quick and friendly and not overly busy in this part of the market compared to overall. Also tried the sea urchin, divine!

‚ö†Ô∏è ‚ö†Ô∏è ‚ö†Ô∏è I'll be completely honest. The seafood is nice and fresh but the prices are completely random. Depending who is serving you they really overcharge for a plate. It's extremely expensive and not worth it. Be careful.
Seafood galore. Fresh! Raw cherrystone clams, steamed percebes, oysters, shrimps, and immense happines!

Fantastic quality and top notch service. As close as one can get to experiencing the best of Galician seafood, at a very affordable price, while in Madrid. Octopus, crab, pimientos de padr√≥n, and empanadas Gallegas are all superb. 100% recommended.
Good food, and amazing service. But heads-up, they serve the seafood platter COLD.

I love the food and environment, friendly staff, seafood basket is huge. I prefer the prawns more than crabs. Love the pepper which I can finish one plate by myself. Do not recommend soup and oysters. Overall, good food with very reasonable price.
The restaurant doesn‚Äôt need my review. You do. One of the best seafood experiences I‚Äôve had in my life. I could have died after this meal, but I don‚Äôt want to as I wanna go back.

One of our most favourite restaurants in the world! We love coming here. The service is brusk but so authentic. The shellfish platter is unique and plentiful and superb value. And the only tourists are Spanish!
We were looking for Pulpo a la Gallega and stopped because there was a host at the door that gave us very good vibes, everything was delicious and the service was very good.

The service was correct due to the language barrier. Food was really not great, the razor clam was overcooked and too chewy. The black squid noodles were very salty and the shrimp and squid not super fresh. We also order the grilled shrimp, overpriced for that medium size shrimp. The only good one was the pimentos. Four dishes and one cup of cheap wine for 84‚Ç¨, rip off. Would not recommend.

Located in the middle of shopping street. Place is big so may not need reservation on weekdays. Many choices of seafood items with pictures. Price was not bad depends on what you eat. We getting a la carte and came out great value. Oysters was tasty, mussels was good potion and fresh, shrimp was well seasoning, octopus was tender and flat top grilled seabass was the best. Service fast and intuitive.
The grilled octopus is a must, we ordered another portion right after because it was so good!!
Food was perfect, service was perfect. Try the paella and the specials.
The food was pretty good. I've never seen anyone make seabass fish this good before. I loved it.
I like this place.  Very good fresh seafood, and very good draft beer.
An institution! Love this place simple authentic and the seafood is super fresh. Highly recommend

review_text: Some of the freshest and best seafood in the world is served at this modern styled restaurant from Pescader√≠as Coru√±esas group. The raw material is exceptional, the seafood, the fish, their home made smoked salmon, the seasonal products (angulas), etc. Appropriate selection of wines. Unfortunately the service is very dry and inattentive, just focused on dishing out the food and take it away while you are still chewing. If you cannot book a table, the food available at the bar is also excellent.
Food was spectacular, service was very attentive and the atmosphere was lovely.
You can‚Äôt do anything wrong here. Very traditional Madrid restaurant. Great seafood. Try to get a table in the front room. Acoustic in backroom and atmosphere not very nice‚Ä¶ else super.
Great wine.  Salty fish.  Cold potatoes (even after having them replaced) mediocre salad and stale bread.  And yet they have a photo of the üëë  dining in the restaurant.  So who am I to complain?

Great seafood spot. This is where the locals go. Good quality and nice selection. This is a traditional upscale seafood restaurant in a beautiful part of Madrid. Service can be hit or miss. Make a reservation
Friendly staff and well served, Good food quality, the patatas and calamari were very delicious. The paella was good I think little more spices will take the dish higher level
Completely beyond my expectations. This place deserve to be my first stop in Madrid.

The food is amazing and super fresh! Really really loved the carabineros and special mention to the oysters (the best I‚Äôve ever eaten)! The service was also exceptional. The team was very welcoming and dedicated. They gave us many suggestions and really encouraged us to try the freshest products they received. The restaurant is also clean, very well-maintained and decorated. Thank you so much! I‚Äôll come again!

user_id: We ordered the platter for 6-8 people as we were 8. The portion is generous
restaurant_id: they have rice and inside  the platter you can find potatoes
rating: squid
review_text: clams
date: prawns

review_text: Had an amazing dining! The seafood was exceptionally fresh, and the portion sizes were surprisingly generous, especially considering the affordability of the prices. The flavors were simply outstanding, with the perfect balance of spiciness and seafood freshness - would really recommend the spicy sauce!

It‚Äôs the best seafood boil in all of Spain, we‚Äôve traveled through all of Spain, and nothing came close to this place. The crab is massive and delicious, and the flavor is amazing!! Super affordable compared to other places and our waiter was a complete sweetheart and hilarious.

Very positively surprised, very good food for affordable prices. I ordered around 450 gr of shrimps, it was around 35-40 pieces for 17 euros. Very tasty, fresh, original way of serving the food. I recommend for a sea food restaurant!

My boyfriend and I went here to have dinner and we came out satisfied and wanting to go back again soon. Since it‚Äôs a restaurant that specializes in Galician cooking, the prices are reasonable and the food quality? Just splendid. üëåüèº We really enjoyed the food and the ambience of the place and even recommended it to our friends if they want to experience such decadent cuisine. ü§©ü§©

It was raining and this restaurant was right around the corner from our hotel. They were just a few people since we were not on the Spanish schedule. I speak a little Spanish and both waiters were extremely simpatico. We were new at eating in Spain and ordered too much. We had three appetizers, marinated salmon salad, empanadas and croquetas. All three were very delicious. Unfortunately the entrees were lackluster, not terrible but not great either. My wife had the cod which was a little bit rubbery I had hake in garlic sauce that was actually a little bit bland. We should have just shared one entree because we were too full to finish and had no room for dessert we had some very fine crispy white wine bottom line very good restaurant excellent service I would order different entrees next time
The food was simply amazing; every dish was bursting with flavor. The entire staff was very attentive and professional, always ensuring everything was perfect.

The mixed paella we had here was delicious, we both enjoyed it so much. The croquetas and padron peppers were great also. We loved our desserts, the chuppa chip ice cream was such a treat and the basque cheesecake was fantastic! The service was fantastic, Pablo was so friendly and tried his best with his limited English. There wasn‚Äôt many people when we went so the atmosphere wasn‚Äôt there but it seemed there were a lot of locals there so we felt we had a local experience which was great. Would highly recommend eating here, particularly the paella!

I feel hard done by. I went here based on reviews. However, some of the dishes on the board weren‚Äôt available, and the octopus sandwich was VERY ordinary. Great atmosphere and the fella was super nice. Food was just not really worth writing home about‚Ä¶unless it was an off day.
Amazing food and very nice service. I recommend that you try pulpo a le gallega, navajas a la plancha and lac√≥n a la gallega. Also had a pitcher of sangria, which by far, one of the best I had.

Outside of the atmosphere being a little dated this place is definitely worth the price. Every dish from the Caviar to steak tartare to the incredible fish (I mean absolutely incredible fish served for 2 as the only option on the fish menu served for two) was outstanding! The wine list is incredible and well priced. Plus the portions are BIG!! Finally a place that is highly priced but actually gives you decent portions for the cost...so happy I went here! Reality is overall for what you get it's very well priced

Amazing food, fish is mandatory and well like that place very much‚Ä¶the service could be a bit more attentive and rush less at the table as I dont like if the spill over and over on this nice white table top‚Ä¶. and not apologizing, but nevertheless, very nice place and love the fresh fish selection, price value TOP

Incredible seafood restaurant. I‚Äôm pretty sure we were the only non-Spanish customers that night, but had no problems with our inability to speak the language. Most of the main course seafood items are offered by weight, which was a little confusing. But the staff helped us figure out the right amount of items. Incredible!!

Great showcase for bonito tuna, so we had to try teriyaki and sesame skewers, so juicy and flavourful and raw bonito with saffron was a taste sensation. Everything was quality, clean and well presented and a fun experience. Great job.

I‚Äôll give this place five stars just becomes I‚Äôm obsessed obsessed obsessed with crab crab crab. Honestly, I did not find the crab as shown below to be tasty, it was smoked or salted, but it was obviously fresh! Next time I would want to try the crab cake instead. I still appreciated the freshness and the vibe! Five out of five!
The best experience we‚Äôve had
The crab tapas here are delicious. Ib would totally recommend it. Yours truly @fooderarri
Nice selections, the one in my photo is super tasty!
The food was delicious, fresh and cooked very well. The service was good, tapas came with beer, the waiters didnt know english but its easy to communicate and order by showing them from pictures üôÇ
Very Nice place. Super friendly staff ‚ò∫Ô∏è Pulpo gallego was amazing , shrimps also good ones ü§§ were there twice and would come again üòÉ

The best meal I had in Madrid! We were just walking around the area and found this place had a menu of the day so we went in and we‚Äôre so glad we did. Every single bite of every dish we had here was so heavenly, I could not move on from it after a few days. It makes me want to go to Galicia, Spain to taste more of their dishes there. The staff were so nice too, they were attentive and easy to call even if we were in the corner.
Las Zamburi√±as a la plancha, priced at ‚Ç¨20 for 12 pieces, are delicious and perfectly cooked.

An excellent example of knowing how to cook, a simple menu and enormous respect for the raw materials and ingredients used.  This restaurant faithfully represents what it is to eat in Spain, excellent food, simple, exquisite and well cooked.

Had dinner here on our last night in Madrid. Found after doing google search & read great reviews. Such a cool vibe, great food & service. Started off with charcoal shrimp, arugula salad with pear/walnuts and main entree was of course Argentine steak with truffle fries & grilled veggies. All portions were generous to share & delicious. Very happy we chose here to eat since it was a great way to end our memorable visit.

Sublime meal. The most delicious steak that cut like butter with truffle fries and padr√≥n peppers. Cocktails were yummy and not shy of alcohol. Staff were friendly and very welcoming. Atmosphere/music made me want to get up and dance. Great evening and would highly recommend if you are visiting Madrid.
Gabriel was really great and made sure we had everything we needed! The food was delicious and the cocktails are a must. Definitely recommend!!

We had a lovely meal here. Our server Francis explained the different cuts of meat in English and made us feel very welcome. Starters were generous portions and the place had a really nice vibe. Definitely worth checking out :)

This restaurant is a true gem! The grilled steaks were perfect, octopus was great, they are offering a wonderful selection of wines and cocktails. Desserts are just divine. The atmosphere is inviting. Absolute recommended.

WOW! The steaks are fantastic! Cooked to perfection and very flavorful. One of the best steaks I've ever had and if you have seen any of my reviews you know I love steak! I had the ribeye with french fries. All the starter's we had we're excellent and the sides we're also great. The wine we had was a Spanish red and complimented the steaks very well. We had cocktails to start and all of them were great. Also the service and staff were superb. If your in Madrid city center and want a steak with a fine dining experience this place is for you!

Delicious food cuisines from Argentina and Italy. Our starters, the entrees, and the drinks were all delicious. Table service could‚Äôve been better as I had to flag down our waiters multiple times. Place has two physical locations with lots of seating across from each other. Reservations are highly recommended but we did also come early and lucked out with a walk-in.

I just moved to Madrid and this was my first time eating out alone here, I was greeted warmly and looked after all night by my waiter Jesus. The food was amazing and so was the wine! I couldn‚Äôt have picked a better place to go!

I‚Äôm glad I found this place on Google. We ordered the Strilion steak and the 24-hour marinated chicken breast. The flavors of both dishes were outstanding. The salt on the steak paired with the grilled green peppers made for an interesting and delicious combination. The chicken was thoroughly marinated in a spicy sauce and served with a perfectly cooked sweet potato topped with cheese and ham bits. Highly recommended!
We were just walking past and decided to stop in. So glad we did. The burger was delicious! I like that you can order different sizes. I had a small one which was plenty! The truffle burger ..OMG!!

Absolutely delicious! Great burgers, great other meats. We really couldn't choose so we shared 3 ways which was no problem at all. Service was fast and very friendly. It is a small space but they run multiple turns. If you like good dry aged meat this is the place to be.
The burgers were great and the servers attentive. The quality of the meat was amazing.  Highly recommend.

My partner and I went here for valentines and we have absolutely no bad things to say. Everything was excellent. The variety on the menu, the quick service and quality of the food. Patricia was our waitress and she was spot on with everything. Over all great experience and will be 100% returning.

Me and my mum went to dinner here and it was such a nice experience. The food was amazing and the aesthetic of the restaurant made the meal even better! We had the chicken quesadillas, steak nachos, sirloin steak and caesar salad and they were really nice! The steak nachos for me were the highlight they were so delicious I highly recommend them. We also had some drinks i had a mango mojito which was so refreshing and my mum had a sangria Prosecco which she also enjoyed!
Best burger I‚Äôve had in Spain. Beautiful looking restaurant and the drinks are delicious. My girlfriend LOVED their sangrias. Definitely recommend it to any and all tourists or even locals.

This restaurant is a perfect spot for the Argentinian meat. However, the service could be slightly better you know. The restaurant was not full, but they were so slow, we were waiting for our menu for 20 min. I mean, again it was not full, only a few tables were occupied. But the meat was good, I asked for medium but it was more then medium, medium well. Thanks, they also speak English and warn if the portion is big

Excellent customer service provided by all waiting staff. They were very attentive and also bilingual.  Enjoyed a salad with chicken and a glass of white wine during my first visit.  Ordered the chicken sandwich the second visit but didn't enjoy it as much as the salad.  There were chewy fat pieces that I wasn't able to eat.

user_id: I ordered the SteakBurger Original
rating: and it was absolutely worth every bite! The quality of the meat was excellent
review_text: perfectly cooked
date: and packed with flavor. The overall experience was fantastic
source_user_name: and I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great burger in Madrid.

review_text: I‚Äôve eaten at numerous Steakburger restaurants and food has been good. My meal choice this time was a disappointment - the grilled chicken was horrible, left most of it. It came in strange seasoning and was swimming in oil. Potatoes were cold and so were the tomatoes. I was expecting not to be charged for it, but I was. Nachos were average. Never ordering these meals again. Service was okay and so were the prices
One of the best veggie burgers I ever tried! The waiters were amazing and friendly, and really made us feel welcome and relaxed. This will be our first food stop the next time we go to Madrid.
Very good steak house, the wagyu is extremely tasty, and the cocktail are excellent (the expresso martini)
What a place! Upmarket steak restaurant that delivers in every way.  What an amazing experience.
yummy meats ‚ù§Ô∏è lovely staff
Amazing service, thank you Alejandra

Amazing kosher Steakhouse in Madrid. We had appetizers, steaks, chicken skewers, and schnitzel. Excellent Spanish wine with our meal.  Owners were super friendly and helpful.  An overall great dinner.  A must when in Madrid.

We arrived on a wet night so we were alone in the restaurant, but that meant that the owner gave us all his attention. I like to try and eat "local" food and there were plenty of items on the menu that were Spanish. We had a dish of sliced meats, Spanish sausages and of course an entrecote. All very tasty and some Spanish wine to go with it. Highly recommended.

This Kosher eatery is a bit shabby and looks run down. But the food was fresh and tasty. Draft beer was good. The manager/waiter is an Orthodox Jew who was very pleasant. Service was fast. Central location in Madrid. Worth checking out.

Great little steakhouse.  The food is kosher and excellent. Went there for my last dinner in Madrid with my colleagues and we were not disappointed.  Started off with the classic hummus and a Caesar salad to share.  Then each had the ribeye (medium plus) with french fries.  Excellent seasoning and taste on the steaks. Served with a chimichurri sauce that took the taste to another level.  If you are nearby, stop in and enjoy the food.

The burgers were really delicious! Unfortunately our waitress did not speak a single word english, even words like ‚Äúpotato‚Äù she did not understand at all, so it was a bit difficult to order but the food was still really good!

I visited  Steakburger recently,  I want to recommend 100 % this restaurant everything i ate there was delicious.  I bought ‚Äú la bacon jam ‚Äú and ‚Äú brownie con helado ‚Äú I received a good experience with the food and also with my waitress Gabriela.  She was so friendly and kind, she offered to me really good service and for me the service was really important too. Definitely, I will come back soon because I‚Äôm curious for other options they have on the menu

My favourite Steakhouse in Madrid. I come here every 4 months and the food is delicious. The meat is always on point and they even have options like grilled vegetables or fish. And lastly, the candles are amazing! Looking forward to go again!
Fantastic dinner with some of the best meat I ever had. Great staff with attention to details and making the stay great. Thank you!

Don Asador Parrilla Argentina in Madrid offers a warm, welcoming ambiance that captures the essence of an authentic Argentinian steakhouse. The restaurant‚Äôs decor, with rustic wood accents and soft lighting, creates a cozy atmosphere perfect for an evening out. While the food is decent, featuring a variety of grilled meats, sausages, and classic Argentinian sides, what really stands out here is the friendly, attentive service that makes you feel right at home. The staff is more than happy to guide you through the menu, offering suggestions and ensuring your experience is enjoyable from start to finish. The portions are generous, and there‚Äôs a good selection of Argentinian wines to pair with your meal, enhancing the overall experience. If you‚Äôre looking for a casual spot to enjoy a traditional meal in a pleasant setting, Don Asador Parrilla Argentina is worth a visit for its inviting atmosphere and hospitality.

I went there around 7:15 pm and there was no soul to be found! The staff was very friendly and the service was prompt. Got the Special Meat dish. While the meat and sauces were good, I felt like the meat cuts could have been better. Also the sausage was just half of one, so barely the size of a thumb. Sangria tasted "okay". Not great. Still a good experience!

OMG!  This is a small restaurant, maybe 10 tables but the flavors are incredible. Prices are incredibly reasonable for Madrid.  We had the mixed grill. (Parriadas?). My BF is Argentinian from Corduba and a food distributor and he approves.  The Wine menu  little bit limited, but get the Cab over the melbec in my opinion. And do not miss the empanadas.!!! we had chicken and beef and they‚Äôre both incredible. Absolutely incredible.  Yeah the dessert was excellent as well.  And save the moment and look through the photographs in the restaurant they feature incredible famous Argentinians, such as Manu Ginobili!!  don‚Äôt miss this cute restaurant.  The staff are from Cuba! Honduras! And northern Argentina!
i had the special meat platter so i can taste everything and it was amazing. i enjoyed every piece of meat, and it‚Äôll be a hard time deciding on what to get next time!

Food was good, but the place felt cold inside. Johan was a friend waiter, but he seemed to be alone, hence the feeling I had he was a bit over stressed. Prices are fair , I just had to wait a bit long for my food, and there weren‚Äôt too many people, so kitchen could have worked faster. Over good experience.

It tooks 20 minutes till someone came to take the order. After that it tooks 30 minutes till we got the food. The ribs were OK. The French fries were cold and old. We ordered backed potato but didn't got it. Bad experience. Far away from Berlin.

Have not been to a Tony Roma‚Äôs in a long, long time. Hence, was looking forward to add to my body of good experiences from the past and elsewhere. What a disappointment this latest visit was. Ordered the tenderloin steak. The cut I got served was definitely not a tenderloin! It was tough, cooked very unevenly and not rested at all. As a consequence, my fries were ruined as they became soaked with the steak‚Äôs running juices. In contrast, the roasted vegetables were nice. The waiting staff also deserve commendation. They were a friendly and attentive bunch.

Almost empty restaurant on my visit and the food was served quite quickly. Annoying that the waiter/ manager was permanently on his phone, hiding behind the desk/ bar area - so it was different to get his attention. I‚Äôm not sure why there is a fish tank in the restaurant, it‚Äôs a bit strange. I like ayran but seriously, a litre of it was too much. But it was cheap. Lentil soup was tasty. The condiments in dirty squeezable containers were not appealing. The whole feel to the restaurant was dirty and cheap. Meat was like eating leather. For the price it‚Äôs worth another visit, but I‚Äôll lower my expectations
Everything at this restaurant is wonderful. The service was excellent, the food was very hot and fresh. I highly recommend the lentil soup, very tasty.

Incredible experience!! We came for one specific dish the ‚Äúkunefe‚Äù as it is a Turkish specific desert. Needless to say that this was by far the BEST kunefe I‚Äôve ever had and we‚Äôve been to turkey where it‚Äôs from! The server promptly let us select our table and upon ordering had our delicious desert to our table in 15 minutes. It was ridiculously fresh and had an unbeatable flavor. I‚Äôd highly recommend getting the ‚Äúte turco‚Äù as well to partner with this dish as they compliment each other perfectly! I can only imaging that the meat and other traditional Turkish items taste just as incredible and authentic as this dish. I highly recommend this restaurant for the authentic Turkish experience!!
Good place, tasty kebap,  portions are not small. Prices are normal.
Great food! Had a nice meal, loved all the sauce, and took some baklava to go!

I had an excellent experience at this restaurant! The service was impeccable, and the food was absolutely delicious. The bread and salted butter, along with the soup served immediately before ordering, were simply outstanding and set the tone for a great meal. The dishes were of high quality, perfectly cooked, and full of flavor. I highly recommend this place and will definitely return!"

We had the luck to find De Maria, Plaza Callao, on the first night of our visit to Madrid. We had a very memorable meal. Then 27 days later, on our last night, we invited friends and had our last meal here as well. Sometimes, I find that good memories get distorted and attempts to repeat the magic fail. Not in the case of De Maria, we had another great meal. Excellent service, lots of complimentary additional touches; gazpacho, sorbet, almond cookies and liqueurs added to the extraordinary starters, mains and deserts. Small thing but the best french fries we had in our month to Madrid. Visit this restaurant you will not be disappointed.

Great fine dining place on preciados road . They serve complementary champagne, breads and dessert . The service is quick the individual dishes very tasty . We ordered pastas which were great vegetarian ones .

Edit: WHAT a difference a year makes you'll get better service at your local Mc Donald,  the host needed to ask our names 3 times after being sited, the server threw the menu at the table and ask for our order without asking whether we would be having water or wine needed to ask for the wine list, the server dropped a tomatoe out of our carpaccio to the table and after been ask about it picked up and place it on the serving plate, when the water came he brought only one glass when they're were two people at the table an extra one needed to be requested, we ordered the Solomillo with mushrooms and roqueford, we're still waiting for cheese and mushrooms. The wonderful place we visited last year no longer exists. The food mediocre and the service is the worst I've had on a high price restaurant for years this place in my opinion has turned into a high price dump and will never come back or recommend ever again.
We saved this location for the last night on Madrid and happens to be a great selection. We will come back definitely!

We went here quite late for some dinner, and it was worth it! We were looking for pasta around the area and came over this place. It is more suitable to take the pasta to go, but they also have a few tables inside so you can enjoy your pasta there. They have a nice concept where you can select the type of pasta you want and the sauce. Everything is also super fresh! We loved the pasta here and were very happy we get to try this place!

We came for lunch, and there was a long line, but we still decided to wait. We waited for about half an hour, but it was truly worth it. There are only a few tables, so the pasta is mostly packed to go. However, we ate there, and it was absolutely great! Cheap and delicious ‚Äì I highly recommend it.
The food was very tasty and authentic, especially the Tiramisu. :). The staff and the Service were also great.
We had a dinner at the restaurant. The food was amazing and really delicious. The staff and especially our waitress Stephany are really polite and responsive. I Recommend it.

WOW, my husband and i were split between 3 restaurants to celebrate our anniversary and I‚Äôm sooo happy we chose this one! Food, magic! Service, magic! Drinks, magic! It was all so good! Abel our server was so sweet, funny, and very attentive. 10 out of 10 would highly recommend!
THE BEST FOOD EVER. I will be thinking about the Caprese and cookie skillet for the rest of my life. Yadira was our server and she‚Äôs perfect. 10/10
GENIAL - i love this restaraunt! The pepperoni pizza was amazing. Delicious and great value. Our waiter Deivy was lovely!

The food was incredible. Portions are on the smaller side, but incredibly delicious. The best tirramisu I ever had. The lasagna was very flavourfull. The enterier of the restaurant is beautiful and the service was good!

The food was incredible, but the service could have been better. They seem to be severely understaffed and short tempered with us when we were not very demanding. Took a while to get the check and had to ask again after 15 minutes. FOOD: I ordered one of the Gnocchi dishes and got the Bruschetta bread as an appetizer . My sister ordered the award winning Pistachio pizza and loved it, I tried it and it was incredible. Incredible wine selection as well. Very neat spot and setting but felt a bit stressed from the employees and their temperaments. Not sure that I would go back.

Great pizza. If you want the right Neapolitan pizza in Madrid then go there. Most pizzas are around 15‚Ç¨ and very worth it. The pizza  just melted in my mouth. Soft, incredible tomato sauce and quality toppings.

We were very lucky to stumble upon this place when looking for a restaurant to get lunch. The owner (I think) was very kind and noticed that I‚Äôm cold and he offered to close the doors. All the waiters were nice, helpful and polite. Pizza - delicious!

i instantly fell in-love with this restaurant! their pasta is the best! artesanal, they have open kitchen so you can see the pastas being prepared! great staff, very friendly! definitely worth every penny! we didn‚Äôt have reservation so they told us that we only have 2hrs to eat, i don‚Äôt know if it also applies to does who have reservations but it‚Äôs fine!

The appetizer was absolutely delicious, the burrata was really breathtaking . For the main course I had carbonara which was unfortunately cold. Overall, they mixed up our meals so maybe that's why I was cold. Dessert was tiramisu and it was delicious too. Overall, the restaurant has a great atmosphere. Unfortunately, I can't give 5 stars for the cold food.
We liked the pastas a lot, more than their sauce the texture of the home made pasta is recognizable. The service is fast and efficient. Ambiance is cute. +Thank you Elia for such a friendly service.

This is the perfect place for a high quality meal in a short amount of time. We had reservations at 4 and were out the door 40min later with no waiting time. The Truffle carbonara was INSANELY DELICIOUS. My partner got the Call Me Mama and he loved it too.
Chill vibes and yummy food!! We came to this place on a Saturday night, the food was extremely good and the service Elia provided was also outstanding. Loved it and will definitely come again :)
Great Italian restaurant in Chueca. Broad selection of wines. Fresca pasta, tasty burata cheese, and the best tomato cream sauce for ravioli. We enjoyed every dish and the fantastic service.
The best pasta in Madrid. We went for the truffle pasta and it did not disappoint! Amazing food and great service.

For me it‚Äôs the best Italian restaurant in madrid. The decoration is amazing. The food is tasty and delicious and the portions are great. The staff are very friendly and helpful. You can enjoy the food and the atmosphere like you are in Italy.

We had a variety of food here, and every pasta we ordered was amazing! Paulo was great and recommended a few dishes and wines to us that were 10/10. Would recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a good Italian place with good atmosphere.
A lovely Italian restaurant with a big menu and a great selection of dishes to share. The truffle pasta was excellent! A perfect spot for a relaxed evening with friends/family.

This restaurant was right next to our hotel in Madrid and only about 5 mins walk from the main square, we tried it the first day and were super impressed! It's small inside with good service, proper hidden gem. Super reasonably priced an aprrol spritz was 3 euros! Had the gnocchi and 2 types of pizza then returned on the last day as it was so tasty!
It‚Äôs my favourite Italian place in Madrid! I go there all the time with my Italian friends and they always say it feels like home. They are all super nice, kind and homey.

I absolutely loved the quality of the pizza. You can tell it's crafted and baked carefully. The pizza price range goes from 10,90-14,50‚Ç¨ and they have a vegetarian option too. The service was outstanding, and we didn't have to wait too long to be served, or for the food to come out, so that's appreciated considering the area. The place itself is cozy, and makes you feel like a local. We'd definitely visit again!

Food is as delicious. Prices are reasonable, a pasta dish and one for their pizzas came out to 35 euros. The atmosphere is relaxed with a country side Italian feel. We had a 3 month old baby so they were very accommodating with a high chair and sitting us away from louder guests.

We recently had dinner with friends at this restaurant, and the experience was fantastic. The atmosphere was absolutely wonderful, and the service was exceptional, filled with positive energy. However, the lasagna was a bit disappointing as it lacked depth in flavor and could have used a richer sauce. The Prosciutto e Funghi pizza also could have had a better flavor and combination. Despite this, the overall experience was great. Highly recommend for a delightful evening out!
Such a cozy little spot, with perfectly executed Vitello Tonnato and Truffle Risotto.  A true gem, and the neighborhood is also so friendly and welcoming.
Delicious authentic Italian food.  It was a fantastic dinning experience.

Wow! The perfect place we visited by mistake for lunch. We were in the center of the shopping street, remembered we were starving and came up with this perfect restaurant. We had to wait a bit since we didn‚Äôt have reservations but it was worth it. The cocktails we ordered were delicious and well made. The food was the same, the most delicious oven pizza and the pasta too. Really recommend to stop by for lunch and even dinner. The perfect spot.

A wonderful experience at your restaurant! The welcome was warm and attentive, the atmosphere cozy and inviting. The dishes were delicious, with beautiful presentation. It‚Äôs clear that you take great care in ensuring customer satisfaction, and it shows in the quality of service. We will gladly return and recommend your establishment to others. Thank you for this lovely experience!

We ordered the Carbonara and Spaghetti with Gambon, and both dishes were amazing. However, the sangria had cream in it, which is quite unusual. Most places don‚Äôt serve it that way, so it would be better if they asked before adding it. Aside from that, the food arrived quickly, and the service was great.

The place is excellent, the food is amazing. The service is less, there are not enough waiters, they forgot to serve us some of the things we ordered. They did not serve cutlery with the food on time. Also, the espresso arrived after we finished eating dessert.

After trying many Italian restaurants in Madrid, this is ranking as our favorite. Small restaurant with authentic Italian dishes - in love with the Focaccia and the pasta üçù we will definitely come back when the next pasta cravings hit
Original Italian recipes, very good carbonara and incredible pistachio cheesecake. We recommend booking a table in advance.
A very good pizzeria, I think was the 35 award in a worldwide tournament. The local it's medium and cosy. Very recommended
Yileng was an amazing. The food was delicious, we got a table really fast even though we didn‚Äôt have a reservation. Definitely recommend this place.

Recommended by our hotel concierge to Oven Mozzarella Gran Via 55 for this Italian restaurant. Great food and very nice ambience. Parmigiana de Melanzane (baked aubergines with parmigiano reggiano cheese and homemade pomodoro sauce), fresh spaghetti with red shrimp, smokey chipotle and pomodoro sauce, pizza l'originale and biscotti for dessert. So so good. Reservation is required.
Unbelievable! Superb food, lovely staff and decor is fabulous. We had two superb pasta dishes, the focaccia was amazing and the cheesecake was the best ever.
Cozy place, regardless of the tourist place. Price ok, just fried dough and hot chocolate, but this return to childhood.
Thought we would try some Italian will in Madrid. The food and wine were excellent. The service was very good, although the servers were run off their feet. Loved the atmosphere.
Overall, a great little Italian spot. Service was relatively quick and the food was good. I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôd rush back to them but they were definitely good.

Food is really good, specially the pizzas that are delicious and come in good size for one. The service is a bit slow, so don‚Äôt rush to get in and out, but the servers are very friendly. I recommend.

Amazing!!! If you want to eat pasta in Madrid, stop looking and come to Bresca. I went there twice on my trip, first with my girlfriend, and then we came back with our friends! The pasta is truly amazing, and there are loads of vegan, vegetarian or gluten free options. There‚Äôs even an entire page on the menu dedicated specifically to vegan options, and another one for gluten free options. There were plenty of vegetarian choices on the ‚Äúmain menu‚Äù as well. Great atmosphere and very nice decorations. The service was excellent too. I highly recommend the pasta with pear and Gorgonzola (one of the best pastas I have ever eaten!). The only negative thing is that the portions are quite small, which is actually too bad because the pasta is really delicious. The price is okay though. I would really recommend going, you won‚Äôt regret it :)
Delicious authentic Italian dishes. Vegan friendly. Passion fruit lemonade was so tasty. Definitely I will be back. Reservations are welcome.

The food is great, the staff are nice, the decoration was nice, but there was something about the place didn‚Äôt creat the good vibes, maybe the toilet are need to be improved, there were flies  coming from the basement next to the toilet.
Reservations are a must! A small place but you won't find better Italian food! A total pleasure for the palate! Highly recommended!

Simply wonderful. Loved Giuseppe and Estella . We were made to feel so welcome by them. The food was the best we had in Madrid by far. The wonderful atmosphere with the amazing food and entertaining wait staff  made for the best experience we have had . The pear/gorgonzola pasta and seafood  dishes were to die for. We will be back. Best time we've had in Madrid. Thank you for an enjoyable evening. You must get a reservation since there are only 5 tables. Call for assistance.
A stunning Italian restaurant in Madrid. Great wines, great food, good vibes. Worth a recommendation üëåüëåüëå
The cutest small restaurant. I love the food, it was amazing and the service super fabulous. Homemade Italian cuisine in Madrid ‚ù§Ô∏è

The best meal with the best service I have ever experienced. The vibe of the place feels like you walked into your grandparent's house and the couple (owners) there make the place so welcoming. The food was better than food you would find in Italy. Can't wait to go back

WOW for the taste, OUCH for the price! Bricco Gourmet Madrid offers fresh and delicious food with great flavors, making it a delightful dining experience. However, the prices feel a bit steep for what you get. If you‚Äôre planning to visit, I‚Äôd recommend checking the menu carefully and ordering accordingly to avoid any surprises!

Very good dinner at Bricco Gourmet! The owner is very nice and explains how and where the ingredients are from. It tastes really good ! I didn't know the Pinsa Romana, made with rice and it's very suitable fro gluten-free diets. They also have vegetarian options. Also the street was not too crowded which was enjoyable for eating outside üòä

Truly the BEST pizza I‚Äôve ever had! The food was incredible, and our host was super knowledgeable and recommended the perfect wine and beer to accompany our meal. We cannot wait to come back to Madrid just so we can eat here again!

I'm so glad we were able to make it here. Top notch service, delicious al dente porchini mushroom and black truffle risotto, and multiple options for fresh ingredient pizzas (including buffalo mozzarella). Thank you so much for making our last dinner in Spain memorable. Kudos to nonna. ü•∞

Coming from Canada this is 100% a place to go.  The owner is extremely passionate and knowledgeable, and the food was top notch. Some of the best pizza and risotto ever. The lemonchello spritz were delectable and I wish everywhere made them even close to this good. The cannoli was an amazing way to finish the meal. His connection to his family is endearing and his grandmother should be proud of the tradition he is keeping alive.
focaccia was delicious and great service too! super friendly
This place is a Gem in the heart of Madrid! Ricardo is so friendly and always smiling:) we had drinks and the Darsena Focaccia. Everything was great! We‚Äôll be back soon :)

We were very surprised by the place. We have tried the Rivello, Pepe nero, Maniero foccacias. The rivello is the traditional one that can never be missing. We also recommend trying the Maniero, where honey and bacon are the main protagonist. The owner of the place (Ricardo) is extremely friendly and has been attentive at all times.

We had the come a casa and Carnegie sandwich. Both were delicious. The meats are cut on the spot and the focaccias are as delicious as what they put inside. Staff is very friendly and made sure every spot stayed clean. Definitely recommend this place for a great lunch. We paid 19.80 euros for 2 sandwiches.
Wow amazing sandwich. The foccacia bread with crisp outside soft inside with basil and mortadella flavor combination was delicious. Highly recommended.

We happened upon Oliveto after going to the Centro De Arte and i feel lucky the three of us had lunch there. Outstanding Italian menu with some Spanish delights as well. Exceptional food and a good selection of wines and beers too, plus pretty good value.

Place is always busy so make reservations. It is pretty small with only about six tables. The meal was a bit rushed as they organize a second sitting so they asked us to order our meals after only sitting down for a few minutes. Appetizers arrived within a few minutes and were good, not awesome. I enjoyed my meal, but other reviews were mixed.  The lemoncelo treat at the end was a nice touch from them. I would return again for a quick meal.

Great italian restaurant close to reina sofia. Excellent pizza and pasta (we were a group of 7 and everything we tried was delicious). Service super friendly and happy to accomodate any changes (even created a dish not on the menu for us...) Portions are not huge. Very fair price especially considering the quality.

Great food, wine, and service. I wanted just some noodles and sauce, not on the menu, but the accommodated me, no problem. Followed by the Regina Margherita pizza. The sauce was spectacular, on the pasta and pizza. Crust was perfect as well with the fresh mozzarella. Wine paired great with everything. And the tiramisu was delicious. Great place.

An absolute gem of Italian ! Awesome food and service. Incredible menu del dia for only ‚Ç¨14.99 for three courses and a drink. The wine was very good too. The bresaola was best I have eaten in years in a restaurant. I will be back!!!

Lovely Italian restaurant with delicious FRESH pastaüòç Had fiocchi filled with pear, gorgonzola sauce & truffle. Super delicious! Everything was perfect and it‚Äôs the perfect place if you are looking for a chilled place. The service was quick & on the point. No ‚Äúshi shi‚Äù & not too friendly - just everything you needed.

It‚Äôs my second time there to enjoy a lunch with my collaborators. Amazing as the first time, this place exceeded all our high expectations. Specially the Beijing Duck, a tasteful flavor to remind me of my hometown. The only thing I think they could improve is the music. It‚Äôs so cringe and does not fit the place well that‚Äôs why the 3 stars out of 5. Maybe no one is talking about the music but for me ambient music is important for a successful business. Cheers!

Really good place for Asian food! The whole restaurant is very well decorated and I am in love with the entrance and the mirrors. The atmosphere is very cozy with a dark lighting. The food came fast and everything was super delicious. The service was also good. Overall, I definitely enjoyed it and I would come back!

I wonder if all the favorite rating are for the setting. As someone from New York, the food taste no more than 2 out of 10. The steak is not tender. The Iberia port char-shiu is overly fatty. The sauces for both are greesy. We paid 120 Euro and out of the restaurant very unsatisfactied

The decoration of the environment tells a luxury story. The bartender has a very good sense of humor and his skill is one of the kind. My drink shows a fabulous flavor. I personally recommend this place. I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll have a great time there.

Impeccable service. Great lunch menu with delicious choices. I had the assorted dom sum, the iberico ham with citrus and the chocolate brownie. All were amazing. I could have eaten the dim sum 3 more times, perfect pockets of scrumptious pleasure!! Quiet, calm, serene atmosphere. Located close to Grand Via. A great experience!
Top experience for when you need a break from indulging in endless tapas in Spain. The freshness of ingredients and light cooking techniques provide a refreshing tasting during a long vacation.

I really enjoyed this Asian restaurant! They have a great variety of dishes. We tried the tasty meat and shrimp gyozas, and the dragon roll sushi was amazing. The duck with crepe-style pancakes and sauce was exceptional, highly recommended! Also, the langostino with asparagus and spicy sauce is a must-try if you like spicy food. The restaurant is spacious, quiet, and the service was fast and attentive. I highly recommend it!

Impeccable service and exquisite taste and flavors. Love the nice touch of free crackers at the beginning and a complimentary digestive plum liqueur and walnut to complete the meal. The pork dish Guo Bao rou and wonton soup was exceptional and a must try!

If you're a foodie, you simply can't miss this restaurant! Every dish we ordered was a masterpiece. The sushi was incredibly fresh, with the fish tasting as if it had just been caught from the ocean.La noria was light and crispy, with a perfect balance of crunch and tenderness. The staff were attentive and knowledgeable, making our dining experience even more enjoyable. It's no wonder this place is popular.

user_id: The highlight
rating: is the food. Every dish we tried was unique
review_text: with fresh ingredients and rich flavors. I ordered the signature steak
date: which was perfectly seared with just the right tenderness. My friend's seafood pasta was equally impressive
source_user_name: with incredibly fresh seafood and perfectly cooked pasta.

review_text: Had a great experience here! The staff was super friendly, and the food was both delicious and beautifully presented. One of the dishes even came in a Ferris wheel, which was a fun surprise. Overall, a nice spot for good food and a welcoming atmosphere. Will definitely be back!

I love Asian food and this is hands down my favourite restaurant in Madrid. Every single thing is home made and you can taste it, and it never sits on your stomach. The staff are attentive and super efficient and the location inside the market is super picturesque. 1000% recommend
A little taste of home.. As an Asian person who lives in Europe, We‚Äôre happy to find this place in Madrid. The Owner is really friendly. The foods taste great and the place also really cozy..

All the authentic flavours of Asian food! I had the most delicious noodle dish that they kindly adapted to be meat free. Great service. Great experience. Great prices. Highly recommend and will go back!

Just had a delicious dinner at Asian Army! Everything we ordered was delicious and the service was good. The dumplings with their special sauce was delicious, we also had the chicken skewers and Vietnamese spring rolls (big rolls!).  Highly recommend this place if you are like us, need a break from Spanish food and tapas.

Lovely little restaurant in downtown Madrid, with very friendly and helpful staff, knowledgeable about allergies, lactose intolerance and gluten. Wide variety of food from ramen to rice and udon noodles. My favourites were la tortita salada, won ton soup and baozi dumplings. Prices are decent and service very quick. Would recommend!
The staff were super super friendly and kind. Big portions of food served fast, very tasty and cheap.

Amazing and authentic Chinese food in the heart of Madrid. Ramen comes with excellent soup. Seafood ramen came with very fresh shrimp and the eggs are perfectly cooked. The people working there are incredibly kind and welcoming. 10/10. Would recommend.
The homemade Chinese food here is absolutely amazing, and the staff are incredibly friendly. Highly recommend!

A cozy place in the heart of Madrid, with genuine spicy Asian delicacies. Tried their Juan men rice meal, and it made us come back for the second time during our 3 days stay in the city. Plus you get Weisbiers if you are a fan German beers.
So the food was very fairly priced, which I was in shock. Every single thing we ate was absolutely delicious. I have the diverse Asian population in Madrid and this restaurants is one of the reasons.

This place has great atmosphere but stay away from the Thai in the back. Noodles were drenched in sweet sauce and the overcooked noodles were inedible with chop sticks because they fall apart. I went back to tell the cook and she did not make it right. Terrible experience at 18‚Ç¨
Mayaki Thai Street Food was ok. Pad Thai was not authentic at all, not sure why they added cabbage to it instead of bean sprouts. Khao Soi was too sweet and Pad Thai portion was quite small.
We got food from two vendors: Unagi Sushi and sone noodle place. Also we got some beers from the bar. In general all good!

The food was amazing! We ordered the chicken noodle soup, fried rice, and fried chicken. The noodle soup was absolutely delicious‚Äîso flavorful, I simply loved it! The fried chicken and rice were great as well. Overall, a fantastic meal. Highly recommend!

I was told this is the one of the best sichuan restaurants in Madrid so maybe I set my expectation too high. The food is authentic but lacks something we called ‚ÄúÈîÖÊ∞î‚Äù. Can do better so leave 4 stars :)

A very authentic Chinese restaurant, great menu, large portions, amazing atmosphere, friendly staff,  lovely decor, the crispy duck was flavoursome and delicious, but we found the squid tentacles with red chilli a little chewy. We booked a table and would highly recommend this as a very busy place.

Had the Fever Executive Menu and wasn't disappointing. Food was delicious, the place has good atmosphere and nice decoration, and staff was friendly. The offer included 3 dishes, dessert and drinks, which was a great deal! The size of the portions are OK considering that they are tapas style.

We enjoyed our food here. Asian cuisine with a Spanish touch, some twists and nice options to pick from. Most of the items on the menu have fish/seafood (I guess there are some 5 that were not). They have a deal where you can pick 4 little plates for ‚Ç¨25. I mostly think 3 plates per person are enough but the deal was worth it.
Compared to all the other restaurants i have been to in Madrid, this one was by far my favorite. The food had great flavor and presentations. Just one thing - please clean the shrimps. >_

The restaurant is well decorated and creates a nice atmosphere; however, the food did not rise to that level. The dishes offered nice presentation and big flavour but only managed to be one note and lacked depth. I do have to say the service was good and quick.
Very good sushi, amazing tinto de verano, a great atmosphere and friendly staff

I've never tried Chinese food before, but it was worth a shot. The waitress helped me choose from the men√∫, and the dishes were tasty. However, I'm not a fan of the atmosphere, and overall, it wasn't good enough for me to want to return.
I eat here everyday during my trip to madrid for a week haha,  authentic, good price, delicious,  i definitely will visit madrid just to eat here again  i recommend
We tried a couple of dishes from this place and everything was just so good! We really liked the spicy crispy tofu and definitely recommend the place if you‚Äôre craving some authentic Chinese food.

The best malatang in Madrid so far! I have tried other ones but this one stands out the most for its value to price and the taste above all! I barely ever write a review but this is definitely deserving of one. I would recommend this to all my friends! I ordered a soup base of normal spicy and it was good, not too spicy if you have good tolerance. The ingredients are fresh, you can tell. Overall, 5 stars!

This is some of the best food I‚Äôve had in Madrid. I‚Äôm gluten free and my spouse is not. We both thoroughly enjoyed the ribs and pork sisig, both gluten free. The portions were generous, ingredients were fresh, and food was served piping hot. The ribs were so flavorful and tender the meat fell off the bone. The owner is friendly and very knowledgeable about a variety of food allergies and special diets, including Celiacs. We will definitely be back because I want to try the rest of the gluten free options, including gf ramen. Thank you for your hospitality, clear allergen labeling, and sharing your delicious menu with us.
Such good food!!! Gluten free sushi  vegan options! Very fresh ingredients, so good, and made with care. Great service as well!
Delicious. For the best Asian street food in Madrid you must try Onii Chan
Amazing food and outstanding service. Absolutely love it & will keep repeating. Muchisimas gracias John üôè

user_id: The dishes are light and home-cooked
rating: homely feel. While not particularly impressive
review_text: the portions are generous and the prices are reasonable
date: making it a solid choice for a quick

review_text: Good food with a really nice service

The meat is rich in flavor, fat but not greasy. Paired with white rice topped with marinated sesame seeds, every bite is particularly satisfying. And the candied egg is an extra bonus, cut open with a knife, the runny egg yolk and the braised pork sauce are perfectly blended, and the flavor levels are suddenly enriched. The overall portion is very generous and the price is reasonable. It is really a Taiwanese delicacy that makes people want to remember it after eating it.

Very good new restaurant! I was so happy to find a mixian restaurant in Madrid! The atmosphere and the staff are very nice. Service is also very quick. The soups were very tasty! The quantity is also more than enough and you can ask for more mixian. Will come back to try other flavors!! All the best!

It's the best rice noodles that I have tried in Madrid! The service here is really nice! The waiters are really sweet and very patient.  The restaurant is located in a quiet area and really close to the Royal Palace! really walkable! If you wanna try some real Chinese noodles I will definitely recommend here!
Clean and nice environment. Food is superb. Order the soup with pimiento, which add a slight pinch of spicy that is tolerable for non-spicy eaters like me. Highly recommended for winter.
Recently they changed their menu a bit. Still, best dish combination is 20 and 75, rice and chicken curry (mix all together to enjoy).
A really nice restaurant with reasonable prices, delicious food and friendly staff.

Nice Chinese restaurant for Chinese food lovers, It's near to hotel sterling where i was staying in Madrid. they don't have alot of vegetarian dishes but somehow i found veg noodles and spring roll that was fantastic. Hotel staff and cleanliness was quality.

So nice place with good offer ! We had a buffet for 13.75 per person . A lot of food for this price and delicious as well ! Thanks for our waitresse Maria for good service and explanation, very kind lady.  Defiantly can recommend this restaurant.

If I ever find myself in Madrid, I can‚Äôt miss stopping by this place and ordering one of my absolute favorites‚Äîtheir roasted duck. The food is incredibly delicious, and the staff is very attentive and friendly.

I ordered pan fried rice noodles with vegetables, sweet and sour chicken over rice and fried almond shrimp. They are a little on the salty side but that is usually the case when you eat out. My kids and I enjoyed our dinner and the servers were all very nice and attentive.

If you don‚Äôt need great atmosphere and luxury interiors, but huge portions of tasty food - this place is for you. We had sashimi plate, wok and combo. The plates were huge!! Loved this place for its simplicity. And the prices are really low.

I wanted to like this more as staff were lovely and welcomed me as solo diner, but I found their Chinese-style food lacking (hot and sour soup was neither, and the prawn and vegetable noodles were bland; but the fried dumplings *were* good). It was a busy Friday, maybe they were having an off day?
Ordered fried beef, sweet and sour pork, and fried rice. Everything is just perfect!
Amazing!!!! We ordered dumplings with shrimp, chicken, beef and pork and not one of them disappointed!! Took only a few minutes for the food to come and the staff was so nice. Absolutely recommend

If you're craving for dumplings, this is the place and its hand-made. They serve mostly dumpling; pan seared and steam. Its also very affordable , 10 pcs of dumplings for 5‚Ç¨ - 7‚Ç¨ . Decors are creative with notes that u can draw on and leave it there for extra touch. The servers were attentive as well and nice. definitely a fave now (with stamp card that could give you free food when u come often).
By far the best dumplings in town ‚Ä¶ the gamba and black truffle are amazing, the pork and fish, the pork ‚Ä¶ you will not be disappointed with any.
One of my favorite places to dine in Madrid. The gyozas are delicious and so is their tinto de verano. It‚Äôs also a very affordable place, which makes it even better.

Lovely restaurant serving delicious food. The owners are kind and the service is top notch! I ordered the wrong thing and they insisted I only pay for the right order. For that act of kindness alone they deserve all the praise!! Definitely recommend giving them a visit and enjoying their lovely food and hospitality.

Disappointed at the food. Bao buns were deep fried and super greasy. Not fresh soft buns like they should be. The beef noodle soup was not a nice clear broth and full of mushrooms and meat that had a lot of fatty pieces. Lastly the spicy wontons were in a super sweet sauce. Nothing like what they should taste like.

Amaazing food! The whole experience from start to finish is great, waitresses are so friendly and kind. The food can‚Äôt get better and perfect portion size. Our family really enjoyed the experience. The only small complaint is the coffe - it was really bad (unfortunately i am italian)

Comfortable and relaxed Asian kitchen with a nice choice from across the continent. Dumplings were filling and tasty, green curry creamy and full of veg, sushi platter just right. I give 5 stars when I find no faults and this place with it‚Äôs awesome staff were faultless.

Great service and yummy food. We got the Dan Dan noodles and the 1st bento box. Both were great! Also got the spicy Szechuan dumplings but we didn‚Äôt like them as much because they were a bit too sweet and not very spicy and a bit too doughy. Not worth the 10‚Ç¨

Visited this restaurant with two other friends for dinner on a Sunday. I ordered prawn noodles, chicken momos, and chicken with Sichuan sauce. All of them tasted good. Service could have been faster. Maybe we were at the busiest time, so food preparation took little time.

The best Chinese dumplings I have ever had overseas, both steam and pan fried ones are delicious. I‚Äôve visited many times within a week while staying in Madrid. The price is pretty fair. Service is good!
The food was so good. It‚Äôs perfect for a fast, delicious wok dinner.

Fast service and a wide selection of options. Choose your base (vegetables, rice, or different kinds of noodles) then your meats/vegetables, then your sauce. The food was ready in less than 10 minutes after ordering. They offer dine-in or takeaway also.

Excellent food and service. I would definitely do the tasting menu. You get to try their best dishes and they do small portions so you don‚Äôt feel like you over ate by the end. Great place for a business lunch or special occasions.

You wouldn't expect this quality and type of restaurant in this place, but it's been here for years! The food is amazing, very seasonal and fresh. It's fine dining, but without the molecular or fancy things, just great ingredients prepared with love. The wines are amazing too! It's on the pricey side if you expect to be pampered like a Michelin star restaurant or comparable price, but the local atmosphere and friendly people make up for it. The shrimps and the salpicon are so good and if you're lucky enough to get the teardrop peas, you're going to have one of the best meals

Food was nice. We had the middle menu and 20% of it was amazing but the rest was just good. May be our expectations were too high. Or may be the fact that we had to wait 45 minutes to get the first dish annoyed us. Overall almost three hours to have dinner was too much for a pleasant experience.

Birthday gift of tasting menu from our daughter.  18 courses of Canary-inspired flavors! Wow! Every bite was a new taste experience. Topped off with best chocolate ice cream bite ever!!  Servers were very courteous and friendly in a well-lit, stylish dining room.  Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

Lovely, round tasting menu. I was very happy with the smaller sized menu and the Canarian wine pairings to go with them. The atmosphere was relaxed, the staff was kind (and practiced my Spanish with me!), the pictures tell the story of the food‚Ä¶

Although it lost its Michelin star in 2023, L√∫a is still a fantastic restaurant. The chef, Manuel Dom√≠nguez, enhances traditional Galician dishes with unique creative elements. It's an excellent stepping stone into haute cuisine, without the sometimes exuberant mannerism of more distinguished places. While you can order individual dishes, we opted for the tasting menu. Consisting of 2 appetizers, 3 starters, 2 main dishes and 2 desserts, it is adequately priced at ‚Ç¨92 per person. The quality is on par with what you would typically get in a traditional-leaning 1-Michelin-star restaurant.
