Our highlights were the peach gazpacho and the foie micuit with pear and caramelized cheese. While I'm not a fan of the traditional Santiago cake for dessert, the coulant version they make at L√∫a is amazing. The only thing that could be improved are the meat dishes: you can choose between suckling pig and squab, but both rely a bit too much on the sauce they are served with. Other than that, we had a great dinner in a relatively casual atmosphere.

What a surprising and great dinner! We had a fantastic meal where we tried incredible and interesting dishes. The pigeon was the star of the show! It would‚Äôve been perfect if the wine pairing could‚Äôve been explained a bit better or in general a bit more time for service and enjoyment of the atmosphere was possible.

Our visit to Lua was one of those cozy, warm experiences that you treasure forever. We had wonderful food and wine in the company of good friends. The service we received was incredibly friendly and informative, both elegant but approachable, intuitive to our needs. We chose to start with an order of  Foie Midcuit Sobre Empanada De Pera Y Queso San Sim√≥n Caramelizado, and a half order of impeccably soft and supple Pulpo a Feira. My companion ordered their Lubina con Verduritas, and I had the Verdinas con Carabineros, and the Raya En Caldeirada Sobre Sopa De Ib√©ricos. For dessert, I had the Brownie con Helado de Turron y Trufa (yes, it had authentic black truffles shaved on top) and my friend a "deconstructed" Tarta de Santiago. The whole meal was amazing; some of the dishes were elevated versions of traditional Galician dishes (the Verdinas or the Tarta de Santiago) while others were successful experiments (like the Fois Midcuit or the crazy-delicious Brownie with Turron Ice Cream and shaved Trufa). Lua deserves their 2023 Michelin star!

I had the tasting menu and cannot fault any of the dishes at all. Beautifully presented, amazing dishes. A great value for money because of the quality of dishes being extremely high. I would certainly return if I am in Madrid again.

From the moment we arrived, we were warmly greeted, and our coats were carefully taken. The staff was both exceptionally friendly and highly professional, ensuring a flawless experience. The tasting menu was outstanding, with each dish beautifully presented and thoughtfully explained, making it truly unforgettable. Fabio, in particular, stood out for his kindness and professionalism, adding to the restaurant‚Äôs impeccable service.

What a wonderful food experience! We had the 10 course menu - and there was not a single dish which hadn‚Äôt deserved a Michelin star. Vibrant tastes, spicy and full of flavor. The dishes were just the right size and each of them beautifully arranged. Interesting wine pairing. The Kuoco is absolutely to be recommended .

The food was so amazing! Very unique tasting menu. Our favorite was the shrimps but everything was truly delicious. Service was amazing. We went with the waiter‚Äôs recommendation with wine pairing. Totally worth it! Wish everyone can try this place!

This restaurant was an absolute gem! While visiting Madrid, my husband and I made a reservation here for lunch, and we couldn‚Äôt have been happier with our choice. From the moment we arrived, it was clear that this place was something special. The drinks were masterfully crafted. We ordered the Pisco Nikkei, which was a refreshing blend of flavors, and the Spicy Margarita, which had just the right amount of kick‚Äîboth were amazing. We tried a variety of dishes from the menu, and each one was a delightful surprise. The Wonton Crujiente was a crispy, flavorful start, and the Croqueta Chili Crab was rich and indulgent. My favorite appetizer was the Japo Pani Puri‚Äîan innovative twist that was bursting with vibrant flavors. We also tried the 7 Potencias, a seafood dish that was as delicious as it was beautifully presented, and the Ceviche, which was fresh, zesty, and perfectly balanced. Every bite was an exceptional experience, full of bold and exciting flavors. The combination of expertly crafted cocktails, innovative dishes, and a warm, inviting atmosphere made this lunch one of the highlights of our trip to Madrid. If you're looking for a dining experience that offers both creativity and quality, this restaurant is an absolute must.
The experience is highly worth it! I had the best dishes in Madrid so far. Sergio's attention and kindness took it to a whole new level. Strongly recommend!

Beautifully designed restaurant, elegant and cozy at the same time. Very interesting menu, a journey into Mediterranean flavors, from meat to seafood to delicious vegetables and fruits. Kind and attentive staff. Recommended for special occasions.

Poor attention to detail for a Michelin starred restaurant, our server was very cold, lacked energy, and felt forced to do the job. We would not mind had the food been good, but it was not. Like other reviews mentioned, most dishes were too salty or too rich. Starters were the highlights, and everything went downhill afterwards. We did not even finish the rooster/squid dish. While the chef had interesting takes on the offal, execution was not there.

Some of the dishes were truly outstanding especially the pig feet tartlets but some courses were quite bland. While the sommelier and the wine pairing truly stood out and felt all wines were in harmony with the food the rest of the staff seemed confused at some point first rushing us through the meals then completely forgetting us at the end.

We wanted to take advantage of a Michelin star restaurant while visiting Madrid, and La Tasquer√≠a did not disappoint! The service was fantastic- they have a few servers who speak English, if your Spanish isn‚Äôt very strong- and they made recommendations, gave opinions, etc. A reservation is required. The menus offer a variety of dishes using offal from many different animals, and we were pleasantly surprised by some things we‚Äôve never tried. While I strongly believe you cannot go wrong with any of the menu options, I really enjoyed each dish from the Set Menu M, especially the dessert. The atmosphere definitely lends itself to a ‚Äúspecial occasion‚Äù if you want, but is not pretentious and is very welcoming. The chef goes around and speaks to patrons, which is just a nice touch. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience!

Interesting Japanese fusion. Some plates were a small representation of bigger plates like arroz a la cubana and very delicious although we had a hard time with the waiters due to some of them not even remembering the ingredients that each plate had or mistaking plates and giving them to other customers more than once.  We spotted the waiters standing and talking quite a few times while we had asked for the bill and had to wait half an hour to receive it and waiting the same or longer to be served as well. Me and my partner left very much later than we intended to due to these inconveniences. Overall good food but poor service.

Really good and interesting restaurant. This is a true fusion restaurant. Meaning that the chef clearly knows a lot about Japanese and Spanish cuisine and is able to mix them both in creative and delicious ways. The nigiris were great. It is on the expensive side and the portions are small so you need to order more. The dining room decor is OK, nothing outstanding.

overall nice and casual vibe! tried the 7-course seasonal tasting menu and my fav was the low-temperature egg with truffle, seasonal mushrooms and Iberian broth‚Äîsuper tasty soup base! moscato was really good too. only thing was that some of the dishes were a bit salty for me
Bomb food. The shot of pumpkin soup they give you is good. Good cheese board. Incredible tripe dish & wonton prawn appetizers. Good duck, & tasty dessert.
Highly recommended. All food were nice and delicious. The squid and seafood rice were amazing. Price was reasonable too.
A real gem, fantastic place! A little bit outside, close to Bernabeu stadium, we found this fabulous restaurant. Also special for Madrid, early dinners are possible.

Deciding to lunch at Donzoko was one of our best decisions ever! the food here is spectacular, very fresh, high quality and good variety (they even had hamachi which is hard to find in Europe). the hosts are very friendly and polite and the atmosphere is beautiful. the prices are also very reasonable. we went to other ‚Äúauthentic sushi places‚Äù in Madrid such as Miyama but we liked this place a lot more!
Noticeably better quality and presentation than many other places. Good price for the quality. Definitely worth visiting. Great decor too.

This was an incredible Japanese dining experience! The authentic flavors were felt in each and every dish. Sony, our English-speaking server, added a personal touch with friendly service and great recommendations. Highly recommend while visiting Madrid!

Very nice and authentic Japanese restaurant! The service was great, everyone was so welcoming, attentive and professional. The sushis and sashimi were great! Good portion and very fresh! We also had takoyaki and green tea. It was perfect for 2. The pace at which the dishes were served was also perfect. We booked a table in the tatami room, which we highly recommend. It was very charming, the atmosphere was calm with very relaxing instrumental Japanese music. The seats were also very comfortable. It was a Saturday at 1pm and we were almost alone the whole time in the tatami room. Overall, it was a really special and delighting experience! I‚Äôll definitely come back again!

user_id: However
restaurant_id: the service was a bit slow
rating: and the wait time for the food was around 20-25 minutes. As for the food itself
review_text: I was somewhat disappointed. I expected more
date: especially from the Sanbeiji Chicken
source_user_name: which lacked vibrant flavors. The special infusion drink was also too sweet and watery when it should have been thicker.

review_text: W shop for offering authentic merchandise, from jerseys and scarves to collectible memorabilia. The great employees provide exceptional service, ensuring every supporter finds the perfect item. It's the ultimate destination for Madridistas to showcase their passion for the iconic football club! "HALA MADRID"

Terrible service, the staf is more interested in chatting with each other than assisting customers. They work in official Real Madrid store but don‚Äôt even know the players‚Äô names. They clumsily stick letters onto the jerseys.

Service was bad! The workers there seems like they don‚Äôt want to work. No smiles no welcome no hi! The queue was super slooow! I had 2 people in front of me and had to literally wait 35 min.. not only that when we were about to go out the store my bag started the alarm. The cashier forgot to take the alarm off my purchase.. that‚Äôs how lazy the staff was. Other staff took care of it and apologized on behalf of her lazy colleagues poor her, cleaning up after her colleagues
As a RM Fan, I will never forget that I paid 15 euros for a bag without realizing it :) The products were of very good quality and the staff was very friendly.

This place is surely to give your eyes a shower of extreme opulence. It was mesmerising to see the length to which monarchs invested their wealth in so many intricate details. My absolute favorite part was the collection of musical instruments, which include 2 Stradivarius violins and one Viola. I found the rest of the castle overwhelming, but that is not to say that it is not an enjoyable experience

Don't Wait In Line To Buy A Ticket Also Don't Buy In Advance Both Options Your Have To Wait Up To 1 to 2hrs to get in. The only and honestly best way is to use a tour guide or agency that offers tour guides, your pay probably 5 or 6 euros more only and your get a guided tour around the palace however you won't have to wait straight through no problem.
A spectacular palace! It is highly recommended to pre-book your tickets online. Where you have a specified entry time as well as having a dedicated entrance with no waiting time.

One of the most gorgeous royal palaces in the world, filled with art pieces and decorations that will leave your mouth open. It is usually quite crowded so it's better to go early. The audio guide is very helpful and worth the price.

A stunning and grand palace with impressive architecture and beautifully decorated rooms. The visit is worth it, but the ticket price is quite high, and despite having a ticket, there was still a long waiting time. If you don‚Äôt mind the crowds, it‚Äôs a great place to explore Madrid‚Äôs royal history!

We visited around 11am and it was virtually empty! The staff were the friendliest of all the Madrid museums and galleries we have visited, everyone said hello. We enjoyed 3 floors of paintings and sculptures. You have to go up the steps on left to ticket office at the shop. There is a large lift inside. Fantastic comfy sofas to sit and admire the artwork, unlike the hard benches at other galleries! These were very comfortable!

I visited both the permanent exhibition of this museum and the temporary exhibition of Goya. While the permanent collection was more engaging than the Goya exhibit, overall, if you‚Äôre in Madrid for just a couple of days, I‚Äôd suggest prioritizing more popular art museums. In my opinion, this museum wasn‚Äôt particularly impressive. However, I did find some individual art pieces that I liked a lot.

Very nice museum with lots of beautiful artworks spread over the floors. The staff is helpful but doesn't always speak English. Admission is free, at least in the winter season. Definitely see the copper plates used by Goya for some of his most famous imprints. There are also some modern artwork displays on the upper floors that you will not want to miss. This was a gem of a find, but you can leave it till your last days in Madrid, like we did.
I was so happy to find this museum as I wanted to make sure that I saw some art while I was visiting Madrid. Delighted with the original pieces by Goya. I felt steeped in tradition and art.

This is like the Prado's quiet cousin, but it's almost as good. It attracts few visitors and on the Sunday I went it was like having a private viewing. There's lots of superb paintings and on the top floor it moves to a more modern flavour rather than images of religion, battles and the rich and famous.

It is very nice opera house, and important one on the world's operatic map. Casts are usually very good, and producers like stage and music directors are always better than average. Theatre is modern, accessible for disabled. Ushers & people serving directly to public are nice, friendly and helpful. I had a bad side seat, and I moved to better section. While I was waiting for last moment to take an empty seat, no one was bothering me (not like in Vienna - where to do such switch would be like almost a crime...)

This Royal Theatre is the national Opera house and is a huge building with a large capacity. it is close to the Palace Real and offers amazing views of the palace from its terraces. The reception rooms are very impressive. We booked our tickets in advance and did a self guided tour for 40 min, which was good enough. Overall a good experience however the theatre lacks opulence.

I have toured many opera houses in my travels. This was wasn't as I had hoped. I bought my ticket online and made use of the audio guide on my phone. It was easy to get started. However, after 2 stops I lost service so had to read the digital paragraphs instead of getting audio. It came back towards the end. Some rooms were very nice but the theatre itself wasn't that impressive. Grateful for the human guides along the way as a few times I got turned around and they assisted me beautifully. I suggest to only do if you have time. It took me under 1 hr.

Expensive but worth it. Sangria was the best I‚Äôve had in Madrid. The apple cake was nice but not for me but for the right patron they would love it. The ham and bread was to die for. Certain staff can be standoffish and rude, but the ones I chose to encounter with were always pleasant!
beautiful place and staff very friendly. the spanish omelette tapa was amazing, guildas were okay.

Classical tourist trap, food was terrible, service was bad. Looks nice from outside but atmosphere inside is poor, waiters do not care about you and food could be dangerous. We has stuffed tomatoes that were rotten and must have been cooked a week before. Do NOT go there!!
A quiet place to have a quick meal. Simple fare and nothing spectacular. No fuss, no frills. Communicating in English was a challenge but use Google translate to get by.  Friendly waitress.
Cute old Tapas bar, really authentic
A really good place, considering quality / price. See food is the best.
The staff are friendly and welcoming. The beer and vermut is second to none. The locals are here enjoying themselves and tourists, too. A lovely bite is provided with each drink, with a smile.

I've been coming to Madrid since 2018 and have tried more than 70 restaurants here, I just found this place, Qubek... What can I say about it, the food, the place, the people, ohhhh the people. First I have to say it is a must! The real traditional Madrid food, and have to say that's the best I ever tried, believe me, is a pleasure to come and have a wonderful time there. If you want to have a delicious breakfast, if you want to have a great lunch, it is the perfect place, but coming to dinner is another name that I can't find. IF YOU'RE IN MADRID, QUBEK IS THE PLACE TO LIVE THE REAL MADRID EXPERIENCE
This restaurant is wonderful. Original food. The staff was friendly and exceptional. A wonderful find!

Very close to the Prado Museum, this place was fantastic from start to finish. Loved it! Service was great and the wine they recommended was really good and affordable. We got the Dessert sampler and that was the only way to go-YUM! We would highly recommend this place!

A magnificent church with quite astonishing art work and general religious artifacts. As  per usual,  more representations of Mary than the supposedly more important individual. Who, again as per usual, is absurdly presented as white Anglo Saxon. Ignore these absurdities and enjoy the grand, over the top,  excesses which, however far removed from the central simplicity of Christianity, are remarkable.  If only in terms of the religious bad taste. Entry free. Just one more of the astonishing churches in Madrid.
Good church for prayer. On the main altar we can see the tomb of san Isidro, the patron of Madrid.

The baroque church of St Isidore of Madrid, AKA as Santa Iglesia Colegiata de San Isidro, is a very short walk from Plaza Mayor and is worth the detour. Built in the seventeenth century, its decorations are rich, varied and very colorful.
If you're visiting Plaza Mayor, take a short walk down to this beautiful church! Admission is free and there's a few things to see. Including the tomb of St. Isidore.
The entire place is beautiful beyond words. Breathtaking. I tried to take pictures however; the pictures do not do it justice.

A bit of a hot day during our visit, but the garden does have quite a few shaded pads. There is a small exhibition hall, where they had some interesting photographs and other artworks on display. I assume these rotate from time to time. There are a couple of the original greenhouses, which have tropical Flora and other beautiful plants on display. There is a large section of bonsai trees, not the best I‚Äôve seen since I have been to Japan many times, but it was nice to see these being tended carefully in Madrid. Definitely worth a stop on your itinerary if you have a few days in Madrid. The park/garden is quite spacious so dress comfortably and wear comfortable shoes.

We visited in the winter when most of the plants are dormant and a few bulbs are popping up in anticipation of spring. The greenhouse tropical plants is worth seeing as are the large collection of bonsais. Take your time and enjoy the peacefulness of the gardens.

Very well kept botanical gardens. Went in early November so not much were in bloom but it's well maintained and some flowers and vegetables were still flowering. Also the greenhouse is very cool with all the cactus and other planta

For some reason we entered in the morning for free. Since it was November, are not as many flowers in bloom but I still think it was worth the visit. I especially liked the building featuring local artists (Nov 2024: Jose Maria) and the bonsai terrace. There is a small rack with a map when you enter so be sure to pick one up.

Wonderful. Need 2 hours. Not such a good idea to charge for the exhibition. The hot houses are small but lovely. The Bonsai are great. The entire space is so relaxing and exquisite. I really enjoyed myself
Super SHALLOW cups!! Good flavor but you're way overpaying for only 2 "scoops" on the most shallow cups you've ever eaten. No joke it's about half the depth you expect on the cups.
Extremely expensive with no flavour..  feeling like a total waste of money
Friendly staff and the ice cream was very good! I got the fundence and grosella one. Very noice!
Taking off 1 star because it was a bit pricey for 1 scoop. But the mango flavor itself was authentic and delicious.

It's gluten-free heaven! I wouldn't recommend it for general audience though - I find gf food less tasty than wheat based stuff.  However for people who have to avoid gluten it's really paradise! I've had my first gf ramen here and it was close the the real deal ;)
Great food and Roberto was a very nice waiter! We had a lovely evening. Will definitely come back here again.

Takos Al Pastor serves some of the most delicious tacos in town, paired perfectly with their variety of spicy sauces that pack a flavorful punch. The tacos are fresh, authentic, and bursting with taste. A must-visit spot for taco lovers.

Don‚Äôt let the long lines scare you away - the service is fast and it is absolutely worth the wait! Delicious tacos and quesadillas, in a vibrant setting. The beef was our favorite. Personally I was full after three tacos, so it can be a pretty cheap but nevertheless full of taste meal.

There is definitely a line to get in, but the wait is totally worth it. They have plenty of seating. The people were friendly and helpful, the tacos were out in less than 5 minutes after placing the order and I highly recommend trying everything. Also the price was even better. I‚Äôll definitely be back as it‚Äôs the best tacos I‚Äôve had. If you‚Äôre thinking about going here, just go here and you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

Visited for a quick lunch, staff were very helpful  and patient with our limited Spanish. Servers recommended Bocarones and cured anchovies which were 10/10 and really enjoyed the Vermut. Revisited later in the evening and the atmosphere was even better. Really great no nonsense spot

We tried for few days to eat here and try the atmosphere and the tapas. Finally we found the right time ( around 13:30) and we found 2 places inside. The setup is great, you feel the old Madrid, from tables to food, and the service was too. We got mixed tapas with beer , we spent around 45 min and we enjoyed every minute. Expect something simple , with good and fresh tapas , and friendly simple service.

Recommended by friends, and while it‚Äôs well located, feels like it‚Äôs infused with history and the food is pretty good, it was full of noisy tourists and the servers weren‚Äôt so friendly or welcoming‚Ä¶ maybe because of all the tourists üôÉ

Santiago Bernab√©u Stadium Tour is a must-visit for football fans and an unforgettable experience for Real Madrid enthusiasts. The tour offers exclusive access to iconic areas like the players' tunnel, locker rooms, press room, and the pitch, with a breathtaking panoramic view of the stadium. The museum is a highlight, showcasing Real Madrid‚Äôs rich history through trophies, memorabilia, and interactive exhibits. While tickets can be pricey and crowds common during peak times, the tour‚Äôs blend of history, passion, and behind-the-scenes access makes it a memorable and worthwhile experience for anyone visiting Madrid.

Easy to access, incredible tour. I went solo and had a great time. The trophy hall was very impressive and fun, lots of explanations from expert employees as well. Not allowed to go on the pitch but offer seating in the upper deck. Great place to stop for a break. History and origin of the club well explained. Science behind the stadium also thoroughly explained with a few diagrams showing how they turn the stadium into a concert hall as well, it blew my socks off!

If the only you allow visitors to see because of the remont that wasn't finished yet is the museum (which isn't that big) and a glance at the stadium from highest floor ("panoramic view"üòÖ), why do you charge full price of 35/38‚Ç¨ in the box office? Which is more than most of Europe. Especially when it's a self guided tour. You can atleast make a discount for the printed personal photos (20‚Ç¨ each)... what a bummer

Great experience because ... is Bernab√©u Stadium, has a lot of history and trophies, not for the tour itself which is dissapointing compared to other stadium tours. There is the Museum (with trophies, t-shirts etc displayed, interactive points to learn about each important moment in team's history) and the panoramic view of the stadium (wow!). But you cannot visit pitch and benches, player entrance, conference room, commentators place or other worth visiting spaces. And worst of all: they make you take 3 pictures as part of the tour and charges you at the end 20euros/picture, price I would have paid for all 3 in digital form but not 60 printed on paper (option they refused) this is really a rip off and alterate the experience.

Amazing, recommended. Food in the area is good but this place is outstanding. Great taste, staff super friendly and helpful, nice vibe. I strongly recommend to try Rabo de Toro. This place has everything. Prices are average but cheap if you consider the great taste.

Very impressive decor and a nice area to sit and enjoy your time, but the food is not as good, probably I‚Äôd rate it 3,5-4. Of course, expect high prices‚Ä¶ The hostess is very friendly and welcoming!

I was visiting Madrid and had lunch at this amazing restaurant,  purely by random chance.  We were seated outside,  by the beautiful plaza del oriente.  Our server was amazing,  bringing us snacks before the kitchen opened because it was closed for another 15 minutes.  They don't open the kitchen until 1pm, but you can have a drink and wait.  The croquetas of ham were outstanding! We ordered a paella for 2 which was so tasty.  It's really enough for 3 people by the way.  Truly am awesome experience.

It was very fancy and cozy. Staff were very friendly, polite and caring. We hd a very lovely conversation with them. We ordered vegetarian paella, Pizza, mussels and grilled vegetables. They were all mouthwatering. The presentation and the colors were very appetizing. It's the most expensive restaurant we have visited during our trip but there are other restaurants that were more expensive and didn't provide vegetarian options. It was definitely worth it. Staff requested that we help them write "Merry Christmas" in Arabic and English. This really made our day final day in Spain. Unforgettable.
Great food, amazing service! The cold strawberry soup and the ox tail are worth trying. There is a beautiful venue on the lower level

Great atmosphere. It's extremely cozy. Unfortunately the hotel breakfast deal is no good. Jamon made me sick, the eggs are strange, and the toast is never toasted. It's also served with ice cold butter. Even the cafe con Leche is subpar.
Service was great. Food was exceptional,beautiful presentation everyone was attentive and professional

Oriente Restaurant in Madrid is said to be where Diego Vel√°zquez painted 'Las Meninas', which alone makes it worth a visit. The refined cuisine and the chance to dine in royal cellars add to the experience. The food was delicious, especially the poached fish in garlic parsley sauce with clams. However, the service was so slow that after 3 hours, we didn't have enough time for dessert as the bus was already waiting for our group.

Everything was incredibly delicious! All the dishes were so fresh, and I truly felt like I was dining in a Mediterranean country, which of course, Spain is. The quality of the ingredients and the presentation were perfect. It fully captured the essence of Mediterranean cuisine‚Äîlight, flavorful, and satisfying. An unforgettable experience, and definitely a place to visit again!
Best gyro I've ever had in my life. The pomegranate seeds were a very nice surprise. I would come back here 12/10!!!

As American tourists it‚Äôs probably unusual to leave the central plazas of old town for a neighborhood eatery in this section of the city that is more popular with the locals. But it was so worth it. The place sits on the corner of a small plaza and its not very big but we enjoyed the almost street vendor feel of the place even though they had a nice little restaurant space. The staff was so friendly and helped us with our Spanish and actually helped us realize that we were ordering way more than we could handle. Because the plates that they serve are massive. And so packed with fresh and flavorful goodness.

Great food. The staff was super nice checking if the food was good. We had the slow cooked beef plate and the beef wrap. I asked for one extra sauce and the cook gave me 3 types of amazing sauces I guess so I can try them all. The lady working the cash also treated us with two baklavas for free. Very good food and nice staff.

Great sandwich spot. The bread is crunchy and tasty and the jamon is salty and tender. The bread is also full of tomate. I also tried the one with tortillas, which was actually pretty decent. Good spot for a quick lunch. Sitting outside is not the best setting. Service was quick and the lady serving was super nice.
Need to add more halal choice, and more vegetarian options

The truth is I‚Äôm not too sure even now what the hype is about! The queue is crazy long. 1st time I went, it was around 1-2pm and it was a long queue and I was hungry so I decided not to wait. 2nd day I went again, this time around 3+pm ‚Ä¶ the queue is still long. Since it‚Äôs a highly recommended place for the calamari sandwich, I decided I‚Äôll queue and try. It is nice, as in the sandwich is unique and I‚Äôve not had a calamari sandwich before. It is of course dry, since it‚Äôs deep fried. There are other options for sandwiches, so if you don‚Äôt like deep fried, there are other choices. Reasonable price , it‚Äôs filling and cheap. The olives however to me is just so so. Anyways, if you like calamari, and you want to try , I would recommend.

If you find yourself near Mayer Plaza and crave an unforgettable squid calamari experience, this is the place to be! Renowned for its incredibly flavorful and perfectly crispy squid, this spot draws a bustling crowd, and for good reason. Be prepared to wait in line if you wish to dine inside, or opt for a convenient grab-and-go option. Either way, the wait is well worth it. Generously portioned, a single serving is more than satisfying for one person. A must-try for seafood lovers!

The best fried calamari sandwich I‚Äôve ever tasted! Located in the center of Madrid, this place is worth the visit. There was a waiting line, but it moved quickly. The prices are affordable, and the food is delicious. I highly recommend it!

Easily one of the best sandwiches I ever had. The rave and hype was well deserved. Tender calamari on a soft hoagie style roll. Service was excellent even with a huge crowd.  Would've gladly paid more than 4 euros for this delight. Can't wait for my next trip back to Madrid.

recently visited this restaurant after hearing all the buzz, and while the food was great, it didn‚Äôt quite live up to the viral hype. The dishes were flavorful and well-prepared, and the ambiance was nice. However, be prepared for a wait if you want a seat ‚Äî you‚Äôll likely need to queue for about 30 to 60 minutes before being seated. Overall, I would recommend it, but just manage your expectations and be patient with the wait times!

It was my first time to try taco that day, and it was very delicious!  And the service staff are very nice and enthusiastic.  I ordered a drink that tasted like coconut milk with sweet and sour pineapple. It was also very amazing. You must try it.
Although the shop leaves a bit of room to improve, but the services and the foods are awesome. The foods are reasonably price. Very friendly and quick service. Highly recommended!!

Although the place is tiny, the food is delicious (which kinda makes you forget about the place size). The nachos plate was gigantic (don‚Äôt mind the pic as we dove into it before taking a photo) and tacos were amazing - lots of flavour (also gone before photo making). Highly recommend if you go there for food only (not authentic experience etc).

The food was perfect! Full of taste and juiciness, decent portions, quick service. The staff were great (Christian and Ole) and that experienced marked the highlight of our foodie journey that week! :)

This looks more like a deli that a restaurant. On our very first night we dropped our bags ran out to enjoy the evening and walked into try some of Spain's famous ham and red wine. We ordered a sample platter of hams they gave us a small platter of ham sausages along with our two glasses of absolutely fantastic red wine.  Before we left we picked up some cold cuts for breakfast.  Tried to go back a few nights later and the place was packed to the rafters.

Casual tapas and beer hall specialised in jamon. I make sure I come back here every time I visit Madrid. Although price is average but the quality of the food never disappoints! Also glad they have 3 types of 0.0% beer on draft which was hard to find in other bars in Spain.

Food quality is normal, but at low prices. (You can also order better quality at higher prices) They provide a great and efficient customer service, in a big & centric place... One of the greatest Madrid bars! Do not miss it.

We were wondering in Madrid and this restaurant caught our eyes with the market style and all the jam√≥n hanging from the celling. We decided to try it out one night during our trip. The price was ok and portion were quite generous. But food was just so so and prepared very casually. We also ordered sangria and that was some most watery sangria we have had during our trip to Spain.
Very good food!!! It worths the experience! Authentic place, good fresh food, all types of jamon. Friendly staff!

Cute little place with good homey food. Both the chicken and shepherd‚Äôs pie were really satisfying. Wish we could eat more but it was physically impossible. Will definitely be back to try other dishes on the menu!
The food was great and staff was very nice. Good atmosphere and good price for the food. (Also one of the guys spoke great English which was extremely helpful!)

The food was amazing. I cannot stress enough the quality of the food we ate and the mixture of flavors. The ‚ÄúCaribbean Burger‚Äù, the ‚ÄúSandwich Club‚Äù and the ‚ÄúCrispy Chicken‚Äù were our choices and if we can, we will repeat.
Best of America burger and Grilled Cajun chicken were really nice. The dining room is small, so not many customers get in at the same time.
Better than most Michelin star restaurants we visited. And that says a lot. It's ok for a quick brunch. Also the bathroom was not very sanitary. Do make some adjustments.

Small Chinese Hunan restaurant, but it‚Äôs definitely authentic Hunan cuisine, I was surprised by finding such good quality Chinese food in Madrid. I told chef it‚Äôs delicious, his wife said he loved to hear customers saying that, he‚Äôs very into cooking and determined to make great dishes for customers, if someone said his food was not good, then he could not sleep, that‚Äôs the reason why his food is tasty! Sorry about the pictures I didn‚Äôt want to take it until I found out it was delicious!
Great food, awesome attentive staff and an overall worthy dinner experience. Highly recommend.
Everything was perfect. Just important to know that the menu is only in Spanish
The best food I have had in Madrid üòãüëç

Very nice little bar/restaurant with only a few small tables in the back. In the bar-area are a few high tables. The interior is cozy and well designed. Staff is very friendly. The food is great. Good hummus and bread with among others, a perfect hamburger, super pulled pork and spicy turkey. Not expensive. Had a perfect meal, with drinks, with 4, for ‚Ç¨ 50.=. Highly recommended. It's best to reserve a table.

i loved the place! delicious food, especially the mix of fried potatoes. the best potatoes i've had in my life, really üòã they have a burger with avocado paste, i liked it a LOT. and a cool menu too. our server was smily and nice, she spoke English too, which is a good bonus here. they gave us candy at the end which was so sweet in both meanings ‚ô•Ô∏è

I had the pork nachos and pork burger. Very good. If getting anything from here I recommend the pork. Very tasty and went well with everything else. Every bite I took was savory.. I had to cherish every moment as if it were my last. What if I never get to bite into this again? I couldn‚Äôt waste that opportunity.
The place is small and cozy. Great lunch for two. Service was impeccable and the food was great. Desserts were delicious also. Would love to come back!

Had the loveliest lunch at Matilda! The service was impeccable and I couldn‚Äôt get over the 3 course rotating menu. The ambiance is eclectic but they change up with menu so based on what they have cooking that day you get to choose one appetizer, one main and a dessert for a steal. This little hole in the wall is a small jaunt from the m train station and I couldn‚Äôt recommend it any higher! Next time you find yourself in Madrid pop in for some authentic local Spanish cuisine!

Cafe Matilda is a delightful gem with a charming corner location. Though it‚Äôs quite small, with only eight tables, the cozy atmosphere is worth the wait. The food is delicious, and the coffee, especially the cappuccino, is exceptional. Be sure to try the fresh orange juice, the croissant with Nutella, and the scrambled eggs. The croissant with Serrano ham and Manchego cheese is also a must! What truly sets this place apart is the outstanding service provided by Fernando‚Äîhis hospitality makes the experience even more enjoyable. Highly recommend!
cute spot near Retiro Park with delicious lentil soup and a ham and potato dish. The owner is friendly and accommodating to the Spanish-language-challenged. Nice atmosphere cozy

Absolutely fantastic. The place is charming, with a cozy atmosphere. The owner is wonderful, so kind and friendly. The food is incredibly delicious - I had the salmorrejo, ravioli, and coffee flan and they were all out of this world. One of my favorite lunches I‚Äôve had in Spain, and I‚Äôve lived here for many years. I will definitely return next time I visit Madrid! ‚ô•Ô∏è

We had an absolutely lovely visit here, Seth great food and even better service, all in a less-touristy location. We had the menu-de-dia (lunch menu) with three beers, and the total bill was Euro 40 (April 2024).  The beer came with tapas, and the menu with three courses, and we left very full and satisfied.

An absolute disaster! The food was clearly reheated in the microwave and tasted awful. Charging ‚Ç¨8.50 for a beer is just outrageous‚ÄîI‚Äôve never paid that much for a beer in my entire life. The service? Practically non-existent. You‚Äôre rushed in and out as quickly as possible, with no care or hospitality. The atmosphere is cold and unwelcoming. We paid over ‚Ç¨50 for two people for food that wasn‚Äôt even close to being worth it. I strongly advise everyone to stay far away from this place.

We stopped by twice during our stay for a bottle of wine and to sit outside. While we did not come for the food, we ordered patatas bravas once, and the dish was hot and the sauce had a nice taste, likely as good as the place around the corner. They also always give a complimentary dish, like olives or salumi. Nice service and great people watching spot.
Great food, big portions and super service!
Good sandwiches. Only small rounded 3 tables to eat there so more focused on take out. Nice staff, good food and good pricing. Paid 7,40‚Ç¨ for a big Jamon sandwich and expresso caffe

Great place for a quick bite.  It‚Äôs a little small but they have great coffee.  Staff is very friendly as well as customers.  It‚Äôs also cheap.  So don‚Äôt be shy.  If you are in the are and feel hungry? Swing by.  You won‚Äôt be disappointed
Very good food and kind service! Really feel welcome there
Small but nice to have a bite.
I love their food here.. got their menu sets and it was really good.. Healthy ,clean and the staff were friendly, the shop itself was really nice,love the colour.
Wonderful brunch spot! The staff were extremely welcoming and they take pride in their food. It all came out looking good and tasting good too. Would go back again!
The sourdough is great and the avocado toasts have great flavor. I went two days in a row because the vibe was great and the staff super fun and friendly.
Superb breakfast! Great menus, what a taste! Great value for the price, 10/10 would come again!
The food was very good. I had a matcha latte and the tacos with two different meats. Super tasty. Good price. I had great service from Camila. She was very kind and attentive.

Such a great place for breakfast/brunch! The aesthetic is fun and playful yet sophisticated and cool! The staff is incredible!!!!! Shoutout to them for the warm and welcoming service and great recommendations. We enjoyed our coffee and the treatment so much we went back the next day for food (and more coffee) and it did not disappoint! I encourage anyone in the area to stop by and enjoy this gem of a spot!

Polite staff! Food is very tasty, orange juice and bread are fresh and delicious . service was quick on Monday morning around 9 am. We got Iberian brunch and Parisian. Both were tasty but Iberian brunch is in totally different league both in portions and taste.really recommend it.

Amazing food, big portions, quick and kind service! Bread was sooo good with the olive oil. Definitely get a cinnamon bun (very sweet)!! The New Yorker came with two drink choices!! So we got an orange juice (yum) and a hot chocolate (also yum). All plates and drinks were completely empty by the end of our meal!! Give them a try !

Absolutely delicious! We had the parisienne benedict, the American breakfast, and finished with the cinnamon roll with chocolate and hazelnut.  Their cappuccino is probably the best coffee I've ever had and that's saying a lot.  The service was amazing and very friendly. They even let our small dog come sit inside with us! Highly recommend for coffee, a fantastic breakfast or brunch!
Quick and friendly service, the food didn‚Äôt take too long and was really good! We had the full brunch which included plenty of food for the price. Would recommend!

They managed us to crave a simple dish like avocado toast. We ordered the halloumi Madrid-style avocado tostada, and everything on it was full of flavor and simply delicious. The tomato they use for the toast was a big highlight. The coffees are served in a cute manner, the baristas definitely have a talent! Easily the best brunch we have had

I went there to take brunch, its small nice place , the service was good, I ordered scrambled eggs but they don‚Äôt have, we changed our order and the food was average, also we also order benut butter and banana bread and was very üòã tasty

My avocado salmon bagel was wonderful. Tea and coffee were great. The place was very busy, but the service was enjoyable. I liked the atmosphere - you could feel the beat of the city with multiple languages spoken around. Definitely recommend!

Yummy food and great coffee! Service was fast and quantity was good. I tried the curry bowl and although the chicken pieces could have been more, there was nothing else to complain on the quality of the dish. The cappuccino was a classic

The food is pretty delicious. They have many options and even offer a 5 course brunch if you'd like that. I ordered the crepe cl√°ssico, and my friends ordered the pancakes con chocolate fundido and the Pollo al Curry y aguacate. We also ordered the Orange smoothie and the mat ha latte. Matcha in spain seems to be served on the colder side but it's still an unsweetened matcha drink.

Small, but mighty place. Very good food, very fresh. The place is very busy, hard to find space to sit. Coffee is amazing. Service is great and precise. I would like to come back for this great experience.

A great place for breakfast! The avocado toast was very delicious and the grilled cheese added a special flavor. The cortado coffee was perfectly made and enjoyable. The atmosphere is calm the design is beautiful, and the staff are friendly and welcoming, making the experience even more comfortable.

This place is super nice and cosy. It was just next to my hotel so I thought I will give a try. The place  is really great and looks amazing on the photos. Not only the design was great as well the food was wow. I would say in my toast there was a bit too much of peanut butter but it was really great anyway! Service was super nice and friendly. If you want to get brunch or lunch in a great place I would fully recommend you visit this place!
Such a cozy place, food was delicious. And the lady from Ecuador i think very sweet! Love it
I had the waffle meal, it was delicious and filling. The atmosphere is very chilled and the decorations are very instagramable. My friend had the This is lava and she also enjoyed her meal.

Super cute brunch and lunch spot!! Delicious and filling food, and healthy at that! The ambience is adorable too and the vibes are perfect with all the greenery. Highly recommend whether visiting Madrid, or living here!!

We are both vegan and this is the best place we have found in Madrid to eat. We ordered two salads, love salad and funky salad, and they were both delicious. The sauces were great, the flavors amazing, the coffee is big and tasty. the place itself looks great, the food looks great and the staff are nice and helpful . If you are looking for vegan food and breakfasts, this is the place for you.

We arrived for breakfast and hadn‚Äôt booked (suggest you do this!) the waitress couldn‚Äôt be more helpful in accommodating to fit is in. We were very lucky. The cafe has a wonderful relaxed ambience and all the staff were attentive and excellent. The food and coffee was amazing. Give it a visit, you won‚Äôt be disappointed!

user_id: I slightly lowered the rating for service because one day we had to wait about 15-20 minutes for the check. The service itself wasn‚Äôt very fast either
restaurant_id: but the place was completely full in the morning
rating: so that's understandable. However
review_text: waiting 20 minutes for the check was a bit too much. So keep in mind
date: if you have exact plans after breakfast. However
source_user_name: on some busy days it's really fast. It‚Äôs best to book a table in advance to avoid waiting (very conveniently done online) ‚Äì the place is truly very popular and excellent.,2025-01-08,Solsbury

review_text: My friends and I went to this place for brunch and we loved it! It was very American but the food and coffee was awesome and there were lots of options! The restaurant was so cute. Would highly recommend! We got American pancakes, superfood breaky, guacamole toast, and guaca scrambled.

Came here for sunset and drinks. It was such a cozy spot! The drinks were delicious and Daniel S. was very friendly and helpful in guiding us to the rooftop terrace. Would love to catch another sunset here!

Marieley, Maria and Milka are insane at services the hotel is in a great location. Food is incredible; the best value for money you will find in Madrid: all the dishes are fresh and spot on. What an incredible experience. I‚Äôll go back every time I‚Äôm in Madrid

I like this rooftop, especially for the view of Madrid. The price is ‚Ç¨14 but this includes a drink which I think is better than most bars because usually there are two separate fees for some of the paid for rooftops. My friend and I enjoyed espresso martinis and a Hugo lemonade spritz.

Food was so yummy & portions were excellent! Our server Jesus did an amazing job with food suggestions and then went a step further to help me customize my plate! I got the Bacon & Egg bagel with avocado and caramelized onions, as he recommended and it was delicious!! I also tried their vanilla latte, which rich & semi-sweet. Highly recommend this location!

Indiscreto Brunch in Madrid truly impressed us with its vibrant, welcoming vibe and an array of fresh, delightful dishes. I enjoyed a perfectly balanced avocado toast with poached eggs, while my partner‚Äôs Benedict was equally satisfying. Our son couldn‚Äôt get enough of the a√ßa√≠ bowl‚Äîand his passion fruit lemonade was an absolute hit. We rounded off our meal with a moist, flavorful carrot cake, and the fresh OJ and expertly brewed coffee added just the right touch to our experience. Overall, it‚Äôs a gem of a brunch spot that promises quality food and a relaxed ambiance, making it a perfect family outing. Enjoy your visit!

Great brunch spot. Cool vibes/decorations inside, but the food and service are the true attractions. Had amazing eggs on croissant, pancakes, raspberry lemonade, and some avocado beat toast. All was delicious, probably my favorite brunch spot out of all the many visited. I would go back again (and did, twice in 3 days lol). Awesome place, highly recommend!!!!

I came here with my family multiple times during my trip to Madrid! The food is wonderful, the coffee and orange juice are great and the service was phenomenal. When I return, I‚Äôll be choosing accommodations near this place again for easy access!

I went here for breakfast and the food was delicious. I ordered the croissant‚Äôwich and the yoghurt bowl both of which were very tasty. I also had a simple coffee with milk which was very pleasant. Would definitely recommend and I will be visiting again!
Delicious food - we got the avocado Benedict, huevos rancheros, and berry mango smoothie. Quick service. Loved the Bruno mars music playing in the background!

Passed by as I saw great reviews. The place was nice‚Ä¶ not many people inside‚Ä¶ you need to wait a bit for a service‚Ä¶ the card is not big‚Ä¶ you still have some choices‚Ä¶ I was really thinking what to order as I could not find anything that would catch my eye‚Ä¶ so I google and got a French toast. I have to admit is was really good‚Ä¶ coffee was good as well. After the brunch I tried to asked 4 times to lay the bill but‚Ä¶ no success‚Ä¶ so went myself to the counted and still waited some time to pay it. I had a slight feeling of being ignored‚Ä¶ I would say I will never go back there but if you feel like‚Ä¶ give a try.

One of the few places in Madrid where they don't take reservations which is a plus in my view. You can just walk in, and If it's busy you'll wait a few minutes but usually no more than 10 (if busy).  It's super family friendly as they have books and toys for the kids to play ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê. The food has great quality and quantity so think about sharing if you're having the bowls. We had the enchiladas suizas and had to take some home.  Overall a great place to visit if you're craving a latin flavours brunch.

I came here this past weekend with a few friends to have a brunch and enjoy a nice chat. Although the food was good (not extraordinary but tasted good), I shall not be back and neither will my friends. After not even 1hr, one of the waiters (or was he the owner ü§î) came to ask us if we were going to order anything else (I wasn‚Äôt even half done with my plate and neither were my friends)! We asked him why and he mumbled something like ¬´¬†you‚Äôre taking a long time¬†¬ª. Like what?! How rude? We come to enjoy ourselves and enjoy the food but now you come and rush us out, pretty much üòí. Why? There wasn‚Äôt even a big line up front and since there is no reservation and I got there early on purpose to get a table and enjoy my time; I don‚Äôt find it fair to be rushed like that. If we had ordered only drinks, ok fair enough, you‚Äôre trying to make more profit. But we were eating! Anyways, after that I felt like the whole time this guy just wanted us out. I shall not be back and would not recommend this spot either! There are so many delicious and friendlier brunch places in Madrid. Sadly this one won‚Äôt be on my list!

We came for brunch here today and it was absolutely amazing! The Food, the staff and the atmosphere were all superb. We all had a juice and  a different kind of breakfast couldn‚Äôt fault them. We will definitely be back. Thanks for a great time!
Amazing breakfast/brunch. One of the best we have during a week long stay in Madrid. We will be back.

The waffles were clearly store bought since they tasted artificial and had the sugar chunks. The papaya juice, even though I was already aware that it was not fresh, was very watery. Good Arepas. The service is regular.
Really cute decor, the food was delicious and the service was really fast. The staff was kind and spoke both Spanish and English. Would definitely recommend to tourists and locals!

It‚Äôs really really a very good brunch. The Benedict bagel was really delicious and you can taste the coconut cream ü§§ and so was the coconut matcha latte ü´†üôÇ‚Äç‚ÜïÔ∏è. The service was amazing and so fast also i didn‚Äôt find a queue and the atmosphere was great.

I was very disappointed in the dish I ordered. ‚Ç¨9.50 for the avocado toast - which was basically a tasteless avocado paste on a super dry piece of bread, with some cherry tomatoes - and an extra ‚Ç¨2 for the eggs. Not worth it. HOWEVER, I did have one of the best iced coffee. It was their coco house iced latte if I‚Äôm not mistaken. I wouldn‚Äôt go back, but maybe I was just unlucky that day. The staff were super nice, and really appreciated their service.
Food came really fast and was absolutely delicious. Everything freshly made. Coffees are enormous. We will come back!

Un sitio que me cant√≥! The food is amazing with a mix between Latin cuisine and Asian, the ambience is super cute with family pics and you feel like being in Puerto Rico! Staff was super sweet and kind. Highly recommended

A true hidden gem in Madrid. Tia Julia offer excellent tapas in the evening and brunch from 10am. The food is beautifully presented and generously proportioned. We ate tapas here last night and came straight back for brunch the next day!
Superlative brunch! The spot looks like a normal Spanish bar but when you order the brunch it is a feast for the senses. Everything we ordered was amazing. I expect food will be top notch too.

I use to come here every Sunday for a brunch or for lunch. The place is magic for me: beautiful atmosphere, delicious food and always good vibes. Tobias e Omar make you feel home, great people. I strongly suggest this place for any occasion, an easy drink, a party Friday or a relaxing Sunday! Love you

Super good food, space is small bit uncomfortable, the dish I got was more than enough for 2 people unless you‚Äôre really hungry. The potatoes are to die for so so good and the service is ok . Not sure if it‚Äôs a thing in Spain but they usually don‚Äôt ask if you need something.. you usually have to call a server over. But they were happy to assist. Great atmosphere. Thank you so much !

I absolutely love this place. I have been here twice now and the food is soooo delicious. They‚Äôre definitely known for their pancakes (get the dark chocolate & strawberry one). It‚Äôs my favorite pancake platter ever. Laura has been my waitress twice and she is just the best! Super friendly and attentive. Will be back here soon :) Also, I haven‚Äôt needed to wait the two times I‚Äôve been here which is always a plus.

Stop here for a random coffee and croissant but got an amazing surprise! Out of this world pancakes for my sons with fruit and maple syrup with a cheeky chicken face burnt in. Scrambled eggs were lovely on sourdough and big tasty avocado. Great surprise and will come again. Andres was our server and he‚Äôs was brilliant

The pancakes and cappuccino were so good! The workers were nice and spoke english. The restaurant in itself was very different and trendy. There‚Äôs a table with a bathtub as a seat, and a spring like swing-seat. Over all very good experience!

Best breakfast/brunch we had in Madrid, by far! Jennifer, our server, was incredible. I speak very poor Spanish, but she was so patient and wonderful to us. The orange juice was the best orange juice I‚Äôve ever had. I ordered ‚Äúthe vegetable‚Äù benedict and my fianc√© got the ‚Äúbunny‚Äôs plate‚Äù, and we finished with the carrot cake. Everything was over-the-top delicious and flavorful! I don‚Äôt usually get carrot cake, but if all carrot cake was like theirs, I‚Äôd eat it everyday. This is one of those meals that you dream about for years after.

Very nice place with cosy interior and very pleasant stuff. We were blessed that it was table available, but better to reserve in advance. Delicious breakfast with various options, as well I want to mention option that for 5.90 you can add to your breakfast mimosa with cava, big coffee and a dessert!

My family of 4 really enjoyed our brunch here. We also appreciated that we could make reservations ahead of time. My husband had a Benedict, I had mushroom toast, and the kids each had pancakes. Each plate is lots of food. The food was delicious and the drinks were great. The service was wonderful, too.
Very good food, english speaking waitress, fair price

Simple brunch menu but so delicious. The eggs benedict was excellent, and the included breads and croissant with the jam and plenty of butter was delicious too. Latte is great. Orange juice tastes a bit sour. A little pricey.
The food was amazing! And they have the best gluten free bread that I have tried in Madrid. Also, the gluten free brownie was super tasty! I will definitely come back :)
Great food. Big portions. Amazing coffee! Great service. We got the chocolate pancakes. After 3 weeks in Europe. We were missing them. The burger was big. And the hunger plate really good.

We found this cute brunch place by chance and it delivered more than we expected. The service was great and the food was amazing ü§© fresh avocados for the toast and the poached eggs were perfectly cooked. Definitely will be back üíñüíñüíñ

I'd go back, for sure. They have standard breakfast fare and it all looked good: pancakes, bowls, and toast with an assortment of toppings. Pretty much everything has an egg in/on/around it and they have a few veggie/vegan options with vegan egg scrambles. The presentation of the food is quite eye-catching, so I was afraid the fruit pancakes would be a sugar-bomb, but the compote was a good mix of tart and fruity. The menu was in Spanish and I'm not certain there was an English option, but I heard our waiter speak English to other tables, so between Google and this fella, you're in good hands.

Amazing brunch spot! The food was delicious, beautifully presented, and the atmosphere was great. A special shoutout to Ale for his friendly and attentive service‚Äîhe made the experience even better. Highly recommend and will definitely be back!

Always great breakfast spot and great coffee! The food was delicious, the ambiance was cozy and welcoming, and the staff friendly. It was my first time at this branch, yet the experience was cheerful. Perfect for starting the day! And sure I will comeback.

As a family of 4 with two teens. We ate breakfast here 3 mornings of the 3 days we visited Madrid. Absolutely worth standing in line for. Presentation, flavor and quantity were instagram worthy. We loved the staff who remembered us each day. Even open on New Years Day. Highly recommended!

Absolutely amazing from the moment you walk up to the storefront. The service and food were top notch. Not only was the food excellent, but the presentation was incredible. My husband had the Salty Stack and I had the Avo Feast and we could‚Äôve licked our plates clean. Highly recommend this sweet spot.
Great place for vegan food! We had tacos, cauliflower buffalo wings and calamari. Awesome menu with a variety of appetizers. Will come here again for the burgers!

Let me let you into a secret, Madristas and anyone who is present in Madrid. Mad Mad Vegan is an awesome place to eat. Vegan or not. In fact you should not carry the Vegan label in your mind when think of visiting this establishment. You will enjoy the food whether you are non vegetarian or vegan or vegetarian. My regret is that I couldn‚Äôt fit in another visit while we were in Madrid. The eatery is reached through a set of windy roads. There is outdoor seating too. Ordered the homemade coli Buffalo wings to start. Cauliflower was exquisitely flavored with a unique spice blend, not Buffalo wings through and through but nonetheless very tasty. The tacos and sandwiches that followed were so good that if you took a test you would not know the difference between a veg and non veg dish. Awesome.

Great experience at Mad Mad Vegan. Went on a Sunday afternoon without a reservation, when it was very busy. The staff did their best to still accommodate us. Was really delighted at the service standards. The burger was definitely one of the best I have had in a long time (being vegetarian in Spain, doesn‚Äôt leave many decent options). I happen to be in the area again on the following day and I went again for a quick lunch. The lady hostess there was very friendly and even gave us some free souvenirs. Thanks again! Can‚Äôt wait to see them expand to the U.K. hopefully üôÇ
Delicious burger (and I don‚Äôt even like burgersü§£), really kind and helpful Kelner (friday 31/01/25 14:00)ü©∑ Amazing vegan place (ofc for vegans and non-vegans)!
Delicious and rich pad thai and lovely service! Ordered half starter and patatas came with it too! so much food but great flavours!! Was enough for the next day too :)
Very delicious food! I especially enjoyed the pizza and the desserts were amazing. The cheesecake was out of this world! Overall a very good experience.

Delicious Vegan lunch. I really recommend the Pad Thai noodles! üçúüáπüá≠üåøü•ú I was here for the first time about a year ago in 2023 and I was really surprised how great the food was as a non-vegan. Looking forward to go back to try some more dishes. Thank you!

The croquetas are a must try. I also had the bocadillo calamari and it was insanely good. My Spanish is not good but the staff were all so friendly & nice. Must go if you‚Äôre looking for vegan Spanish food in Madrid!
Very friendly staff. Great food. There are a lot of beer options. Very quiet inside. They also have tables outside on the street. They offer free water if you don't want beer.

perfect!!!! the tacos are heavenly! the servers are very nice, water and appetizers are free and it is not very expensive. We went twice and will recommend it. Even out non-vegan friends enjoyed it a lot

Must visit this restaurant if you‚Äôre in Madrid. The food is absolutely mind blowing! We have tried the cauliflower buffalo wings, a double cheeseburger, club sandwich and tiramisu. They were all super delish. Highly recommend.

The sandwich components and sauces were not overly impressive, but the actual patty was phenomenal. Their beyond meat is soft, juicy and super tasty. I arrived just before 8pm and there were some seats, however was fully booked from 20.30 onwards and big groups were turned away. The staff is kind and the atmosphere is cool and chill. Good place for solo travellers if arrive early you can seat at the bar.

Mad Mad Vegan offers inventive and tasty vegan cuisine that will delight even non-vegetarians. Their burgers are simply delicious and hearty. Starters, such as vegan teque√±os with red fruit marmalade and green alioli, are a treat for the taste buds. The staff is warm and attentive, creating a friendly and welcoming atmosphere. Whether you are vegan or simply curious to discover innovative cuisine, Mad Mad Vegan is a must-see address in Madrid.

The place is very nice, the vegetarian/vegan menu is also super and the quality of food is amazing. I loved it so much that I went there twice in a weekend, while visiting Madrid. It could be a bit pricey, but I think it's ok for the place. I definitely loved the "Milhojas" cake with vegan chocolate cream! Highly recommended!

I really liked this place, not many vegetarian places in Spain. It‚Äôs well decorated and there is a peaceful atmosphere. The served you a soup with break free of charge at the beginning. The drinks are a bit expensive but they have a great selection of wine.

my first time here and it was just delicious and  all veganü´∂ I can definitely recommend. It was also crowded with locals which always gives me a good feeling that not only tourists go to these places üòè the waiter seemed to be a little hectically and annoyed as we can only spoke in English ro him at the beginning but he turned out to be ok at the endüòÖüôà so give it a try

Needed to have vegetarian on Tuesday and after one false alarm, found this google maps. Great find just off gran via. After a bit of deliberation choose the special 3 courses for 10e and a Couldn‚Äôt go wrong right? And so correct.  The chickpeas appetizer was good. I would have expected it a bit warmer but full disclosure this maybe way it is supposed to be served. The fideva made from short Spanish pasta mushrooms and seaweed was very tasty. As is it seems like with all Spanish cuisine the heat spice level is in the low which we augmented with some tobasco. And the chocolate panacotta dessert was divine. Not too sweet and very easy. If you are looking for vegan place off gran via, you will do good with Vega.
Very recommended. I'll go back again for sure. After 17.00 - if I'm right -, cake + coffee (any kind): 6‚Ç¨. Delicious cake and coffee. Great service.
Great vegan food here. I got the paella, but received a really delicious free entree. The meal was large I was so full after it ! Totally delicious, highly recommend to vegans. Good value.

Service here was great - we walked in very near closing time (30 minutes before) and they kindly served us. I had the vegan mousaka which was very cheesy and the appetizer they gave us. My friend enjoyed the vegetarian paella!

The atmosphere here is warm and welcoming, clean, and comfortably cool. The staff was exceptionally nice and kind. I ordered the hummus, the Mediterranean salad, and a gin-based cocktail‚Äîall of which were great! The prices are very affordable. Overall, a wonderful experience. Highly recommend!
Food was great! Very flavorful and tasty. Gave a very home cooked sort of vibe. Lemonade was not too sweet which is a good thing. Would definitely go here again!
Delicious and Big servings! Would definitely come back again ‚ù§Ô∏è

A great dinner! I came here with a group of friends from several parts of Europe and everything was quite tasty and unique. I am not vegan, but I'm always interested in trying something new, and tbh I would totally recommend this place to anyone!

Loved this place, the food was just GREAT !! also had a lovely sweet white wine which is a rare find. Wait staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful.  No negatives at all. Highly recommend this place to vegans.

The food was tasty and nicely presented. However, there was no music inside. During our visit, there were no other guests, so we ate in complete silence. When we asked for a few minutes to decide, the staff disappeared for a long leaving us alone.
Great tasting food. Service was fast but also slow.  Once food ordered it came out quickly, but the staff was slow to come over and check up. Took even longer to pay.

Really nice, laid back place in a great Madrid neighbourhood. Vegan food was great - fresh and good portions. The draft beer is excellent too. It is so important in this crazy world that people have established and continue to provide safe and welcoming space for anyone who is different or marginalised: I am in awe. My partner and I, who visited twice over two visits to the city, will definitely come back when next here. Thank you.
Very inclusive atmosphere and great music. Wonderful stuff too. We got the daily menu that was delicious. Everything vegan.

Delicious vegan food with generous, filling portions for a reasonable price. Great atmosphere with kind employees. The toilets are unisex, covered in stickers and marker, and equipped with free menstrual products.
As vegetarians, it‚Äôs tricky finding options at Spanish restaurants. We were really happy to get to try some vegetarian versions of local food here. Service was amazing too
Great vegan chicken and burgers. The fries were excellent but the medium size was too much for 2 people. Very clean and modern but with limited seating place about 4 chairs only.
They let me order even though it was 3 minutes before closing! I got the classic burger with beef. Was so so delicious I signed up for the loyalty program. I am excited to try the chicken!

The service was great. The sandwich was pretty good. The cheese balls were a bit off but the lotus cheesecake was actually off, it was expired and gross. The label said 8/12, a day after I bought it. Kinda upset because it wasn‚Äôt cheap, 6,95‚Ç¨ down the drain. Stick to the sandwiches and you‚Äôll be satisfied.

It was very good.  We had two different burgers, and enjoyed them both.  We also had the fries and cheese balls.  Small place, seating for about 8.  However oy 5-6 comfortably.   Service was good, they charge for every little thing, even if you wanted a little extra sauce.  They were out of the bacon when we were there, so we were a bit disappointed in that as I was excited.
It was the worst vegan burger we‚Äôve ever had. After just two bites, my wife and I couldn‚Äôt continue. Especially disappointing when compared to the incredible experience we had at Mad Mad Vegan.
Lovely place and the executive menu is great value for a burger meal. Kelia was so friendly and helpful

I had the chicken burger which had good texture but not as much flavour as I‚Äôd have liked. The place was spacious and clean, and the service was quick though. Maybe I should try other items on their large menu!
Huge delicious selection of vegan asian food and very friendly staff. Highly recommended!
They have a lot of choices and the food was tasty and quite cheap. Of course not like a 5 star restaurant but we both were really happy. They also heated it up. Would go again
I tried the seitan potato curry(5‚Ç¨) and vegetable tofu soup(3‚Ç¨).The food is tasty and reasonably priced.Highly recommend it

I was looking for oyster sauce in many supermarkets and several Asian markets without any success, but this place had it for a cheap price AND in 3 different sizes! Later on during the covid19 lockdown when all the supermarkets were out of vanilla extract, this place had that too (plus and they took sanitazing the place very seriously üëç) . The service was great the both times, first time they were already closed but served me through the window crack anyway.

Being a vegetarian in Spain, especially one who hates eating at 8:30 pm means a lot of veggie burgers so thank goodness for lunch at Artemisa in Madrid. Three course delicious lunch for 15 euros. Going back tomorrow!
Best combination of a vegetarian and gluten free. Friendly staff, tasty food and a diverse menu at a fair price.

Wow! Some of the best food I‚Äôve had in Madrid! I loved their daily menu but we also got their croquettes! Everything was delicious and we loved the mandarin cake! The vegetarian paella was delicious and highly recommend this gem!

I was dining here around lunch time and even though the place was almost full and I didn't have any reservations, I was lucky and got a seat at a table. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I had a vegan miso soup and vegan croquettes, and additionally a vegan cake as a takeaway. They all tasted good. The overall price is a bit high though.

I ordered the Greek salad, my husband got the "meatballs" and we shared the patatas bravas. The salad was delicious, the tomatoes were fresh and ripe, the patatas bravas had a nice garlicky sauce, and the "meatballs" were soft accompanied by a nice tomato sauce. I also had a glass of the white wine - it was on the dry side, very nice and complimented the food.

My wife and I LOVE La Encomienda! The vibe is cool, the servers are super nice and were patient with my so-so Spanish and the food is excellent. We had the beet ravioli, potato croquettas and the veggie gyozas. So tasty, and everything is presented beautifully. If we were here even one more day we would definitely return. Go!

I loved their food, but the service wasn‚Äôt good. I ordered lasagna with red cabbage and beyond meat burger, both were very delicious. Interior of the place can be improved. I didn‚Äôt like service because the waiter was weird. We came there early evening and were alone, there were not other visitors. We waited 10 min and waiter didn‚Äôt come so we took the menu by ourselves and read it. We called the waiter and she took the menu back because she didn‚Äôt like we took it ourselves and left us only one menu (for two people! When there were no people and all the menu paper were available). Than we made an order and call here again, than we needed her help several times and she never was in the room, she was always talking with a cook on the kitchen so we needed to go to the kitchen every time and she looked very annoyed, like we (basically her work) disrupted her from something important (her chatting). Looked she didn‚Äôt like her job, I hope no one  forced her to work there.

Tasty Vegan/Vegetarian food,. Fresh, natural ingredients and variety of flavours, served with love. Lovely, understated place, at a fair price. Three of us went and we really enjoyed our meal and experience.

I was really impressed with how helpful and attentive the staff was. I don‚Äôt speak much Spanish and have allergies so was excited to have someone explain what was safe for me and show total awareness of the contents of their food. There is a daily changing menu with a variety of tastes per option. We got the combo option so got to try some of everything and each dish was uniquely flavored. The white beans tasted like they had ham in them - which was impressive to me for vegan food! Food was more salty than I‚Äôd go for normally. Lots of options for dessert! I was so happy to have a yummy, filling, and safe meal.

This place was amazing! Gracious and helpful staff, clean atmosphere, and a wonderful blend of flavors and textures. The food is light and flavorful, and the menu of the day is the best deal in town. Exactly what we were looking for, and supposedly the oldest eatery in Madrid established in 1979.

Very nice place . Jesus and Babe received us as a family member. I ate there every single day of my stay which was more than 10 meals. Always good . The change the menu everyday . Salad or soup , bread and main meal then desert and tea or Malta to end . üëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª
Great place if you're looking for a vegetarian or gluten free restaurant. We especially enjoyed the meatballs and the tiramisu at the end. Excellent food!

The best vegetarian/vegan food we ever tried. Plus it‚Äôs gluten free as well. I started with nachos and guacamole and my wife asked for pumpkin cream soup with coconut milk. Both plates were really delicious. But the best was the Phuket wok that both of us ordered for main plate and it was just outstanding, we both loved it. After all we could not miss the vegan chocolate cake as well. I really recommend stopping by if you‚Äôre in Madrid.

user_id: I had the croquettes to start
restaurant_id: 6 of them. Then I had the taster menu number 3
rating: I was told this was for 2 people but I said I was hungry. It‚Äôs definitely for 2 people
review_text: lots of wonderful dishes on one plate. For desert
date: which I normally never have

review_text: This was an excellent place to eat lunch! So good I went back the next day. Everything is vegetarian or vegan. The food was üíØ. Great service. Great price. What more could you want?

Wow the vegan food here is so special. The dishes are so creative and different, but all so delicious! Wish we could have tried everything on the menu. It was a nice atmosphere inside and service was really great. Would recommend to any vegans visiting Madrid!

Food, service, and atmosphere are amazing! We were truly surprised and happy with the food. We came back a second time! I will say the carbonara was not my type of pasta, but there‚Äôs definitely something for everyone! I recommend the pacherri al Ragu Del Mare, tiramisu, Alexander salad, and coppa alle nocciole.
This is such an amazing vegan Resturant. The food is always perfect, the place is lovely, the staff are great. Top level vegan in Madrid.

Beautiful vegan Italian restaurant. The portions are generous. The ambiance is beautiful, very well decorated and ideal for a romantic dinner for two. The day I went, it seemed like it was a bit busy or short-staffed, and they got my order wrong (I was served by the owner herself!), bringing another pizza flavor. When I questioned it, she insisted on bringing the pizza I ordered, I said it wasn't necessary, because I was already full. Even so, when I left, she gave me the pizza I ordered (the correct one), in a take-out box, as a gift. I thought it was thoughtful of her!
one of the few perfect vegan restaurants I've been to. the food is absolutely delicious, the crew is professional and kind, the ambiance is sublime ‚ú®
Went to El buda feliz with office colleagues for a team dinner. Very good choice for Chinese cuisine in the prime area of the city, behind Gran via and Callao.
What a great place! Just seconds away from Gran Via and 4 courses and a drink for ‚Ç¨15! Yummy food, quick service with a smile. Highly recommend!

This place is amazing! A must see in Madrid, if you want something different than salty ham and watery wine, check this place out!!! My husband and I had a fabulous time, exploring the Asian culinary gastronomy of this restaurant/ bar. The duck fried rice is exquisite! YUMMERS!
Amazing place, not authentic Chinese but great atmosphere!! Best one was the dessert
Great atmosphere and very tasty food! Tried the noodles with chicken and mushrooms and the lemon chicken‚Ä¶ both were great!

I had an epic experience at Hunan Restaurant. My meal had generous portions fit for a glorious feast. The food was excellent, as was the service. I thoroughly enjoyed their super tasty grilled sliced beef, fried rice with eggs, and the unique coco milk.

Delicious chinese food satisfying crazing after eating Portuguese and Spanish food for a week. I would not call it authentic but all dishes were very tasty. Chinese cauliflower was the standout dish. Bustling at 11pm on Friday night. Service sub par because staff assumed we were from China based on appearance.

I like everything here. We enjoyed all the food we ordered and finished everything. They have the authentic chinese taste.
