You can really tell the difference, since I'm from Vienna and there's like hundreds of Chinese resto, I can say that here in Hunan they have this uniqe and authentic taste. Ambiance is nice, the style is simple yet elegant, but the price is cheap and with big serving. Would definitely come back to try some of the other dishes. The manager or owner(I forgot to ask) also accomodated us nicely. There's just one mistake when thay gave us a different dish aside what we ordered but that was not a problem because what they gave us was also really good.
Very nice Human Chinese food. True Chinese cuisine, the place is run and owned by Chinese. Super nice and attentive staff and the food was very yummy. 100%% recommendable :)

Delicious, good portions, and affordable. I had a craving for something different in my travels, so I went for Chinese. I ordered the guotie, beef stir fry, and chicken with chili pepper. Loved it all, and if I wasn't eating alone, it would have been enough for two. The price was very affordable and the service was wonderful. I would return here and definitely recommend it if you're wanting something different in Madrid.

Actually I don't want to recommend this best hot pot restaurant to others because I am worrying if too many peoples goes then I won't get a chance to have this great food again. This restaurant offer the charcoal Lamb hot pot which I only have tried in China and this restaurant could bring this best dish to Madrid is really hard and it's the best food for winter.
Tres bonne place! Wow, love it !
My favorite Chinese restaurant in Madrid. It's good for sharing some plates for 4 or more people because each plate is big and I guess you can't finish it alone.

Very very yummy food. The Sichuan beef dish wasn't very spicy so don't be afraid to eat it if you're bad with spice. The aubergine was simply amazing. The jasmine tea was well brewed and didn't get bitter. The rice cakes with brown sugar were super yummy and had such an intriguing texture. I loved it here üíú

Very nice spot here near the Plaza de Espa√±a in Madrid. I loved my plate because it was actually spicy, which is very difficult to find as many places in Spain do not add spice to cater to the Spanish diet. my glass noodles were fantastic and very filling. Great prices and good service will be coming back for sure!

The location is very strategic, just a few steps from Plaza Espa√±a. The food was good, already adjusted to the local palate (I am talking about the spicy level üò¨), service was good and immediate. Might need to reserve on weekends, though, but during weekdays you can just walk-in. We ordered spicy wonton, mapo tofu and braised pork, and they‚Äôre all yummy. Wanna go back and try more food from their menu list.

Overall a great place but with limited menu items. Food was quite good and service was fast. We enjoyed the spicy wontons as well as the fried rice. The xiao long bao was ok but it was also a bit dry with no soup inside like the usual xiao long baos.

Overall the food was delicious, especially the stir-fried rice (with strong flavor of cashew nuts). We also had Pekinese duck and cucumber salad. Portions were huge, we took away half of the food. Staff are friendly and the atmosphere is nice. The place is very big and has two floors, so it‚Äôs possible to go without a reservation. Just note that when you go out, you completely smell of Chinese food.

I have only one question: "Why is it so delicious?" It's incredible. All the dishes I ordered were perfect and incredibly flavorful. I didn't even have time to take a photo. I really liked everything.

An acceptable Chinese food that we found in Madrid. The taste is above average as I won‚Äôt say it is superb because it is not. I guess they need to cater for local culture but I would think any Asian would accept the quality of the food presented in this restaurant. I would go back again.

Very pleased to find this authentic Chinese restaurant right in the middle of Madrid. You can adjust the spicy level for all the dishes. The portions are quite big and great value for the price. I definitely will be coming back here whenever I‚Äôm craving for authentic Chinese food.

I highly recommend this place for authentic spicy Chinese food.  It‚Äôs located near our hotel, during a recent visit to Madrid two weeks ago. After reading all the reviews I am glad we gave it a try. It did not disappoint.  I am glad they didn‚Äôt tone down the level of spiciness to appease the locals and stick to their authenticity.  You order from the table by scanning a QR code. They have free wifi in case you have a weak mobile signal.  Checkout what we ordered for 2 people.
Nice flavours, excellent service and amazing atmosphere, I will come back. Next time I will take less spicy, they weren‚Äôt kidding with the medium ha.

Went here in May, we stumbled across it after a busy morning. Order through your phone at the table, honestly some of the best Chinese food I've ever had. The golden shrimp was delicious, the spare ribs & tofu dish was amazing and so were the vegetables. While we were there, a lot of delivery orders came in and I completely understood why, the quality is great and the seasoning even better.

Had a delightful experience at the Chinese restaurant! A vast array of Chinese dishes to choose from. The soup was simply the best, packed with a variety of ingredients. A generous portion, all under 7 euros. Options for both spicy and mild soups. The beef noodle soup included noodles, potatoes, seaweed, and mushrooms ‚Äì a perfect blend. I recommend adding soy sauce and sesame oil, conveniently available on the table. Will definitely return to try more.

The food was great but the service needs a little more work, the staff were not friendly, lucky we a Chinese friend who could order and understand well otherwise we would‚Äôve had something we didn‚Äôt ask for. If you are allergic to nuts or anything be very very specific to them. Enjoy the hot and spicy if you can handle it

The place is quite big, but the light is a bit too strong. The service was friendly and fast. They serve many Chinese street food, the flavor was fine. The price is great for the amount they gave, so if you want to eat something small and cheap, here is a great place to come.
Very authentic Chinese Sichuan cuisine, next to the popular food court market but this one can't be beat!
I was in shock that it is the only Chinese food restaurant in Madrid that is super cheap and delicious, I loved both the food and they are also super friendly in the restaurant. 10/10.

Had dinner here twice during our 4-night stay in Madrid.  Would have made it 3 times if not for their rest day on Tuesday.  This establishment offers authentic & delicious Chinese food.  And the prices for the dishes are reasonable too!  We are very happy to have stumbled upon this restaurant.

3 years later still so good!... 3 years ago: One of the few places where dishes in real life look better than on photos. Real, unbelievably delicious taste of very affordable Chinese food. Best restaurant in Madrid during week-long stay!

The service was excellent, and the food was outstanding. The house-made chili sauce, in particular, exceeded all expectations. If I lived locally, I‚Äôd visit regularly for authentic hometown food taste.

It was tasty, delicious Chinese food. We loved the beef with Bambus. It had a rich umami flavour. The waiter was a nice friendly person. And they don't close at 16:00/17:00, so we could get an early dinner and didn't have to wait after 19:40/20:00.
I married a Chongqing man who lived in the USA and tried hundreds of Sichuan restaurants in the USA. None of them can beat this one! Very very authentic and with homemade style.
Excellent choice for authentic and delicious Chinese in Madrid. Good service, tasty food (big portions) and recommended.

Been twice now and no desire to be back. There is a strong smell of food cooking and it stays on your clothes, you smell like a canteen. Girl on the cashier till is not interested in working there, no service at all. One waiter spoke fluent English and was helpful. The food portions are huge, massive. Prices are incredible for the amount you get. No matter what I ordered on my two visits, each dish tasted the same. Often looking the same. I cannot recommend
Located close to hotels. Bilingual and friendly.  My food was made on demand.  Was looking to order egg foo young but they didn't offer it on the menu.
Very friendly, trilingual staff and amazing food at great prices! The food came quickly too. We enjoyed fried rice noodles and sweet and sour pork rice bowl.
So far the best Chinese food I have ever tasted 10/10
The food taste is not bad, ofc cannot compare to the real local Chinese. I would say the beef noodle is soso, but the others two dishes I ordered I like it.

Amazing Shichuan food. It's very high quality. It's not too expensive, a bit more than a run of the mill Chinese restaurant, but MUCH better quality!! Worth ever cent. We will definitely return to try my plates.

This place has the best Chinese food I have tasted yet. The ambience is nothing great, but the simplicity makes you feel like you are in an authentic Chinese restaurant. The fried chicken with Sichuan chillies is replete with flavour and it is a must have!
Great and authentic Chinese food. Chilly oil on request. Very well balanced and spicy as it should be. Very happy

Amazing product and preparation for bang bang noodles in Madrid. Food is made fresh and the quality of every piece of the bowl is undisputable. Heat levels are also great and overall value for the meal is also good when you take into consideration every. Will be frequenting the place from now on for sure!
Specialized in those hand-ripped noodles coming  from Xi‚Äôan, Bi√°ng Bi√°ng is  simple, fresh and tasty. Short menu, kind service and bibs to prevent getting dirty.

Their biang biang noodles are absolutely delicious! We tried the classic ones but also the ones with meat and cumin looked amazing. Really suggested in case you fancy trying some authentic flavors! I suggest to book in advance since the place is kinda small.

A gem of real Chinese food. Ive been twice and it does not disappoint. The value for money is amazing. You see how they make the noodles and they have with soup of without. I recommend getting the classic ones in menu (with egg and slices of beef) and the dry noodles with pork in peanut sauce. Super tasty. The staff is friendly and speaks English. The place is full of Chinese which is a good sign of the authenticity of the food

Popped in for some hand-pulled noodles. The noodles were deliciously chewy and the broth was hearty and flavorful. My soup was topped with beef, cilantro and herbs, and veg. Everyone in the place was Asian‚Äî always a good sign for me! No frills, small but effective menu, great prices. I will be back.

Best Chinese food I had in Madrid. Their specialty is lamian ( traditional Chinese ramen) and it was for me an instant favourite. Highly recommend to anyone who wants to try the authentic cusine. Their hot sauce is to die for!

I was craving Chinese noodles which this place did not disappoint. The staff spoke Chinese and menu is straight to the point. The Lanzhou noodles have great texture and the broth was amazing. I added vinegar and spices to the noodles that adds more complexity which we usually like in our hometown from China. Highly recommend this place!
Nice, cozy place with normal prices. I had the dumplings with duck and truffle and it was the beeeeest thing. If you like truffle I totally recommend it. The spring roll weren't so special.
Went in during lunch hour and it wasn‚Äôt busy at all, got a table right away. I ordered the pork bao and it was quite good. Overall good service and wasn‚Äôt too expensive.

Hotaru Madrid is a true gem! The sushi is absolutely top-notch, and the tuna is so fatty, it simply melts in your mouth. The service is impeccable, and a special shoutout to Fabiana for her warm and friendly welcome. Alexandra, the sushi chef, is incredibly talented; each dish was a work of art and tasted amazing. The restaurant also has a good vibe and beautiful interior design, making the whole experience even more enjoyable. Hotaru Madrid is truly a rising star for Michelin, and I can't wait to see it get the recognition it deserves. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for an authentic and delightful sushi experience in Madrid!

The place is beautiful, the service is excellent, and the food is good however The quality does not match the price. The only reasonably priced thing in the menu is the omakase. If you order things separately the bill easily goes ‚Ç¨100. I would definitely recommend the omakase, however simple dishes like a roll a price highly.

Great experience, the decoration was amazing as well as the service. The food was very good, a lot of variety but a bit overpriced in my opinion (we were 4 and paid almost 200‚Ç¨ without wine). The desserts are a must (see pics). With no doubt its the best Japanese I tried in Madrid so far.

Hotaru offers great food with some standout dishes, but it leans on the pricey side. The nigiri selection is excellent, and the soft-shell crab maki is a highlight. The broccoli was a pleasant and unexpected surprise. While the overall experience was good, the price feels a bit high for the portion sizes.

Absolutely great experience , the food was incredible, the cocktails too ( the lychee martini was soo good) and the service is the cherry on top of the cake. We were attended by Carolina who made my anniversary dinner truly memorable. Will definitely come back.
Great place for an evening with friends or family.  Service is wonderful and food is delicious.  Sit at the sushi bar for a more informal but entertaining experience.

The roll bar offers an incredible view of the chefs expertly crafting the rolls. Every individual, whether trained or not, appears as though they are seasoned professionals. Not only the food is excellent, but the expirience is on another level. Will definitely be at the top of my list on Japanese cuisine.

Hands down best sushi I‚Äôve ever had. The fish was incredible and everything we ordered was excellent. The staff were also all so kind and the experience was unforgettable. Highly recommend this restaurant. Ichikani if you see this I am wondering where you get your fish from. Thank you so much for giving me the best meal of my life!
Amazing food with such good quality ingredients. Staff was very friendly and the atmosphere really takes you to Japan. 5/5 experience!!

They have a very extensive menu and everything looked delicious so it was hard to choose one thing but I went for the chicken udon and I‚Äôm glad i did, it was really nice. The only negative is that the staff need a bit more training. One of them didn‚Äôt know the names of the dishes which confused us when bringing out the food and one of them overcharged me which thankfully I noticed and fixed before I left.

There are no typical sushis or rolls in the menu, buuuut the menu is incredible. The fish section and hot meals are amazing. I could lunch and dine here everyday. Service is also good. Highly recommend.
We went for dinner and we loved it. We thought it was gonna be one more Japanese restaurant, but it turned out to be a very nice experience. The food was exquisite.

The food was so authentic that one could see (and listen to) Japanese people eating here. Clean and comfortable place with nice ambience, dishes are very tasty, and staff are kind and prompt. I recommend it very much!

Amazing variety of food and drink, capturing the essence of japanese cuisine and atmosphere with the decoration. The dessert we tried, the sweet potato brul√©e, was exceptionally creamy and just sweet enough. The karaage was the best I‚Äôve had in Madrid, and the udon soup was also amazing. I highly recommend this restaurant and I‚Äôll be coming back.

user_id: During my visit
restaurant_id: I indulged in both the natural and flamed salmon nigiri; both were exquisite. The O-toro nigiri was a highlight‚Äîexceptionally tender and creamy
rating: truly a delicacy. The inari also boasted a pleasant flavour. While the salmon and tuna tartares were a tad strong for my palate
review_text: the undeniable quality of the ingredients shone through in every dish. To conclude the meal
date: I savoured a strawberry mochi for dessert
source_user_name: which was nothing short of delightful.

review_text: Wonderful Japanese sushi and Korean food. We ordered miso soup, sushi and bulgogi beef. Pumpkin soup appetizer. All food was prepared to perfection. Service was prompt yet not hurried.  We could enjoy our meal at a nice pace. Service staff answered questions and provided recommendations.

We loved every dish, the selection of nigiris was wonderful and very good value for money (we ate it so fast that I have no picture haha). We also tried some rolls and the korean fried chicken which we really enjoyed. Also had some sake and tried makgeolli for the first time thanks to their recommendation. We‚Äôll be back!

I never leave reviews, but this place was just too good. My partner and I were visiting Madrid, and we ended up coming here two nights in a row. As someone with celiac, I haven‚Äôt had Japanese food in over a decade. This restaurant was such a treat, and the staff were so kind. Our personal favorite was the yakisoba, but I‚Äôm convinced there isn‚Äôt a bad dish on the menu. And don‚Äôt forget to try their desserts!

Absolutely amazing Japanese restaurant that is 100% gluten free and also many dairy free options. A fantastic place for celiacs. The service is super friendly and the food is superb. I had one of the best Ramens of my life here, gluten free or not! The desserts are also really good so leave some space. Some options can be made vegan. Next time I'm in Madrid, this is an absolute must to go back to. Especially on a weekend, I'd recommend to get a reservation.
Amazing food! Super friendly staff! Awesome that the whole menu is gluten free. Very rare to find gluten free Japanese cuisine. The katsudon was delicious!

Okashi Sanda is a delightful Japanese eatery in Madrid's Barrio Malasa√±a, offering a unique concept that caters to vegans and gluten-free diners. The menu features an array of delectable dishes such as Gyosas, Ramen, traditional Japanese plates, and delectable sweet desserts ‚Äì all gluten-free and boasting a wide range of vegan options. The restaurant charms with its pleasing decor and attentive service. It's a haven for those seeking delicious, dietary-conscious Japanese cuisine in a vibrant neighborhood setting.

My spouse and I ordered off the menu del dia and paid ‚Ç¨20 for the Sushi and ‚Ç¨19 for the ramen option. I need to eat a gluten free diet; so non sushi Japanese options are a rare treat. My spouse said the gluten free items were indistinguishable from regular dishes. Everything on the menu is gluten free! The restaurant is clean with nice decor, beautiful serving pieces, and an attentive wait staff that carefully removed dishes from the table between courses. I especially loved that they brought out extra plates and bowls so that could share the different courses. It is a good value and quality for the price. I especially loved the gyoza and ramen. We will definitely eat here again!
We liked it (but not loved it). We tried the day-menu, so we expect to get it better next time choosing from the general dishes.

Very tasty and classy place. Prices are definitely too high for the quality though. The sashimi are great as the ramen and the beef dishes. Altogether it did not justify the 50+ euro per menu. If you are in tight spot and want to invite someone to a sushi night they‚Äôll remember, no matter the cost, it‚Äôs the right place

Food was delicious, the waiters are attentive too, but the water is super expensive. When asked for water to accompany our lunch, we were served Italian bottled water at ‚Ç¨3.25 we seems rather high-priced.

Very good discovery in Madrid downtown! One of the few restaurants open on Christmas Eve and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. Great food, great atmosphere, great experience and great service. I loved everything here! I would definitely visit it again!

Really really unique and great experience eating in this fantastic place. We had great meat and food in general and a free apppetizer and liquor in the end. Very friendly and nice environment.  Value for memory and of course recommended!
Kobe Beef is Amazing! It just melts in your mouth. Worth the price. The Tataki madurada is also very good. Plum Liquor after the meal was sweet and delicious way to end the meal.

Best Japanese restaurant I have been in Europe. They really took Sushi to another level. Creative and delicious dishes. Strongly recommend their Gunkan. It‚Äôs like an explosion of tastes in the mouth!
Great experience! I recommend the spicy tuna uramaki and aburi uramaki. Friendly service!

My friends and I absolutely love coming to Kippu! The staff are the BEST, they‚Äôre all so lovely and welcoming every time. Food is incredible- tempura rolls wowowow. Shout out to Bing, Kai, Micheal!!

user_id: We tried the Suma Maki
rating: Aburi Uramaki
review_text: and Yakimeshi Pato. All the dishes were very good
date: and I especially liked the last two. With the discount from The Fork
source_user_name: we paid about 58 EUR including drinks.

review_text: The food was absolutely amazing. Some of the freshest fish I have ever had. Michael took great care of us and made the evening very memorable.
Amazing experience. Super nice place and the menu was delicious. A lot of great dishes, the highlight was the desertüòç Super friendly staff. Can highly recommend it.

user_id: From the moment you step inside
restaurant_id: you‚Äôre transported to a traditional Japanese home
rating: complete with wooden walls
review_text: fabric partitions
date: and a minimalist aesthetic that feels both cozy and authentic. Before heading to your table
source_user_name: the hostess gives you a quick intro to the restaurant‚Äôs concept and its history‚Äîa nice touch that sets the tone for the evening.

review_text: It was an amazing experience. We were six people, sharing many different dishes, the salmon sushi was extraordinary, the wagyu as well. Beautiful restaurant, fantastic service with really great food üíØ
Amazing Sushi experience in Madrid, the presentation of each dish and the flavor combinations were spot on! Best bites of Toro I've ever had.. Really enjoyed everything

Really good asian restaurant in Madrid! At first when you walk in it‚Äôs kind of confusing because there is no one at reception but apart from that the service was very good. The interior was very interesting and well done. The food came very fast and it was extremely delicious as well. We ordered edamame, sushi, gyoza and dessert and everything was so delicious! I definitely recommend eating here if you are craving sushi

Really enjoyed the food and atmosphere here. A really different experience with a live DJ, but not so loud you couldn't talk and enjoy the fantastic food offered up by Red Project. I felt the staff could have been more attentive, we waited 20minutes to order just the wine with the dinner. But apart from that, I would definitely return, prices are on the high side and again I felt the staff offered the more expensive options rather than the more tasty ones. Sashimi was great, but the stand out dishes were the crispy rice with tuna and the Jagger Rolls. Boyh exceptional. Would return.

The atmosphere and decoration is good! It makes you feel like dining in a night club. However the food is not up to standard. We ordered vegetable tempura, swiftie roll and miso soup. The tempura are not crispy enough and the sushi roll tastes really mediocre. If you want to have good authentic Japanese food, this might not the place to go.

Five stars across the board. The food was spectacularly tasty and beautifully presented. It serves mostly Asian (Japanese) inspired dishes with a Spanish twist. Try the nigiri! The service was also top-notch: fast and as kind as it gets in Madrid. Overall, the vibe of the place is really cool. I will certainly be back for more.

I was hesitant to try this place as I still haven‚Äôt found a good Japanese spot in Madrid.. at first glance, it really has the Japanese vibe. It feels like walking at a Japanese hole in the wall with the wood, art, lanterns, and dim lighting. The menu has a good variety and we went with the Katsu bao, gyozas, and some sushi. The bao was outstanding!! The pork came in a hot pot and it was ‚ÄúDIY‚Äù. Delicious!!! The gyozas were pretty good too and the sushi was also okay. We tried the sushi that had mango, cream cheese and salmon and maybe this wasn‚Äôt the best one to try as it really felt like a mix of flavors. But still good! I enjoyed the place and would definitely return if I find myself around this area again.
Nice Japanese hideaway in Madrid. Really feels like a Japanese diner, but food is nowhere near Japanese. Ramen was week off good or genuine. Prices were good though.

Place was clean and located right off the main strip of shopping stores. Was located in the perfect spot. We had gyudon, chicken teriyaki, salmon tartare and a maguro roll for an early dinner. Super yummy!! Food was awesome and staff was very pleasent.  Did a great job speaking English for us. Even scored a great window seat so we could people watch.  Would definitely visit!!
Great location, large indoor footprint for many tables. The staff were very accommodating, friendly and professional. Especially with young children. Food was excellent. Maraming Salamat!

Delicious food, unique experience: we had their house speciality, Japanese hot pot. It was a sweetish soup, a bit neutral compared to other hot pot types. The lady who prepared was not super nice, maybe she just had a bad day, I am sending her a hug.
Incredible site by acacias, attentive and very friendly chef, and very attentive waiter and the dishes prepared at the moment and most importantly, tasty food!100% recommended.

user_id: This cozy little place in the center impressed us with its friendly and professional staff. The food was beyond delicious; they use high-quality fish
restaurant_id: and the uramaki roll was a standout ‚Äì a beautifully crafted
rating: sizable
review_text: and fresh piece. The sashimi and nigiri were equally delightful
date: presented with finesse. Pairing them with the Japanese Iki Yuzu beer is a must. Considering the top-notch quality of both the food and service
source_user_name: the prices are surprisingly reasonable. It has quickly become a favorite on our sushi list in Madrid. Don't miss out on this culinary gem!,2024-01-13,Bella Natha S

review_text: Fair price with good quality and tasty sushi. It's a small intimate place. Recommended.
Never go here.  Place was empty and my wife and I wanted to sit down and eat - they told us we needed a reservation.  Made no sense.

Following my madrid friend's recommendation, we came to Sr Ito during our visit in Madrid ! It was such a pleasure and the food was so delicious ! Not to mention the service. Especially, the pan bao with Panceta and Kimchi sauce, was the perfect harmony that i used to eat in Korea and the sushi with anchovy was just a delice !! ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è ‚ú® Definitely want to try here again ! i piatti e la gentilezza ci hanno fatto bene üòä

I'll start with the fact that I can't put more than two stars.The atmosphere in the restaurant is not very good. They put us down there  it 's like in a small box , all the tables are close to each other and very small.The chefs are terrible. We ordered Gyoza Toro and Gyoza marisco both were cold .(what I said to the waiter, she said they shoud be  hot ) , but to us they bring cold , next dishes  Bao Eby  also were cold . Next they  brought to us sushi and rolls.The rice wasn't sticky, it was just falling (You can see in the photo how bad they did this sushi). If the chefs can 't cook rice , and the gyozas are given cold .. they shouldn't work in the kitchen .The service was very slow, the first dishes they bringef to us almost after 1 hour .And after 30 minutes we had to pay the bill , because the table reserve is only 1 hour and 30 minute‚Ä¶. So because of bad service we needed to eat all food in 30 min .I do not recommend this place and we will never come back
Honestly had a fantastic time in Madrid, the team was very warm and welcome, the food was fanatics

I love this place for their simplicity and good quality sushi. You can tell from the freshness on a week day of their tuna. Their service is ok, could be friendlier and more professional (the guy seemed very junior and a bit unhappy), but otherwise, it‚Äôs worth eating there. I‚Äôve been going for years

The most incredible Japanese restaurant I have found in Madrid! The plates look humble but the taste is AMAZING! Service is always perfect and also the other dishes are great. But the Kimuchi Salmon is by far my favourite. I enjoy every meal there.

If you like traditional Japanese food, this is the right spot. We‚Äôve been so many times and tried almost everything on the menu and everything is just delicious. My favorite dish is the kimuchi salmon with rice. It‚Äôs not a fancy place and this is probably the reason why I like it so much.

If you‚Äôre in Madrid and craving sushi, Kazu is the place to be. The quality is insane: everything tastes super fresh, and you can tell they put so much attention into every detail. The vibe is also really nice, intimate but not too formal. 100% recommend if you love sushi!

I really want to love this place‚Ä¶ The sauces are amazing and the concept is amazing. However, every time I order from Kazu, the fish tastes slightly off, and very fishy. I wish they used fresher fish and it would be a 5 star for sure!
It was delivered to my home, loved it so much and the package was well-organised. I would go to it over and over again, I‚Äôm falling in love with this culture and its food all over again.
Gyoza was juicy and hot. Edamame was also tasty. The sandwiches were mid. But an affordable place to try at least once if you‚Äôre in the area and hungry.

Great place to have a unique twist to sushi. The sushi sandwiches were incredible!!! My favorite was the acevichado. The acevichado came with a sauce that‚Äôs a mix of leche de Tigre and spicy Mayo, mind blown! The service was also great and he took the time to explain all of the options and combinations. Thanks Emilio!

Sorry i got to burst your bubble. They dont make their own soup. THE RAMEN IS SO BAD. THEY BUY THEIR REVIEWS.  Its off ready made bottle which you can buy from suppliers. Their broth is too thin to even be consider a good ramen. Their char siew is decent thou. Their noodle is supplier n not house made so all in all dont waste your time if u want authentic ramen here. You can tell from my photos the thickness of the broth. Move on.
Great place for v√©g√©tarian food. A Little crowdy but i mean worth it. Th√© food quality its great and th√© size portion is more than enought.
I was impressed by the quality of their Shoyu Tonkotsu ramen. Its soup, noodle, and pork slices all are at the excellent level. Thanks for serving such great ramen there.

With how much we paid for the food, we should‚Äôve had much better service. We got into the restaurant, were led to our seats, but a waiter didn‚Äôt come up to us until about 20 minutes later. We started to order and she told us that we have to leave in 1 1/2 hours because another reservation is coming in. So we order the omakase experience and it felt incredibly rushed. Like right after we finished the last bite of one thing, the next course was on its way to our spot. But not only that, we also fully felt forgotten. One of the chefs had to keep reminding the waitress to help out or bring us food. By the end of the meal, we got our dessert, which was fully melted, not how it was supposed to be (the people next to us had the proper way the dessert was served). And as soon as we finish the dessert, we‚Äôre handed the check. I go in my purse to look for some change because I wanted to pay cash and the waitress already has the card reader ready and in my face, even though I clearly have my cash sitting out ready. Horrible service and we feel like we wasted 150 euro.

The sushi here was great. I tried several nigiris and they were delicious. Sometimes it‚Äôs hard to find fresh tuna in Madrid but this is the spot. I also tried a scallop dish and it was amazing. Lastly, the staff was lovely and the service was top notch. Definitely coming back

Worldclass Sushi a little outside the main area though in good walking distance. Can only recommend to eat the chefs menue. Great price-value for a fantastic and authentic experience. Will definitely come again.

Unbelievably amazing Japanese grill! Every bite was heavenly, I think the place deserve a Michelin star. We did pay 68‚Ç¨ each but we ordered more than what you normally would, so maybe a normal price would be 40-50‚Ç¨ and for the quality of the ingredients, it's a fair price.

This was excellent Indian food! To start, we had the vegetable pakora, which was the best pakora  I've had, and I live in a city with many great Indian restaurants. We also had the aloo saag, and the eggplant. Both dishes were incredible and the flavours sublime. The atmosphere was relaxing and welcoming. Great service. We highly recommend this amazing little gem in the heart of literary quarter.

Two words, absolutely banging. Had the chicken balti and it was amazing, highly recommend. The peshwari naan was a beaut that added a touch of sweetness that I always crave with curry. Not even left the restaurant and I needed to post about how much I enjoyed it!
After a whole week in Seville and Madrid couldn‚Äôt have anymore tapas. This place was a great find. Delicious food lovely service and just what we needed yum

Nice ambience and nice food, some of the food was a little bit salty for me, but I normally ate without a lot of salt, in any case, you can ask for less salty when you order. The service was correct, and the food it‚Äôs so good. The bathrooms were clean, and the location its perfect. With a live show, will be the best place to share a night with friends!

One of the best Indian restaurants I‚Äôve ever tried! The food is incredibly delicious, rich in authentic flavors and perfectly spiced. The service is outstanding‚Äîstaff are friendly, welcoming, and very attentive. The atmosphere is great, making it a truly authentic Indian dining experience. Definitely my go-to spot whenever I crave Indian food! üëåüèºüî•
Excellent place if you're craving some Indian food in madrid. The food was well prepared, the roti was cooked to perfection and the service was quick too. Highly recommend.
Food (especially the paneer) and service was great! The ambiance is really nice as well. Would definitely recommend for good Indian food.

We were at Madrid from 11 to 14 Jan 2025, travelled for vacations from Berlin to Barcelona and then Madrid back to Berlin. Taste of food at Indian Aroma was really delicious, I would rather prefer to say ‡§≤‡§ù‡•Ä‡§ù. We are in Berlin from Feb 2024 and had been to many Indian restaurants in Berlin and around but never felt like eating the food quality as served at Indian aroma. We took lunch two times during our stay at Madrid.
This has got to be the best Indian food I‚Äôve ever had!! So much flavor packed in every bite. The naan was great as well. Please stop by if you are near the area. You won‚Äôt regret it.

We were visiting my daughter in Madrid and had a delicious dinner at Indian Aroma! Service was great and food was awesome üëè. A must try place in Madrid. Ask for South Indian spicy if you want to get your dishes spicy üå∂Ô∏è.
A great experience eating indian food here. The ambience is nice. Service was quick. Good food. Slightly over priced is what I felt. They made the food fresh.

We recently visited this Indian restaurant near the center. While the atmosphere was somewhat dirty and quite warm, the food was absolutely delicious in every way and served promptly. The staff were friendly, and the service was excellent. I highly recommend trying the Tandoori Chicken Tikka; it was incredibly tasty. At the end, they treated us with a refreshing mango drink that really lifted our spirits. Overall, despite the ambiance issues, the quality of the food and service made our visit worthwhile.

We had here dinner and it was one of our best dinners in Madrid. We felt we were back in India with the food being so accurate and delicious. The stuff were kind and friendly and we can‚Äôt wait to come again! We took the chicken tikka masala and malai kofta with garlic naan.

This is an awesome restaurant, we were searching desi taste in madrid and found actual one. Highly recommended. Cook is from delhi and Mr Koshi has helped us for services, he is truly a great host‚Ä¶.thanks Indian Accent :)
Food was ok , service was good. There few things not that were not cooked well but the owner did take it off the bill.
The most amazing food and service! Genuinely one of the best Indians I‚Äôve ever had. Koshi was so lovely and attentive. Would highly recommend ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

A delightful experience and delicious food! Indian Accent was great stop on our short trip to Madrid. The owner is extremely accommodating and very sweet. We enjoyed our meal and he personally checked in with us several times to make sure everything was to our liking, which it was and more! As we were leaving we heard another group exclaim they wish they had food like this at home. Would go back in a heartbeat. Good prices, good portion sizes. Don't forget to share!

My group of 6 had a wonderful experience here. The food was outstanding & the service was hospitable and helpful. We don‚Äôt speak much Spanish and the owner/staff were very kind & patient with us. They are a new restaurant in the area and we wish them success!
Excellent food and people
AAAAAH queee riiico todooo
Delightful, I went with my partner and we loved it, at a good price and the people who treated us were super nice. I highly recommend it.
Fab Indian restaurant just off the main square in Madrid, big portions and very tasty food. Biryani and naan were our favourite dishes! The bill was 25 euro each

Had gone with a group of 30 people , we are from india and yes nice location and very well furnished fast service but not very friendly asked him for wi fi password and he like never responded. Food is good , yeah worth your visit if you are in this location

Indian restaurant close to city centre, ambience and decor is amazing as well as service. I couldn't say a bad word about the vegetarian food, cheese rolls and onion bhajiya I would recommend. I opted for palak paneer and a peshawari naan for main course, and the taste was delightful. Unfortunately, my friends were disappointed with the non vegetarian curries and kebabs, so hence did not give 5 stars.

This is an Indian restaurant with such a good and nice atmosphere. The inside is beautiful, it feels small and cozy with good service. The food is delicious, with enough vegetarian options. Vegan options could‚Äôve been more, since man of the veggie dishes included paneer. It seems to be a pretty popular place so I‚Äôd recommend making a reservation.

Average Indian Food but with few arrogant and disrespectful staff.. so strict on closing time that didn‚Äôt allow me to finish my dinner.. why even take my order then.. the whole city was awake as it‚Äôs just 11pm, all nearby restaurants running with full crowd.. waiters keep coming back to back and telling we are close, no dignity to even let their last customer to finish his dinner. In the end I have to leave some un-finished food due to irritating staff. Overall very unpleasant experience. There are many other Indian restaurants around, please try them instead when in Madrid..

We had an excellent meal at this restaurant this week, booked on The Fork. The staff were friendly and professional, and the location and decor are charming and comfortable. We ordered the sharing starters and then a mixed tandoori grill, excellent portion sizes, and the flavours were outstanding. A high quality meal for a reasonable price given the quality. We will visit again when we are in Madrid.

Nice looking and comfortable place. Food is reasonably good, though they didn‚Äôt make it as spicy as we asked. Be careful that they don‚Äôt overcharge you. We did not appreciate that they charged us for the papadum they brought without asking.

Very good taste. Me and my family come here 2 times in our 2 days visit in madrid. They has very good servant, especially Ahmed. They give us bonus manggo juice and cucumber as my little daughter love it so much

Extremely horrible food, NEVER try this place, Dal makhani was yellow, and paneer tikka was yellow as well, cook is using lot of food color, our mouth and hands were yellow all day. Naan was half cooked. Jeet‚Äôs rice was served burnt black jeera . See the photos, and in the end they still charge you for full even after complaining them multiple times.

I ordered this on Uber Eats and received dishes so watery they weren‚Äôt edible. Even though it was 2 x 1, it was absolutely disgusting and not worth it at all. My suggestion is to pay a little more and eat quality food somewhere else

If I could give more stars I would! Ahmed was the perfect server! I will be coming back and bringing friends! The food was amazing, especially for someone out of town just looking for something reliable! You can‚Äôt go wrong with a Taste of India. If you‚Äôre lucky, Ahmed will be here to take care of you!

The food here is so good with several vegan options, authentic, great portions and inexpensive with friendly people especially Kaimu. They even gave us complimentary mango lassi. I liked it so much on first visit that I went again. I highly recommend this restaurant
Papadam and chutney, samosas, Pakoras, garlic naan, pilau rice, mango lassi, pistachio kulfi ice cream, Phaal curry, and Glacy special hot curry were delicious!

Moharaj is such a gem! I went to Moharaj for the first time with my partner yesterday evening. We ordered Rogan Josh chicken, Tarka Dhal, and Garlic Naan. They were all sooo good! It was my first time to have both dishes I was so surprised by how great they were. And this evening I was craving both dishes. I order both again with garlic naan but this time as take-away and all for myself haha Just as great as the first time! Thank you Moharaj for your kindness and wonderful food!! I‚Äôm so lucky to have found you! :)

Best Indian food I had in Spain! So good I had to come here twice! On the first day I wanted something spicy so I got the chicken vindaloo and let me tell you, they brought the heat üî• My second day I went with something a little more mild and creamy with the palak paneer. Both dishes were exquisite. The naan was outstanding as well. The staff here are so friendly and patient and make you feel at home. They also treated me to a mango lassi for dessert. Highly recommend stopping here if you‚Äôre in the area!

Islam our waiter is fantastic. Because of him we are here the second time in 3 days. He can speak English and provides excellent service. The food here is outstanding and they use outstanding ingredients and high quality food. The restaurant is super clean and well maintained. Some of the best Indian food I ate in my life. I highly recommend this place!

The food was amazing and made extra spicy on request for our specialty order. We really appreciated the excellent service from Islam our waiter and atmosphere. Everyone in the restaurant spoke English and understood our broken Spanish.
Loooved this place. The food and service were absolutely fantastic.  Will definitely be coming back when we come back to Madrid. This is the place to come.

The service was good for an afternoon service. We got our food quite quick after ordering and the server was great. But I didn't really like the food we got. We got garlic Naan, cheesy chicken Tikka and chicken bhuna which was not very good. Overall not terrible, but also definitely not great !
Tasty Vegetable Biryani in Madrid. Many vegetarian indian options are available.
This place has the best tandoori I‚Äôve ever had, hands down.
Really very tasty food! Everything we ordered was wonderful! The service was very good , with attention to our wishes and a very pleasant atmosphere! The restaurant is wonderful!

It was really good!! We went to celebrate our anniversary and finished the day with the best dinner! lots of vegan options! I will show you in pictures what I had, I‚Äôm not really good with all the names! But definitely, loved it! I want to go back soon and try more plates! The desserts are hot, interesting fact about indian desserts! üëå go!!!

Our neighbors are from Northern India and they had gone on a date night to Nilah last summer upon their opening. They raved about the dosas. I hadn‚Äôt had a dosa since moving here. A proper dosa was what I had been craving.  We went today and had mixed raita, pani puri, rogan josh, vegetable biryani, chicken kovan and dosas. Chapati as well. It wasn‚Äôt spicy which I wish I had been asked about adding it but, it was aromatic, beautifully plated and everything was so fresh. I had communicated one dosa but received two but, they did not offer anything as recompense so we took the other home.  I‚Äôm not sure if the chai was made from scratch as it was very weak and not spicy or aromatic which was weird because everything else was so heavenly. After speaking with the owner/chef it was nice to know that all the meat was fresh and halal, not frozen and the menu was complimentary to all needs plus gluten free, vegan  and veggie friendly. Overall it‚Äôs clean, beautifully decorated and the staff are nice & friendly. The vibe was organised and peaceful. The velvet benches are a nice touch with the elegant mid century modern chairs  Atmosphere-wise, I feel there are missing elements of the culture as I expected textiles or art from Chennai, Kerala -just a glimpse. I would suggest this because it‚Äôs too vanilla. Show offyour culture as It‚Äôs an amazing one! In addition, I would have liked ambient music as well but, the tables and tabletop were elegantly appointed. I felt like this is a must for all future client dinners and my partners work luncheons because it satisfies all dietary restrictions & appetites. Thank you for an amazing meal and we are grateful for your hospitality - we will return. Many blessings and success to your business now and onward. We needed a place showcasing Southern Indian delights! Veronica and Carlos

As a tamil guy, I approve of the authenticity of south indian cuisine at Nilah restaurant. ;) I've been hearing this recommendation from many other tamil friends in Madrid. I went with six colleagues for a team dinner. We ordered the classic south indian foods like idly, ghee dosai, Vadai, oothappam, madurai chicken curry, chicken lollipop, prawn 65, mutton coconut fry, fish curry, chicken Chettinad, Parotta. Parotta with mutton chukka was my favourite. Everyone loved the food. Spicy chicken Chettinad was the ultimate.  No other indian restaurants in Madrid serve these authentic south indian food. Thanks for making me feel at home. Nandri!

If you're an Indian craving authentic South Indian flavors in Madrid, Nilah is a must-try. After spending two months in America, I was really longing for some good Indian food, and I was so glad we found this place. The butter chicken was excellent, and the paratha was just perfect. The masala dosa was also top-notch! It's clear they prioritize quality, and offer a wide range of options, including vegetarian, vegan, and other dietary accommodations. It's a great spot to get that taste of home you might be missing.

One of the best Indian restaurants in Madrid. Friendly staff members,  high quality of food, and reasonable price. I tried many Indian restaurants in different cities of Spain, including Barcelona, Bilbao, Malaga, Vigo, etc. This place can be considered as one of the top competitors in providing Indian cuisine. Menu of the day is 13.5 euros, which is reliable considering the quality and the quantity of food they provide. Highly recommended.
Very good food. friendly service. Decent prices. Highly recommended for people who know or don't know Indian food. Best to reserve. It's usually full.
The staff was incredible, and the food was amazing. He took care of our large group, was very organized and efficient. We are from out of town and enjoyed this meal so much, the service is incredible
Very nice and cozy indian restaurant!! We celebrate here the nye unespectably  and we had a very nice time. A place to recommend for sure!!
Great food, great service, the restaurant has a 42 years history. Worth visiting again. ThankS  Mr. Bashir & Nazir for the experiance

Being a Pakistani, I can say this with certainty that the food is authentic and exceeds expectations! Amazing that over the years they have maintained a really good standard of food and service. Would highly recommend!
The best Indian/ Pakistani food we have had in Madrid. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is ambient. The restaurant is popular among the locals and has been there for more than 40 years.

Excellent atmosphere and service, very clean. Food tasted good but I have eaten much better food at other Indian/Pakistani restaurants. I had ordered rice, naan, chicken karahi and chicken jalfrezi and these two chicken dishes looked almost identical with slight variation in color. I had to ask the waiter which was which. Serving size was also smaller. Online menu was not available so I took the pictures of the menu and I am uploading.

Very friendly staff and excellent food quality and good quantity. They are very busy on the weekends so you need to make a reservation. Had Chicken Saag and Chicken Jalfriezi. Both were great. The naan is cooked fresh on a tandoor. Jalfriezi is on the spicy side by default and they can adjust if you ask. Highly recommended.
Best Indian restaurant you can find in Madrid. Must try. Highly recommended.
Really a good place to eat Indian food.üíØ Came twice and still the best!!

Forget all the tourist trap places: if you want great Indian food in Madrid, this is where you go. Curries range from mild to genuinely spicy; everything was fresh and perfectly cooked. Garlic naan and mango lassi were the best I‚Äôve ever had‚Äîin fact, the owner gave us free mango lassis with dinner!
Amazing food, best indian food in town. I‚Äôve been many times and the food and service are always magnificent. I really recommend the butter chicken.

We ordered the menu for 2 so we could sample several dishes. Every one of them was lacking taste. The menu was 32‚Ç¨ which was quite expensive for the amount of food. The desert was supposed to be gulab and they provided an ice cream that was pure ice with no taste. Really disappointing. I do not recommend, there are better Indian restaurants in the area with more reasonable prices. The service was fast and nice though and the atmosphere was not bad either
Amazing food and very broad selection of dishes, but cooking time could be faster, even though it fades away when you finally get your delicious curry

HALAL food eaters - Have visited Madrid a few times now, and this has to be the best Indian food I've had. The service was excellent from start to finish, and the food was amazingly delicious. Highly recommend to Indian food lovers. All dishes except Lamb dishes are halal. 5* service and 5* food.

amazing food! Probably one of the best Indian restaurants I‚Äôve tried in Madrid. We went there with 10 people and they were able to recommend the perfect amount and kinda of food! The have Kingfisher and cobra beer and lots of great Indian dishes!

We loved this restaurant as it was close to our accommodation in Madrid. The food was authentic Indian and my husband fell in love with their Chicken Tikka that come out sizzling hot, very moist and delicious. There‚Äôs a nice touch of a complimentary glass of a liqueur at the end of the meal. We visited them 3 times during our stay and they didn‚Äôt disappoint us. The staff - Amenu, Hasan and Abdul are all lovely.
Very hospitable and helpful staff   Genuinely nice people. The mains came quickly this may or may not be to your liking.

Solid food, affordable, good service. The restaurant is larger than it seems, so finding a table shouldn't be too hard. The lamb tandoori was a favorite, but the butter chicken lacked tomato sauce (I'm sure there are multiple versions of this recipe, I just like the zesty version better)
Love everything üòç perfect please for Indian food in Madrid! üíØ pretty valuable ü•ò

Came here for the New Year Eve dinner and the food was really good.  I love their tandoori chicken which is moist and tasty.  Their curry is on the spicy side even at medium but it was great.  The owner was very friendly and welcoming me overall a great meal for the last day of 2024.

I was here with a friend and we asked for a menu each. The amount of food was not enough. The starter was really small and same with the main dish. The palak paneer I asked for did not look like a palak paneer at all, and the taste was absolutely not as expected (I have had this dish several times before). It had a looot of sugar in it and tasted more like a dessert than a dinner. The waiter was absent during our meal so when I told him about my bad food experience when we were leaving he replied that "this is the way palak paneer is served in Madrid". This is not true and so I told him, but it looked like he did not try to understand what I was saying. Also the naan was below average standard. Not recommended.
The worst service I have ever got on a restaurant. They lied and we ended up with this...

This place has some great indian food. They also know how to take care of their customers. They make great suggestions and have a fun staff. When we ate there they threw in a dish on the house. Would definitely come back soon!

Disgusting food. Order Uber eats. The food was stale and old like it was sitting around for days. Stay away from this place. I put a complaint to Uber eats to remove this place. So bad o could not eat it. 43 euro wasted.
Food quality is very very bad. All the cuisine taste is same including lassi and it is sweet only.
Horrible customer service, the waiters seemed really angry and stressed, would not recommend
food is disgusting, place is dirty, and service is horrible

What a great place! Our hotel was around the corner and I‚Äôd read the reviews before visiting. Was delighted to see the 3 piece band playing who were fantastic and entertaining. Service is great! The margarita was delicious and the nachos were really good. My boyfriend said it is best Mexican he has ever had!!
The place to be in Madrid when it comes to authentic mexican food! Unbelievable atmosphere, reliable prices and awesome food. Simple great!

The atmosphere was amazing. True mexican music. The staff is so nice. And the food was so so good. We had the aztec soup, tamales and the fajjitas. After that we had a few frozen margarita‚Äôs . When we paid the bill we got a really nice shot of tequila. Would definetly recommend this place 10/10

We had dinner today in this place and everything was amazing! The restaurant is very cozy with beautiful details. Thank you very much Keider and Luciana for the perfect service! I suggest this place 100%.

My friends and I stumbled across this place and we were pleasantly surprised! We got right in and the wait staff was very kind. The margaritas were amazing as were the tacos. The prices are very reasonable. 10/10 would recommend, will also come again!
Food was delicious but the burrito was amazing. Very friendly staff. Cute and cozy place.
All cocktails are delicious and generous. The staff is very attentive and Vivi is the best, will be coming back for sure

10/25/24, what a great experience and excellent food. Had the pastor tacos (delicious), roserito tacos (üòã) and wire (appetizer) üëçüèº. Loved it all. Thank you from California ü´° see you next time ü§ù

The prawn tacos were just amazing. Juicy and succulent on the inside, crispy on the outside. Paired with a creamy sauce and a hefty slice of avocado. And try the Mogo mogo too, very interesting mix of sweet and savory.

Nice and very basic but super cozy Mexican restaurant! We were a group and tried 7-8 dishes as they come in bites and can be shared - all were very delicious! It would be good to also listen to the staff - they give brilliant recommendations! Drinks are great too! Definitely recommend this place!
Warm atmosphere and nice people. We came to this place for some drinks. We had frozen margaritas and it was amazing! We‚Äôll come next time for delicious tacos.

The best nachos I‚Äôve tried! The restaurant is small but cozy, funky, and located in the center of Madrid. The staff was friendly, the service was great, and the prices were reasonable. I recommend it!

Solid Mexican quick service restaurant right down the road from the royal palace.  The food was great and hit the spot after a lot of walking in the morning. I easily recommend as a place to grab lunch. The food was fresh,  a great bang for the buck and easy to eat.
Great food and good service. Would definitely recommend!
Good service, tables outside have heaters. Food tastes amazing and fresh! I ordered the strawberry marg and it was delicious. Definitely would come back.

Just dropped in at random for lunch while wandering around Madrid. Absolutely outstanding. The guacamole is superb, the tacos are out of this world. And, when the owner tells you that the salsa is ‚Äúmuy fuerte‚Äù believe him.

Small place great experience! Very authentic and delicious Mexican food, the best flautas i have tried in a long time , everything was super fresh and great balanced, the service earned the 5 stars. We paid 42EUR each a party of 6 (margaritas and beer included) so pretty good !
Had the best Mexican food of my life here. Our waiter Ruth was incredible and all of her recommendations were outstanding. Their service and care were unmatched. Thank you!
Highly recommended! A wonderful taqueria just off of Plaza Mayor. Great food, great drinks, and excellent service.
Amazing place. Great value for money. Tacos were incredible, quick service, lots of seating. I would genuinely have eaten 50 tacos they're that good
What a find.  Excellent food, very inexpensive, and top notch service in a cozy central Madrid location.  We had multiple types of tacos, but the Carnitas were the best!
Best tacos ever! Wide variety. Authentic food.
Good food and good service. Tacos are a bit small but tasty. I especially enjoyed the cochinita pibil.
Tacos are good but I had better. Quesadilla is one of the best for sure. Service is attentive and fast, and price is fair for its location.
I had the passion fruit frozen margarita and it was so good! Only 7.90! The chips and guacamole and their beef tacos were good too. Good service, recommend

The best Mexican I‚Äôve ever had! Highly recommend starting with the ceviche and tostadas de at√∫n rojo and trying aaaaall the tacos üôå it was also great finishing off with the coulant de chocolate con helado üëå Beautifully decorated restaurant with excellent service as well - a must visit in Madrid ‚ú®

When I say the staff is friendly, they are next level. The lady that served us was truely super nice! Also the food was delicious! All the smells of the dishes passing by were  amazing, we had a ‚Äòpati pami‚Äô plate to share with three. We added few extra tortillas and portions along with it. Super delicious! Mille Gracias!

the place isn‚Äôt horrible but the experience was a little disappointing. it‚Äôs definitely not autism friendly, there‚Äôs a lot of loud sounds and lights which isn‚Äôt a bad thing if you like that. the food was a bit of a miss, there was nothing wrong with it but it was also nothing spectacular. the service was just not good, our waiter was pretty rude and it seemed like we were bothering him all evening. basically it‚Äôs ok but there‚Äôs better options.

We came here via TheFork (with a discount on the food, not the drinks nor the day's set menu). We had a nice lunch sharing nachos with guacamole and enchiladas rojas which weren¬¥t that hot (for Spanish tastes!). Next time we'll go for the green ones. The service was efficient and friendly. The waitress is a natural. The frozen margaritas were large, light and refreshing.
Best taco‚Äôs I‚Äôve had, the mojito and margarita were so good, and the server‚Äôs were lovely ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Decided to celebrate my birthday with some friends in this place. We received a very warm welcome, the servers were very attentive and friendly. The atmosphere is awesome and the food was delicious.
Some of the most authentic Mexican food I‚Äôve encountered in Europe down to the prices. Great ambiance, great food, great service. Loud and cheerful and the wait is worth it in my opinion.

It would be quite OK if some of the "guests" weren't so inconsiderate. On my first visit, my dinner and my nerves were completely ruined by a guy at the next table and his ongoing extremely loud, hysterical laughter. Even the waitress asked him about it, but it didn't bother him at all. When I came back two days later, I didn't enter. Again, some bawlers were shouting so loudly that one could hear it from the street even with the door closed. And the food quality and service friendliness isn't worth it at all putting up with that noise. It doesn't have to be silent like in a monastery's refactorium, but also it doesn't necessarily have to be this incredibly loud. In general, it can be said that deficiencies in social behavior and intelligence cannot be compensated by volume. Just a few hundred yards away there's a Mexican restaurant where things aren't like an carnival event that's gotten out of control.

For simple Mexican food in the middle of Madrid it was really good! Traveling with our young daughters who don‚Äôt yet appreciate Spanish cuisine it is necessary to insert a more comforting meal for them here and there and this place did not disappoint. As a matter of fact, the little one wants to return for dinner. Pictured‚Äî tacos de bistec, no cilantro or onions per daughter‚Äôs request.

I cannot imagine finding better Mexican food in Madrid! PERFECT for Americans craving a Mexican meal. Owner is a gem! Food was the BEST we had in all of Spain. If you have been to Acapulco, these tacos al pastor are what you have been searching for ever since. Go and enjoy!

Found it on my way to another place. Had seen it on G maps, recognized the name and went in to eat. Food was tasty, small, but tasty. A little bit too 'fancy' trying to go for the upscale feeling, and that was the only negative. Usually the homey Mexican places are the authentic, this was it but i wish it was a bit more down to earth.

It was a great experience. Food is not as simple as in regular Mexican restaurant but still very delicious! We are all before I could make a photo! Cocktails are great. I recommend this place for sure and will come back!

The first nice thing is you don't have to wait until 8pm to have dinner. The food was very good. The Ceviche with fish and prawn had an explosion of flavours. The combination of passion fruit juice, promagranite and cilantro really elevated the fresh flavours of the seafood. Prices are reasonable too. More smiles from the wait staff would definitely make it a perfect place to dine.

Food is tasty but a bit too expensive for what it is in my opinion. Especially with how cheap a lot of taco places in Madrid are. Having said that I really enjoyed what I ate, the restaurant itself is nice with a good atmosphere. The service was excellent.

The waiter, Alejandro, offered us a service beyond our expectations. He was really patient, smiling at all times and recommended us the best choices for our dinning experience. The ceviche was one of the best we have ever tried. The kid‚Äôs taco is wonderful. It comes with a soft and juicy steak. Cocktails were delicious too. Congratulations to all the team (kitchen, dining room and bar). We will definitely come back whenever we come to Madrid again ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Nice tacos üåÆ and ambiance fits accordingly. Some tacos not as good but the pastor one is def a must try! Margaritas are not slushy frozen and the mango one was not great, tamarind was better. Beers only ‚Ç¨2 which is cheap relatively for EU. Server/bartender/chef (was all 1x guy) was really nice and accommodating!

The food is amazing, I initially ordered 5, but decided to order 5 more all for muyself. If you‚Äôre looking for a comfortable place, this isn‚Äôt your place, but apparently they have another spot on the other side of the block. If you‚Äôre coming for a quick bite, this is your spot. The food comes extremely quick and is tasty. Salsa to taste and also garnish. My favorite was the Mole, it was something I never had before. Most tacos are 1,50 with some for 2,00 and a few for 2,50. There‚Äôs also a selection of tequilas and mezcals, but again, this isn‚Äôt the place to have a nice drink with your buddy or date

Tiny place in the midst of Madrid. Awesome corn tortillas with delicious meats - Cochinita Pibil, chicken mole and the nopales (cactus) were amazing. We also tried the tamales which was a fun experience wrapped in a banana leaf. Good beer on tap and a refreshing margarita hit the spot. Tasty salsas and a great spot for a quick bite!

I liked this place! The tacos are great, the ambiance is relaxed, the decoration is nice, and the service is ok. The quality and flavour of the tacos is similar to those that you would have at family gathering on a Sunday afternoon in Mexico City, where people did not bother much to cook, yet it was good enough to come back every week. I will definitely do! üòÄ

This was indeed a nice experience! The place is authentic and the guys there seems to run the business with dedication and passion to their roots. The food is delicious, very special flavors and you can see that the recipes ate the original ones. A place where you should go if you are looking for a mexican food stop.

This is our favourite place in Madrid. They take bookings at 8pm or 10pm and I would recommend booking as it was full the entire time. Everything is so reasonably priced, tacos are ‚Ç¨1.50-‚Ç¨2.50 and margaritas are ‚Ç¨7, with multiple flavours to choose from. Staff were so quick and the tacos were the best I‚Äôve ever add. 10/10 would definitely recommend!
The service with Danny was spetacular, I really loved it and the food is soooo good with a great price. I'm very happy I founded this place to eat in Madrid!

Super friendly staff, nice decor, reasonable prices. I didn‚Äôt enjoy the food to be honest, it wasn‚Äôt to my taste that‚Äôs all. It was presented lovely and made with good ingredients. Location is very central and easy to reach. Good selection of meals and drinks

Made a group of Singaporeans felt right at home in Mexico despite the language barrier. Staff was friendly and welcoming, patient with our order. Food was excellent, we had the quesas and nachos along with sangria. The live band was amazing and engaging, like a little fiesta in the middle of Madrid! Love it!

Firstly I would like to say that the staff were very nice and the restaurant was one of the most eye-catching places I've, however, it's my passion for Mexican food in which I must give such a low rating. Although this was the coolest looking Mexican restaurant I've been in the food was the worst, not to say it was bad just not good. Ordered Taco but I got something of a cross between Enchiladas and Fajita, was also very expensive. Would like to give five stars for the staff and the decorations of the place.

The tacos are amazing and the low prices are unmatched. You know the place is good because there is always a line out of the door. The only issue is you often have to wait awhile to order and then are pressured to give up your seat to the next customer. This is just a consequence of their popularity. Overall a great food and I would recommend
GREAT TACOS. I tried like 10 in total, and they were all great. Anything not tacos has a risk of being very mid. Very quick service.

Little place tucked away in El Rastro. By far my favorite Mexican Restaurant in Madrid. Their aguas Fresca are amazing and my only problem is always having to decide which tacos to have! Their margaritas are delicious as well! Always good, always friendly.
Best tacos I‚Äôve had in Madrid and Teddy was a wonderful server!! Super attentive without being too much. Highly recommend the buffet (all you can eat) and margaritas!!!
That was a tasty Turkish d√∂ner in the city center of Madrid. Also, the price is quite affordable. The serving has come very fast and the workers were smiling. I appreciated it. Thanks üôèüèª
The service was quick and they also had a separate vegetarian menu, which was such a relief.
Great good and service.   Small place - not fancy, but well worth stopping in for a meal.   I liked it so much I went back the next day for another chicken shawarma pita.  Thanks!
I never ever ever review. The best food in Madrid. The only place similar to Jordan (the country) amazing.
Good. Still need to improve the service
Very nice place with a pleasant atmosphere. Very delicious food and attentive service. Highly recommended
Simply spectacular and exquisite! The skylight group never ceases to surprise. The space is spectacular, the gastronomic proposal is delicious. We will make reservations for next week.
Unbeatable atmosphere, and exquisite food. The treatment by Cruz, a 10. Thank you!

Our hotel receptionist recommended this restaurant for us to try and it did not disappoint! We were lucky to get a table as we were walk in customers. The service is very good, our waitress is super friendly and polite (I forgot her name üòÖ beautiful chinese girl) and the food recommendations did not disappoint,  each dish was delicious!! And we did not leave anything on the plate! Highly recommend!

This was recommended by our hotel.  The food was decent, although the lady sitting across from our table quietly warned us not to get the chicken wings that were recommended to her and her husband.  We ordered a lot of food, but they came out slow. At one point one wait staff asked if we were done when we are still waiting for more food.  They got one of our orders wrong(the waitress repeated our order to us, but still entered something else into the system), but happy to correct it when we pointed it out.  Just more waiting.  Things happen and we have to stay positive. Overall, the items we ordered were good. Better than average.  We would come back again.

I recently had one of my best seafood experiences at this restaurant. The food was bursting with flavor, and everything was incredibly fresh. The waiter was exceptionally professional and welcoming, adding to the overall pleasant experience. The ambiance of the place is fantastic, with a unique and well-thought-out design. Additionally, the prices are fair, making it a great value for such high-quality seafood.
Good cheap Lebanese spot. The food was good and came out fast. I got the number 5 Cordero. It was a good portion and taste great.
Amazing food and atmosphere. The kafta combination with rice was delicious and a perfect portion. There is limited seating but it adds to the coziness.

Okay Lebanese if you want something at the end of night. Food is decent but cleanliness of interior make you wonder how they handle the food. Bottles with clear layer of dust build up for years are the first noticeable warning‚Ä¶service is slow and prices are fair

Authentic and very affordable Lebanese food. I tried the tawouk sandwich, falafel, fries and muhammara. They were all excellent. The owner was generous and hospitable too. Highly recommended. Will definitely become a regular.

The Matbah in Centro Madrid is a hidden gem! Their fresh chicken skewers are a must-try‚Äîjuicy, flavorful, and grilled to perfection. The ambiance is cozy, and the staff is attentive, making it a fantastic dining experience. Highly recommend for anyone craving authentic, delicious flavors in the heart of Madrid!

Food was okay. Beef was too salty for my taste. The chicken was good. The veal was a bit too tough. The sides were all good. Friendly staff. Only a few tables inside so it will be hard for bigger groups of more than 4.
Best halal food in Madrid! We were in Madrid for three days and we came here every day! Friendly Muslim staff, great bowls and wraps. Can‚Äôt go wrong with anything on the menu. Highly recommend!

Chanced upon this hidden gem, Emma Cocina, a small neighborhood restaurant near Plaza San Miguel. It serves Mediterranean cuisine, we had mixed lettuce salad with crispy bacon and avocado, escalivada with frigate tuna, aubergines with cordobesa style, salmorejo (cold tomato soup), chicken tajine and stewed pork cheek with mashed potatoes. The food was tasty and great.

We stopped in on a recommendation from someone we know. We did not have a good experience. They didn‚Äôt bring us what we ordered, wouldn‚Äôt exchange our food, and there was now debating it. The potatoes were simple but good and the tacos were so so. Would not recommend this spot to anyone.
Emma Cocina was a delightful find!  It's a small, cozy restaurant right next to Mercado San Miguel with delicious daily menus.  The soup of the day and the escalivada with tuna were excellent.

We visited the restaurant in the night and we did not need a reservation to find a table. We ordered three dishes. Each one of them was good, the two dishes had pork and it was melting. The only negative I found was that for me the portions were a little small, but rather than that I would definitely suggest it and I would go there again.
How good could 'a grilled salmon' be? Don't even dare to underestimate a simple dish in Spain. Woo-lah-la

The place is well located in the heart of Chuecas, a nice Madrid neighbourhood. The atmosphere is cool, lovely decoration. The staff is charming and attentive. Fast service. The food was good, although I haven‚Äôt loved the croquetas. Not the traditional preparation as I was expecting. The octopus was great as well as the salpicon they gave as a starter for free. Overall, my experience in casa marius was positive :)

Amazing restaurant.  Very nice staff, very accommodating.  And delicious food.  We had so much fun, and the prices are very reasonable.  I would highly recommend this place right near El Retiro.  5 stars all around!

Cosy, great food, attentive staff, and good prices. We thoroughly enjoyed the whole dining experience at this restaurant. The menu of the day was impressive, inexpensive, and full of flavour. A nice glass of red wine went down very well. We had the lobster risoto, it was tasty and well seasoned. My mail was very tasty, and the fries/chips were homemade. Highly recommended.

We had our wedding dinner in Mune Pelayo. Michael and the team were so lovely and super helpful. The food was fantastic especially the meze plates. I definetely fall in love with this place. It is much more than the pictures.

I was able to explore several restaurants in Madrid and this one was hands down, one of my top 5. The middle eastern food was on point, coming from someone who is from the Levant region. The fattoush, tabbouleh, the trio  appetizer, the grilled meats were absolutely delish! We finished it off with the knafeh and it was so worth it! The staff were friendly and gave us recommendations as to what was their favs. The decor was also very nice. We were  big party but they were able to accommodate us quickly and food came out swiftly as well. If I‚Äôm ever in Madrid again, I will made a point to return to this restaurant.

The ambiance was pleasant and tranquil, creating an enjoyable dining experience. We sampled a variety of dishes and were impressed with all of them, except for one that didn‚Äôt quite meet our expectations.

Really enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere at Mune. We tried the assorted  cold vegan platter (moussaka, lubieh bzeit, selek bi tahini, warak enab) along with the assorted hot platter (kibbe, rakayek, spinach fatayer, meat sambussik with yogurt). All were amazing and can't wait to go back to try individual dishes.

Visited Madrid several weeks ago and had dinner at this wonderful place, across the street from the Royal Palace. It is small, so reservations highly recommended. Everything we had here was delicious and tasty! The service was also excellent! This is one of our favorite restaurants in Madrid and will be back for sure. It's also very new, clean and beautiful inside. If you sit outside you can people watch and catch a beautiful sunset. Definitely recommend this place, especially if you get over tapas like we did.

Chicken - juicy tender delicious. Potatoes - to die for. The textures and flavors of everything are incredible. And the service was impeccable everyone was so kind and attentive. Definitely a must try when in Madrid! And they have a beautiful terrace that looks towards the palace and if you‚Äôre lucky you can catch a beautiful sunset.

Amazing restaurant, found it completely randomly. We had the pleasure to taste delicious falafel, beetroot hummus and more in a very cozy, clean and nice environment. Every detail in the ambience was perfectly combined with good and friendly service. The only pity was that my friends and I were late so we could only taste some of the ‚Äúentradas‚Äù. There are several vegan and vegetarian options, that are also reported on the menu to recognize them faster (highly appreciated). The prices are pretty cheap, considering also the great location, in the very centre. Nothing to complain about, wonderful job! We will definitely come back
Recommend üëåüèºInitially, my meat was overcooked, but the staff quickly replaced it. The new dish was good, and I appreciated their prompt service. Overall, a decent experience

Even though it was a super busy night, they were so kind and attentive to us. They dealt with a seafood allergy and a vegetarian who didn‚Äôt realize that ‚Äúbocadillo vegetal‚Äù contained tuna. Would absolutely go there again. Recommend 100000%. Also the prices are incredibly good.

We sat here for lunch. Altough the restaurant may seem a little bit pricey, it is worth the whole experience. Paella for 2 is what i strongly recommend, while you wait you get perfect starters. Good price value ratio. Get a cold beer from the tap to enjoy your starters with!

We visited Mediterrae with my wife in December 2021 after a long walk. We didn‚Äôt know this hidden place but decided to give it a chance. We ordered a couple of dishes as we were not crazy hungry and we had been VERY surprised by the quality of the food. Overall very good. We ordered ‚Äú1/2 Costillar‚Äù and ‚ÄúHamburguesa Hawaiana‚Äù. Both were very good!

Cute little place for delicious food and friendly staff. We stumbled upon it by chance and decided to give it a try. The vegetarian options were limited but tasty enough that the lack of options didn‚Äôt matter to us. Highly recommended.
Great food! I love authentic Greek food and this food transported me back to Crete! Unfortunately they don't have Gyro's but the soulvaki with feta and tzatziki was very close and absolutely amazing!
