review_text: Very enjoyable dinner. The paella, cod were superb.  Fried artichoke was a bit oily but very tasty. Ravioli was also very tasty but a bit dense.
I was impressed and did not expect such a good food. I know if I am in Madrid again, I will book a table. I recommend it because the place was crowedd
Very good! The food was amazing, the service is exceptional :-) Thanks for the waiter who speaks Portuguese we could understand all plates!

We had a lovely lunch here, and really enjoyed the food and atmosphere - it's really a hidden gem, with excellent food and fair prices. The booths were comfortable and quiet for conversation, and service was excellent. We'll definitely be coming back again!

The atmosphere is really nice and quiet. I tried some tapas: the Croquetas de jam√≥n ib√©rico, the alcachofa and the pan bao. There were delicious. I went tree times and as main course I chose raw meat and fish. The tataki of tuna, the beef steak tartare and the salmon tartare. That was wonderful and tasty. They have great spanish red wines and beers. I appreciated particularly the staff which were kind and friendly. I enjoyed so much. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm traveling to Madrid.

Very atmospheric restaurant, waiters are friendly and can speak English, decoration is beautiful. All the food we ordered are delicious, I can taste they are very fresh, the sweet and good favour in the meat.

The dishes were delicious with good quality, the service was fine. We had men√∫ del d√≠a in the restaurant for ‚Ç¨14.5 per person. If you want to have men√∫ del d√≠a, you won't be able to reserve the table according the restaurant policy. So you can only go there in the moment, and the staff will tell you that you can only stay 1 hour. That remark didn't sound so friendly -- maybe they were just busy.

This has to be one of the best places in Madrid! They have a very large daily specials list with the freshest food! plus, they are great at adapting the portions so that you can try as many different plates as you'd like :)
The octopus dish was very tasty. However, the salmon tartare was salty for me. Maybe it was because I didn't ask for "Sin sal"

absolutely fantastic value for one of the tastiest meals i‚Äôve had in a long time. i had a starter, main and dessert, with a coffee and a soft drink for less than 20‚Ç¨ at lunch. service was fast and kind, and everything was very tasty! would recommend strongly!
Great tapas lunch after visiting El Ritiro. On side street of main road, so not as loud and beautiful inside. Food was delicious and our party was happy.
Nice local restaurant, the food is OK but the portion is not a lot.
We had lunch here a couple of times and enjoyed every dish, in particular the rape con arroz and a really delicious hamburger. Great flavor and attractively plated. Very pleasant atmosphere.

Awesome experience with great food and drink.  Staff was very accommodating with my terrible Spanish.  Highly recommend for anyone looking for a great satisfying meal and super polite staff.  Get the cheesecake, you‚Äôre welcome.

Good overall value, the food was delicious and the place is very nice. The eggplant was crispy on the outside and just right on the inside. The desert was made with Ice cream and banana and was also just right. You might also want to try the Tinto de Verano, a refreshing option for summer.

Cathy was amazing!! The scallop ceviche is some of the best seafood we've ever had. Definitely recommend reserving ahead of time, we got lucky with a last minute reservation and they were more than accommodating, and if you're gonna try it ask for Cathy!!
This place didn‚Äôt miss. Easily the best meal we had during our short few days in Madrid. The salmon belly was special. Oysters, tomato salad, lobster ceviche, and croquettes were all great.

The flavors of the dishes are truly rich. We went as a group of two couples, and for four people, the portions are small. I had to order one more individual dish. It was somewhat complicated to choose dishes to share since the menu has more options with seafood, which is limiting for someone like me who is allergic to shellfish. The service was inconsistent‚Äîsometimes quick, sometimes very slow. We found that the wine we ordered did not match the description on the menu. It took us almost 20 minutes to be able to pay the bill.

review_text: Incredible Italian food well situated in the vibrant shopping district. The Carbomama was simply fantastic. Creamy, cheesy, and laced with the fragrance of oil from cured meat. The prosciutto topped pizza, whose name escapes me, was wonderful as well. Service was superb and there‚Äôs a whole English-friendly section in the restaurant. Highly recommend reservations as the walk-ins are completely up to chance.
Shrimp tartar was good, the fish tempura also nice, the duck was fine but not the best. Overall good, but a bit overpriced compared to other restaurants.

One of the tastiest restaurants I‚Äôve been to in Madrid! Fantastic menu for dinner, ambiance and service. We went two weekends in a row because we couldn‚Äôt stop thinking about the Duck! The starters are so varied - a very creative fusion of typical spanish dishes with an eclectic twist. The palomitas de gambon were delicious!

Amazing atmosphere, lovely deco, cosy. Has all the ingredients for a perfect dine out. Service amazing, it‚Äôs well worth the price. We had croquetas and zucchini flowers both delicious highly recommend it. For main course steak and cod both superb, maybe a bit to much alioli but that‚Äôs more of a personal reference. You cannot leaving without tasting the coolest torija and the most special sangria.

The inside looked very chic and cozy, but we were sat outside despite being the only ones there for the first hour. The ensaladilla and duck were delicious, as were the sangrias! Unfortunately, the beef and vegetables were an incredible disappointment. They all had literally no flavor - like, they didn't even taste like plain beef and veggies! It was so bizarre?! It was too bad we had to pay nearly 30 euro for the most flavorless dish we've ever eaten. Overall, I wouldn't say this spot is particularly worth the hype.

This was a delicious fusion restaurant many options to choose from. The atmosphere was romantic and elegant. There‚Äôs lots of cocktails but even more wine options! Would recommend making a reservation because it did get busy! The service was great and my server was attentive and super nice!

One of our favorite restaurants!  We spent over two weeks in Spain and this was one of our favorite restaurants. My family and I really enjoyed the dining experience. Staff went above and beyond! I have a gluten allergy and the kitchen made sure to go above and beyond to make sure my dining experience was just as memorable as my family‚Äôs.

Overall really good experience. Service was good although one of the waiters kept on trying to take our food before we were done. Our main waiter gave us good recommendations. I highly recommend the dumplings ü•ü and if you can, take at least half of one in a full bite, the explosion of flavors in your mouth is delicious.

Wonderful restaurant!! First, only by the decorations and the interior of this place you know you will definitely have an enjoyable experience. Service was on point and the food came relatively fast. The meals were absolutely amazing - taste 10/10 as well as presentation-wise. I loved everything and I will definitely come back again! If you are in Madrid and are a fan of Italian cuisine this is definitely the place!

What a warm experience! The staff was very friendly. Talia helped us out throughout the night and was lovely. The barman was also very helpful in helping me choose a drink. Very happy with the overall experience!

review_text: This was my second time dining at Allegra and it is a wonderful experience. JC was our server and she was a delight, she also spoke English and it was nice to not have to worry about the language barrier for a dinner. Also, highly recommend the spicy rigatoni, it‚Äôs amazing!! And they even brought out a special treat for us at the end as we were celebrating our anniversary. Great restaurant!

Loved every minute here! The vibe is just priceless, if you‚Äôre looking for a dinner in a special place in Madrid this is it! The food is also very good especially can recommend the aubergines (starters) and tortellinis. The ravioli weren‚Äôt as special as expected.
It was a great meal, but not a truly remarkable one. Everything was fresh and well executed, but the umami wasn‚Äôt there. Loved the design of the place and the service.

Great food. The pasta was delicious and the wine (great options by the glass) were fantastic. My only complaint is they give you bread and water without asking if you want it or telling you it's not complimentary and then charge for it. It's not expensive but it's a matter of principle. Barring that small detail, the overall experience was amazing.

Ten con Ten is a pretentious restaurant that falls short in almost every aspect. The main thing, the food, is excessively expensive for the portion and quality. They welcomed our group with (cold) bread and a small pumpkin soup that was given to us without asking, and we come to find out that is was charged. Service was mixed with some servers friendly and knowledgeable, and others lost and somewhat unfriendly. The space is well decorated and felt clean, but it was very small and crammed. All in all, if you are visiting Madrid for a few days and were thinking of stopping at Ten Con Ten I would recommend you do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

I am glad we were able to find reservations online. The food menu isn‚Äôt too big but the food was high-quality. The wine and cocktail menu is more extensive. We went on a Thursday night and it was packed, especially the bar.

review_text: I had a fantastic experience at this vibrant Madrid restaurant - Spanish with Venezuelan influence. The atmosphere was warm and lively, with friendly, attentive service throughout the evening. The food was diverse and flavorful‚Äîhighlights included the spicy sausage pizza, crispy aubergine, crab croquettes, and pork tacos. Each dish was delicious, well-presented, and full of bold flavors. The menu catered to various tastes, offering a great mix of textures and spices. With drinks included, the meal came to around ‚Ç¨40 per person, making it a great value for the quality and experience. Definitely a spot I‚Äôd return to whenever I'm visiting Madrid again.

Lovely little spot! Although we didn‚Äôt have a reservation, we happened to stumble upon this restaurant and walked in and we were offered a table. The food was delicious and the service was of high quality. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Madrid.

The most fantastic experience, every dish was an adventure that transported you to a different part of the world with their culinary creations from taste to perfect presentation. The staff friendly , knowledgeable and constantly making sure that we were enjoying every moment, every dish and drinks. Thank you for a fantastic experience. Angel and staff kudos to all.
We‚Äôve arrived to Madrid for 2 days and had 2 amazing dinners here. Delicious bread with smoked butter, beef tartar, peppers Padron, artichokes and of course steaks. Highly recommend!
Spacious restaurant, ideal for friends & family gatherings. Great for sharing multiple dishes, big enough for everyone to try. Good steak and delicously grilled artichokes.

Luis Miguel was awesome.  Our second time here and were lucky to have LM as a server both times. Overall great food (chuleton was incredible as well as the tiramisou) impecable service.  We will be back

The service of this restaurant is 5 stars. From manager to staff they were really helpfull to save our company dinner meeting, as there was an error with our reservation and due to fully booked they did not had it easy to find us a place, but they really made that extramile to save our dinner and create a nice table for us. Thank you! Grazie mile! And for food all outstanding from starters to desert. Well done Carbon !

Excellent place to stop in for tapas! Fresh pinchos made with high quality ingredients available at the bar. There are seats available for those who arrive early enough. The food, the atmosphere and the service are all top. Highly recommend!
The food is very delicious...the terrace on the road, but it's very romantic! The cheesecake is fantastic...and staff HChris he is so kind and perfect! Thank you for your service...‚ô°

Classic Spanish restaurant in a great area. The place is really big and they have 2 outdoor terraces, one on the top floor and one at the entrance to the restaurant. Nice ambient and decoration and profesional service. We went in without a reservation and everyone we spoke to was really nice. Portions are not big but food was good. To our surprise, the highlight were the tikka masala tacos.
I love this restaurant. The food is spectacular and the service is excellent. Without a doubt, Johan made our experience so much more special.

I had tapas for dinner a couple of nights back. It was a work event paid for by the company, so (un)fortunately I cannot comment on the price quality ratio. What I can comment on is the food and the vibe. The food was great, and there was really a perfect variety of tapas. I actually hate sharing food, as I never feel I have eaten quite enough. But in this case it was okay. The Spanish wine accompanying the food was really good. After 11PM the tables were put aside and the real fun began. A concert from two girls who invited people on stage to sing with them. I didn‚Äôt understand any of the lyrics as it were mostly Spanish songs. But the vibe was amazing! I even got dragged on stage. Although I got out of singing as soon as they realised I was a gringo.
The overall experience was ok. The service was the best of all.

The staff was amazing. Went out of their way to get us a table without reservations, even on the busiest night (Valentine‚Äôs Day). The food was amazing. I really enjoyed the tuna tartar, truffle pasta, and the tiramisu for dessert. 10/10 would definitely recommend

The food was spectacular. I would suggest ordering the pastas, especially the pesto and truffle. Service was good and the overall aesthetic of the place was very appealing. Definitely would come again.
super cute place with a nice atmosphere and good food. Our server Harley Melvin was super nice and helpful.

The food was absolutely delicious, really recommend the raviolis. The service was okay, there wasn‚Äôt much warmth from the workers, and a large lack of communication. One of our biggest take away was the fact that they silently provided bread in the beginning of the meal, and come to find out they charged 2‚Ç¨ per slice of bread (we had 6). Other than that, it was great food with mediocre service.

Great restaurant with a delicious menu. We visited on a Friday night while they were having an event on the lower level, so they sat us upstairs. The space felt cozy and great for conversation. Enjoyed a variety of dishes including the Salmon, the chicken and the  frozen yogurt dessert!
Everything was excellent‚Äîthere‚Äôs a great menu selection, an elegant atmosphere. We enjoyed having our lunch here.
Delicious wine, tuna tartare, chicken, and chocolate dessert! It was slow when we came in so service was initially a bit spotty, but overall a lovely experience.

We loved it here, the food was delicious. We had some unusual and beautiful dishes. Katha and Nay were very lovely and warm waitresses!The service was really quick as well, even though they were busy. It's a pretty interior as well, atmospheric. Would definitely recommend!

Really enjoyed the food here. Our server, Genesis, was extremely kind and gave attentive service. The atmosphere is really cute and at night they put out candles on the tables which is nice. I had the sirloin steak and my mom had the Caprese salad. Both were very tasty, we thoroughly enjoyed our meals!

Treze is a fine dining restaurant with a unique menu with very interesting choices, a great deal of seafood choices and for those with not such a large appetite as the portions are small. The quality of the food is excellent and the choices are varied so there should be something for everyone. Having said this, I had everything from the ‚Äúoff the menu‚Äù and all of the special dishes of the day. Although I thought their ingredients and preparations are of a high level quality and standard, I was not impressed. We asked for the main dish which was a part of the Tuna fish that is right behind the head and supposedly very prized but I didn‚Äôt like the texture of that part of the fish. It was slimy and gooey, so not for me or my friend with me either. Neither one of us enjoyed it. We also picked the salad of the day which was a mixture of three types of beans and also Tuna fish (I guess we were really in the mood for Tuna!) and it was fine. We also had a tomato salad that was also fine. I have to say that the service is excellent, the waiters do know their ‚Äúmetiere‚Äù and know how to present and sell the dishes to you, plus they made you feel tended to and taken care of. The atmosphere is nice and elegant but not over the top. It is pricey so be ready for the bill‚Ä¶ Then again, it is a Michelin star restaurant!

Great bib gourmand restaurant in Salamanca. We especially liked the pigeon gyozo serving and the rabbit main. The blue cheese cheesecake was a fish and interesting dessert. The cava we got at treze was the best we have gotten anywhere.

As a female solo traveler, I came across this restaurant and decided to give it a try. It turned out to be an incredible experience, exceeding my expectations. I was warmly welcomed by Anthony, and the service was fantastic. Roberto treated me to generous in-house shots and delicious dishes. I was truly in awe of the warm hospitality and generosity I encountered. I fell in love with this place and will definitely return when I visit Madrid again. The food was amazing, and overall, it was such a lovely experience! ü´∂

Eloy was our server and he was very caring and attentive to us! Gifted us two bottles of wine at the end. We had the special menu, which came with 6 entrees, 1 main and 2 desserts. 100 euros per person, definitely worth it! Portion sizes were perfect :)
Had a great dinner here. We had 100 euro/person course meal. It was worthy. I think better than ordering individual meals. You can taste a lots of seafood as Galician style.

Amazing dinner at Los Montes de Galicia, one of our favorite meals in Madrid. In a quiet neighborhood, but lively and packed restaurant. Alex and Juan Jose were excellent with service. Extremely attentive and helpful. Great wine selection, and many affordable options. To start, the jamon iberico was excellent! Cod & potato fritters to start were also good - nice crunchy, light fry. Had 2 different steaks as our main dishes, both were delicious. For dessert, the cheesecake was very creamy and lemon sorbet was refreshing and served in champagne flute. Overall, would highly recommend and would come back.

Manuel saved the day! An exceptional dining experience from start to finish. The wine selection was superb, with a well-curated list featuring both bold reds and crisp whites that perfectly complemented the meal. The service was impeccable‚Äîattentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely friendly. The staff went above and beyond, offering thoughtful recommendations and ensuring every detail was just right. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making for a memorable evening. Every dish was crafted with care, showcasing fresh ingredients and excellent flavors. Highly recommended for anyone seeking delicious food, great wine, and outstanding service in a welcoming setting.

The place is nice and cozy, the food is good but this place excels at its service and attention. The hostess and waiters were very charming and charismatic, but our waiter, Arpita, takes the golden star. She was very sweet and very attentive to us. We ordered a variety of plates, but the plates that stood out in flavor were the Pollo Alla Caccioatora and the Lasagna di Zia Lidia; the other plates (Risotto Frutti di Mare, Tagliatelle alla Bolognese and Gnocchi alla Vicentina) could have used more of the subtle Italian flavor/seasoning - to avoid using salt and pepper on the table, specially on the seafood dishes that need the soft flavoring to mask the fishy aroma). But the overall experience was nice, they even gave us complimentary ‚Äúchupe‚Äù (soup like shots) on the house. Arpita and the rest went the extra mile as well by giving us one of the desserts we ordered (Tarta de Queso) on the house as well, after they realized we were celebrating a birthday on the table. Excellent place for dining and wining!

Absolutely amazing Italian restaurant in Madrid. Deliciously prepared dishes that are unique and exquisite. Nice atmosphere, nice service, a bit on the pricey side but totally worth it. I highly recommend it!
Very nice flavours in the meal, both guests happy with the choices that were made. Very friendly staff, fluent in English. Excellent experience,  I recommend.

Arpita was a darling and treated us amazing!! Everyone was super nice and the restaurant very cozy. Will be coming back soon ü§çü§ç the taglioni truffle was the star of the night as well the burrata
Amazing food. Mario took great care of us at the bar. Fantastic margaritas and food. Fried green tomatoes and croquettes a must.

I really enjoyed my meal at La Musa. They snuck me in early, as I didn't have a reservation. I told them I would be quick! Had a drink and 3 (savory) dishes. All were great, especially the Rock and Roll shrimp sandwich. The fried green tomatoes had good flavor but a bit too much breading...if you are particular about yours. I would choose something else, as the menu is ample! I also had the eggplant and it was great. The service here too was quite friendly. And the atmosphere is fun, with a bit of funky. I will absolutely be back!

i tasted the testing menu. everything was great. i really liked the meaty mashed potatoes and the french toast with ice cream. i liked the orange vermouth from the drinks. the cheerfulness and service of the staff was great. a perfect place in every way.
A lovely place to eat with a great atmosphere and excellent food. The staff are helpful and cheerful.
Loved it... Delicious food, great and friendly service and lovely atmosphere. So cozy and authentic! We had the tasting menu üòã.

Superbly prepared and creative fusion cuisine. Went with a group of three friends on a Saturday night without a reservation expecting a long wait, but our host Alex managed to seat us immediately. Many thanks to our gracious server Carolina for her charm and excellent suggestions on bites and wine pairing. Lots of small plates, so be bold and try everything on the menu. You can‚Äôt go wrong.

Easily the best meal we had in Madrid. Wish we had time for a repeat visit to try other dishes. Our reservation was for 11pm on a Thursday night and the restaurant was still poppin. Tinto de verano was delicious and refreshing with its citrus foam. I was a huge fan of the duck lasagna and prawn carpaccio. Run, don‚Äôt walk to 80 Grados!

We tried a hip restaurant in Madrid, the food was ok, nothing spectacular.  The waiter was rude when asked questions in Spanish.  Won‚Äôt be visiting this restaurant any time soon. Atmosphere was great though.

The outstanding food. Everything looked elegant with beautiful colours. It was a beautiful combination of typical Spanish food with modest  twist. You can adapt the size of the portions. Make sure you try as many positions as possible. The cherry on the cake was the dessert, angel bread wafer- the best dessert I had since a loong time. The staff is very helpful and smiling. I fully recommend this place.
An absolute brilliant find for our 1st night in Madrid. The food was delicious and the 2 waiters  were fabulous. I would definitely visit here again.

The food is great. The cod is amazing and well elaborated. Only little minus are the portions size. Can be a bit bigger as was shrinking a bit (or make it a bit more expensive) quality and flavour as commented really nice! Definitely will try again

Fantastic creative menu and high quality ingredients. Try the Strawberry Sardines - an unexpected delicious combo! Cozy but energetic atmosphere with attentive staff - enjoyed the coursing out approach which ensured you could relax and enjoy each dish.
Family run Ethiopian joint with the mainstay veggie options. Food was really good. Portions were a little smaller than expected but I‚Äôd go back.

Perfect, considerate service, catering for a range of different dietary needs without issue and producing incredible, delicious, filling food! Really great in all aspects, thank you very much. (Good for gluten free, good for vegetarians, good for vegans)
I had a desire for Ethiopian food while on a short visit to Madrid and to my surprise I found Nuria.  This was the best Ethiopian food I have eaten.

God I can never not love ethiopian food. Everything we ate was absolutely delicious, the plate was so well put together and all of the flavors were amazing. The man who served us was also very kind and helped us pick out what we wanted. Please come here!

We accidentally found this amazing restaurant while exploring the inner suburbs of Madrid. We can say that this was our favourite restaurant in Madrid! Everything was delicious. We wish we could order more, but our stomachs could not handle anymore. You can a get a mega pint of tinto de verano. Which was sublime. Also, the staff were friendly. Highly recommended!

Right off the bat, incredible wait staff welcomed us to our table. Free cold water ready on the table. attentive service throughout. Seemed to be a very local spot. Definitely make a reservation. Classic Spanish fare, but unpretentiously elevated. Order the roast chicken and don‚Äôt skip the croquette.
Amazing food and great atmosphere in this traditional Spanish restaurant. The cheesecake might just be the best one I have ever had. Definitely stop by on your next visit to Madrid.

Croquetas!! They really are delicious here with a touch of rosemary and truffle. Casa Macarena is a great traditional bar / restaurant, always buzzing with an authentic bar vibe. We prioritised the croquetas this time, but the rest of the food coming out of the kitchen looked amazing. Nice service - waiting staff were super engaged. I'll be back for more!!

Excellent service, amazing vibe, food is absolutely delicious. Alejandro and Enzo were really nice and went above and beyond with their service. We went there 2 nights in a row, and the food came out very fast. Totally recommend!
Delicious! Recommend the veal cannoli ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è would skip the risotto (not pictured) as it‚Äôs nothing special. The dog fish was interesting.
Super cozy place with delicious food. I had the menu of the day, which I can definitely recommend. The pizza di√°vola was really delicious. Our waiter, Keyner, was really attentive and very nice:)

The food was fine, nothing special. Nice interior and atmosphere. Unfortunately bad service, we waited for 45 minutes for the waiter to take our orders, the waiters didn‚Äôt return to us to check if the food was nice or to ask if we needed anything more. Then, when we wanted to pay, we waited for 45 minutes more, resulting in us needing to go and look for the waiter.

Shared some plates with friends and they were all delicious! The perfect place to sit outside and have a drink and a bite to eat when in the neighborhood. The salmon and pork were especially delicious.

FYI we are rating this place based on location, view and the drinks.  First visit was on 9/14/22.  Very affordable to sit and people watch.  Our server was wonderful and attentive.  The Tequila with soda is ‚Ç¨5.375 ea what a bargain!  Cocktail mix comes with the drinks.  Eventually they give you olives. We will be back, as a matter of fact, if I lived there I would be there at least 3 to 4 times a week just to drink.
Food was excellent. Service could be better. I order the same plate 3 times to a lady, and she never brought the dish. I decided to order to the young guy.

The food was mind blowing !! Also the portion sizes were wild. Ordered 3 meals between 2 people because we thought the dishes would be small due to the cheap price. Ended up going home looking pregnant. Cocktails were a bit over prised, everything else was great!
Nice place. Food is really good. Have simple Menu but very authentic and good taste. Also suitable for international traveller. Recommended.

Disappointing Cachopo very chewy and lacking in filling of cheese and ham.Tempura of vegetables as a starter fine both dishes shared. Very small restaurant just 7 tables. Dog friendly is not my choice of restaurant but respect their policy.  We would not return.
Incredible food. They took a while to serve because we ordered a la carte instead of from the menu, but it was definitely worth the wait. The house red was also remarkable.
Our first day in Madrid, taken here for lunch by some local friends. Every dish a winner. Highly recommend! Photo is of the menu out at the door, English menu provided at the table
Authentic, delicious, original, tasty and very nice service. Highly recommended if you are looking for some original...

Great food! Waiter gave us free shots and candy... Prices are expensive but with the warm atmosphere it ended up being super affordable... Staff spoke fluent Spanish, English, and French.  Great for groups!!!
Service was great. Good cocktail menu. Cocktails start at around 9 euros. Nice atmosphere and a good selection of tunes. Good vibez!
great bar, chill environment, good drinks, good service. nice place to come with friends for drinks. lovely staff
Nice place to go and meet people, great staff nice drinks. You can stop by, have some drinks with friends listen to good music and enjoy.
We had a great time! The food was out of this world- best bravas sauce we had in our 3 weeks in Spain! Great beers on tap. And the staff and owner are so friendly. Definitely would be back.
Will definitely come back! Great food, staff and the atmosphere üëåüèΩü§ç

Had the set menu, which came with 2 courses (appetizer and main), soup, bread, drink and dessert. The food was excellent in every way and was super value for money. in our opinion, they should have been priced way higher. Would highly recommend anyone to try this place!
Amazing place and ambience, very friendly stuff, amazing food . Home made pasta, fresh seafood, desserts , nice wine selection‚Ä¶.

Mama Chico Restaurant in Madrid offers good food in a nice atmosphere, but it has some drawbacks. The service was average‚Äîthey canceled the Fork reservation but still accommodated a group of seven. While the food was enjoyable, the seating wasn‚Äôt very comfortable, and the toilets were dirty. On top of that, the restaurant felt overpriced for the overall experience. Overall rating: 3/5.
BEST food we had in Spain without question. The burrata ravioli was world class. Really good wine, fabulous service, great playlist too, bonus!
The stuffed mushrooms oh my god!!!! So delicious ü§§ the atmosphere is amazing Annie she helped us to choose our dishes and we‚Äôre on point and thank you Chef Miguel.

Very nice atmosphere and delicious food. I love cozy small establishments and this one is one of my favs now. Not only the scent of cookies coming out of the oven, but the lighting and the amazing staff amount to an excellent dining experience. I totally recommend the artichokes and the milhojas de patata. When it comes to wine, let staff make some recommendations, and they may surprise you.

The food is absolutely amazing! The place is very cozy with deem lights, perfect for a intimate dinner. I gave 4 starts just because we wanted some cocktails from their menu and they told us they do not do cocktails, then again sangria, they couldn't provide, then a dish they didn't have it which was a bit odd. In rest, very good, would recommend!

To be quite honest, we almost cancelled our reservation because we were so tired (and sleepy from jetlag and a full day of sightseeing). We were so glad we went through with it as this was our best meal in our trip! We had the beef loin with truffle cream and chimichurri which woke us up from its vibrant flavors! Milhojas de patata y huevo con boletus, aceite de trufas y crujiente de jam√≥n was also fantastic. We ended with a creamy cheesecake that was so good! Would definitely return to try many of their other dishes.

A small, cosy pizza bar. People kept walking in even when the place was full. Pizza was fresh, airy and filled with flavour. Would recommend the margarita and genovese pizzas. The desserts were also rich and sweet. Very friendly staff. Book in advance.

Tried the margherita because if a pizzeria can make a great margherita, the rest of the menu is likely solid too. And I wasn‚Äôt disappointed! The pizza was very tasty, with perfectly balanced tomatoes and cheese on a great crust. Thanks to Riza for the great service. Overall, a pretty good experience!

Incredible pizza! Thin crispy base and a pillowy crust. Great selection of flavours and they modified ours to make them vegetarian. Would definitely recommend. Staff really welcoming too. We had no reservation and were able to walk in on a Saturday night.

4.5/5 super crowded. tortillas here is more fluid than normal ones I got from other restaurants or even supermarkets. I personally like the taste. The staff couldn‚Äôt speak English therefore its a bit difficult to communicate, but finally we got what we want. The original tortilla is traditional, and the one with mushrooms? is more flavory.
Place serves some of the best tacos I have ever tasted. My Mexican friend who was with me confirmed that the taste of the food was like that of from Mexico.  I absolutely recommend üëå

The music, the sound of the people create this lively atmosphere of this lovely tortilla bar. The chipirones croquetas are good but nothing impressive, the tortilla, however, nails it. It‚Äôs perfectly cooked and the combination of the flavours is sublime. Enjoyed every bite of it and made me want more. Order and pay at the bar, it‚Äôs easier to get a table if you are not alone like me. But eating standing by the bar is also a great Spanish cultural experience. And the price is super affordable and reasonable.

Pez Tortilla is an absolute all-time great restaurant and bar. In our short time in Madrid, my roommates and I ended up visiting three separate times. The Spanish tortillas, croquetas, vermouth, and beer options are simply all excellent. The quality of the food, the value for money, atmosphere inside, and vibe of the staff make Pez Tortilla an unmatched local spot in Malasa√±a. The menu is simple and everything offering is a good choice. The space inside is intimate, but it‚Äôs a great place to hang out if there‚Äôs space and you have a little time. Otherwise, they offer takeaway to enjoy your tortilla at home. I highly recommend Pez Tortilla, and will certainly be back.
If you looking for proper Mexican atmosphere with good food in good price with very lovely service then that‚Äôs your place! Good tacos and very friendly service!

Fantastic looking Mexican cantina with some authentic decor and a good social vibe. Unfortunately, the layer of dust on top of all the decor means that this place has not had a good clean out in ages. They serve a selection of tacos for ‚Ç¨2 each, however the taste was dreadful. I ordered a 5 different tacos, and each one tasted the same and as bad as the other. Not worth the effort - even for a cheap meal.
Great bar for cocktails and tamales and tacos. We got a a few things to share and all tasted really good and was very affordable.

I'm giving it four stars because I'd come back if I had friends or family eating here, but I wouldn't come back here on my own accord. I enjoyed the food but it didn't taste like the Mexican food I had in California. (Sorry about pic quality, I took it para llevar and I ate half the taco.) The place blasted old country songs which I actually like so that was a funny little treat. The place was really clean and the service was nice, so what else can you ask for from a "Mexican" restaurant in Malasana? Tacos are 2e and the tamales are 4e.
Nice small bar. The margaritas were strong. The tacos cheap. Good value for money.
The food was really good. I‚Äôve been to thailand and it‚Äôs a bit different but i really like the creativity. I had the red curry. üëç the music and atmosphere is also great.

Flavourful and hearty authentic Thai food served with a smile! The lady was working the restaurant was very polite and helpful. Be sure to treat yourself with the Mango Sticky Rice at the end. Another plus was ALL items on the menu were HALAL!
Ordered pad Thai and some fried chicken through globo. Pad Thai tasted bad and fried chicken was good but got 3 bite sized pieces for 4.5euros Lol
Excellent freshly cooked food. However Tom Yum soup fell short of expectations (not authentic Thai and was missing the main ingredient -  lemon grass). Overall good food and large quantities

We had just arrived in Madrid and this was the first place we stopped after checking in our hotel near by. The place looks like it is service fresh healthy food but the truth is that the food is premade and not the fresh picture it sells. We got 3 plates and 2 drinks and it costs us ‚Ç¨60. The drinks were watered down with no taste. The Mediterranean salad with watermelon was horrible and the fried rice was really old. Overall I do not recommend this place for the price. Also, the service was not great. The girl working there was very impatient as we don‚Äôt speak or understand Spanish and had questions about the menu.
Great place to get some healthy food options around Chueca. Friendly staff and cozy atmosphere.
Great place with options for healthy food, a lots od vegetables, vegeterian and vegan option. You have also meat. Fast service, open all day.
Cool place to eat something small, drink some coffee and do some work. Great jazz / elevator music. It‚Äôs quiet enough to focus, but not pin-needle silent which I enjoyed. And they have outlets

Amazing tapas for reasonable prices. Got the best sleep of my life, probably for like 14 hours. Super long day the day prior and slept crazy. Found this place and seemed like a great spot. Wow blown away. Food was amazing and it was for reasonable prices. Not only reasonable but I would expect that level of quality in the food to be higher prices. Each dish was great, and the service was amazing as well. Don‚Äôt know how this place is more well known, maybe it is, I don‚Äôt know much about the well knowness of the restaurants in Madrid. Great place definitely recommend. My beli gave it a 7.9 but I think it‚Äôs more like a 8.7 for the quality and price of the food.

Cocktails coming to all tables around us looked incredible however we got a reasonably priced bottle of wine.  Service decent but the real show here is what I would call elevated unique Tapas familiar but not common.  Prices a tad higher than other spots but still fair value.

This tapas restaurant is fantastic! The food was incredibly flavorful and beautifully prepared‚Äîevery dish was a delight. The atmosphere was cozy and vibrant, and the service was excellent. Highly recommend for anyone craving delicious, authentic tapas.

Had lunch here with my family. We ordered several appetizers and we liked them all. The Japanese balls and the chicken wings you can see in the pictures. We all ordered different ramen and they were all good. I had the duck and was great. They also have a loyalty program which we signed up for since we plan to go again. Vegetarian options. Make a reservation.

Very disappointing. I ordered Tofu Ramen which was probably a big mistake! The tofu was straight from the package and probably still very wet and watery. It had no salt, no spices etc. and just thrown into the broth. So it had absolutely no flavour and made the whole broth also taste like water. The ramen had basically no taste and the noodles were overcooked as well. I loved the interior and maybe the other ramen are better but I can not recommend tofu ramen

Nice location with friendly staff but the ramen is sadly not authentic at all. I wanted to have a good authentic ramen which is why I came but the broth is not authentic, the egg is completely hard boiled and the additional ingredients ordered were cold. If you want to have a nice noodle soup ok but if you desire an authentic ramen I would suggest a different location.
Yummy food, Abdul was great and super helpful :), would recommend and will come back to try other things üòã

We had dinner here because we always saw it full. The food was good and portions huge. Had the huevos rotos and the chicken curry which were both really tasty. Service was very attentive. I will go back soon.

We love the neighbourhood of chueca with their many restaurants. This restaurant services typical Spanish food. The portions are huge so we had to ask for a doggy bag. Service is friendly. The tables are a bit close to each other so there is not too much space. Love the croquettes!

This restaurant located in chueca is great if you‚Äôre dining in groups of 3/4 people. We shared a buratta salad and calamari. It was a lot for two people and we ended up bringing some home. Service was okay but it  was difficult to catch the waitress‚Äôs attention despite it being quiet.

No much personal attention from staff. Only two waiters for the whole upstairs so understandable but not making a fancy experience. Luckily we were seated onbtheir way to kitchen so we got orders and reminders through. Food was very tasty, good mouth feel and indeed much!

The Seasonal Menu was disappointing. The chicken was served raw, and the tuna tataki was of poor quality‚Äîlacking freshness and overly fatty. Overall, our experience was unpleasant and unappetizing. I cannot recommend this restaurant, as the food was subpar and felt cheap.

oxtail croquettes were incredible!! highly recommend. Had the baby octopus for main and was very impressed. For dessert we had a selection of the desserts which were also tasty. Amazing value, fabulous service and great atmosphere! Would definitely return

The food was absolutely amazing‚Ä¶ The goat cheese salad was the absolute best goat cheese we have ever eaten. The shrimp was perfectly seasoned, and the squid was so tender. The duck was better than some iPad and restaurants in Paris. Even the cheesecake was amazing. It was so light and flavorful. This restaurant is a must visit.
Fresh and tasty! The lady was super friendly and helpful.
Excellent food, made in house. You can taste the quality of the ingredients. The staff was gracious and helpful. Much better than Chipotle!
Decent burritos with a few options to choose from. It's all rather generic, great for a quick bite, however. Portion size is good, but I felt it's rather expensive for what you get.

We were rolling in the city, tired, hungry. What awaited us was a fine and relatively affordable meal that filled our bellies with gusto. I recommend the Caracas burrito and I will add that the cheese chesadilla with fresh vegetables was delicious according to my girlfriend. Staff were very friendly and helpful despite my dodgy Spanish. Thanks!

I came here for dinner with some friends and the place is really cool. I love the decoration and the ambience however, the rest of the experience wasn‚Äôt so great. We arrived in a small group of 4 people and the servers didn‚Äôt pay any attention to us once we were sat down. After almost 10 minutes we had to ask for the menu. The place wasn‚Äôt even half full. Then they took another tables order before us even though we arrived beforehand and were ready. The quality of the food wasn‚Äôt great. The torreznos came out burnt and the tacos lacked flavour and finally when they asked if wanted dessert we said yes and also ordered cocktails and because it was 11pm they said we couldn‚Äôt order cocktails as they were closing soon despite there were still people eating their meal. When we complained they told us next time we come they will invite us to cocktails but after our experience we don‚Äôt plan to go back and they should have tried to make an effort while we were there. The server said it‚Äôs not his fault but unfortunately he is the face that represents the restaurant and we were disappointed with the service and food in general.

A cosy little place that is very Instagramable. However, the food is average at best and way overpriced. We went there on a Sunday at 2:30 (typical Spanish lunch time). We waited at least 5 minutes until someone came to sit us at a table... The place was pretty empty (literally ours and two more tables were being used) which makes me wonder if that's why they charge a lot for such an average (at best) tasting food. Save yourself from an "eh" experience and do NOT order the "üêô on its ink".
A most see & dine place! So much to look at inside! Food was amazing. Good prices. Best pulled pork sandwich I‚Äôve had in my life!

I was so looking forward to eating here. I didn‚Äôt have the best experience. The waitress wasn‚Äôt friendly at all. The food wasn‚Äôt bad but it wasn‚Äôt worth what it cost ( I got the ribs for reference and they had no flavor).  For desert, I wanted tiramisu but they didn‚Äôt offer it, even though, it was one of the only three that they had on the menu del d√≠a. I wanted Ribera wine and they only had Rioja and it was early in the day. I asked about changing salad for French fries and it was impossible somehow. I think my opinion is based on a combinations of different things but the waitstaff service made if worse instead of better.

I love this quaint, authentic restaurant where all food is home made. Everything we ordered was fresh and prepared carefully and with thought. We ordered the half portion ceviche de corvina, the carrilladas, and closed it out with alb√≥ndigas made from cuttlefish. We drank 4 glasses of Ribera vino tinto. Portions were sufficient to share and priced exceptionally reasonable. Service was outstanding and we had a pleasant time there. Will definitely return.

Quaint place away from the busy area. Cool decor and atmosphere. Overall food was good. Burger was a little undercooked so just be clear on how you want it cooked. Burrata was the winner of the night. While I didn‚Äôt get any dessert, I saw many plates come out and it looked fantastic.

Sat on one of 3 tables on the terrace on a beautiful sunny day in Chueca. Had a drink and then the excellent menu del dia = cream of squash soup for my partner, and a tasty "carpaccio" of white mushrooms for me thinly sliced white boletus with parsley, garlic and oil, and garnished with delicious grated cheese. Followed by perfectly fried anchovies and crisps, and my partner went with pasta with fresh tomato and basil. The 2 course menu with pan and bebida = E13 - excellent amount of food for the price! Lovely terrace, but only 3 - 4 tables, so go early, or late for lunch. Highly recommend. Very good service - would go again!
The backyard space was so nice. Apparently going on a Sunday meant they were out of a lot of menu items. Still the food was pretty good and the service was great.

Super cozy place with a great atmosphere, lovely terrace in the garden where you can escape from the heat‚ù§Ô∏è The food was great and the staff is very lovely and friendly. The Patatas Bravas much recommended!
I had a quick coffee with a friend there. Lovely cafe. It's very chilled especially the outdoor area. The location is very central, at the chueca area side of Madrid.

I feel like we fell on a tourist trap... We order one thing, they brought another, we didn't know the menu, I think the waiter should had explain that 2 plates had similar name and clarify before bringing the food. It was a really small plate of octopus, but double the price of the one we order.

Everything about our experience at Baco y Beto was perfect, from the food to the service to the atmosphere! Every dish was delicious and special, and our server had fantastic recommendations for complementary beverages. My favorite dish was the fried mushrooms and truffle sauce, but I‚Äôm really glad we tried the cassava and chayote ceviche because it was amazing and so new! Everything was fresh, local, and made with immense care. I cannot recommend highly enough! Thank you for a great evening!

This was one of the best dinners of our trip!!! And the guy was super friendly and nice, and accommodating to our big group of 8 even tho it was a small place. We had the octopus, Havana beef, Iberian pork (not pictured), pink tomato + burrata, eggplant Parmesan, fried mushroom with truffle sauce, roasted veg (not pictured), jamon (not pictured), and tinto de verano. Everything was good ü•π Only comment is that the place was a bit dark!

This place is such a hidden gem! The vibe is extremely cozy and romantic and the food is amazing. The owner does everything himself and is so friendly. We basically told him to give us what he recommended and he surely did not disappoint. Everything was fairly priced as well. Definitely worth asking what the specials of the day are. Such a nice place that I almost want to keep it a secret, but can‚Äôt help wanting to support such a talented and hardworking man! Would love to return

We came here to have some tapas with my friends and we loved it, the service was outstanding can‚Äôt remember the name of the Venezuelan girl who helped us with our drinks and food suggestions but she was superb, and for the food yummy and flavorful definitely a great place to visit
A really nice restaurant with a nice atmosphere and very friendly staff , and the food taste amazing , totally recommended
The food is ok, the service is pretty quick. I would say the price was a little to high compared to what it was ordered but the overall experience is positive.

If you‚Äôre looking for some traditional Spanish tapas this is the place to go. The service is super fast to the point you barely make eye contact with your waiter. The croquettas are good. The salads are big but don‚Äôt really taste anything. As soon as you finish your plate, your waiter is coming and ask you if you want anything else. And drop the check. It‚Äôs a bit of a fast food but it still tastes good.

A nice place for a quick lunch or merienda if you‚Äôre looking for some pintxos. Would highly recommend their chistorra sandwich. It‚Äôs my definite go to. They also have menu del dia which are quite affordable with big servings. Staff is really nice too! I like bringing my guests here whenever they visit Madrid.

Food was okay. The Gilda pintxo was really tiny and the donut was way too rich.  However, the part we didn't really like was the service. The woman was fine, but the guy could not be bothered. No hello and even avoided eye contact. Like we were a burden to his workday. Makes me wonder what he's doing in the restaurant industry.

My friend Antonio made a reservation one week ahead and took me here. The restaurant has awarded best Pinchos or something. Tried all kinds of pinchos originally created here and really love all foods and drinks. Highly recommended if you happen to visit Madrid !!!

A very creative and innovative Spanish cuisine restaurant. Grilled green pepper great as always, and they deliver such innovative Spanish dishes you can't experience elsewhere. Friend told us many dishes win awards. It is not a traditional Spanish restaurant. And most of the guests are young.

Informal, excellent service and original Basque-style pinxos to share. Takes "tapas" to another level. The Ensaladilla Rusa was creamy and tasty. We also had the donut de cocido, served with a delicious broth to dip it in, bu√±uelos de carne (very original presentation!) and abanico de cerdo. The pork was like a cut of "secreto", delicious, but with it's fatty parts, not pork loin. Everything was so good, I just wish the serving sizes were a bit more plentiful. ‚Ç¨30 per person.
A traditional standing bar that is worth visiting. The vermouth on tap was nice.

This taberna is a great spot for a traditional ‚Äúold world‚Äù Madrid bar scene. The bar area is simple and filled with locals. It is no frills and inexpensive but full of charm. They do have a selection of basic tapas and conservas. The olives are delicious.
Nice bar at the plaza de chueca. Cana 2euro, empanada with tuna 2 euro, veryyy good oilve ü•∞ƒ± love olive

In the, what must be 20 years that I have been coming to Madrid, a visit to Angel Sierra for me is a must. I‚Äôve always liked its traditional vibe, and a nice crisp ca√±a.  I do miss however, being able to drink on the street. When I see many other areas and bars in the city centre that have on-street drinking, I‚Äôm perplexed why it‚Äôs not allowed here.

Staff are friendly and polite, service was fast on Monday afternoon.food was really good.fried squid is very tasty and must have. Charcoal scallops very unique taste. Marinated pork was tender and delicious. Ham and mango Salad was good.
Kudos to the chef. The dish is perfect. Strongly recommended üëç

Loved it! Nice date night. Lola Simone is sultry and talented. Food was outstanding (we had the tasting menu - do it!). Service was quick, helpful. We got there at the first sitting at 8:30pm and it was empty for the first 20+ minutes. Oops. We just had more vermut to fill the time.

The octopus was tough and underseasoned. Also, I don‚Äôt understand the idea of serving mashed potatoes with octopus on top of a toast. The mussels were great. Oxtail stew was nice but the mashed potatoes were again flavorless.
We tried the bull s end and the soup. Just be aware soups are served cold. Everything was excellent. Place is very packed if you don't mind.
Cute and quirky spot.  Very crowded and popular with locals when we visited.  Despite the crowd the servers were hustling, very attentive and pleasant.  Had drinks only.

Small colourful restaurant that‚Äôs usually pretty busy. Service was friendly and food comes out fast. The stewed beef was perfectly cooked, pickled code was tasty, gazpacho was a bit on the watery side and not as good as other places. Some of the dishes are quite simple and nothing to write home about. There is wifi, if needed. Cava was good! Wasn‚Äôt terrible, wasn‚Äôt great but not sure I have the need to return.

user_id: Our Madrid collos stew was missing morcilla. When we advised the waiter
restaurant_id: we were told it would be a minute to get it fixed. The table next to us had the same issue
rating: but they didn‚Äôt notice. 10 minutes later
review_text: a tiny piece of microwaved morcilla came out
date: by this time the collos was cold and too thick/gelatinous. There‚Äôs better food on the street

review_text: This is my second time in Madrid and third time in Casa Lucas. I mean I love you guys. Oxtail and chicken tostas are my all-time favorites, but that tomato salad with goat cheese was also very delish!

We had a late lunch here and really enjoyed it The food was great and the service was an also very nice. The atmosphere was fan but things special. The pork on onion bread. I also really liked the black pasta with carrots

On our last night in Madrid we serendipitously found ourselves at casa Lucas. Somehow it ended up being the cherry on top of our already amazing time. The service was so welcoming and the food surprised us with how delish and creative it was. My friend ordered a dish with their ‚Äúcorn mousse‚Äù which we loved so much they brought more of it out to eat with bread. We recommend the oxtail as well as it truly melted on the tongue. We cannot wait to come be back to Madrid and definitely back to Casa Lucas.

You will find this cozy spot among several tapas joints and bars. The unassuming exterior gives way to a warm and laid-back atmosphere inside. The wine selection is great and the food is simply delightful‚Äîportions are surprisingly generous. The service? Top-notch. If you're up for a chill vibe and traditional Spanish tapas, this place is highly recommended.
We got here pretty late so the place was pretty quiet. The staff were lovely and the food was amazing! Would tell everyone to go here.

We were visiting Madrid for the weekend and decided to book this restaurant for dinner. I couldn‚Äôt make a better choice, everything was very good: the food was delicious, the wine was good, the staff was polite and attentive and the interior is very interesting decorated. The food we choose:  jamon de bellota, jamon croquettee and their speciality suckling pig. Definitely a place to come again.

Came here primarily because of my love for the works of Arturo Perez Reverte for the last 30 years. I don't even know what connection he has to the place if any. Took my daughter here in 2010 or so and returned with my two sons this week. The murals on the building opposite were new to me, and a great surprise. If anything the place was better than I remembered. The guy at the front was welcoming and took my reservation professionally. Every dish was excellent. The Limo de Buey especially. if there's any negative it's being charged per person for bread that we didn't touch, something like 11 euros. Sucks in Italy, sucked here. Service was top notch, little things like warming a brandy glass-done. Great night.

Really close to the city center and Plazza Mayor, on a nice quiet alley, it was quite a joy there. We stayed at the terrace, but the inside was rustic and genuine. The staff was quiet friendly and I must say the wine list was impressive. Food was amazing with fresh ingredients, at least that is how it tasted. Prices were reasonable considering the location and quality of food and service.

Our experience here was a mixed bag. Off the English menu we ordered the roasted green peppers of Padron, and then under desserts the rice pudding and lemon sherbet with cava. Absolutely loved the lemon sherbet with cava. But we were puzzled when the waiter brought out the ‚Äúrice pudding‚Äù which looked more like like weird cakes with rice in them and something wrapped around them. My friend took a bite out of it, and found it weird that it wasn‚Äôt sweet considering she ordered it off the dessert menu. She stopped the waiter to double check that it was rice pudding and he just said yes and zoomed off. Then when we got our bill, which included bread that had been brought to the table but we never even touched, we noticed a weird name on the list of things we had ordered. Long story short, she then asked him in Spanish what it was and that is when he told her oh it was blood pudding. My friend was visibly surprised because he was just like oh you didn‚Äôt know like everyone just knows that. I have seen blood puddings on menus before, but looking at their site the blood pudding and rice pudding are in separate sections and she pointed to the one she wanted when she ordered, and she checked with the waiter! Not something I ever would have ordered and I did not like it, or the way they just brushed it off.

The oldest inn has been established since 1642. Great setting for our first meal in Madrid. We booked in advance and stated it for a birthday but they didn't do anything which is fine. We ordered the roast lamb and garlic prawns which were delicious. The lamb was so juicy didn't feel like eating lamb as the meat is so tender and didn't have that gaming smell. My husband loved the garlicky prawns. Overall, it was a good experience although the price is too steep. My husband certainly wasn't impressed with the price. It's too touristy but I really did enjoy the old inn building and vibe. We were given two keys printed with their inn name as souvenirs. Not sure if they give all people. After all still highly recommended it if money isn't a concern for you.

amazing place, perfect for family gatherings. the morcilla de burgos was amazing, the cogollos and tuna salad could use less cogollos. the charcuterie board amazing, fresh bread and good callos. my favorite was the oxtail, so tender and incredible sauce. the lamb was okay, a bit plane imo, but it was good. for desserts we tried the mixed plate and it was okay, nothing impressive. the bill for 8 people w wine and beers came to 450, quite expensive but worth the price for the city center.

Expensive but it was totally worth it. I‚Äôll suggest the lamb. Also, nice to have croquettes for free while reading the menu :). Final remark: you could talk to each other perfectly, no eco at all in there.
A place with real history, specializing in lamb cooked in a stone oven dated 1642. Charming dining rooms and gracious service. A  large wine list with very reasonable prices.

Amazing experience. It‚Äôs not just food, it‚Äôs history, atmosphere, great service and delicious food! It was travel back in time. And we‚Äôve got a small souvenir to remind us about that experience and to let us come back and we definitely will.

We were just looking for a quick bite, but this ended up being our favorite meal out of everywhere we went in Spain. Not only was the food delicious, but the owners were so incredibly kind. They made the whole night so fun, made great conversation, and even better jokes. If you're even close to the area, you've gotta check it out!

Cozy in the afternoon. i took an AMAZING coffee and the server was super nice !! i just arrived to madrid and was so hungry and out of energy but only one sip of this coffe and all my energy came back. sadly the kitchen was closed at 3pm BUT there were some snacks (tappas?) and they were so good i almost ate everything! i felt like home. definitively i will come again in those days i am here ! i bet in the evening the food is super good as well and the ambient as well! also the location is really nice. right next to a church. beautiful. btw i recommend this mango cream! super delicious!

La Mulata was a great dining experience. Nicely prepared food, an excellent salad and burger, colorful art, great location in La Latina, and a charming owner who provided the best service of our entire trip. Welcoming, helpful, kind, and he gave us a complimentary digestive to complete the meal. I definitely recommend La Mulata.
Lovely food, in a very nice location and had a lovely atmosphere. Service was helpful

We stopped by for a cocktail around 11pm on a Friday night. We ended up staying for two hours because the service, the drinks, the atmosphere, and the staff were incredible. Great pisco sours and margaritas! The owners are incredibly nice. We can‚Äôt wait to come back.

user_id: Other plates worth ordering are the rice
rating: the bacalao
review_text: and
date: of course

review_text: The food was OK, not great, not bad. The tomato salad was fresh and a great combo with the fig marmalade and we really liked the soap desert. The patates braves not crispy enough, and the meat we ordered was not worth the price. The quality doesn't justify the price.

Wonderful experience. They open at 7pm and we showed up and found ourselves the first table. Yes they like to eat late in Spain! Haha. So we had some drinks, some beef tenderloin and some king prawns. The portions are good and the service is outstanding. They even had English menus!

Although I loved other cities more, this was the best dinner we ever had in this Spain trip. Very impressive taste and idea. Strongly recommend the crispy ox tail wrap ‚ÄúRabo Detoro‚Äù and you don‚Äôt want to miss the ‚Äúbubble and soap‚Äù dessert!

We visited with my tween daughter for dinner and we both were enchanted - both with the design and food! Not to forget - the service was great, they hyped up the vibe and were fun  too (just order a steak or nachos and you‚Äôll see). I was a little afraid that it would be a children restaurant with nice decir yet mediocre food but was very pleasantly surprised - no chicken nuggets, no pizzaüòÄ I had the octopus and it might easily be one of the best I ever had (and I‚Äôve had them a lot).
A little bit expensive but the service and the atmosphere are worth it.

The food is delicious.  The atmosphere fabulous.  The staff are friendly and knowledgeable. The pricing is excellent. This was my first time in Madrid, and I ended up going both nights, as it was so good. Can't wait to go back next time I visit.

Certainly one of the most interesting menus you‚Äôll find in Spain. Plates are somewhere between a tapa and a racion. But the creativity and flavor combinations are incredible. I‚Äôve been going here since 2017 and have never been disappointed. This time I tried duck filled cannelloni in a wild mushroom sauce. Also had moussaka. Just incredible flavors. And the is fun, cozy and has jazz themed decor.
Lamiak was a surprise for us, as we were strolling around that neighborhood and randomly selected it. It was profoundly great. Cheap, excellent tapas and sublime red wine. Must visit in Madrid

A perfect dinner in Madrid! Steak cooked to perfection, fantastic empanadas, excellent drinks, very accommodating to give us a table where the pram could be tucked next to. Friendly staff and would recommend to anyone visiting Madrid! It does get quite busy after 9pm so would recommend if with children going a little earlier.
Delicious food and friendly staff. The portions are quite generous and all of it was very flavorful. The big barbecue platter can easily feed 3+ people. Would definitely recommend this place!

Well, the design has been done by Dracula himself, it gives the place an original touch. The napkins look like curtains from the 70ies and my lips are still bleeding from using them (slightly exagerating).  The service is a catastrophe. I was alone in the restaurant but I had to call the waiter to be given a menu. Kitchen calls the waiters with a little bell (Dracuuuuulaaaaa is cooking). They called the waiter 4 times before he brought my food. I did not really like the starter, empanada de carne. Not my day until now buuuuuuut the main course entra√±as de ternera camoati con milhojas de patatas was delicious and perfectly cooked. I forgot to mention that there was another client, a guy completely drunk at the bar. That was a very original experience, I had fun.

Very nice Restaurant in Madrid. The food is excellent, the ambiente very cozy and the staff more than friendly. I can recommend the tuna & avocado tatar as a starter! The wine selection is not huge, but very well selected. I highly recommend the El Camoati.

We went there on a Saturday afternoon without reservation and were able to get a seat on the outside tables for 1,5 hours since it was reserved for that time but that was no problem for us. The service was very nice and attentive and the card seemed very good. We not ordered sorrentinos one with squash and salvia and the other ones with spinach and a mushroom sauce. Maybe ordering pasta instead of meat was not the right choice at an Argentinian restaurant but we were a little disappointed with it. Apart from beeing a small portion which can be ok if the taste is great but sadly that wasn‚Äôt the case with the mushroom sauce. It was not even a sauce but pure full fat cream without any flavour not even salt or pepper. Not even the mushroom had a taste. I‚Äôm sure the other food is great but in our case we weren‚Äôt lucky so I can‚Äôt give more than 3 stars.

Incredible food for great price. English menu available and our server spoke really good English which was a bonus for me. Regularly changing small menu in simple starter-main-dessert format, using seasonal ingredients, with wine pairings. One of the best meals I've had in my life I reckon. Plus the restaurant has a really nice vibe to it, doesn't feel stiff at all, overall you can see why it's still doing so well 1.5 years after opening!

A truly memorable meal. Every course inventive and executed perfectly. And it therefore felt that 3 courses at ‚Ç¨46 was in fact good value. We had the paired flight of drinks at ‚Ç¨20. And again some very interesting choices - who‚Äôd have thought sake would work so well with cold cucumber soup ? Great service (and the staff all spoke excellent English) Bravo üëè

Very nice place with a starter/main/dessert menu for 46‚Ç¨ with the option of wine pairing for each plate for an additional 20‚Ç¨. Plates were really good and surprising for the palate, plus wines were very interesting and went really well with the food (there are very different grapes and options from Spain, Austria and even Sake was served for one meal). I recommend this place for a nice gastro evening yet downside is that place really needs some improvement on atmosphere & setting since it was a little bit dull and gloomy for a fine-dining restaurant.
I took my son visiting me in Madrid to Tr√®sde for a fine dining but not super stuffy experience. What a treat! Food, service and ambience were top notch!
EXCELLENT creative dinner. Worth seeking out this place. Staff was attentive and welcoming. Really a great evening.

I was going to walk 20+ minutes to gamble on a restaurant, walked by this place and the 4.9 rating is spot on, reasonably priced, delicious, fast and hits the spot. Like the other reviews say, you won't be disappointed.

Best hot dogs in Madrid. Don‚Äôt hesitate going here and trying them. They also offer a lot of extra sauces with amazing flavors that you can put on. The price is very good + they have menu options that are even more affordable

Another of our favorites in Madrid. Only open Thursday through Sunday. Limited seating so call ahead for reservations!  We‚Äôve been going here for almost five years and it never disappoints. Whether the hospitality of the owner or the consistent excellence of the chef. This is a proud women owned and operated business! The Russa salad is the creamiest I‚Äôve ever had. The mushrooms on the potato pur√©e are sublime. Their wine list always features new and amazing wines. And then the dessert‚Ä¶. A key lime pie to die for and tarta de tres leches(?) that is incredible. All this in a cozy, rustic feel dining room. Ask for the rear room. The front used to be a packed bar area. Exciting and fun but post-Covid they converted the bar area to table service. A true hidden gem in Madrid‚Äôs La Latina neighborhood. Worth walking the extra few blocks past the tourist filled Cava Baja area for this incredible restaurant!

The food was fabulous (in articular the artichokes - if they have them on the menu have some!), The wine was excellent and the service was really friendly. I shall definitely go back. Arrive early as it gets really busy.

One of our best meals in our three week visit to Madrid, recommended by a friend. We had a fantastic meal, each course absolutely delicious and surprising! Service is great. Menu full of unique original items. A real treasure! And surprisingly reasonable for the elevated food. Small and intimate too. Just go if you can, limited evenings open!

It was an experience, we had an authentic lunch and fun discovering the typical tapas and drinks of the place. It is local, I guess we were the only tourists there. Ask the staff for some advice on the food and drink, if you‚Äôre not familiar with Spanish/southern Spanish tabernas. It‚Äôs not the regular paella and sangria place. We liked it!

It was like stepping into another time period and place (Sanlucar de Barrameda in the 1960‚Äôs). I had an enjoyable evening in the company of friends and acquaintances. The service was impeccable. The food and wine were excellent. I ordered the Solomillo with the peppered sauce. Melts in your mouth.

After witnessing some quite rude service at another restaurant on my first day in Madrid the night before I was a bit skeptical when I walked into this highly rated venue. The service here was friendly and food was good. What I liked the most was that the bartender was willing to explain the food on the menu and gave some recommendations - he was acting with professionalism!

One of our true favorites over the past five years. For awhile we went every week. The represents the best of Cadiz and southern Andalusian cuisine. Our all time favorite is the cheek stew (carrillada). Fork tender with soft carrots and a wonderful gravy. And plenty of bread for that gravy. Other top plates are the mojama (smoked tuna) and tortillitas with shrimp. We‚Äôve even sampled urchin there in the past and the cazon en adobo is very good. They serve a really great red , Ramon Bilbao, and many guests enjoy the vermouth. Our server Jose was super friendly and kept things moving quickly while still managing lively conversation with everyone !  Definitely stop by when in Madrid.
The best baby squids we had, this dish blew my mind! Scallops are also a must try! Overall good food in a cozy restaurant, love it!

This is a neighborhood restaurant with pretty good menu choices and friendly service. We came in at 1:30pm for the main meal of the day. We had a warm squid appetizer, a monk fish dish and a partridge, with a puff pastry dessert. All recommended.
Great place. Very friendly service. Loved the venison! We will be back.

Very nice restaurant with very interesting torrtilla de patatas options, all very tasty. The big option is massive and decently prized for its quantity and quality. The tosta with meat and guacamole was decent and the eggs with chistorra delicious and a huge portion. Would recommend as it's ideally situated in the lovely neighborhood of la latina

I had lunch here, and I was super happy with the service. The tortilla was super juicy and nice, I got the mini version and I still couldn‚Äôt finish it. The service is great, and the staff super friendly and there to help. I liked that the waitress recommended a wine according to my asks. Vegetarian options as well.

Delicious food in the heart of the Latin quarter! The portions are huge, fresh and very tasty. The staff is very kind. There is also outdoor seating with fans. I highly recommend the goat cheese toast!

Unbelievably awesome service. Literally the best service I‚Äôve had in Madrid in a while. The food was excellent, we had the croquettes and the vegetable paella, and we all loved it. The perfect spot to grab food and drinks after the Rastro on Sunday afternoon. Friendly staff, great food makes this our new go to spot. Highly recommend!!!
Very nice food, staff is super nice and the vibe is great, came with Melik, his mom, his brother, his aunt, his sister in law and my gurl
Good place to eat. Spanish food made by Dominicans so the food is quite nice, would come again.
Such a cool hidden place! Don't let the entrance fool you! Thanks to all the staff for the amazing night! üî•

Fantastic restaurant with suprising dishes, great wines and a lovely atmosphere. The salmon marinated in gin tonic with lime mayonnaise is one of my favourite dishes here. üçã‚Äçüü©üêüü•ÇThe team is very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. Every time has been amazing coming here. Already looking forward to the next time as there are so many incredible dishes. üç∑ü§©üçΩÔ∏è
Very innovative dishes with great quality and interesting flavors!!

Visited Taberna & Media with some work colleagues from all around the world and really enjoyed the experience. Highly recommend Torreznos, ‚ÄúPatatas Bravas‚Äù (with a tweak) and Shitake mushrooms with honey Ali Oli! Definitely coming back!

Don't let the spartan, slightly outdated look of this restaurant, it is a hidden gem! Awesome product, traditional Spanish cuisine with a twist. Fairer prices than many other pretentious high end outfits. It's wine list might benefit from greater depth, yet the selection is great and very reasonably priced. Highly recommended!

Hardcore Spanish menu, full of seafood and fish options. Definitely have to reserve, if you are visiting would recommend you take a look at the menus before to understand the different dishes. Have salon and barra, always full especially on weekends. If you want to eat like a local, come here and they will treat you great. Great prices, around 50 euros a person with full range of food and drinks for a great feast. Would go back for sure
We had the Boletus (mushrooms) eggs and Rabo de Toro (bull's tail), both excellent.

Great food! The tuna dish is the best fish I have ever ate! It's so amazing! Free appetizer dry  shrimp is also great :) Very good cake:) love their fresh bread, different flavours you can choose what you prefer:) love the atmosphere, beautiful decoration and great service:)

Go go go! Though it was packed (best to reserve!) they said it was about 30 minutes for a table and then we were served. Amazing food! Seriously good and really good service too! An absolute gem in the Salamanca barrio and one of the best meals I‚Äôve had in Madrid - even after 6 visits!
Fancy ambiance, great location, good service, and the best food so far. Highly recommend visiting, especially if you are around El Retiro.

What a great find! This little spot has amazing dishes at decent prices, and a full bar. We made a reservation (recommended for dinner) but it is a casual place. Take note - no high chairs or changing table for little ones and it's a small place, so not much room for a stroller. The paella was delicious, as was the Camembert appetizer. Staff was also very friendly and helpful.

Nice little Spanish restaurant! Everything was very tasty and waiters were attentive. Good list of wine also. The atmosphere is cosy. Feels like you are at home. Don‚Äôt hesitate; you won‚Äôt be disappointed!

It‚Äôs so good I stopped by TWICE. The vibes were immaculate and got boosted to 11 on weekend nights, with the quintessential Spanish bar crowd. Food was some of the best I‚Äôve had in Madrid, from fresh, well seasoned seafood to rich, rich steak. The drinks were great too! They were pretty tourist friendly as they had an English menu, and the service staff were fantastic. Definitely a place I‚Äôll stop by every time I‚Äôm in Madrid.

This was a very lively tapas bar with delicious food and wonderful service. We managed to grab the last remaining table inside as we'd originally booked a table outside but was raining and couldn't sit outside. Shout-out to the two waiters who were working on the evening of 12/3 as they were so kind and patient with us, and took the time to explain the menu, check in on us and have a friendly chat. They took my husband's allergy very seriously and made sure that dishes we ordered didn't contain anything that he might be allergic to, which we really appreciated about. The food was excellent, particularly the rice with octopus. They do serve a generous portion so come hungry! Overall lovely experience.

La Castela is a delightful culinary find in Madrid, offering a cozy atmosphere and impeccable service. Known for its creative yet traditional Spanish dishes, the restaurant excels in both flavor and presentation. Highlights include their perfectly grilled meats, fresh seafood, and mouthwatering Iberian specialties. I had the Octopus con risotto, drunken clams, and small tapas dishes on the side. The menu features a variety of options, making it a great choice for both casual meals and special occasions. With a welcoming vibe and reasonable prices for the quality, La Castela is a standout spot for anyone craving delicious, authentic Spanish cuisine. Great place to grab lunch after a walk through Parque de El Retiro!
