Great cuisine and great service. We were guided not to order more than we should, a rare and most valuable ethical attitude. Very good and well cooked fish out of menu, very high quelity

It was hard find good and balanced dishes with good wine and great service in Madrid. But this restaurant answerd all my wishes . The Bas fish was great the service amazing and the wine perfect with the fish.yes! And the dessert just perfect 5/5.  Thank you for awesome tasty time.

This was my first restaurant once i arrived to Spain and it has been the best so far. We were a big party, and pretty much ordered everything off the menu, they were all delicious and impressive. Of course the service was amazing as well. I recommend the eggplant with hummus, the tuna tartar, the skirt steak, the quinoa/lentil salad and the empanadas. I will definitely try to come back before the end of my trip.

Excellent restaurant, we came twice in one week while visiting. The appetizer are amazing, loved the beef empanadas, tuna tartar and eggplant and hummus. The steak was delicious with fried yuca. Highly recommended if you visit Madrid!

This restaurant was an absolute delight! The chef‚Äôs talent truly shines, and the dish I had‚Äîbeef ribs‚Äîwas exceptional, easily 5-star quality. The meat was tender, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The cozy atmosphere made the dining experience even more enjoyable, and the service was top-notch‚Äîattentive and professional. I can't emphasize enough how excellent the chef is; their expertise is evident in every bite. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a top-tier dining experience in Madrid!

Amazing food and service. They didn't have an English menu but the waitress was really nice and translated everything. Quality of the fish and meat was exceptional! Also great atmosphere and wines. Highly recommended

The sashimi was absolutely amazing, but the dessert options here were on another level and truly exceptional. I couldn‚Äôt think of a better place to go with your loved one. During our stay in Madrid we had the privilege of visiting and can‚Äôt say how grateful we were to the staff members.

Take the opportunity to book with the fork and go to this beautiful restaurant. Food was another level! You can thoroughly taste the research behind the dishes they serve. The place itself is beautiful and the service was the kindest. I highly recommend to go if you‚Äôre looking for a spot around the park!

Positively the best meal I've had in Spain. The tomatoe salad with tuns belly was so unique and flavourful. The octopus was so tender and the black Angus beef was literally soft as butter. Don't miss the Flao goat cheesecake for dessert. So amazing!

This restaurant is the perfect place for a cozy meal or celebration! The ambiance is warming, the service is really nice (the waiters explain you what you are about to it) and the food is just great! We had the tasting menu and from the olives to the dessert, you just enjoy excellent food prepared with care. We found the restaurant by chance (it's close to Retiro garden), but I've already bookmarked it to go back soon.

Incredible restaurant that deserves its Michelin star rating. We came here for the menu of the day and were not disappointed at all. Every dish was executed with perfection- with the freshest tasting ingredients, the right balance of flavor and beautiful plating. One of the best meals we had while in Madrid. We are planning to come back to Madrid to eat here again

Stopped in this trendy bar for a few beers before dinner and sat at the bar. Staff kind and helpful. Very nice ambiance. Good beer and lovely olives provided. Unable to comment on food as we didn‚Äôt eat here sadly.

The food was excellent. I loved the bucket of fresh butter with warm artisan bread. The burrata salad was an inspiration. So delicate but delicious. The mussels were in a surprising light curry sauce that I could have eaten like soup. Absolutely delicious!

Most of the dishes we ordered were good but our risotto was overly salty.  Our server recommended an incredible red wine that was well worth the ‚Ç¨10 per glass price tag. They play loud music later at night with a lot of people drinking in the bar area so it has a fun, energetic vibe.

We stayed in the owner‚Äôs Airbnb just in front of this restaurant. We found this restaurant full of customers any time while it‚Äôs open, and most of them are local customers, not the visitors. We thought it must a truly good restaurant certified by the local customers. We decided to try it, and finally went 5 times during our 7 nights of stay. We are very happy that we have done so. We enjoyed all the foods so much we had at this restaurant.The seafoods served at this restaurant are very fresh or live. All the dishes are well prepared with delicate presentations, and very tasty. Also, the prices are very reasonable. Highly recommended. A mast-do in Madrid.

Excellent quality seafood and great service. Staff helped a lot with menu choices and making you feel at home during the experience. I love being able to choose which piece of seafood I want from the bar. Great wines by the glass.

Incredible! Visiting Madrid from Texas and found this gem of a restaurant in a beautiful neighborhood. From the starter, to the house wines, everything was top notch. All seafood dishes were phenomenal! Grilled Octopus, scallops and razor clams were favorites. The service was impeccable. Thank you for the great evening. I will be back on the next trip.

Every dish we ordered were excellent, but seafood was the star here. Highly recommend the grilled platter (scallops, baby squid and razor clams were standouts), giant prawns and tuna and avocado salad.

Today we had an event at the Retiro park and we had lunch at Zoko Retiro and it was PERFECT. The staff is lovely, all of them, from the waiters to the kitchen staff! Congratulations, you made our event to be a success!!! the food was beyond delicious!! I highly recommend going there for lunch, dinner or only to taste their croquetas, one of the best in the city!

I honestly can‚Äôt explain what this place is like, you have to go and experience it for yourself ! For anyone who loves food and wants to try a truly different concept, YOU HAVE TO COME HERE !! Everything from the look, the taste, the texture and the smell makes your senses tingle as each new dish you don‚Äôt know how it is going to look, and even more how it will taste, and every time it doesn‚Äôt disappoint. Our first time here and every time we come to Madrid we have to come back here. The service is great, very helpful with suggestions and guidance, the atmosphere is vibrant and the prices are very reasonable for the level of quality you receive. It‚Äôs like a Michelin Star restaurant around by your corner shop. One of the best.

Vinoteca Garcia de la Navarra is an elegant restaurant located in Salamanca, Madrid. It stands at the pinnacle of Madrid's dining scene, offering the best cuisine in the city. The service is exceptional, catering to a high-class local clientele from Madrid. Lunches here typically extend beyond 2 hours, allowing guests to immerse themselves in the Spanish tradition of leisurely dining. It's a place where you can witness firsthand how the Spanish truly embrace the art of a long lunch, surrounded by elegant locals who embody the essence of Madrid's culture. With several-course dinners, Vinoteca embodies the essence of a fulfilling life.

I have to say this, I've been in a lot of restaurants lately but this one is out of this world, I have to say from the minute you get inn you feel something different, the atmosphere is great, the service, I believe that the service makes the experience great, and this one have to take the best service ever, how they explained to you the food and drinks, you must try something of the day, everything sounds delicious. The sad part is that I went alone and only have the opportunity to try 3 dishes, and only admire the other dishes that went to the other tables. Without any doubt I have to proclaim this the best restaurant in Madrid!!! Every time a came here it's a lock to get dinner.

Best place we‚Äôve eaten so far on our European vacation! For starters we got the sliced tomatoes with parmesan as well as the ham and cheese croquettes..delicious! For my entree I got the entrecote steak & for dessert i got the panchineta. Definitely would recommend and would come back in a heart beat.
I had a great experience at Castelados in Madrid! The food was delicious, and the atmosphere was warm and welcoming. I‚Äôm adding a photo of the menu for reference‚Äîhighly recommend!
Friend of mine recommended and did not disappoint. The jamon was amazing, little tuna/tomato salad as well. 5/5. Will come back again

Honestly, this is a gem of a restaurant in Madrid. If you are in the mood for some delicious seafood and fish dishes, this place offers excellent choices and at a very reasonable price! It is located in the Ibiza area of Madrid, two steps from the El Retiro park and surrounded by an infinity of other restaurants, which are also very good. We ordered the chick peas with jumbo shrimp ü¶ê and the garlic shrimp, both of which were part of their specialties list. Their house white wine was perfectly matched to pair with these delicious dishes. The shrimp could not be fresher. The garlic shrimp comes with a special sauce which is a bit on the hot side, but it was bearable. Unless you don‚Äôt like spicy hot foods. We also ordered a mixed salad and I have to say that I have never tasted such deeply intense flavored tomatoes üçÖ in my life! Probably in Italy‚Ä¶ For dessert, we tried their passion fruit cheese cake üç∞. Oh Lord have mercy..! Incredibly tasty. I can‚Äôt recommend enough this restaurant. Please remember to make reservations with plenty of time in advance or you will never get in. Enjoy!

We went there to try the traditional dish of Madrid. Everything was delicious, and everyone was friendly. They worked hard to serve us quickly so we wouldn't miss our train. I really appreciated their effort!

My husband and I came here during our honeymoon back in September 2022, after a recommendation from a server from a nearby spot that was too busy to seat us at the time. Wow, we are SO glad we took this recommendation. Months later, we still often reminisce about how creative and delicious this spontaneous meal was. My husband had a pork dish, and I had a fresh salmon and tamarind dish. We were blown away by the freshness of the ingredients and the combinations of flavors. We finished with a passion fruit merengue dessert, which was also incredible. Everyone was so kind, helpful, and patient with us as we translated the unique menu and made our choices. Thank you Zalamero Taberna for an excellent meal that we will remember for a long time to come.
Delicious experience! Speedy service and the flavors are to perfection.
I had the best croquetas and callos Madrillenos of my life at Zalamero. Not only the taste is great, but the price is affordable and the staff is incredibly sympathetic. Totally recomendable place.

Very kind, professional and welcomming attitude  from the waiters. The food is delicious, de wine we had was recommended by the waiter and it was a perfect match with the dish we had. Calm and authentic spanish restaurant, definetely recommand it! Gracias!

I‚Äôm in my first time in Madrid, and I went to the Adrede randomly, and it was the best decision. The food was amazing, and the portions were bigger than I expected. Everything was impeccable, from the food to the service. Special thanks to Alberto, the kindest person I‚Äôve met in Madrid. He was very attentive! I can‚Äôt wait to come back.

Amazing surprise to come in after morning at the Prado and have some of the best food during our entire trip to Spain. All of the small plates (tapas) were delicious. The croquettes were easily the best we had in all of Spain. Fried artichoke was also delicious so was the omelette with leeks, cheese and ham. Then there was the desserts. A cheesecake and molten chocolate cake with ice cream that word so quickly I couldn't even snap a picture of them.
Marcus was our waiter and he‚Äôs really friendly and helpful for recommendations ! The restaurant is very popular among the locals and food we had was absolutely delicious !

We are in Spain for our honeymoon and wanted to try something to try around Retiro Park and we came across Erre Que Erre, and this place is amazing!! The food, wine, etc. was all incredible. Our server Elena was also amazing she was super friendly, helpful and attentive. She always made sure we had everything we needed I cannot recommend this place enough!!!
Lovely little place in the heart of Madrid near Retiro. Food is great, service is awesome and staff are very friendly. Stop by and hang out for a while. You will feel like family.

I stumbled upon Erre Que Erre while walking around Retiro, and it was impossible to miss the great vibe this place had on a Friday night - all the tables indoors and outdoors were full and the atmosphere was lively and fun. I had a few typical dishes that were absolutely delicious following great recommendations by the waitress Elena who was helpful and kind despite the language barrier. It's certainly a place I'd love to visit again.
Cozy little place with good food and great service. Daisy was awesome, Gracias.
The food is good, but a bit pricey. The place is worth its location and the terraces. I had lunch, but I think it's more of enjoying a drink place.
Foods are delicious ~ the most beautiful is the natural scenes and light atmosphere. Ham and seafood are perfect,  lemonade is lovely,  sangria taste pretty nice.  We even visited twice in two days.

Located in El Retiro-Park, Florida Park was a relaxing place to stop for lunch during our weekend in Madrid. The food was great and the service very good. We enjoyed it so much, we went back for a second visit!

This is a great pitstop by the park to enjoy the view and eat great food. The food was great, i would recommend the veal truffle and roasted bell peppers. Overall the staff/service was perfect, the food was above expectations and the pricing was a bit steep but reasonable because portions were large. Worth the price of admission

Very atmospheric place, a lot of people are sitting there with the tapas and glass of vine or beer (excellent one). The dinner is started at 8pm. Very fresh products and good tastes. Some dishes was a little bit oily, but in general everything was good. Definitely should go there if you would like to explore Spanish cuisine.
Love coming here!! The rabbit, the croquetas, the breaded shrimp‚Ä¶ everything is delicious and great service

This place is super touristy, in our ‚Äúoverflow‚Äù room with five tables, two asked for the Italian menus while the other two asked for English menus‚Ä¶but that didn‚Äôt take away from the tasty food we ate. The suckling pig, which is what this restaurant is known for, was amazing! The skin was super crispy and the meat moist and tender, absolutely delicious. In addition, the garlic soup, which sounded generic was anything but generic. It derived its flavor from aged Iberico ham, and is made almost like the onion soup with toast/bread that added to the texture of the soup. Definitely worth trying.

We had just finished a bike tour. We‚Äôre walking around the street looking for a place to dine. A couple overheard us discussing what the three of us wanted and they said try this place we found it last year doing the same thing you‚Äôre doing right now, debating where to go.  Walk inside and it‚Äôs like a labyrinth to get to the very back table. I just saw from a previous review that you could get a tour totally bummed. I didn‚Äôt see that before we left. Food was delicious, atmosphere  was tremendous and the service was spectacular.

The ambiance was highly enjoyable, however, the quality of the food was merely satisfactory. I believe the crowded conditions due to the weekend and the Real Madrid vs. Barcelona match may have contributed to this. I intend to revisit the establishment during a less crowded time to provide a more accurate assessment.
Deeeelicious. Great choice yummy food, great ambiance. Great location too! Go walk around inside and try to get the tour( we couldn't for dates we were here)

We found this restaurant on a night when the neighbouring reknown restaurant was full and I have to say, it was a blessing in disguise as at the end of our 3 nights in Madrid and after 2 roasted suckling pig, this is the best we had tasted and it was awesome, and I fondly missed and tried to have one in Barcelona and nothing comes close to it. The restaurant is full of history , deep and beautiful - the service staff are well dressed and trained well to serve with etiquette. We only ordered a pig to share and on hindsight should have ordered more of their other dishes on the menu to try. A must try in Madrid.

This is a beautiful restaurant. The food presentation was beautiful as well. We all ordered from the 3 course menu which was priced very nicely. The food was pretty good but nothing to brag about. For the money it was great though. I recommend.

My biggest dissapointment in Madrid. Besides very nice interior of the restaurant, everything else was bad. Tasteless food, small portions, raw, tough, bloody pork I got and left it on the plate, nobody even asked is anything wrong, they just picked up the plate. Staff is confused, always in a rush although the restaurant wasn't even half full. Hard to communicate since none of them speak English. They offer cheesecake, caramel mousse and pudding as desserts, but as you can see, that's all the same tasteless base decorated differently. Avoid this place.

Horrendous food, good atmosphere, decent service. We ate here for lunch because the decor looked reasonable. The price was very reasonable including 3 courses and alcohol. However, the entrees were already a letdown, with bland and small portions. All of our main meals were very low quality, with the steak looking measly thin and tasting like rubber, the swordfish being incredibly bland, and the chicken being bone dry. The dessert was even worse, with the cheesecake having the consistency of tofu and the caramel pudding tasting bitter. I would rather they charge more or disclose the quality before luring tourists in, the chefs clearly put no effort into the cuisine. Avoid avoid avoid unless you only care about beautiful decorations and don't care what you put in your mouth.

It's a very beautiful place, the atmosphere, wonderful service, everyone is friendly and helpful. But! The kitchen is just disgusting. The food is cold, but it was slightly warmed up in the microwave, tasteless, the meat was raw, and this is pork, which is dangerous.

This restaurant is the highlight of our 2-day trip in Madrid! It‚Äôs the best restaurant in Madrid to us! The vibe is perfect, the gentleman who helped us, explained the whole menu to us in English! Everyone works here is just so nice. The dishes taste great and have HUGE PORTIONS!! We spent around 20‚Ç¨ per person but the food is enough for our dinner tonight and breakfast tomorrow! Absolutely amazing place!!!
Perfecto! So delicious and huge portions, we took Menu del dia and were so happy!

Had dinner and a few drinks. Staff were super friendly and funny. Had the Russian salad and croquettes which were decent size portions and delish. Also shared a steak which was huge! Happy hour is good too, 2 for 1 drinks üòä We had a giggle at google translate which listed 'Broken eggs - pissed off' üòÑ

This is a nice restaurant specialized in Basque cuisine. The Filipino server who knows English is really nice. I recommend the cheese cake. I wouldn't say it's the best but since they claim to specialize in Basque cuisine, the cheesecake must be the authentic traditional Basque cheesecake. Highly recommend people to try it. The Iberian ham is also good but I am not a big fan of ham.
Value for money. The best tapas shop in the city. Generous portions. Most recommended.

I think we all know what to expect in this establishment, nothing fancy but great local tapas & drinks experience. I have to highlight the great customer service I received. They were proactive, really attentive and friendly. Wish you the best guys!

Great experience of a typical Sidrer√≠a/ tapas in Madrid. The place was crowded when we first arrived but we were allocated rapidly on a table (without chairs, just standing). The place has a tradition of gifting a plate of tapas with every (alcoholic) drink you buy (although it depends on many things, it is not something they will ALWAYS do). I recommend to experience a typical spanish tapas bar.
Authentic tapas restaurant with excellent service from Alfredo. Simply top notch! We have been there several times and have never been disappointed. No visit to Madrid without stopping by here..

One of my favorite places in Madrid for tapas and vermouth. Best tortilla ever. I was in Madrid for 4 days and came by twice. I'd probably have went more if it wasn't so busy. And yes, it is constantly busy.

I visited first time about 10 years ago, haven‚Äôt had the chance to comeback since. But today it finally happened. Still great tapas, the ambiance is beautifully madridian and the service is friendly and warm. 10/10 will not wait a decade to rerun this time‚Ä¶
Nice tapas bar with a great decoration of nostalgia! The only problem was we went after 17:00 and all the tapas were almost finished so we had limited place options, just that you are aware.
Amazing wine selection and tapas. The best I found in Madrid after searching for 2 days. I had their organic wine Filarmonia MSM 2023 Organic Wine.
Small but good food ,wine restaurant!

It is a little gem of a bar. It's tiny but full of joy shared by all. There are no strangers here, just friends that you haven't met yet. If you are looking for a place with a soul, that's it! Tapas is amazing because owners care about the origin and quality of the food that they serve. And verm√∫.. well.. where will I start?! It's home made, delicious and served with a piece of orange and an olive so it not only tastes amazing but it also looks cute!

Lovely paella. Very rich in flavour, perfect amount and variety of seafood, and just cooked to perfection. I got the normal salty version but it was more salty than expected. Would definitely recommend getting the least salty version and season to taste instead.

Hands down, the best meal I had in Madrid and most certainly the best paella. The entire staff is so very friendly and attentive- but had not been I still would have rated this 5/5 just based on food quality alone. That being said, they added to the ambiance and took the meal to even greater heights. Make a reservation, go for lunch. They are only open 13:00-17:00! I wish we hadn‚Äôt discovered it on our last day-otherwise we certainly would have gone twice.

Dining here was the highlight of our trip! All the dishes, especially the paella, were amazing. Also, the service was brilliant. They were very attentive to everybody who dined in and were the most friendliest bunch of lads. We went back again before our flight home and as expected every dish was made to perfection. Best paella by far. This will surely be our first stop when we go back to Madrid.  Thanks again!
The restaurant very cozy vibes . Food are good we ordered main dishes and also appetizers. Staffs are kind Alex was helping us for the services and kind
Very tasty paella made within 25 minutes, great service and top location. Our waiter, Eduardo, was super nice and quick!

When ordering, the server informed me that the seafood paella would take 20 minutes, but it was absolutely worth the wait. It was a delicious Spanish seafood paella, with very fresh seafood, and the flavor wasn‚Äôt too salty for my taste.

Not a fan of the tiger mussel as recommended, they blended the mussel with creamy stuff, topped with crumbs and bake it, just too creamy for my liking and i could not taste the mussels. Razor clam and scallops great. Sicilian octopus, if you like bonito flakes, you will like this dish. Tuna tartare ok. Overall not bad, above average. One thing i have to mention is i was eating alone and was the only person seated inside in the restaurant. I wanted to have tapas like everybody else but they seated me inside and i specifically asked if the menu would be the same and she said yes. But portion was not the same, so i doubt the price would be too. ü§î If you want to have small tapas, maybe sit on the high chairs at the front in the restaurant (not outside, cost extra) and just point to what others were eating. Also i don't speak spanish so i give them the benefit of the doubt.
Great restaurant for seafood/shellfish, but with other options as well, with very friendly and accommodating staff. Well worth the visit.
This place is amazing! Ten out of ten. Amazing ingredients, cooking and staff. Best food I‚Äôve eaten in Madrid. Can‚Äôt recommend it highly enough

Cerveceria Monje is fantastic! The quality of the food is outstanding. We had oysters from Galicia, scalops and clams. Everything was extraordinary and super fresh! We can‚Äôt wait to be back and try more things. The owner Luis was an amazing host, he made us feel welcomed and gave us an amazing experience. Thank you for your hospitality, we‚Äôll be back!
Decent seafood tapas bar but the menu is fairly limited and there is a per dish premium to eat outside, which is common in Spain. Very friendly staff though.
Love the food. Truly delicious. The presentation of the food is very nice. The staff are friendly and very happy to help. I would definitely recommend to anyone who is visiting Madrid.

It's really a seafood restaurant, but I was in the mood for a burger. Wasn't the best I'd had but meat was high quality and fries were really nice. Given a bowl of nuts when seated at the table. Staff was very friendly and spoke English. Wine by the glass was decent. The location and view are very relaxing compared to most of the city with great outdoor seating. An artist was painting the area while I ate lunch.
Amazing food, experience and location. You can even learn how to prepare a paella with the most incredible chef!

We LOVED this place for octopus üêô! Delicious. We got scallops which were delicious too, and their specialty boiled potatoes, and a pitcher of the best sangria (tinto) that we had thus far. Would return.

Our experience was vastly different than others. The Sangria literally tastes like soap and somehow they managed to serve Octopus with no flavor. My husband got the beef tenderloin and it was raw and the toughest meat he had eaten in his entire life. Married 10 years and I‚Äôve never seen him spit meat out. Looks delicious tastes awful.
Best sea food in Madrid . Octopus so delicious. But maybe food should be more hot , but still worth to visit.

Good by feels a bit pricey for what it is. Octopus tender but the potato paste it's served with was bland and cold. Service was nice and nice to be outside. Grilled squid also good but no need to come back again.
We visited el Barril de Goya for a mid day tapas. Our experience was good and the food right on point, the place got really full around 3pm. I recommend it if you want good seafood and some drinks

Everything we were served was incredible, but the two waiters have poor customer service skills. When the wine was delivered, it was not presented but opened and put in the bucket and was not served. Were we supposed to pour our own wine? Food was great, but the waiters were not gracious or helpful.
A lovely, top quality seafood restaurant with very good service ! But be careful with the delicious desserts : they are huge !!

The lobster paella was a showcase,  as well as the shrimp cocktail.  We weren't expecting food there to be this amazing,  since it was a random choice by pure chance.  What a refreshing,  delicious pleasant surprise Madrid.  You don't cease to impress!
The food was very good but service was a little rushed. The rice came while we were eating the starters so we sent it away and we had it though it was excellent but it spoiled the meal a little.

Best decision I made in Madrid is to stay in this town and visit this place to buy seafood. I bought langostine shrimps and mussels- best quality and good price. Owners didn't speak English but were very kind.

Seafood stew with a quality-price ratio that is not bad at all. I went on Christmas Eve and got to the line at the fishmonger at 7:15 in the morning. There was a queue of about 50 meters on the street at about 2 degrees. The seafood restaurant opened at 7:30 and they didn't serve me until 10:15. The prawns were actually very dry (44e per kilo), the prawns were not bad (40e kg), the cockles and the legs were very good. I meant to catch barnacles and they flew away. The bigaros are also over, if you want to be able to get everything on this date you have to get up early. Of course the prices are very good and the guys are professionals. But of course, 3 hours in line. Maybe on another date you can save this wait.
There is no better place to buy seafood in Madrid. Year after year we queue on Christmas Eve even if it's -1¬∞C like today. Great and hard-working people. 100% recommended.
The quality of the products they sell is unsurpassed, the attention of 10 and the kindness is the reason why this business lasts, thank you very much for giving us these seafood products
It is a place that is worth it, the genre and the staff are spectacular... the only thing is that sometimes you have to wait but they never fail

Very bad dining. Beware. I Sat in the bar area to watch the cook grill up some chicken and meat. I saw the cook, preparing raw meat and raw chicken on the same table he was preparing the plates of food. While Grabbing vegetables / lettuce with the same gloves he was cutting up raw meat with. And touching the plates with same gloves he was touching raw meat with. He would set the plates on top of raw meat that was placed on the table that was going to be thrown away since he had no space to put plates to prepare. He Was placing plates on top of raw meat. Aside from that my chicken came super uncooked I had to return it. And to finish the story with raw meat prints on my plate. Waiter was very rude. Made us wait for a table of 2. While still seating people who just got there

We had a big late lunch here. I thought the food was great. They start with some sparkling wine on the house and some gazpacho. We ordered a burrata to share, and I had a milanesa with French fries and vegetables. Then, when we asked for the check, they gave us a frozen Limon drink and almond cookies and limoncello. All very good

The Gaucha was so delicious. We requested the baked potatoes and seafood salad. So worth it. The atmosphere was relaxing and the waiters were very appreciative. They gave free drink and small pastry. I would definitely visit again. Keep in mind this place is for you to be relaxing while eating so if your looking to get in eat and get out you may  want to look else where.

I liked the place. The food was perfecto. We ordered Argentinian Barbecue and it was very big portions mire than 2 persons. Although the price was a little high but totally worth the food and the service. They also have menu at 17 EUR

Dinner special for $19 euros which included 1 drink, very generous portion of steak flank, fries or salad as a side & ice cream or flan as dessert. Service was ok, staff seemed frazzled but maybe it was just a really busy night.

They tried to charge me twice. To be fair, I am quite sure they weren't scamming. But they were belligerent that I hadn't yet paid when I had, and it was their fault. Unfortunate. Get it together. Once they looked up the charge on my card on their computer they did eventually apologize, so there's that.
The best service that I have in Madrid! They welcome you with a sparkling Cava wine, gazpacho bread and butter the grilled meat was delicious same with the salads and Great price.
Great restaurant, the staff are excellent as is the food, great food at a reasonable price e, well worth the visit and will go back when we return to Madrid

I have eaten here a few times and there while menu is fantastic. I must however draw your attention to their Dulce de Leche cake which is just amazing.  You won't get a better  desert in all of Madrid
The food was not bad, but it was not good either. The pasta does not taste fresh, like they used sauce from a jar and instant noodles. üòÖ The chili oil was good though.

The waiter was nice, but this was the only good thing...the risotto was not tasty and creamy, and the pizza didn't have any meat in description but it had some  pork in fact..couldn't finish my food even
The food was below average. The service was really bad. An expensive restaurant and really not worth the money, don't go near there
One of the best places of Asian food that I‚Äôve ever been to, in which  NEM NEM out stands from the others. It‚Äôs their fourth and newest restaurant in Madrid.
Amazing experience. Great timing and delicious food. Really comfortable place.
Super good!

user_id: First of all
restaurant_id: it was nice to be able to taste Korean and Chinese food at a reasonable price of around 10 euros per dish. In particular
rating: in addition to popular foods in Korea
review_text: such as Snowing Chicken
date: there are also several dishes tailored to the tastes of Koreans
source_user_name: so I think it will be enough to relieve Koreans' longing for Korean food.,2025-02-28,Jin

review_text: We had a great dinner with my Vietnamese friends, we ordered many dishes like Nem, Banh Tom, Salmon sushi rolls....very delicious! Highly recommended! We also really like the atmosphere, it is very cozy for dinner and the service is super friendly and very attentive!

I think for a quick bit, this is a good place to get something. You can choose between many different street food options in one kind of bigger food court maul. This place was very nice because they had vegan meat which was very good. The portions are okay for their prices and served nicely with decoration. I can definitely recommend to come here for take away, because sitting there isn‚Äôt super nice.

Located in the back of the Yatai street food market, Smok Mok is the place if you‚Äôre looking for some flavor in Madrid. We came for the wings (recommended in one of the other reviews) which are very good, but the ribs were the highlight; smoked for 6 hours, falling off of the bone with a nice teriyaki like sauce.

I like how they designed their place. I tried Japanese Curry and it was delicious! It tastes a similar to the original but still different. And the stuff we‚Äôre super friendly and could speak English perfectly üëçüèª

A very beautiful restaurant, the ceiling especially. We got the tasting menu without wine pairing and it was very tasty. At first it looks like small portions but they are extremely filling!! The Pescado Tikka was a surprisingly my favorite dish. We had heard cocktails are good and they did not disappoint!

The food was delicious, authentic Indian cuisine. The decor is beautiful. My only complaint was the service. I was expecting a much better service from a restaurant of this caliber. They weren‚Äôt attentive if we needed more wine or if we had finished our food and the empty plates stayed on the table longer than necessary. They also took very long to serve the main dish.

I was truly excited to go to this restaurant. Service and atmosphere are good. A nice touch was the papadum and amuse bouche offered in the beginning. No issues there. Problem is food is so bland. I say this in the nicest way possible, but the flavors were not reminiscent of Indian cuisine. There was a lack of salt and spice (in general) with some of the dishes. I was told the vegetable curry was reminiscent of a ‚ÄúSouth Indian Thai style curry‚Äù which sounded good. I received it and was immediately in dismay. No pepper or spice visible in sight, but more importantly, could not taste any flavor. Vegetables were cooked well, not too soft or not too raw. That was a positive to it. My partner agreed with me as he stated his dish was bland and nothing notable. I guess I just expected more from a restaurant that‚Äôs well rated. Not worth a Michelin star, and I would go to a more authentic Indian restaurant next time.

I was impressed with my experience at Benares Madrid. The food is exceptional, both in taste and quality, with generous portion sizes that leave you completely satisfied. The naans are truly standout..melting effortlessly in your mouth. Everything on the menu is fab! You cannot go wrong with any choice. Brownie points for atmosphere which is very inviting and the service is top notch, making for an overall delightful dining experience. I will definitely be returning to enjoy this culinary gem again!

We came here seeking french onion soup. It was good; can‚Äôt say the absolute best I‚Äôve ever had, but definitely satisfying. My wife had escargot as a main and was happy. Unfortunately the beef bourguignon was not available that night, so ordered the entrec√¥te instead. It was a bit disappointing‚Ä¶very tough and sinewy.

The place is well decorated with its own personality and intimacy. Everything inside gives an old feeling, and it creates great atmospheres. All the dishes were delicious with good quality. I especially love their beef tartare, the flavor was outstanding. Their duck tenderloin and fish were also amazing. We already visited this place more than 5 times. If you come here in the winter, you should try their fresh foie.

Great service, awesome food, good experience overall. I would suggest to go easy with the music volume inside the restaurant because sometimes we struggled to hear each other out during dinner but when it comes to the rest of the experience 10/10. Great Chicken Tikka Masala, The cheese naan was on point and the butter chicken was VERY tasty. The carrot cake at the end was a gold brochure. 100% recommend
Good Indian food. All we ordered was good.

Visited this restaurant once for lunch and once for dinner. On both occasions the food was incredible. We tried the chicken tandoori, chicken madras, plain rice, pilau rice, naan breads and more. The service was brilliant too.

Personally, the food was really good. Their Panak paneer is amongst the best I've had in Madrid. Their rice and naan as well. Their mango chicken was very tasty, but the chicken itself a tad dry. With thefork promotion it became the best bang for your buck indian food imo. Even without the promotion, i'd feel content to return.

Good authentic Indian food..nice ambience w/ decent service..Staff member suggested to go with mix of Pakora and Samosa in starter - was good in taste but was greasy...Kadhai Paneer did not feel rich in taste and not worth of the price tag. The best part was Naan and complimentary sauce served during meal.

I‚Äôm Japanese and I can say that the ramen here is one of the best ramens I had in Madrid. The staff are amazing, the service is excellent and great atmosphere. My toddler is a picky eater, but she already wanted to go back for the ramen next day!
Fantastic place serving truly delicious Hokkaido style Miso Ramen. Also had the takoyaki and yakitori which were both quite yummy. Couple of sakes by the glass, and, obviously, Sapporo beer to pair!

I suggest making a reservation before your visit. When I inquired on Google Maps, they mentioned that walk-ins were acceptable, so I decided to drop by the next day without one. Upon arrival, the staff appeared a bit overwhelmed, which made for a slightly awkward situation. I found myself seated at a large table among couples, but the staff were friendly and accommodating, particularly a Japanese lady. It was nice to enjoy a highball again (even if it wasn‚Äôt a ginger highball). With the cooler weather, enjoying authentic ramen in Madrid was a real treat. If you‚Äôre looking for a genuine ramen experience, this place is worth considering.

The cha shu in our ramen was cooked to perfection. Tender and well marinated. Egg was also spot on. Flavour of the soup had all the right touch. Not too salty or porky tasting. Service was super efficient and friendly.

It was very close to where I was staying, and honestly, it was the best! The place had such good energy, with incredibly kind and polite people. The food was amazing made with so much love and passion. Out of all my restaurant experiences in Madrid, this one stood out. Of course, it depends on what you value, but for me, the people here truly make the difference. They put their heart into everything they do, and that‚Äôs what matters most.

Absolutely in love with this lovely little place! The tomato salad with tuna and basil oil is simply out of this world. Even the humble bread and butter is perfection. Friendly service delivered with care. Thank you for a magical lunch with good simple ingredients. If you are in Madrid make sure you stop here!!

The quintessential Spanish tapas and wine bar filled with unique dishes, delicious wine, and the most welcoming and kind staff. We had a fantastic meal of ham, octopus, tortilla, and shout out to the tomato and tuna which we were told is the house special and is so good! Definitely a good authentic option in a tourist area.
Really good coffee. The food was delicious, we will be back! Highly recommended! The staff were friendly and service minded (and English speaking). Good and chill music and atmosphere .10/10!

Brunchit in Madrid is a delightful brunch spot! The poached eggs with Iberian ham were perfectly cooked, and the quality of the ham really stood out‚Äîit was delicious. We also enjoyed a couple coffees, and the mocha frappe was a sweet treat that hit the spot. The salmon toast was just okay, but overall, the experience and quality of the food made it worth the visit. Friendly staff and cozy atmosphere (plus pet friendly!) make it a great place to start the day. Highly recommend for a tasty brunch in Madrid!

Another magic and lovely place in Madrid. The underground dining room is tastefully decorated. Lights warm up the place. Food was delicious and healthy. My friends and I truly enjoyed this restaurant!

This new restaurant has a lot to offer. The staff was  considerate and friendly in a lovely atmosphere. We particularly loved the cardamon roll, the yogurt with fruit pur√©e layer and the poached eggs.  I would certainly go back for the 3 course brunch menu. Good luck making a name for yourselves. You have good all the right ingredients for success.

We walked in spontaneously,and the service was unbelievably good! My wine glass was empty for no more than 30 seconds before the waiter noticed and refilled it. The level of service was exceptional! The tapas were really delicious. I love this place and would come back every time I‚Äôm in Madrid.

absolutely amazing food & service! our server guillermo was attentive and kind, and the owner, diego, has created a lovely dining experience with great food. the brazilian flair as an homage to his home was very special! try the mouse de maracuya and the glazed pork belly! new fav meal in madrid!
Wonderfully tasty food and great, friendly service. Stopped by here on our first day in Madrid for lunch and enjoyed it immensely. The pork belly and huevos rotos were amazing!
My partner and I came in for a cocktail after a tapas dinner elsewhere, and we had a lovely experience! Jean Carlos was so helpful and a skilled bartender!
Decent brunch choice but definitely the highlight is the view and the garden theme. Very nice to visit as a first timer and make a reservation one day ahead is sufficient.

This place is stunning !!! It was a bit hard to find but I think that‚Äôs the point of the secret ! ü§´ü§´ü§´ lol the staff was super friendly, the drinks were amazing and all of them seemed fun!! Ask for Yelitza if you ever visit, she was great!!

Fantastic lunch experience! We stopped by Restaurante Vegetariano for lunch and will definitely be coming back. They offer a fixed three-course meal of the day with various options, all for an incredible price of just 12 euros per person. The food was fresh, delicious, and light, served quickly with excellent service. The cozy atmosphere made the meal even more enjoyable. Highly recommended!

Great vegan eats. If you need to change it up from too much jam√≥n, this is your place. We walked up after discovering the location. The weather was great (June 2024) so we did lunch in front of the cafe.
Sorry my food was already gone when I decided to write this review, the food is so good and fresh and the price very affordable for what you get. I recommend and will be coming back!

Extremely disappointed, as a vegetarian for 40 years I was looking forward to a varied menu I could choose from in Spain.We waited outside for 25 minutes for staff to take our order. We then gave up and went inside. The staff were dismissive and very rude when we asked for a table so we didn't stay. I would suggest you should avoid this place if you value pleasant and courteous staff.
Such a nice place! The ingredients are fresh and the food was perfectly prepared. I had a lunch prix fixe that came with freshly baked sourdough bread (made by the owner, so good). Vegan options too!
Good food, varied menu. Healthy, fair, and local products. A great surprise.

I found this vegetarian restaurant via Google and dined for lunch alone as a walk-in. The small restaurant itself is charming and the service is warm and friendly. I had the daily menu and was so impressed with quality and quantity of the meal - drink, bread, entree, main & dessert for ‚Ç¨13-14! The dishes were simple, flavourful, and satisfying. I returned on Sunday hoping for another taste experience but they were full so I suggest making a booking on the weekend. The cabbage soup was so delicious that I‚Äôm still thinking about it! This is a great restaurant to visit solo, as a couple or small groups - the setting is intimate and homely. Thanks El Fog√≥n Verde I‚Äôll be back when I visit Madrid again üíõ

Very delicious, high quality, 3-course vegetarian/vegan meal for less than 20‚Ç¨‚Ä¶that‚Äôs a steal! Highly highly recommended! They seem to be busy with lots of reservations, but I had a bit of luck coming impromptu for one person & got a table.

Very good vegetarian restaurant in Chueca! The service is really friendly and the setting is like home. We recommend the wok of vegetables and tofu, the lasagna with vegetables and the croquettes with mushrooms! Tiramis√π was really good too!
Simple, no frills, fast service, great taste, good prices, healthy food.  They check all of the boxes. We‚Äòll be back for sure.
Delicious food at great value for money. I've been in Madrid for 7 weeks and this is probably the best meal out I've had so far. Good prompt service.

I went there to have lunch on a Saturday and we had a wonderful experience. The waiters were super kind and explained the dishes. We had noodles and a chinese burger and it was also delicious! Totally recomend it.

Always a great place to get some noodles or rice. The broth and toppings are crazy. The only problem with this place is that there's way too many options to choose... and everything looks so good! Careful with the spicy. It's reaaaaally spiceüå∂Ô∏èüå∂Ô∏èüå∂Ô∏è Authentic chinese placeüíØ
Spacious place. Friendly staff and quite decent food. I enjoyed my beef noodles a lot. The staff speaks Chinese & Spanish. Would definitely visit again

Service is really fast and the food was okay. I ate here before and it was better, I guess I didn‚Äôt have luck this time. Men√∫ del d√≠a is always a good option and noodles were good, i prefered tiny ones than thick. Chicken was awful and tasted like seafood I was so disapointed. What I liked the most is how clean the restaurant is‚Ä¶especially bathroom. Salad is so refreshing and lemon ice cream is really good.

Ordered veg soup, noodles, rice and plate of veg. We cannot eat the noodles because it is so oily. The veg were not stir fry with garlic nor onion and very oily. We asked for chilli and they gave us a small plate of chilli that is very salty. Same as their veg soup which is also full of salt
Great Chinese food a few blocks away from Gran Via. Fast service and very attentive. Great prices and huge portions. Fair warning - it does get busy on a weekend!

I don't think they know what chicken curry is, I ordered it and it was just fried rice with tiny pieces of chicken (if any, she pointed one piece to me) and a few frozen peas and carrots. Had the spring roll, the veggies inside were not cooked. Of course, there was the language barrier that didn't help but chinese food made by Chinese people shouldn't be hard to make.

As a Shanghainese, this is one of the best places in Madrid to enjoy ‚Äò xiao long bao‚Äô and they even have Shanghai style wontons, which are hard to find anywhere. Every time I come here, it feels like stepping into one of the small neighborhood restaurants back in the old nongtang of Shanghai. I highly recommend it!!!! The owner is also very kind and welcoming! Love ittttt!!!!!
Great service. Nice lady boss who readily customize the dishes to our needs. Food is really good!
The food reminds me of the days in Shanghai. Grateful for the flavorful food and hospitality from the owner.
Great food and environment. Would recommend miso soup and spring rolls for starter and ramen or sushi for main dish

Madrid is a city brimming with great restaurants, and if you like sushi... let's just say that Chic Sushi will be a strong reason why to come back to Madrid! The rolls were amazing, service top notch. Did I mention they have sushi that's out-of this world!

Our waiter was rude, unattentive, i felt like i am annoying him when I ordered. The dishes are all a little bit broken, the online menu is a mess, the food is OK but very overpriced for the quality. Things aren‚Äôt fresh. The temparature in the restaurant is cold. One waitress was very nice though. Would not recommend, i live in Madrid and there are definitly much better places.

My second time here and still one of the best sushi restaurants I‚Äôve ever been to! This will become a regular stop in Madrid for us. The quality and artistry that goes into every dish is incredible. We savored each and every bite. Our favorite was the one with scallop and egg frizzled on top. So special! Would highly recommend.
Nice food, some sushis I didn't like it so much because it's too fusion but employees are so kind and generally food was very good

Simply one of the best sushi in Madrid. Excellent quality/price and service. We enjoyed a lot the fusion nigiris, tasty and exquisite. We will come back indeed. Highly recomended. Bravo chef!! üëèüëèüëè

This is one of the best omakase I have had!  Each dish is full of surprises. Chef Jose was very kind and patient at explaining each item. I would say it has perfectly combine the flavors of Japanese and Spanish cuisines. Highly recommended this omakase, worth every penny üôåüèª

Very nice Place in the Heart of Madrid. We enjoyed a Wagyu Degustation Menu at a very decent Price of ‚Ç¨50 per Person including several courses of very tasty food and a nice charcoal grill at our table for delicious wagyu beef. Definitely a recommended place.
This place is amazing. The food is delicious, service is fast and really nice and the place is really beautiful. A bit pricy but worth it. There's not a single thing they get wrong.

Had dinner with my family here. We really enjoyed the food. The restaurant has two sections: tables inspired by Tokyo‚Äôs street markets and tables where you sit on the ground. My daughter had ramen and it was really good. The rest of us had the Japanese barbecue and it was algo great. They also have some really good sake. Recommend to make a reservation.

One of the best authentic Japanese experiences in Madrid. Not only was the service impecable but the dishes were absolutely outstanding. The spicy tuna tartar was a highlight, extremely fresh and the egg consistency was on point. I would also recommend the gyoza, very flavorful and the combination with the sauce is an experience in itself, you can‚Äôt go wrong with that. They knock it out of the park with the green tea cheesecake and of course I have to mention  they probably have best ramen in Madrid. Will not disappoint.
Loved this place. This is an anime lover's paradise. Amazing food, good atmosphere, a whole wall of Manga for guests to pick through, and great staff! Definitely worth a look!

user_id: Pricing here is quite reasonable
restaurant_id: with Japanese appetizers ranging from 6 - 8 EUR
rating: and donburi priced between 10 - 17 EUR. Despite being open for only two months
review_text: the place is already bustling with patrons. For a genuine taste of Japanese bar food
date: this is the go-to spot. Due to limited seating
source_user_name: I highly recommend making a reservation in advance via Google Maps. I'm eagerly anticipating my next visit to explore more of their offerings.,2023-10-20,Evan Kuo (Taiwanese in Madrid)

review_text: What a pleasant surprise, service was exceptional, the terrace sitting beautiful, and the food was incredible. Felt like an Omakase, the quality of food was over the top, the fusion was impressive. we loved it. would recommend it  100%.
Best Japanese restaurant in Madrid. Just try it! Highly recommend it! Every bite tastes like heaven.

Flashy japanese terrace. In an environment that tries to project luxury and novelty. Do not expect traditional japanese food, this is more of a fusion and experimental place The opposite of wabi sabi. Service is attentive.
If I were going to die and I had one last wish, it would undoubtedly be to have dinner here. There is nothing more to say. An unparalleled dinner with exceptional service.
Great food and service! Better than most of the restos around the plaza.
Very delicious food , staff very friendly , everything is amazing you have to try it

My very favorite Indian restaurant in Madrid. The food is delicious and staff is eager to help and recommend the right dish for you. Portions are quite big, even though it doesn't look like. It's always good to make reservations as this place is almost always full :)

Amazing experience! Ultra nice, attentive staff. Food is real Indian, plenty of sauces, they will bring you more. You get offered more food if you want. Price is actually low for the area of Banco de Espa√±a and Congreso! Superb. Better to go on a weekday for lunch, nice business lunch offer.

Udaipur, an elegant Indian restaurant in Madrid, offers a cozy ambiance with stunning d√©cor for an unforgettable dining experience. Located in a prestigious area, it serves the most reasonably priced three-course lunch menu for just ‚Ç¨17, including a drink and a sweet dish. The service is exceptionally fast and efficient, ensuring a seamless meal. Every dish bursts with authentic flavors, making it a top choice for Indian cuisine lovers. Highly recommended‚Äîvisit with confidence for a fantastic experience!

It‚Äôs fancy (25-30‚Ç¨) but it‚Äôs totally worth. The place is beautiful and the dishes are aesthetically pleasing. My fav ware Cheese Naan(maybe the best I ever had) and Palak Paneer. Maybe, the waiters could be a littler kinder, that‚Äôs the only complain I can do. The music was too loud for a while but they immediately lowered the volume as soon as we asked.

last night we visited Udaipur Indian Cuisine - It was very special night for me - the service and food was mind blowing - there were so many types of Indian traditional dishes... specially Butter Chicken and Chicken Harealy Tikka ohh just speechless...its very glad to have dinner in such a beautiful restaurant

One of the best Mexican restaurants I‚Äôve ever been. The cochinita pibill is so good, the customer service is excellent. I travel a lot to Mexico and visiting Madrid and finding this restaurant I‚Äôve found the food it was so authentic Mexican. Also is very good located in Madrid Centre.

A little Mexican tasca near Ant√≥n Mart√≠n market. La Rebonita is well presented with quirky thoughtful decor and lovely staff. The menu follows suit with a nice selection of starters, tacos and sharing dishes, and a thorough drinks menu with some interesting takes on margaritas (we'll save the experimentation for next time!) On this visit we went for the classic marg and a few tacos (prawn and sudadero beef), as well as the Swiss enchiladas. The food was delicious, fresh and flavoursome, and the margaritas was made up on the spot, which is a big üëç The only small let down was the atmosphere, which was unusually quiet for a Mexican restaurant. Maybe a little background music would do the trick!

This is arguably the best Mexican food I have ever eaten. The menu is vast and it did not disappoint. Every single item was delicious - prawn enchiladas, pork tacos, birria lamb tacos, vegetables. The michelada drink was also perfectly prepared and had a great kick. The service was very friendly and there was very nice d√©cor as well.

My boyfriend and I found this place late at night as we were craving some tacos and micheladas. It was absolutely amazing. Food and drinks were fantastic and tasted straight from Sonora MX! Thank you for the amazing service, friends!
Below average mexican food for extremely high prices compared to other Mexican places in Madrid. Tortilla was store-bought and they looked understaffed with only one waiter

Wonderful Mexican restaurant in the heart of Chueca. Decor and design is authentic and the ambience is 100% Mexican. Prices are reasonable starting at ‚Ç¨3 for a starter to around ‚Ç¨10-‚Ç¨15 for a main. I would have preferred a little more 'zing' to the food to make it a bit more spicy. Complimentary shots of a Margarita end off the meal. I'll definitely be back.

This place was a random find near our air bnb, and we were pleasantly surprised by how delicious it was! We got the nachos with guac which were super indulgent, and then 3 of us split the casserole platter (different types of chicken and tortillas) and oh man, each sample was delicious!

The food is delicious! I‚Äôve been to TKO Tacos several times at it never disappoints. Keep in mind that there usually is a long line to get in, but that‚Äôs just how it is! The cheladas and the margaritas are really good as well :) Highly recommend!

My FAVOURITE taco place!!! It is their fault that I am craving their tacos every time I come to Madrid. The line is really long but so worth it‚Ä¶I came once right when they opened and still it was full. Love them and can‚Äôt wait to eat here again. The only thing that bothered me is that I had to ask a few times to get sauces but they came amazing, it just doesn‚Äôt have the same charm with those spicy sauces‚Ä¶Also the decoration inside is so cute!
Food was great, service was okay. Could‚Äôve been better, after asking 3 times for hot salsa still didn‚Äôt get it. All in call a good an affordable place

One of my favourite places to go every time I‚Äôm in Madrid and hands down they are some of the best tacos I‚Äôve ever had, so much so that I went three times during my visit to Madrid this past October! Highly recommend if you‚Äôre craving Mexican food or if you want to take a break from traditional tapas and Spanish cuisines. service is super quick and staff are very friendly and attentive! You won‚Äôt be disappointed!

Great Greek restaurant in the heart of Chueca. They have a wide variety of typical Greek tapas and dishes. Everything was very tasty and of a high quality. We came on a Saturday night without reservation and the staff accommodated us very kindly despite being a group of 8 people.
One of my favorites in Madrid, awesome service, good quality food, kind of tight but cozy space!!   Nice job!!

Wonderful, light, tastefully decorated place in a quiet street of a busy area. Lunch menu was delicious, varied and well priced. The meat stuffed eggplant was delicious. Brownie with ice cream was perfect! The service was superb, the waiter is super friendly, positive and attentive and made us feel special and welcome.

user_id: The menu offered a great spectrum of Greek traditional dishes
restaurant_id: each prepared with care and authenticity. We started with the some mezzes‚Äîchickpea and roasted pepper creamy hummus
rating: aubergine salad and feta cream with walnuts. Then we continued with assortment of Greek croquettes that melted in our mouths. The main course was equally spectacular. The Gyros was rich and flavorful
review_text: while the chicken and veal skewers were tender
date: juicy

review_text: So pleased to return after 6 years to this fabulous rooftop location and have another great experience. Delicious food, great cocktails, and the sun shining at Christmas; what a treat? The artichokes are sensational, and the chef's recommendations are tasty. Friendly service and a relaxing atmosphere for our lunchtime visit.
Food wasn't as hot as we'd prefer. Portions were a tad smaller than normal, and flavor slightly lacking. The view and atmosphere were amazing, and we enjoyed our waiter

Fantastic rooftop spot with awesome views over Madrid‚Äôs iconic Puerta del Sol. Venue is modern and has a cozy atmosphere. Steak was delicious, and had great selection of drinks. Service was excellent. We visited in winter, with great outdoor heating. A must-visit for anyone looking for a perfect rooftop dining experience in Madrid!

Food was good nit great. Nachos were okay.. The Gummi candies that were brought to the table were a nice touch. Drinks were very tasty. Service was very good. View is not thar great. Frankly, I was disappointed.  Wirth visiting, but the outside cafes ar street level are more enjoyable and the food tends to be better.

I was really debating on posting but I am honestly surprised by all of these high reviews. I read that the grilled calamari and paella were recommended, so we ordered both. The calamari was good with this tasty tomato topping. The paella though, was way too salty and the rice was a bit undercooked. I could not finish my plate and had to wash it down with water. Also, it‚Äôs fairly pricey since they charged 18.50‚Ç¨ per person even if only one person wants the paella. I cannot confirm if this is true, but the aioli trio plate we had looked like it had been sitting out for a while (ours did not look as ‚Äúfresh‚Äù as some of the pics I‚Äôm seeing here) and I saw the waitress dumping some old aioli back into the container bowl - I went to the bathroom and when I came back, I could see the 3 bowls of aioli just sitting out on the counter, no cover. That‚Äôs not very sanitary to me, but I guess no one has gotten sick. Some of the reviews also mentioned this, but I don‚Äôt like that we were charged 1.90‚Ç¨ per piece of bread (that we didn‚Äôt ask for!) and it was hard and stale and difficult to eat. There were only two other parties there when we came, so we were attended to pretty quickly. The service and atmosphere were great though. Maybe the other dishes were good, but don‚Äôt waste your money if you‚Äôre looking for good paella, which was what I was specifically looking for and was quite disappointed. As a big foodie, I am happy to pay for good food, but this was not it

We have been in Spain for three weeks and have had amazing food in every corner. However, El Caldero is the only place we went to twice. Fabulous food and service, especially thankful to Juan and his team for the attention both nights. He made us feel welcome and had insightful recommendations.
The food was incredible. Every dish had an unforgettable experience, especially the Wagyu beef. The restaurant is always full, so it is better to make a reservation before.
Excellent restaurant! Top quality food, great atmosphere and a nice very good service. Our best gourmet experience in Madrid! Highly recommend!
Loved it!! Great gem in Madrid!  Loved the concept - fresh produce + high quality meat!Winning combination

Absolutely lovely. What a charming host. Food to die for. It was super. We loved every moment of our time here and came twice. It is probably one of the best meals we have ever eaten on holiday and the setting is delightful. We cannot recommend enough. What a treat.

One of the best meals I had im Madrid. Beautiful place, with a fairly trained staff (not well prepared for tourists) and a really good wine list. The food is just perfect. Really. We started with the Russian Salad, moving to the traditional Hispanic (Eggs, Jamon & Fries) and for the end a perfect Socarrat Rice with Rice. Just come here and have a good time.

We had a very pleasant dining experience at the ‚ÄúTaberna Puerto Lagasca‚Äù. The formula is simple: Good quality food, attentive staff and a cozy atmosphere. We did not have a reservation and decided to walk in based on intuition. They accommodated us and offered a free appetizer while waiting for the food order. We shared a very decent Mediterranean meal combination of cod fish and vegetables with a couple of glasses of wine at a very reasonable price considering the premium location of the place. Overall a solid A+ establishment.

We loved the place because of its atmosphere and the food was really good, its spanish food with a twist I guess. We tried a little bit of everything and did not disappoint. It looks like the place you go with friends to enjoy a good night out! .

One of the well-known Spanish restaurants in the area. La Maruca famous for its tortilla and cheesecake. The food was good, though not remarkable. The atmosphere is casual and ideal for large gatherings
Fantastic food, fantastic service! Highly recommend! If you're ever in Madrid you gotta stop by this place, it gets pretty busy later at night.

This tapas restaurant is a must-visit if you want to experience authentic Spanish food. The meat, vegetables, and especially the tomatoes were absolutely delicious. The staff is incredibly friendly, creating such a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The beer is perfectly chilled, and every dish was packed with flavor. On top of that, the prices are very reasonable. Without a doubt, a 5/5 experience‚ÄîI‚Äôll definitely be coming back!!

Such a lovely cosy restaurant. The food was excellent! Maria made all the difference! All her recommendations were on point. Excellent service! I will definitely come back (just to be served by Maria‚ò∫Ô∏è).

The dining experience was absolutely phenomenal! The Spanish cuisine was nothing short of extraordinary, with every dish bursting with authentic flavors. The service was impeccable, making the entire experience even more memorable. I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an exceptional meal‚Äîit's a must-visit!
Very good. Located in a quiet ish neighborhood. The drinks and food were great. Very chill.
Cadiz influenced restaurant with friendly staff and nice atmosphere. Delicious plates with fresh ingredients. A lot of options for Tuna

Good service. Food quality is very good, with reasonable portions. However, drinks are overpriced (5-6 euros for a small glass of wine). Also, charging 2.50 euros for a small piece of bread seems expensive and unnecessary

Super super happy to be here to try the delicious food and great service here , I don‚Äôt know speak Spanish üá™üá∏ and is make a joy come up more oysters but the manager is super nice he do something special for me and I felt so warm and also I am the Top popular reviewer in trip advisor I have been eating so much restaurant and this one is my highly recommended in Madrid and I would like to give them a üëçup to honour all they good food and good service! Perfecto
The best restaurant in Madrid I visited in 4 days. Pleasant, cosy atmosphere, friendly staff, excellent, delicious local cuisine. My great recomendations.
Yummy artichokes, and chicken fingers. I‚Äôd skip the croquettes and the wine but cute place. Friendly staff.

In Bar Amor they server typical Spanish food, but with a modern touch. Prices are reasonable and the food is really good. The staff is very friendly. It's quite a small place, so you may not find a table.
Perfect to have a quiet, pleasant and delicius dinner with your loved ones (Whoever they are). Good value for the money and surprisingly friendly staff. Definitely a place to try.

Very cute place; decoration is everywhere, so over the top that it somehow works and creates a great ambiance, cozy and dreamlike. The cocktails were very nice if you like them sweet, interesting and at a good price. Large choice of coffees and hot chocolate!

We got the artichokes and the burrata, as well as a cosmo and a hot chocolate. The food was good, although a bit pricy. It‚Äôs nice to just grab a drink and a plate or two to share. The decor is so cute, I loved it. The hot chocolate isn‚Äôt anything to write home about.

Overrated venue, personally, It's feel like decorations have been thrown at walls, got no sequence, no connection. I have to go for a third choice, consider 1st and 2nd plates were out of the menu at 9pm. No memories taken from this place whatsoever, perhaps an afternoon drink, not my favourite dinner location.

The decor is stunning, the menu extensive. We went for dessert and a drink. The ‚Äòmuerte por chocolate‚Äô is big, 2 pieces of cake, moist and not too sweet. I had chocolate coulant and I liked mine better. Great atmosphere, super fun decor and good service.
Great flavours and presentation. We had the ceviche, scallops, steak with crispy potatoes, all very well seasoned.

The place is beautiful and intimate with great decorations. The staff was really friendly and caring, they also gave us great advice for the ordering. All the dishes were really delicious with high quality. I especially like "Causa de pollo crujiente" and "Fettuccini", the flavors were wonderful and unique. A great place when you want to eat some exclusive dishes with high quality and pay reasonable prices, here is the place.

The best dinners I had while visiting Madrid. Chef Brandon truly knows the cuisine and has a great variety of options for all tastebuds. We started with non-alcoholic passion fruit mojitos made by Alex at the bar that were delicious and refreshing. The Causa de Pollo, Solomillo de Buey, and Fettuccine a la Huanciana all left us wanting more, so much so that we reserved a table to dine-in again our last night in Madrid. Andres was a wonderful sever that made the entire restaurant experience a delight. We were celebrating my graduation that night and he made a sweet memorable gesture to have the  dessert plate decorated. I highly recommend this restaurant and suggest you reserve a table in advance to guarantee a tasty delectable Peruvian fusion dinner when in Madrid.

Dining at 80/20 was an amazing experience. The atmosphere, the food, and the customer service were all exceptional. It was one of the many restaurants we visited during our vacation in Madrid, and the only one we visited twice. We started with pisco sours from the bar, which Alex made to perfection, just the right amount of lime juice and pisco sour. Our menu selections included ceviche, tiradito de salmon, causa clasica, and lomo saltado, and ended with the tarta de queso. All are must haves if you visit. Brandon is truly a master in the kitchen. We'll definitely be back soon. We still talk about the food we had because it left a mark. Thank you, Alex and Andres, for the quality service.

Such amazing flavours and prices and impeccable service; this is a rare gem of a find in Madrid. Everything was perfect from the wines to the starters to the mains; we were so full that we have no space left for desserts! Do not miss out this restaurant when you are in Madrid. ü´∂üèªü´∂üèªü´∂üèª

Wow! Amazing meal here. Small menu, but every single thing was incredible. Plate presentation was like at a Michelin star location. Had the oyster with green sauce small plate, tomato, scallops, and eggplant starters, and octopus for the entree. Probably our best meal in Madrid. Great job!

The food here is amazing. Everything we had was delicious. The scallop and the tomato were my two favorite things. There were only two workers taking care of guests in the dining room, but they were very friendly and the food came out at a good cadence. The restaurant was decorated plainly, but it didn‚Äôt matter because the food was so good.

Summary: disappointing. We had a reservation for 7 people at 19.00, and even though the restaurant was empty, they almost sent us back because we were a lot. Food was ok, except for the cheese plate (tabla de queso - not quesos), which came only with 1 type of cheese and costs 11,5‚Ç¨. That was totally a rip off and extremely disappointing. Then they brought the bill without us asking for it because our 1.5 hour-long reservation time was up. Even though there were still many free tables and we said we‚Äôd like to stay longer, they kindly kicked us out. Never going back.

I went to dinner with my wife for a date night. Food came out very fast. The patatas bravas are their specialty and have multiple options. But they were a bit underwhelming. The sauce tasted like out of a jar. For the other dish, The secreto ib√©rico was really tough. The fried fish was really good. Prices were fair and service good. Gluten free and vegan options.
nice atmosphere, rather good meal, small downside for the fondant and the whipped cream which were not homemade

We were hunting for a breakfast place and came to this beautifully decorated restaurant. The design was sophisticated luxurious and exudes a welcoming warmth. We had the breakfast set at ‚Ç¨24.95 each and the serving was very nice with a entre tower to start and a choice of drinks, mains and coffee or tea.

Our main motivation about picking this place was its ambiance. But additional to nice decoration, all the food was really good. The service was flawless. Prices are not above the level it should be. In conclusion it was a good experience. I have only one note: they are quite strict about 2 hour table reservation duration. I believe it would have been possible to give us a little bit more flexibility. There were quite enough vacant tables at 10:30 pm. We would have ordered some more food.

The place has the aura of a 5-star restaurant, but the service is like a roadside gas station. For a restaurant that claims to be gourmet, serving toast with spoiled salmon was a big surprise. You can see by the picture how it looks disgusting. I only managed to eat the bread and eggs cause I was starving. The service wasn‚Äôt better at all, one of the waitresses rushed us as if they didn't want us there. The menu was very limited with only 6 or 7 toast options. The only thing that made me give it two stars was the orange juice with peaches, otherwise, go at your own risk.

Very friendly and helpful staff, great food! We came for brunch and the food was consumed before we even managed to take photos! The eggs Benedict (salmon or the vegetarian) were fantastic! The smoothies were quite nice too. Very reasonably priced. Thank you for a great experience!
Food was great. Hot dogs always the best and staff super friendly.  I believe we had Andre‚Äôs helping us.  Highly recommend (if you love hot dogs)
David and Jaimar were amazing. Food was amazing. Thank you.

That‚Äôs the best food after midnight in Madrid chueca area! Very very polite staff, plenty of good sauces, very cheap hot dogs, tiny place it could have more seats somewhere but apart of that it is my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù place for food after party!
Easygoing and chilling vibes! The owners and waiters are very nice and kind. The food is just delicious and you can't leave without trying the cheesecake and "crema de orujo".
Most intimate and authentic tapas bar, very basic but in the best way with delicious food and outstanding service. The red house wine was great.
Modest bar with a lively atmosphere and immensely friendly servers. Food is all locally made and it all tastes very good. A must try is the Patatosas
This place is a GEM! I loved it! They give you excellent wine recommendations and service was great! Would definitely recommend. They are fun people!

I found this place partly serendipitously, but it made for a great afternoon. Had meatballs and artichoke salad and both were delicioso üëåüèªüëåüèª staff were great too and made me feel welcome! I regret not being able to make it back in the evening for an event. This place is on my saved list üëäüèªüòé‚úåüèª
Gorgeous place with really friendly staff. The menu is small but they have perfected each item. Nice atmosphere with chill music at lunch time. Definitely recommend

This has been my favourite food spot in Madrid. The menu is small and the food tastes exemplary. The salad, meatballs and croquettes are extremely savoury. The cheescake in dessert was heavenly. The vermaut was extremely delightful and forced me to have more. I would like to visit it again some time.
Great place. A must go for their version of broken eggs!
Amazing place with very big portions and Nicolas there is the best! It is quite delicious and i recommend to try the meatballs for sure!
We stopped by for a chat and a drink. The waitress who served us was exetremely friendly and helpful

A noisy place in the center, where after a walk along ‚ÄúEl Rastro‚Äù you can have a tasty snack and drink a cold beer! Well, what a happy Sunday afternoon in the wonderful city of Madrid under the sun in January. They quickly offered us a table and brought the dishes, the portions were a bit small.

Very good experience. An Andalusian tavern in the center of Madrid. Incredible. I 100% recommend coming here. The Joselito croquettes are crazy, the Pedro Ximenez beef muffin and the broken eggs. On the other hand, the skewer of plain tortilla, I think reheated. We will return

Good service, honest prices. The beers are well drawn and the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãhaving the same glass for beers and doubles is very interesting. The decoration is original, Andalusian without being a pastiche type thing.

La Corta surprised us at its opening: the food is simply incredible, full of flavor and perfect for sharing. In addition, the always very cold beers and the unbeatable atmosphere made the night a great experience. Without a doubt, a place to which we will return again and again. Highly recommended!

Very disappointing lunch. None of the five dishes we ordered convinced us. 1) The tomato was still green and lacked flavor. 2) The crispy pork belly was too dry. 3) The eggplant was drowning in cheese, making it a really heavy dish. 4) The "creamy rice" was actually a risotto. Not a bad one, but the description on the menu is misleading. 5) The meatballs were the worst I've ever tried, completely tasteless and served with a horrible-looking sauce that mostly tasted like vinegar. In sum, it's unexplainable to me why this place has a grade of 4.6.
Fresh Spanish food with an amazing twist - the flavours are highlighted by the different touches provided by the chef.  The simple tomatoes salad is incredible!
Amazing food and service! Lot of fresh vegetables and meat. Typical Cocido Madrile√±o  as per the grandma recipe! Worthy to try it!  We repeat 2 days in a row!

Fantastic place! One of the oldest restaurant in Madrid! I was surprised from the first seconds about service and place! They take care about you from the first moment, took car for parking, opened all doors, put a pillow under the hills (only for women)üòâ, in the end put car in front of door!
