Service was excellent in all details! Food was very tasty, fresh and well cooked!  Classical, high class restaurant which have rules about dress-code. Man should be with jacket for sure and also not casual style for all persons! Thanks a lot for all staff for amazing atmosphere, delicious food, excellent service and emotions!!! Highly recommend!!!

The service is great, very friendly and attentive staff, great wine. The food was awful. The crudit√©s was dry and old. My fish had horribly cooked skin that was not near crispy, potatoes good. Tomato with the fish was just like tomato paste from a can, extremely dense. Herb oil was good but sparse. Minimal seasoning. The fish was edible but only parts of it. I hate flabby skin with no texture on fish. Butter came in water as ice melted. Dessert was dense with little relief. The flavors were not melded well on any dish. There was a lack of texture or a diversity of senses like you would pay at a restaurant of this price and quality. Atmosphere and staff were excellent. The food was just so below par. Edible but lacking flavor, texture and all extremely dense with little relief. Beautiful restaurant but food lacks depth nor a sense of balance from flavor to textures.
Extremely delicious! We were a group of 6 people and ordered a lot to share, all left happy and full. Decent prices, wonderful service, definitely recommend to visit this gem.

Beautiful venue.  Dinner was perfect.  Between the baby shark, calamari, and the artichoke dish, I could eat here every visit to Madrid.  The wine selection is superb.  The service is impeccable.  The gentleman in the picture was a pro at the service.  He was very welcoming.  My sister and I enjoyed every minute of our dinner.

I really enjoyed this unassuming little restaurant tucked away in the busy streets of the trendy Ibiza neighborhood. The eclectic variety of food on offer has a distinct Canarian touch to it, being that the chef is from the Canary Islands. Each dish is beautifully presented and will leave you licking your lips for more. Service is polite and friendly and prices are on par with the neighborhood in which it's located - not cheap.
The pork cheeks was a bit salty for us. But the rest dishes were adorable, especially their cheese cream which we finished it without taking a picture lol

Recommend it with all my heart. Never have I ever tasted anything so divine. we ordered meat tapas and the meat was so nicely done with smoky taste. It melted in our mouths. We had rice rings they were superb and the pork cheek was brilliant. We stuffed ourselves so much or we would‚Äôve kept ordering. Anyone visiting Madrid or living in Madrid has to visit this place. The sisters duo is awesome.
Amazing place, we can recommend, very friendly stuff, absolutely awesome original taste combinations, we enjoyed every single bite :) hopefully get back soon to taste the rest of the menu :)

Absolutely incredible food. Just landed off a flight from England and was desperate to try some Sangria and tapas and wow this did not disappoint. The most tastiest tapas I have ever tasted and the most amazing sangria ever! Will be back tomorrow for sure!

Wanting a light snack we were drawn in by the bar food menu and sangrias. We ordered the calamari, tuna salad and artichokes. Our fave was the salad. The artichokes and calamari were a bit oily and salty for our tastes. The atmosphere was pleasant as were the staff.

We found this spot while walking around town. We were drawn in by the paella combo menu which comes with a selection of tapas, a choice of paella and dessert for 30 euros. The tapas assortment was quite good. We chose the mixed seafood and meat paella and were not disappointed. To top it off, both desserts were delicious, but the cheesecake was really out of this world. I highly recommend this restaurant!!

Checked out this place because we were so tired and didn‚Äôt want to walk far from our hotel to get dinner‚Ä¶ this place‚Ä¶ were we pleasantly surprised!  Everything we ordered was fantastic! Loved the Iberian pork, octopus and artichokes!

Our group really enjoyed our food. Two got the menu of the day choice, and the other three got the combination. No one was disappointed with anything. I really enjoyed the great flavors in my Pollo Asade meal combination. Our waitress was friendly, and the ambiance was fun. Would definitely visit again.
Delicious food!!! I tried the beef dumplings and rice with chicken. Both were yumm especially the dumpling. The female staff was so friendly. The place was cleab and spacious and i liked the design.
AMAZING food. We took 3 types of dumplings (pork, chicken and beef) and all were incredible. So were the cucumber salad and tempura veggies‚Ä¶ haven‚Äôt had food like this in a while. Recommend 100%!

I had a great time at this dumpling and ramen restaurant! The food was delicious. The service was excellent‚Äîstaff were friendly and attentive. Also, the 3D fan was really good-looking, and the uniquely designed vaulted ceiling added to the charm. I'll definitely be back!

This restaurant, once an old caf√© bar, has retained its charming d√©cor and original paintings on the walls. Specializing in a variety of Chinese dumplings, including pan-fried and steamed options, along with a selection of Asian-style small dishes and noodle plates, it offers a delightful culinary experience.

The attentive waitress provided excellent service, presenting the menu with enthusiasm and readiness to offer recommendations. We opted for two lunch sets and an additional steamed pork dumpling, all priced at a very reasonable total of 33 EUR.

As an authentic northern Chinese dumpling establishment, this spot is a must-visit for dumpling enthusiasts. Each dish delighted our taste buds, boasting generous portions. Despite being open for only two months, its hidden gem status won't last long‚ÄîI anticipate it becoming a popular hotspot in the near future.
The food is chef's kiss, it is definitely a recommendation if you love gyoza and wonton soup. The shrimp torpedoes are really good too.
Amazing experience! The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîauthentic, flavorful, and fresh. Our waiter, Abdul, was incredibly friendly and attentive, making our visit even better. Highly recommend!
I recently dined in with my friend at Fathe Pur and the food was absolutely delicious!!  we enjoyed our meals! Thanks to Abdul and the other guy!

The food quality was really good. Marvellous attitude of Abdul made it more proper. I would recommend others to go there and enjoy. I gave them 5 star for sure but one thing still surprised me that restaurant card like Edenred didn‚Äôt work there.

We met and lunched with the marvelous Abdul! He provided outstanding service. We had the menu del d√≠a and it was the perfect portion of food. I had the chicken soup and my wife the cheese rolls. For the entire we had the chicken madras and vegetable masala dish. Medium spicy was definitely fine. Not too hot at all. The carrot cake and mango lasso desserts were a great finish. Our new favorite place for Indian food! Highly recommend.
We had lunch here and the food was so delicious. Staff (Abdul) was also humble and good. I highly recommend this restaurant for the Indian food.

Very relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. Incredible staff and great service.

The food was utterly fantastic, every dish was flavorful and prepared perfectly. We sat at the bar, I would highly recommend it as the bar staff were delightful.

This was the best hummus we had in Madrid.  The atmosphere and staff really brought the whole experience to the next level.

Looking forward to returning.
Very recommended place in Madrid! Food was amazing- hummus, tomato salad and baklava for desert. Portions are big. Atmosphere was very nice and elegant. The place was full so book in advance
Amazing place. I felt like in Tel Aviv. Every dish was super delicious and authentic. Staff is nice too. We definitely come back and try the rest of the menuü•≥

The food, ambience and service were all impeccable. I‚Äôve eaten in many great Tel Avivian restaurants and I believe this to be the best of them all.

Hummus has become an oversaturated menu item today but Barganzo‚Äôs tastes special. Everything we ordered was delicious but I‚Äôve been thinking about the stuffed courgette flowers since I ate them.

The Yemeni style brioche was divine as was the standard pita bread. The grated tomato, oil and labneh dip was the perfect complement to the bread.

This is a must visit restaurant when in Madrid and I think it may be the best restaurant I‚Äôve eaten in.

This was my first visit to Barganzo and I‚Äôll definitely be returning when I‚Äôm next in Madrid.
The food was absolutely delicious. The salad was well seasoned and fresh, the pitas were warm from the oven, and the stuffed vine leaves were exquisite.
The Hummus Barganzo was a little too salty to my taste, but it was well made and the portion was generous.
I do think the portion of stuffed vine leaves could have been a bit bigger for the price, though.
However, these were minor issues and overall we really enjoyed the meal.

Fair warning: Do not expect street-food prices. This is more of an upscale place with nice decor and high quality food. Be prepared to pay ‚Ç¨35-40 and upward per person (without alcohol).

Looking forward to a sister restaurant in Barcelona!
Hi very nice place and the artefacts and painting and the triable mask are amazing , the service is not so good and the food is average, but the bar down has a nice vibes

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Abya and I cannot speak highly enough about my experience. From the moment I entered the restaurant, I was greeted with warmth and genuine hospitality.

Our waiter, Christian from Romania, went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was exceptional. His knowledge of the menu and attentiveness to our needs were truly commendable. He took the time to provide us with personalized recommendations, and each dish he suggested was absolutely delicious.

Christian's passion for his work and his dedication to providing outstanding service were evident throughout our entire meal. His friendly demeanor and kind personality created a welcoming atmosphere that made us feel right at home. He was attentive to every detail, ensuring that we had everything we needed and consistently checking in to ensure our satisfaction.

In addition to the exceptional service, the food at Abya was outstanding. The menu offered some options, and each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. The attention to detail in the preparation and presentation of the food was truly impressive. From the appetizers to the desserts, every bite was a delight.

The combination of the fantastic staff, led by Christian, made us have a great experience. I highly recommend Abya to anyone seeking a memorable meal in a warm and welcoming environment.

Thank you, Christian, and the entire team at Abya, for a truly remarkable dining experience. I will definitely be returning to enjoy your exceptional service again.

The restaurant came recommended from our hotel. Wonderful atmosphere. Good distance between tables. We enjoyed a variety of sharing dishes. The sommelier recommended a delicious local wine to pair with our meal. The staff were busy and felt stretched which provided a lower level of service than expected. Would recommend for a couple or family as we were. After dinner, the staff helped secure a return taxi which was very helpful. 4.3 of 5 stars from us

I think this is one of the best restaurants in Madrid, because all the tables were almost full when i came.
The atmosphere is good, and they have private room.
The food is quite varied and delicious. the avocado salad and beef tacos were fresh, the octopus was tender with sweet pineapple, the seabass was perfectly cooked.
We celebrated 2025 here,all atmosphere, food and service were excellent! We definitely come back!

I know you are coming to Spain to have Paellas, croquetas and Sangrias‚Ä¶ but believe me this is by far the best Mexican restaurant I have ever been outside Mexico‚Ä¶ including USA. Top notch and the service is great. Highly recommended!!!

I had dinner here on the last night of my holiday and let me tell you, this was the best food of the whole trip. Great flavors and good explanation from the staff. If you want good quality food, you should definitely pay a visit. You won‚Äôt regret coming here.

Oh, and I recommend the corn cake for dessert!

We came here after visiting the palace. The food was fantastic. I had the tuna tostada and the tacos pastor. It was easily one of the best tacos pastor I‚Äôve ever had. We also ate the camarones zarandeados which were fire. To top it off for desert we had the pastel de elote. The server was super polite and friendly and the owner came out to give us tips on where to visit. Definitely recommend this place and would return.

Lively Mexican eatery, a few different taco options, mostly with meat. The shrimp tacos were good, the only thing I would have liked more was fried shrimp instead of skewers. Service is friendly. They served us warm nachos and black bean pur√©e first, which was a nice gesture. Music is playing in the background too. Around 16:00 you‚Äôll find it less crowded.

Finally delicious and tasty Mexican food. It's really mission impossible to find Mexican food in Madrid and this is one of the best. The guacamole and flautas are fantastic and so is the cocihinita. I didn't try margaritas but I have no doubt that they make them well too. Service was great and on point. Would definitely return.

Located near the Plaza Major and famous Botin restaurant. This place is amazing and was one of our favourite restaurant! The food was next level and the staff were friendly and one of the staff can speak many languages. Their specialty is the mushroom dish. Highly recommended!

We had such a delightful experience here! Although they kind of stuck our large group downstairs, it turned out to be the most perfect and charming little nook, and it was probably less noisy than if we had sat upstairs in the thick of things. The tables were small, and the stools were backless, but it made for a fun experience for our group of six.

The menu is all shareable plates, and they have a tablet with the menu in various languages, definitely catered to tourists from all over. That being said, we enjoyed ALL the food we tried and thought the meal was very affordable for the quality.

We had sangria, cheese and meat platter, olives, padron peppers, chorizo in cider, and of course the unbelievably wonderful mushrooms. The great thing is that we could just order more food as needed, and we definitely got more of the mushrooms plus more cheese as we went along.

Again, the table was VERY small for all of us and all the food and drinks (we put our basket of bread on a nearby table for a while before anyone was seated there) but it genuinely made for a funny and fun experience, so just make the most of it and don't fret over the logistics too much.

Note that they do not take reservations.

We dined in the basement of this restaurant during our travel to Madrid. The basement reminds me of a cave and it has a unique vibe. The food is delicious and fresh. The Padr√≥n peppers and stuffed mushrooms are amazing. I wish I can eat them everyday. I definitely would recommend this restaurant.

Lovely place. The atmosphere is very different, but cozy nonetheless. The dishes are in the "Tapas" style, and they are really good for sharing. Keep in mind that they tend to be small, and of course, the price is not cheap. Nice for a tasty meal.
The food is super super good anyway, and it's served super fast. Staff is kind and was very efficient.

During a short trip to Madrid, we discovered the tapas restaurant Mes√≥n del Champi√±√≥n on TikTok ‚Äì and what can we say? We just had to go! In fact, we ended up visiting multiple times. Each time, we were warmly welcomed and always got a table in the small back area of the restaurant.

The mushrooms are undoubtedly the highlight of this tapas bar! The stems are removed, filled with roasted ham, and the entire mushroom is soaked in garlic. They're served with two small wooden skewers, making it easy to eat without getting your hands dirty. If you don't find that delicious, I don't know what to tell you!

But the other tapas are also highly recommended. We tried ham croquettes, a mixed platter with Ib√©rico ham and chorizo, and a selection of cheeses ‚Äì everything was simply delicious! We also ordered a pitcher of sangria, the perfect complement to this great experience.

Bread is served with the dishes, which is a wonderful addition. We recommend ordering several tapas and sharing, as this is the best way to enjoy all the fantastic flavors!

The location is cozy, the food speaks for itself, and the staff is very friendly ‚Äì even towards tourists. If there are language barriers, you can easily order via a tablet that shows all the tapas with pictures. This is a must-visit for anyone traveling to Madrid!

It seems that the staffs enjoy working in this restaurant. Every staff had a smile on his/her face and was chatting with each other with laughter while working.
I recommend the red shrimp croquettes! Crispy outside and creamy inside. So tasty and unique. This was my first time having shrimp croquette.
Garlic shrimp was good too but definitely overpriced. ‚Ç¨17.5 for a small plate of small shrimps? Crazy! I had this dish in other restaurants that cost me less than ‚Ç¨10 and tasted as good as here.
The other downside is that there's a lot of trash on floor around the bar. I'm not sure whether it's the culture here but I found it quite disgusting.

We visited during az organised trip. The place is small, outside just a few tables and the queue was quite long. The atmospeher is noisy, waiters are rushing, the kitchen is just a small "box" there all teh magic happens, the food is very delicious, we tried the Garlic shrimps with vermouth. I guess it was the most tasty shrimp I have ever had. The bakes olive oil with garlic and bread is heaven ! Highly recommend if you can book a table or a tour.

The Gambas Al Ajillo were great but a bit overpriced (‚Ç¨18 for a small plate).  Great flavour though.  The croquette were not great and I would not have them again.  I wouldn‚Äôt come back here.  It‚Äôs one of those place to try once and that‚Äôs it.
Lives up to the hype! Definitely go to the original on Calle de Victoria to get the true experience. The gambas de ajillo were muy delicioso. A highlight of our trip to Madrid.

An overrated place riding on its history. For ‚Ç¨17, they serve you a very small portion of tiny shrimp in basic garlic oil. For that price, they could at least take 2 seconds to clean them properly. It‚Äôs really unpleasant to feel the grit of sand in your teeth while eating tender shrimp.

Overpriced for tiny, dirty shrimp. At any other restaurant, you‚Äôd get a full plate of pasta with more shrimp, properly cleaned, and for ‚Ç¨5 less.

Hidden gem! Everything ordered was super fresh and flavourful. I've eaten at Michelin star restaurants since I'm a foodie and this was a quality place. Octopus was super tender with flavourful eggs that had pieces of potato. The blue cheese croquettes had such amazing flavour, with apple sauce to balance it out. The blue cheese was not overpowering at all and made from a special region in Spain. The beef pie was really nice. I don't like doughy empanadas but this place had light pastry, nicely baked and fresh. Also got the Milanese schnitzel and that was super fresh too. Server was incredible dealing with traffic of New Year's Eve - he hustled, cranked out dishes, and tried to clear and organize tables. True professional üëå Highly recommended!

Local restaurant with a good variety of food. Not the most delicious tapas we had but overall was good. We liked the atmosphere more although the music was quite high. Service was great and staff were helpful.

We visited during an organised tapas tour. The place is small, cosy and very friendly. We had a few tapas and home made cider, which is very tasty and the serving is the best part :) The favourite was the honey dressed aubergines and baby calamari croquettes. Highly recommend !

We came here because of the google review that we read. The atmosphere was good and the location was just perfect. However the food were very salty. We ordered paella and spanish onelet Paella was very salty with not much filling inside. The onelete was salty as well. The worst paella i have ever had so far.

We passed by and choose this place because it seemed busy and reviews were ok.
Service was just ok, you could see the girls working were stressed and annoyed. Atmosphere was ok, mostly tourists having drinks.
We ordered croquetas, tortilla espa√±ola and a seafood paella.
Croquetas were good and freshly made, the tortilla was cold but tasty and the paella was by far the worst paella I have ever tried. In the world, not only in Madrid. It was extremely salty, flavorless, and dissapointing.

I visited an excellent restaurant in Madrid last August, and I have very fond memories of the experience. The service was impeccable: attentive, courteous, and always professional. The cuisine offers traditional Spanish dishes reinterpreted in a modern way, without unnecessary frills, but with great attention to the quality of the ingredients. The wine selection is also remarkable.

The atmosphere is casual and comfortable, perfect for a pleasant and relaxed dinner. It‚Äôs the kind of restaurant you can visit often because it combines good food, excellent wine, and a welcoming environment.

The experience was very satisfying: the dishes were well-executed, with high-quality products. Some dishes impressed me more than others, but that comes down to personal taste.

Overall, it was a memorable dinner that will remain one of the best memories of my summer holidays.

The flavours of the food were outstanding. Though on the expensive side, the experience feels justified by the unique and high-quality offerings. A great choice for those seeking something out of the ordinary.
Ps: service also as expected on point!

The ox tail was delicious, soft, and pairs perfectly with the potato cream. Also loved the ice cream that goes well with the cheesecake (although not sure why our cheesecake was not flowy like the ones in the pictures)

This was a fantastic meal, our favorite after a week in Spain. The grilled monkfish and pickled mussels in particular were standouts for us. The servers were also very attentive and helpful as we had two small children dining with us at this somewhat fancy place. Forgive my poor photos as they do this restaurant no justice! Highly recommend!
The food was amazing and the staff were really nice , they even consider half dish for me because I wasn‚Äôt that hungry from the beginning. Totally recommend this place

Very good service, very impressive. I ordered braised pork and a glass of red wine which were tasty. They gave me a kind of pepper which were grilled for appetizer, really good. I would love to try other dishes but too full.

La Malontina delivers an outstanding dining experience! The turbot was exquisitely cooked, delicate, and full of flavor. The artichoke hearts with hummus were a perfect balance of creaminess and smokiness. The braised and caramelized cabbage with anchovies, hazelnuts, and dill vinaigrette brought a delightful mix of textures, while the candied leeks with romesco sauce added a rich, satisfying depth. A must-visit spot and definitely one of the best food in Madrid!

We are a tourist couple from Hong Kong, visiting Madrid for the first time.  It is a little and cozy place, feels like just your home cook.  The waitress is super friendly to explains the dishes to us.  We had pork cheeks, the meat is tender and juicy.  The fresh pasta with red prawn, its umami is delicious.  Pink tomato is so fresh.  We glad to be there.

One of our most memorable moments was spent here at La Malontina during a trip here with my girlfriend. We were looking for somewhere to eat since most places were closed. Our friendly server greeted us despite us now having a reservation and promptly seated us and carefully explained to us each item on the menu and what we should try. We were recommended to try their skewers with pickled guindilla peppers, anchovy, and gordal olives and they were lovely. For main course, we ordered the La Vaca pasta with fresh red prawn and aged beef tenderloin sauteed with boletus edulis. Complimentary padr√≥n peppers were savory and delicious. The chef also came out to greet us during our meal. Everyone at La Malontina was nice and cordial.

I was there yesterday, i had seared scallops with hot sauce. And monkfish baked in the oven with potatoes and herbs. I loved both the dishes. Both were very tasty, the monkfish i never had before and i really enjoyed it, even the taste of the potatoes was really good, everything is fresh and very good quality.

i finished off with a cheesecake which also was very nice. I am leaving in a few hours, otherwise i would have gone today to have the same menu one more time! And the owner is such a gentleman, it is a very small cozy restaurant. I do recommend it. Fix that main door though... Adios!

I am going to edit this review. But i will not delete the old one. I came one day early before a meeting just to eat in this restaurant, the food that i had before was incredible. However today the food was ok. The scallops were very small but good. The calamar was good, i didnt taste anything special, but the decorations of the plate was amazing, i loved it. The monkfish was ok, but the potatoes! Oh my god! They were burnt. I thought he changed the recipe so i trusted and ate it but no, i couldnt eat, i like burnt cheesecake if any of you know it, it is burnt, but it tastes good. It is very unhealthy to eat burnt food so i ate only once, however this burnt potatoes were horrible!. It is a shame because the taste of the potatoes was incredible before. Incredible! I tried to put the burnt ones to a corner but the taste was all over.  The juice of the fish also tasted burnt, i ate a little as i like to dip the fish in the juice, but i had to go due to my meeting for tomorrow and prepare, so i didnt send the order back. But no chef that respects the customer will send such food. I advise to the restaurant to Please always keep your standards same and respect your customers time and money.

I have old photos uploaded and i will upload the new ones. You can see the difference.

Atmosphere was quite fancy, service was okay; staff was helpful but couldt speak english. The meal which is called Arroz con Bogavante is not for people who does not like  shellfish.That‚Äôs why we couldn‚Äôt eat.

Sangria - very good

Bread - meh.  hard and cold, I guess I'm spoiled with fresh warm bread.

Mushroom - The cheese (seems like blue cheese kinda cheese) overwhelmed and couldn't taste any mushroom.  üëéüèº

Croquettes - We ordered the ham and cheese and it was delicious.

Lobster rice - Good lobster flavor but bit on the salty side.

Everything we tasted was delicious, loved lobster and shrimps, and Sangria was very nice
Special thanks for the service and special care, we had meal in this place 3 times during our stay:)
Especially loved their Crispy bread and olive oil ü•∞
Apart from canned white asparagus, food was good. Grilled turbot was very nice even if the presentation and sides were robust. Nice restaurant, needs a reservation.

This is second location we have visited. Food is simply amazing! You must try the artichoke‚Ä¶ no idea how they make it but it‚Äôs melting in your month! The best I have tried in my life! You should try other dishes as well, the verity of main courses and started will make you wanting to come back. One of the best places to eat in Madrid!
We had such an amazing lunch here, the food was so so delicious and fresh - we got the anchovy and beef focaccias. The owner is super friendly and kind, definitely worth coming by!!
Wondered in as part of a tapas walk through Madrid.  Met Santiago and his amazing wine and Jamin.  Highly recommend.
The experience we have is fabulous... The focaccias rustica is really good, we tried lot's of things but for me i will recommend rustica üíØ

This is exactly what we were looking for in Madrid. Good food, beer, tunes and atmosphere. Feels very authentically what we were told Madrid was and we went to a lot of places before we stumbled across this hidden gem!
Great food, great drinks!

Really fun food hall with a great selection of different foods. This is really not a market anymore and is catered heavily for tourists, but it‚Äôs def worthwhile to visit at least once if you‚Äôre visiting Madrid. Def recommend the stall on the left selling different fish tapas on slices of bread.

Nice spot to try some tapas and have drinks with friends and family. Absolutely love the tapas and fruit shops tho.. its not cheap so just okay for the experience. There will be not enough seats for everyone so its really hard to enjoy my food and drinks while standing around random area while eating .Theres more cheaper better places to eat around the area tho. I still recommend coming here if visiting madrid.

Wonderful old market, now more of a foodie mecca. It's more tourists than locals, to be honest, and you have to shop around, as the food (and value!) varies greatly. The tapas and wines are good, but you pay through the nose at some of the seafood outlets, and the croquettes I found very disappointing. Great atmosphere and worth visiting, but be aware.

If you‚Äôre in Madrid, you must come to the Mercado!!! Everything from delicious dessert, amazing salty food to drink,‚Ä¶ you can find it here with a small portion and a good price, allowing you to try all different types of food. The tapas were so good that I came back 3 times despite having to wait in a long line. The place is fully packed during the day but for dinner time it is much hectic.

The atmosphere is amazing in there!
The diversity of the food is amazing, but also the prices can be a bit higher than in other places.

Take into consideration it is most of the times full with people.

I really like this market as it has a nice breakfast joint.  It had most of the meat and produce stalls opens so it was nice to eat breakfast and be able to watch the locals buy meat.  I enjoyed watching the butcher's knife work.   It was quiet in the morning and a great little place to get away from crowds.
although there were some good stores and restaurants, many tenants were closed or empty, lack of lively atmosphere.

What a place!  A living market, not just a tourist attraction where you could do your daily shopping as well as savouring an amazing selection of foods from almost all over the world in very convivial surroundings.  It gets very busy and it is fairly small too on two levels so pick the time of your visit well and avoid the height of rush hour.

The first 2 pics are from the tapas bar on the lower level, the 3rd is from the ceviche bar on the upper level. The food at both places is great and the staff friendly and helpful. It is also a good place to shop for produce and meats
Good quality price ratio vs san miguel
I came here to eat at Casa Dani, this market turns out to be one of the most pleasant experience, good assortment, good restaurants also!

Great place to buy your groceries!! Fresh and good quality and cheaper than other places. I love to come and choose the fruits and vegetables so fresh. Meats, poultry, and fish are excellent quality, too. 150% recommended it.

A good market to visit if you happen to be in the area.

Casa Dani: Good spot for food. Excellent  omelette. They have many shops and the line moves fast.
Fascinating place.  The best seafood market!
Quiet small market in a posh area of Madrid. So not much atmosphere but you can buy pretty much much what you‚Äôd like to take home. Great central cafe.

Our madrilean friends took us there, and it seemed like this was also the activity for all Madrid.
Lots of different food stands with mostly Spanish and Latin American cuisines, and most offer some kind of lunch deal.

We shared a cachopo platter, a bottle of wine and Venezuelan bites for the 4 of us and paid around 50‚Ç¨ for the whole.

Cool atmosphere, but the sitting spots are hard to get ! Like everywhere in Madrid, you learn to make what looks like a 2-persons space, enough to fit 4 plus some space for the food.

good place to eat, drink, or even just to look around to experience local atmosphere.

there is a meat shop named el rincon de manolo, super recommend as they serve nice bocadillos, meat products and drinks with very reasonable prices.

According to friends who live in Madrid this is the real deal: here is where locals dine, for the actual price. We had different food and wine and enjoyed our food. It was quite crowded, but you can sit or stand anywhere you'd like.

"Charming Mercado with Great Variety!"

I recently visited this mercado in Madrid and had a wonderful experience. The atmosphere was vibrant, with a great mix of locals and tourists. The variety of food and drink options was impressive, ranging from traditional Spanish tapas to international cuisine.

The vendors were friendly and knowledgeable, happy to offer recommendations. The quality of the products, especially the fresh produce and seafood, was outstanding. Prices were reasonable for the quality, though some stalls felt slightly on the pricier side.

The only downside was that it got quite crowded during peak hours, which made finding a spot to sit a bit challenging. Still, the energy and charm of the place made up for it.

Overall, it‚Äôs a must-visit spot in Madrid for foodies and those wanting to soak in the local culture. I‚Äôll definitely be back!
A local market with a lot of variety of food choices. Even a Mexican with vegan options. Good place to do a vermut.

Not well advertised; this market offers not only the traditional stands to buy fresh groceries like meats; fish; fruits and vegetables and many more; but also you have a whole second floor dedicated for small stands with a multiple variety of food. A small market able to get all your marketing lists. Near to the metro and near by all the restaurants and shop.

Love the mercado! Amazing vibe! A variety of choices. The wait can be long, as it‚Äôs usually crowded from dinner time onwards. A great place to chill and hangout with friends. Drinks and food at reasonable prices. Highly recommended, a local food court as compared to touristy trap. ü´∂üèª

This place is a spacious food court for you to enjoy different kinds of food. Less touristy than the Mercado de San Miguel and at a better price point.
The staff are polite and helpful.
Highly recommended that you get a bit of some food from each stall to share.
The Peruvian stall serves amazing food. Same for the meat stall.

Wanted to try it since it's near our B&B. It's a smaller version of a food hall-Mercado, and its scale is closer to a food court? Food was great though.

We ordered a steak that was so tender, and an octopus dish that was also done well, not too chewy. The Mexican food was so tasty and the skin was so crispy!

Shout-out to the bartender who was ever so patient in explaining how things work and also guiding me.

Elevated food court. We were surprised by the quality of the food, the peruvian causa lime√±a and the aji de gallina were delicious.  The bao bun were yummy.  And the chorizo and morcilla were of high quality. We ended up on the top floor but it has plenty of corners where to stay.  You have to order the food, they give a buzzer that alerts you when your food is ready. Not cheap but good amounts.
A great place to try different foods.

Located on Calle Fuencarral in the heart of Madrid, Mercado de San Ildefonso is a must-visit destination for food lovers and anyone seeking a lively, dynamic atmosphere. This sprawling venue spans three levels, each offering a unique experience and a diverse array of culinary delights.

From the moment you step inside, the vibrant energy of the market draws you in. With a wide variety of food stalls, there‚Äôs something for everyone‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre in the mood for traditional Spanish flavors, international fusion dishes, or indulgent street food. The food is consistently flavorful and well-prepared, with each stand delivering its own creative spin on classic recipes.

Adding to the lively atmosphere is the market‚Äôs entertainment, including a live DJ that elevates the vibe and makes it an excellent spot for socializing with friends. Whether you‚Äôre grabbing a quick bite or settling in for a few hours, the music and ambiance create a memorable experience.

The staff across the market is attentive and friendly, ensuring that every visit is smooth and enjoyable. The people who gather here are equally vibrant, creating a warm and welcoming environment that reflects Madrid‚Äôs eclectic spirit.

Whether you‚Äôre a local or a traveler, Mercado de San Ildefonso is a fantastic spot to explore new flavors, enjoy great drinks, and soak in the energy of one of Madrid‚Äôs most iconic culinary spaces. Don‚Äôt miss it!
The best food market I experienced in Madrid. It's definitely not a turist trap and you can enjoy some great food. I recommend PROST Fuego & Carbon, their stake was amazing.

We had delicious escargot and poke! I highly recommend to try them ‚ù§Ô∏è

The only one thing, I wish Google said that most of the places are open at 2.30pm. We came at 12.30 to get smth to eat, and Some places were still closed, but we managed to find tasty food
Unbelievable, biggest fresh market in Madrid, mostly locals go, best prices on fishes and vegetables in town,variety of jamon iberico with competitive prices.

We ate the best pastramy sandwitch ever at this place! It was packed but we manged to find a place to stay and eat. It has a really cool vibe and for sure we will return to try more. You can find burgers, pizza, seafood, grill, snitzel, sausages and soooo many varieties of beer. Really diverse.

This place is amazing!!! Great food great prices.  Ambience is just perfect   The people are all smiling and giggling.
Food?!! : got to try a little of everything. There‚Äôs a place right by the entrance that sells empanadas they are just delicious try the spicy lamb.  Some places got homemade beers and they even have on site a Michelin star restaurant.
They also are a market place.  Fresh stuff.
I had a great experience.  You probably heard of ‚ÄúMercado San Miguel ‚Äú. Well it‚Äôs kind of the same but everything has a homemade ambiance. It‚Äôs like a small town festival.

I arrived at the complex by accident, there are lots of food stalls there at different prices and with quite a large variety. It is very worth going, especially for lunch, there is also a large variety of food from tapas to Japanese food. Excellent!

Mercado de San Ant√≥n in Madrid's Chueca neighborhood is a vibrant spot blending traditional charm with modern cuisine. The market offers fresh produce, artisanal foods, and a lively rooftop terrace perfect for tapas and wine with city views. A must-visit for a true taste of Madrid‚Äôs food scene!

Mercado de San Ant√≥n is a nice spot for a diverse culinary experience. It spans multiple levels, offering everything from delicatessen stalls and food bars to fresh, local produce. The rooftop terrace with a restaurant and cocktail bar has a nice view. Unlike the more tourist-focused Mercado de San Miguel, San Ant√≥n is a bit more laid-back that attracts locals as well as visitors. It is clean, modern, and well-organized, though prices can be on the higher side.
We went to 11 Nudos, the rooftop restaurant and bar at Mercado San Ant√≥n, for a couple of drinks. Very nice. Good service and view.

Food market in the city centre, beautiful and big. It is definitely a touristy location but still well worth a visit though you won‚Äôt find many locals in here. There‚Äôs lots of bars and food stalls, the prices are on the higher side but not too scary.

Empty at lunch time on a Sunday, strange... Very nice, but they really pester for tips. At a food hall? I thought this was Europe, not the US where food staff aren't paid well. Mercado San Miguel is more relaxed, like a good quality food hall should be. Food here is better, but a more limited strange. Unlike San Miguel, you will find seats here at peak times, but it just doesn't have the atmosphere. gorgeous decor, but people make an atmosphere.

I really like the ambiente here as it seems more refined in comparison to the other food markets. However, the food is more or less the same: it looks great but it‚Äòs mediocre and mostly just made for tourists. As the majority of the food is reheated, it loses in taste & quality in my opinion. Even the freshly prepared pulpo wasn‚Äòt that convincing as it was rather chewy and at 25‚Ç¨ definitely overpriced.

So it‚Äòs definitely worth a visit but just remember that there are many other places where you get better food for less money, and also with better service.

Hidden under a high end shopping plaza this little gem shouldn‚Äôt be missed. Yes a little pricy but quieter than the more well known gastro markets. I had a lovely local
Wine for ‚Ç¨7 and some padron peppers ‚Ç¨12. Recommended.

Wow! A huge variety of stalls selling tapas of all sorts. Clean modern setting, tables in the center where you wait for your food to be delivered from whichever stalls you have ordered.

We were particularly impressed by one stall with scallops on a half shell with a garlicky sauce, and another with fresh jumbo shrimp in shell flash fried in a different garlic saffron sauce.

Will definitely return for the variety of dishes to choose from. Stall owners friendly.

Topped off lunch tapas with excellent gelato at one of the stalls.
Great experience , a lot of different foods and tasty , atmosphere ia fantastic
Great place for dinner and lunch. An amazing selection as well. Fun place

We went there on a Sunday afternoon. A nice French girl welcomed us. We ordered Negroni and tinto de verano, both were really good. The tinto the verano was really big. They invited us to a cup of popcorns too. The food concept is really unique. They have many logos and menu, each menu has different type of food (poke, burgers, etc.) this place is recommended specially if you are a big group where you have a lot of food option to choose from.
The vibe is super cosy with a very tasteful interior. Staff are very friendly and professional. Clean toilets. Totally recommend for a meal and a drink. Perfect restaurant for a casual date.

Cool concept in La Latina with different styles of kitchens inside the venue. Asian, Hawaiian, Mexican options, and brunch!! They mentioned new kitchens will be joining soon.

Had a poke bowl, very fresh ingredients and abundant salmon and tuna compared to other poke spots.

We ordered several Poke plates, which were a decent size and tasted very good. Our only complaint would be that they could have been a bit cooler in temperature. With minimum AC, the warm food takes away from an otherwise very pleasant meal.
Service was truly slow even though there were only a few tables with people. The little pancakes for dessert were also quite good.

Interior good market located near Gran Via and Plaza de Espa√±a with a concentration of South American and South Asian vendors.

Mostly catering to locals, not a lot of tourists stop here, there is a good selection of food stalls with Peruvian food, friendly vendors.

The market is old but I believe that‚Äôs what its charm, run down, but with a soul, better not renovate and keep its retro style, we liked this one better than the one in Bilbao which is more modern, but has no soul.

Interesting South American food market just off the Gran Via, Madrid. All the SA countries are represented, and the variety of food is impressive.

Good variety of fresh Sea food..
Good butcher men's..

Spices, condiments, lentils, fruits,  vegetables and many more groceries available here in a good price..

A very interesting Latin American market with fish and meat stalls, and other shops as well. I particularly liked the South American style small restaurants, where they prepared local home style cooking. I tried the Peruian ceviche and chicken fried rice, which was a lunch deal at 10'40‚Ç¨, which not but for the good portions served. The ceviche was excellent üëå and the rice was filling. Kudos to the chef. The staff can speak a little English, and the rest we communicated using Google translate üòÇ, and they very friendly and kind. Love and admire the Latin warm welcoming spirit in the middle of Madrid hustle and bustle. High recommend checking the market stores, and trying the local restaurant stalls too.
A true gem, delicious authentic food at great prices with impecable services. Definitely recommend and hope to come back pronto!

It is one of the largest markets in Madrid, offering a wide variety of fresh ingredients and local products. The market covers an area of about 8,800 square meters and hosts more than 250 shops, including a Korean supermarket. Compared to other famous markets, it is frequented by many locals.

They have all sorts of stores here ranging from restaurants, butchers, seafood, fashion/clothing, fruits, veggies, and more. I also tried out some snacks at a couple restaurants and they were all prett delicious. If you come here I highly recommend trying out their empanadas.

They have a handful of South American cuisine restaurants as well such as Venezuelan, Peruvian, Mexican, and more. Things are very clean and organized (especially the butchers area) so you can tell it‚Äôs just taken care of better and is well maintained.

At the entrance to the left there‚Äôs also a map of all the places and areas so you can pre-plan where you‚Äôd like to go as well as to not get lost. Definitely recommend coming here even if you don‚Äôt plan on buying anything to just look at the markets, how their run, etc.

Was here on 2 Nov at 1.30pm and we must have been at the wrong part of the market as all we saw were only food produce more suitable for locals than tourist and there wasn‚Äôt food stalls. Would have loved to try the Peruvian restaurant mentioned by one other reviewer below.

First of all: I like Madrid very much. I first came to this market in 2015 to buy vegetables. This time I came and found that the market was prosperous and people were constantly flowing. The experience was even better after the upgrade. The only drawback was that the parking garage was too small, but fortunately I had sold my car. I wish this market a long life.
The market is a bit confusing at first, very easy for you to get lost. But the quality of the products are amazing and prices are also very good. Certainly worth the visit!

Smaller, multi-level local market in La Latina neighborhood. Lots of meats, fresh produce and smaller shops selling specialty food items from all over. There are several arts and crafts stalls, and this cute look laundromat inside as well.

Nice and clean. Totally worth the trip out there!

Great market with many locals shopping and dining here. Plenty of fresh food stalls, some local art shops, carpenters, bars and cafes. The sellers are really nice and friendly. We recommend to pop in for a cheesecake at the spot with many country flags and an elderly gentleman behind the counter - it is divine! And his pastrami sandwich is good too. Look for it on the first floor.

This market is on the list for all Madrid stops, so naturally I had to stop by, but left feeling both overwhelmed and underwhelmed- overwhelmed by just how busy it was and the lack of a queuing system at stalls, then underwhelmed by the lack of choice for those with dietary restrictions. I ended up getting a spinach and ricotta empanada from a shop (whose name I unfortunately forgot but near the entrance) and was not happy with the service. The empanada however, was delicious and kept me filled the entire day.
Less tourist in this market as most people appeared to be locals.  Very busy with the equivalent noise levels. Many stalls to choose from.

Well worth visiting this mercado, even worth getting out of your way. Good selection of different shops, mainly meat and fish but also done clothes shops and bookstores - even a video game shop! All the meat and fish we tried were fresh and tasty. The cost/value factor is good

Awesome tracks and simple tapas fare. Great beer and service. It‚Äôs tiny, but it makes it cute and intimate. üòä
Brandon was an awesome chap behind the bar. I‚Äôll definitely be back here again üëå

This place is so special ! The owner is so welcoming and caring, he and his colleague took the time to talk with me and exchange discussions about our own cultures. They were so nice. I definitely recommend this place and I would even rate it 6 stars if it were possible !

My husband and I were looking to have a drink on a Saturday evening that didn't require reservations. We came in here and had a great time. The bartenders were really cool, and the vermouth tasted great. We will definitely come back our next time in Madrid.

The aliens are much more polite than the owner.
The place has good atmosphere but in spite of having consumed more than the other clients, we were told to leave the place and finish the drinks in a rush.... unbelievable....this happened whilst more than 10 friends of the owner were allowed to stay..complete nepotism and nothing to do with Madrid spirit.

We stopped here for one drink and ended up staying the entire night. The atmosphere, the drinks, the food.. everything was amazing but I have to say the owner went above and beyond and truly made our experience one I‚Äôll never forget. He was so friendly, took time to get to know us and genuinely cared about making everyone feel special. If you‚Äôre in the area I would HIGHLY recommend stopping by. We had a great night, tried some samples of rum, got to hang something of ours on the wall, and made an awesome new friend. We will probably be going again tonight üòÇ If you can, definitely come here you won‚Äôt regret it :)
Highly recommended. The service here is great. We ordered the fried rice, shrimps tacos and Cuban sandwich. They were all amazing. Do make a reservation before coming over
These tacos were amazing! The best carnitas, no grissel, and the salsas had incredible flavor with the right amount of heat! Definitely worth trying

Hands down one of the best food places in all of Europe and of course, Spain. The shrimp tacos are THE BEST TACOS I‚ÄôVE EVER EATEN. The Fried Rice is AMAZING, the empanadas are sooooo good. Tres del leche is the best I‚Äôve had in Spain. Fresh ingredients. Immensely flavorful. You HAVE TO try this place. And the prices are extremely affordable. Fantastic value. Will go again and again.
The shrimp taco is very nice and fresh. The fried rice is flavourful. The restaurant is clean and comfortable. I love this place

Todo incre√≠ble! After a week of eating nothing but tapas, we switched it up for incredible South American cuisine. We ordered the tostada de at√∫n, los tostones con carnitad, y los tacos de gambas. All were very delicious, amazing flavors, natural ingredients, etc. Service was also very quick and nice. We'll be back

A must in Madrid! Amazing! The place is really nice and the service was great, especially the female bartender. She‚Äôs amazing!!

I tried the vermut de grifo and it was good. The pastrami sandwich was great too. Portions are small though. I suggest making reservations as it gets very crowded.

Absolutely loved this place! The atmosphere was great, super cozy and inviting. The food was extremely good and well-priced, and the cocktails were amazing‚Äîstrong and perfectly made. Definitely a spot I‚Äôll be coming back to! All the bar keepers were super friendly!

Mimicking a classic bar with its diner-style bar, comfy booths and lots of spaces with stools, Trafalgar is a trendy and sociable spot on the side streets around Olavide / Cardenal Cisneros. Super discreet from the outside, and although it's big, it can be easy to miss!
To start, the food menu is a range of interesting takes on some simple classics. Generally good quality, and some predictable items, but the menu is well designed in that you can have snacks or a full-blown meal if you feel like. Portions are reasonable and most items are easy to share.
This was my second visit, and the staples seem to be the anchovies on toast, the "coca" with sardines, tomato and idiazabal cheese, the bravas, the pluma and the langostines. The quality is good, everything is fresh and very tasty. We also tried the leeks, the fresh mushrooms, and the calamari sandwich - the latter two probably being the weaker dishes we tried off the menu.
They have a good wine menu and offer a decent selection at good prices. This is the sort of place that merits some bubbles and I'm glad to say they have a strong cava and champagne offering.
On the downside, the service was just ok - some confusion and general slowness with ordering and paying created a few delays, but otherwise correct and generally efficient in getting food out of the kitchen.
Overall, Trafalgar has a good vibe - comfortable but buzzing. Definitely worth a (return) visit.

Very nice place! I tried the cocktail named ‚ÄúLady Chamber√≠‚Äù and it was really nice! The tapas were really tasty and quality. We had ‚Äúpatatas bravas‚Äù which were not the typical slicss but very elegantly sliced ones served with a top sauce, and ‚Äúcroquetas‚Äù typical in Spain and very delicious aperitifs. ‚ÄúAlcachofas‚Äù, artichokes, was very soft, we loved them.
And ‚Äúchistorra/txistorra‚Äù, small sausages served with patatas bravas.
They also bring extra aperitifs on the house which was super kind :)
The best bar in Madrid, our favorite! It offers good food, great cocktails, and a cozy ambiance. I wish it were easier to find a spot.

Nestled in a truly special corner of Madrid, this place offers breathtaking views of Gran Via street that will leave you in awe. The dining experience is a delightful journey for the senses, showcasing exquisite 5-sense food dishes that tantalize the palate. The ambience is equally enchanting, creating a perfect backdrop for an unforgettable meal. The staff is not only professional but also incredibly friendly, making you feel truly valued as a guest. Don't miss the chance to savor both the culinary delights and the warm hospitality in this remarkable spot!

We had a great experience staying in Hyatt hotel in Madrid Spain. Also dining in their restaurant was unforgettable not only the food was delicious but the service was exceptional, shout out to Romer. Thank you. My husband and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Fantastic food and atmosphere. The waiter was super attentive and the service was quick and efficient. All the food was incredibly tasty but my personal favorite was the Octopus which was cooked to perfection with the black potatoes. The dessert of creamed cheese with fruit was a perfect sweet ending to this meal.

Great restaurant in the centre of Madrid! It is located on the first floor of a nice building with a great view of the Gran Via. The entrance may be a bit hard to find but the place is definitely worth a visit. All the dishes are super tasty and the prices are not too high for the quality of the food!

Tasty food, loved the veggie pizza üçï üòç we had a set menu for 35‚Ç¨ per person, because today was a celebration of ‚ÄúBiblical Magi (Reyes Magos)‚Äù. Excellent service, good food quality. Nice fresh juices. üëçüèΩüëçüèΩüëçüèΩ RECOMMEND üëåüèΩ
One of my favourite restaurants in town! They serve the best traditional Spanish dishes, the tortillas and the beef tartar! ‚ú®

We tried 7 dishes on the menu. They have new Tapas menu, price would be more reasonable than previous. Food was great! I recommend Octopus and Duck gratin. Shrimp ravioli was also good! Service was so friendly and lovely.
Thanks!

Our experience in this restaurant was SO GOOD! The waitresses were very friendly and attentive, and the food simply DELICIOUS..we've both been dreaming about the "virutas de foie" the last days and everything we ordered we would definitely repeat next time!!

Upscale restaurant.
Great dishes and good service.
Restaurant is a part of Villareal Hotel so if you go to this place you should see the the hotel as well, it's a masterpiece.
Don't expect a cheap place.
A very enjoyable tapas dinner. We had the cheese plate, quinoa salad, sirloin with peppers, and the octopus. Everything was delicious, and the service was attentive and friendly.

situated at the sunniest side of the square to sit at for late afternoon and evening sunshine. Small and cosy restaurant and caf√©, Perfect to while away an hour or two sitting drinking coffee or just a small beer or two in the afternoon while doing the essential sport of people watching which we all know and love.

For what I had at DCorazon, it was perfect!

We had the goat cheese and zucchini tapas, which was perfect and light on a very hot day.

Additionally their sangria had plenty of fruit and was quite delicious. Our waiter was accessible and the outdoor seating as mist every minute or so which was nice to keep their guests a bit cooler.

Venue itself is perfectly situated within Plaza Mayor, Madrid.

The food was wonderful! My grandmother particularly enjoyed the gazpacho. We‚Äôre from the US, so we struggled with the language barrier, but the waitress Amina was very helpful. The atmosphere in the Plaza was very nice, although you might be approached by solicitors if you chose to eat outside. Overall, the experience was very pleasant and the food tasted wonderful

Our experience with the food was limited to a single dish - the Iberian pork ribs. The meat was very tender and tasty. It could have been little warmer but overall, very good. Our server, Brian Jackson, was very helpful and friendly making the evening enjoyable.

We found this restaurant with googling and no regret, cocktails was so nice with real taste and foods were so tasty. Inly negative point was a bit pricey which is understandable as they have one of the best location at Plaza mayor.

Thanks üòä

There is a Spanish only menu with a bit more options.

The service was outstanding and fast. The breads that came with the sausages are additional charge. So if you don't want, you need to ask to send them back. I knew they charge and the sausages were delicious. 5/5

Callos 4/5. The callos was so rich. I would need to dip with bread. It was too rich to be eaten alone. I'm not sure how to eat this stew by itself.

Salmon croquettes 4/5. The croquettes were super cheesy so it really depends on your taste. The meal was so full and was intended to be shared.

At the end, the restaurant gave us free coffee shot. It was the first time some restaurant in Madrid even gave out something free.

The restaurant itself was quiet and we went, there were many empty tables.
Super delicious roasted pig and grill lamb. Pig is crispy and so soft inside, the sauce is perfect. Iamb is really soft no smell and tomato salad is amazing!

Tried this place after hearing good things, and overall, it was a good experience. The food was tasty, and the service was friendly, but nothing really stood out as exceptional. It‚Äôs a solid spot for a meal, but I wouldn‚Äôt go out of my way to come back. Worth trying if you‚Äôre in the area!
Suckling pig was very tender and delicious, with a side of potatoes and a very crunchy crust. Lamb was slightly gamey but otherwise very well seasoned.

It is traditional in decor,  food and service, close to the royal palace.  If you are looking for suckling pig or baby lamb dishes,  this  is very authentic,  crispy skin and soft meat.  Their suckling pig tastes just like the one in Segovia.  I also love their apple tart w vanilla ice cream.

Smoked Room is an amazing experience everyone should live at least once. There hasn't been a plate they offered that left us disappointed! The staff is superb, they take care of every detail. It's really worth every cent. Will definetly be back!

The experience at Smoked Room in Madrid was absolutely fantastic. Every course was perfectly seasoned and the flavors were exceptionally well-balanced. Luis, the sommelier, was outstanding and made the entire evening truly enjoyable an experience in itself. The use of high-quality ingredients was evident in every bite. The only thing to mention is that the rooms are quite dark, which could be improved.

Overall, an extraordinary culinary experience that I highly recommend!

The worst 2-star restaurant in Madrid, perhaps the most awful food I had in 2024. Even though I asked for less salt as a dietary requirement, this is still unbelievable salty. Some ingredients and concepts might seem a cultural shock to European diners, but they are very weird to an Asian diner.

Outstanding, 3+ hour dining experience. The two Michelin stars are well deserved.

We were greeted promptly by the reception staff and led down a modern, LED-lit tunnel into the dining room. It‚Äôs very cozy with a 6-person chef‚Äôs counter and two, 4-seat tables.

We had the 14-course Omakase tasting menu. It‚Äôs a fusion of Japanese and Spanish influences with an emphasis on seafood‚Ä¶and of course smoke, for which the restaurant is named.

With the exception of the duck, the courses were creative, beautifully presented and prepared, and thoughtfully explained by the staff (who seemed conversant in at least English, French, German and Spanish). The counter had a primary server who was knowledgeable, friendly and helpful with the wine selections - we had several glasses, but didn‚Äôt opt for the wine pairing(s) which are available. I liked that the chefs would occasionally come out to explain the ingredients and preparation for the dishes being delivered. Wines were very good and reasonably priced.

Lots of local, seasonal ingredients in the dishes. Sauces were a highlight. Amazing execution and fun to watch the proceedings from the counter, with an overhead mirror of the prep area.

Overall, a world-class dining experience. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Thank you Luis for the wonderful evening. Your knowledge, charm and professional attitude lifted everything up.

Excellent food and ingredients. With only a few seats and the corner tables, it feels like a private dining experience.

I loved this place from the word go! Friendly staff will meet and greet you at the door. The decor is simple yet chic. You'll be overwhelmed by the huge variety of food options available on their menu, and if you can't find it on the menu, ask to chef to make it for you. The food was scrumptious and won't disappoint you. Prices work out at an average of around ‚Ç¨30pp depending on how much you drink. A bonus is that you can book on The Fork and make use of discounts up to 40% on menu prices, or use your Yums to get discounts. I recommend ordering anything that comes with the word luxury (their signature word on featured dishes)

I have mixed feelings about this. The sushi and the tallarines with shrimp were A+. The duck dumplings  with truffle and egg rolls were good but i guess i was expecting more flavor, it was both more like beef taste. The restaurant was great and service was excellent and good priced.
We wanted to try a few dishes so we did not have a a bug main dish.
Good food! The sushi was amazing and the next we go we will definitely order more.

I love this place. It was my first time. I came here tonight, because my girlfriend wanted to  I was blown away. First of all, my server was incredible. I can‚Äôt remember his name, but he was the best sever I‚Äôve ever had. He was respectful, knowledgeable of the food he was serving, and just generally a pleasant person to speak to.

Came here during the pandemic and booked through an online platform to get a solid discount on menu items. The food was good, as was the decoration. After the discount, we ended up paying 19‚Ç¨/person which is excellent value.

Just had a great time at Mercado de Chamber√≠! üåü The quality of the products is top-notch, definitely a 5-star experience there. The atmosphere was really nice, and I enjoyed my meal, giving it a solid 4 stars. The service was friendly and attentive, earning another 4 stars from me. Overall, I think the value for money is pretty good too. I‚Äôll definitely be back for more delicious dishes! üçΩÔ∏è
It's a great market. I particularly love WeCook, a cooking class venue that uses ingredients from the market
Lots fresh produce, veges and fruits, but all eatery were closed at night time (5-8pm). If you are a local it's a great place to shop for food.

A very especial place, warm, clean and the people working there are helpful and courteous. Highly recommend, specially the '"Cafeteria - Bar Chamberi", if you want to make a stop while shopping in the Market, is small and cozy, good service, the offer you a selection "Tapas" and the prices are quite reasonable
Great market, very clean and full of tons of great things! Vendors are very nice, and the produce is of extremely good quality.
A really cute organic shop in the neighborhood. Owner Lucia is really helpful and kind to navigate products that I am looking for. I especially love the olive oil. Thank you!!

I was very surprised to find a fluent speaking English dedicated and knowledgeable about organic products. I highly recommend to anyone coming to Madrid lovers of organic products not to miss experience the experience at La Nodriza; was very impressed with large variety. Any time I come back this will be my first step! Helpful and kind owner üëç

One of the best organic products shops in Madrid. The owner Lucia is very friendly and knowledgeable about her products in the shop. It‚Äôs not big but you can find what you need for your daily life. If you are resident in the neighbourhood, you should definitely come to this amazing shop. If you are a tourist touring around, try to take some organic gift from Madrid/Spain back to your home. Lucia speaks perfect English and you can also learn a lot from her about many health related issues. Highly recommended!

Delicious, fresh and specialized products all year round with great care. Special mention to the yogurts, her honey selection and bee wax candles. Thank you Lucia for being the light of the neighborhood.
Lovely little store. The lady working is very friendly and knowledgeable. I will go back for more of my health needs. I can not wait until they have sea moss in stock.

In our case it was a really good experience. We stopped by chance during a bank holiday in Madrid. The staff was friendly, we were even chatting about different topics (oysters included). Were properly reccommended. Had two different oysters and a champagne glass.
5 stars genuine experience
Best oysters in Madrid and great service too. They know how to open a damn oyster.
Best oysters in Madrid, special thanks to Jawad for suggestions and wine pairing. A must!
Terrible service. Took our food to arrive forever. Locals were served first even if they arrived later than us. Disappointed.

A good place to have good champagne and some oysters.
Expensive appetizer, but it's not something you make every day either, so it's great for a treat.
The waiter guides you about the characteristics of the oysters they have.
Hard to go wrong, all very delicious and fresh.

This place is fantastic in terms of fresh produces! Although it isn‚Äôt as well-known to tourists as other markets, I find this place encapsulates all the essence of Spanish awesomeness! Non-Spanish speaking tourists should be able to get by without much troubles!

This market is fabulous! If you can't find what you're looking for in food or drink here, it doesn't exist. The produce is all first rate; the service is excellent and helpful. There is even a vegan diner! This is where the true Madrile√±os shop.

It was so nice to get to a proper market. So many markets in Madrid are dying or being turned into hipster food halls. This one is full of fresh produce and cheese and preserves. And meat, fish, croquettes etc.
There is a good French cheese shop and a fabulous Spanish cheese shop, La Boutique Del Queso. The man there spoke good English and was just so kind and helpful. He has a great change and let me taste many cheeses.
Great mercado, has everything you could possibly want. The stall owner are super lovely and friendly too.

Great place. Typical "barrio" ambience. You can find almost everything you need in terms of grocery shopping, including fresh meat, fish, and produce.
There are also, shoe repair, beauty parlour, etc. Places.
Conveniently situated in the heart of Arganzuela Burrow, close to Atocha-RENFE, rail station.

Nice and cool place with multiple small restaurants. One of the amazing things you will notice, the high level of cleanliness even on weekends with busy hours! ‚≠êÔ∏è we are pizza from D‚ÄôAgustto and we were so happy with quality and taste üòã

We are foreigners and had no clue what to do at first. Thank to Mateo‚Äôs help, he recommended some traditional Spanish food to us. They were good. And it was really crowded at the market, but he managed to find us a spot!
Nice place and good food.  We order Mexican Food at Trompo taco and üçî at Juancho‚Äôs BBQ
Fantastic atmosphere, excellent customer  service and what is most important, the food is super good. Best Spanish omelet with best hamburger with best ‚Ä¶. Do not miss it in Madrid

Decent new food market offering in the north of Madrid near Plaza Castilla. A few staples in here like Juancho's BBQ and Casa Dani. We went for the Mexican and hot dogs and they were good quality, but everything was just a bit cold. They have an app / tablet ordering system for the whole market which seems efficient in principle, but wastes a bit of time between preparing and receiving the food. All in all it was a bit impersonal and everything wasn't as hot as you'd expect. Nice space, but unfortunately no real service.
Historical place, enjoyed olive.
Had a lovely Nespresso coffee there. Friendly English speaking staff.

This indoor market was 50m from where I stayed in Madrid - what a gem! Fresh produce of all sorts, with a good baker and wine merchant around the corner too.
Must try - the iberico ham sawn straight off the bone, and the delicious flat peaches when in season.
Wonderful traditional market with some interesting bars and food stalls
Old place not much to do

It‚Äôs one of my favorite Asian supermarkets in Madrid. Although it doesn‚Äôt seem like a very big store, they actually have a good variety of products, in addition to homemade dishes to take away. If you shop over ‚Ç¨40, they let you take any dish of your preference for free which I think is a really good initiative. But what makes it a different store in my experience is that they have a lot of events such as cooking workshops. Definitely a place to visit.

I gave it a try as I live in El Rastro. Wow. What a real gem!!! I loved the spring rolls with shrimp, which comes with homemade garlicky sweet and sour sauce. This sauce alone deserves its own brand.

I also got panko chicken, which I put in the air fryer, and it came out so good. I also bought some essential Asian ingredients. The prices are so reasonable, and I know I will be back.

The owner and her son (?) are friendly and helpful, especially because I was a bit disoriented as it was my first time at the shop. But now I know I will be back to get my snack and post-workout meals!

This place is a gem. They have a great selection of Asian, vegan, and latin@ ingredients. They also have an excellent selection of craft/artesanal beers and alcohol. Go here, shop for groceries, beer, and grab some take-away. You will not be disappointed.

This place is truly a gem! This little market offers organic food/products. They have a variety of different healthy foods and snacks. Gluten free and great supplements like maca, hemp, cacao powders. This Asian market sells load of vegan/vegetarian options! Even vegan ice creams but nothing could be better than their ready to eat foods! Which majority of them are vegan and vegetarian! Yummy food and great prices! This place is a must go if you are in Madrid!
Small but has essential selections of asian items.
As a historical icon being the oldest tavern in Spain, I feel fortunate to have been able to grab a vermouth here while visiting Madrid. They were very welcoming and the vermut was tasty.

Perfect experience!

Real people, oasis of peace, quietness, tradition and goodwill!

Come by and enjoy some cervezas!

Great dinner, we had huevos rotos to start and then the traditional stew and pork belly. Pork belly was divine. Great selection of wine by the glass too. Service was good even though our table was a bit squashed but considering the old place it was still pleasant.

A friend from Madrid recommended this restaurant to me and he was not wrong! A very nice, intimate place to have dinner. The food was delicious, very traditional, which is what we were looking for. The service was outstanding and very professional as well. Will be back when I‚Äôll visit Madrid in the future!

We had tripe stew with a Spanish omelette. Never have I tasted such a velvety, smooth texture - a truly memorable dish! The spice snail stew was also absolutely excellent also. Mind-blowing to be honest.

Finally, I had the chance to visit this place, a favorite of one of the Philippine National Heroes, Dr. Jose Rizal, and a spot frequented by Ernest Hemingway, who even wrote here.

The food we had was quite good and paired well with the drinks they offered. I just wish the bar incorporated more of its rich history into the menu and perhaps added some stories about its past to the walls, which would make it even more interesting.

We enjoyed some wine‚ÄîRiviera, which had a soft taste, and Madrid, which was stronger, according to their descriptions. Some of the other drinks seemed expensive at EUR 12, but it might be worth trying at least one. For food, we had Gilda Viva Madrid, Taco con carne, and Scallops with ginger‚Äîeverything was delicious, and I savored every bite.

The place offers outdoor, bar, and indoor seating. The indoor area is more suited for eating and drinking, with a great vibe and a perfect spot to hang out with friends.

The service was fast and efficient, and we had no issues.

This place is simply great!

Perfect speak easy but not too quiet and surely you‚Äôll enjiy chatting with your drinking and eating company.  From time to time, you‚Äôll be asked how your food is and if you need any more drinks but in a cery friendly way - thanks Oscar.  He recommended the croquetas and broccoli which is lovely and must try.

All the food we tried didn‚Äôt disappoint.
I‚Äôve tried a few Gilda‚Äôs in San Sebastian and Madrid and this one is definitely on the top of the list. Had a few to make sure üòÇ

Apart from that, the place was established in the 1800s and was frequented by Jose Rizal, national hero of the Philippines. I wonder how good it was before but its nice to see establishments keep the quality, ambience, and service that will make you frequent the place and enjoy their culinary and mixology handiwork.

Loved our visit so much the first time, had to go back again for the Porn Star Martini! Food was good as well and such a good price for the service. Honestly preferred this place over its sister bar Salmon Guru for its cocktails and ambiance.

What an amazing and pleasant place this is. I came here knowing nothing about Madrid, and boy. Was this a wonderful introduction to such a beautiful city. I was able to not only secure a table but also had many delicious cocktails, and there was enough space to have a chat with family from out of town.
One of the best bars I've ever been to. Perfect place to get drinks and snacks in the middle of the day. Not loud or obnoxious, and the historic ambience is wonderfully preserved.

Loved this place. Lively atmosphere. It‚Äôs in a very touristy area but maintains its authenticity. They serve yummy fish tapas. My favorite was the pate de h√≠gado de bacalao. Exquisite! The salad looks good but it was what I enjoyed the least. They also have their very own house wine, a Toro. Surprisingly good! Bonus: the waiter, Alvaro, is hilarious. Makes you feel right at home.

I rarely write reviews, but I love this place so much that I had to share my experience! If you want to enjoy some of the best food in Madrid, visit La Trucha. The restaurant is beautifully decorated, creating a wonderful atmosphere. The staff is exceptionally friendly, and the owner is always present, ensuring everyone is happy. A perfect 10/10!

This place is a most, you need to go and try the amazing and spectacular food, the tapas were great, eggplant with honey and the chicharron were so crunchy and tasty that I have no words to describe it. Love the place, service was excellent.

One of the restaurant we try in Madrid. The tapas are nice but a bit pricey. Overall we are satisfied with the foods we ordered.
Food: 4 stars
Environment: 3 stars
Value for money: 3.5 stars
Worth to try: 3.5 stars

The owner is fantastic! The service was wonderful, decent prices, and busy on a Monday nite even tho we were there pretty early. A good sign! We had garlic shrimp, calamari, Jamon, canap√©s three ways..all delicious! We would definitely return

This is a great little taverna that is away from the crowded tourist streets and restaurants of Madrid.

Be prepared to order in Spanish (which just means reading the menu and pointing when in doubt), as the waitress didn‚Äôt speak much English. This is also a plus in my book, since the place was more patronized by locals.

We had the house salad (Ensalate de Casa) which looks s bit daunting, but is delicious. Just be sure to pair the salty bits, like the anchovies and olives, with the tuna and tomatoes. We were honestly surprised by how well the flavors (tuna belly, tomato, anchovies, green olives, and olive oil) went together.

The chorizo is a must. In many places chorizo can get really salty, but this one was not. Very fresh, juicy, and the perfect amount of heat. Like the salad, the fries that came with the chorizo weren‚Äôt salty and added even more balance to the dish.

We also tried the tripe. It was not at all what we feared. No weird odor or ‚Äúfunk‚Äù to it. Super tender, but unfortunately, way too salty to enjoy even with bread.

We also
The food was amazing - well-cooked, tasty, juicy, and cost-effective. Our server was amicable enough to provide us with suggestions, which we deeply appreciated. Can't wait to be back!

We somehow stumbled into this tapas bar and it impressed us so much. The owner was very efficient and friendly and everything we ordered was great! Especially pleased with the Galatian octopus as it was flavourful and fantastically tender! The iberico cheek was a rare sight on the menu and was a delight to eat with the potato, Demi glaze sauce and bread!

Local tavern with amazing food and good service. The waitress didn't know any english, so she took out some pictures of the food and helped us understand the menu. We had the artichokes with ham and the steak with potatoes and both were out of this world. At the end they gave us two mini magnum icecream bites, which was really appreciated. Definitely recommend!
The lovely wife and I stopped here for some food and were very happy we did. Every single mouthful was delicious
