Came in for a short drink before dinner. Friendly staff with good win selection. However the tomatoes salad was disappointing - It was too salty.

Nonetheless, the decor was interesting with a lion taking center stage.

Stopped here for a glass of wine and some rum on a drizzly January afternoon.  It was very chill and relaxing. The wine was good and the cheese tapa that came with it was superb. And I mean superb cheese. (And I have eaten a lot of cheese in Spain!) Ended up talking to the (new!) owners, who were VERY knowledgeable about their liquors (and the right way to slice a ham and some cheese). I can't say enough about how professional and knowledgeable and kind the owners were. The wine and the rum that I had were at an accessible price (I don't remember exactly, but it couldn't have been more than 4 Euros for a glass of wine and maybe 7 Euros for the mixed drink? Although I'm sure they have fancier stuff, too.)  I will certainly go back there the next time I am in Madrid, and I wish the very best of luck to the new owners!

Traditional Spanish Taverna that openned in 1866 and continues to date. Traditional tapas dishes to relax and escape the summer heat of busy Madrid. Ask for Jamon Ib√©rico, cheese, empanada (galician pastry that can be filled with pretty much anything - meat, fish, apples etc) and get yourself a nice glass of red from Ribera
Traditional, historic, beautifully decorated C19th  tapas bar. Great selection of beer and wine. Friendly and welcoming.
Nice dishes, nice and helpful service, best chocolate cake ! Good wine and top location. Thanks a lot :)

I visited an amazing restaurant in Madrid specializing in Spanish cuisine, and I was completely blown away!

The restaurant features marvelous dishes from various regions of Spain, with each dish being a true work of art. I especially loved the octopus and the salmon, which were simply exquisite!

The wine selection is also excellent, ensuring that everyone can find something to suit their taste.

The atmosphere of the restaurant is incredibly cozy and warm, creating the perfect setting to enjoy food and company.

The staff was not only professional but also very friendly, always ready to assist and provide recommendations.

Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking to savor the true flavors of Spain in a beautiful setting!

A restaurant in Madrid that offered the best service and hospitality. Thanks to their kind explanations and thoughtful wine recommendations, I was able to enjoy the experience in complete comfort. The food was humble in the style of Spanish home cooking, highlighting the natural flavors of the ingredients while warming the soul. Everything was absolutely delicious, especially the chicken and fish dishes. It‚Äôs a pity that I couldn‚Äôt fully enjoy the meal due to fatigue from jet lag during dinner. I‚Äôd love to visit again when I‚Äôm in better condition to savor the food and wine to the fullest!

Excellent menu. Food was fantastic with fresh flavors and creativity. The leek is their famous dish and it is a must order. I tried all the seafood dishes because they conveniently offered me half portions. Servers spoke English as well as Spanish. The dessert was excellent and I finished the meal with an excellent espresso.

The owner greeted me and presented the menu with passion and enthusiasm. The experience was exquisite. Bravo!

Morat√≠n is a hidden gem that truly deserves recognition. From the moment you step through the door, you're greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere. Marcos, the owner,  is a consummate host, ensuring that every guest feels welcome and valued. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly, and always ready to assist with menu recommendations.

But it's the food that truly sets Morat√≠n apart. Each dish is a masterpiece, crafted with fresh, high-quality ingredients and a passion for flavour. Whether you're craving a classic comfort food or something more adventurous, you're sure to find something to tantalize your taste buds. Morat√≠n is a must-visit for anyone seeking a truly memorable dining experience.

Seems all I can do is reiterate many of the other positive reviews! One of best meals in Madrid, which given how amazing the food is in this city, is high praise. Was a wonderful lunchtime dining experience with the food and service impeccable. And this is a vinoteca so we tasted some of the 30 wines they are serving at any one time. We came to try the veal on the menu but were happily distracted with four other amazing dishes. Guess we have to go back. Oh well.

You want a good place to eat to enjoy the perfect Madrid summer air? This place is so perfect! The food is the best in town! The location is in a quiet and nice street! You have to sit outside!!! But if you sit inside, you‚Äôll find a super cool 1920s aesthetic! Take a picture sin the bathroom because the walls are so cool!  The staff is friendly and extremely attentive! YOU HAVE TO HAVE THE MUSSELS!!! The sangria is 10/10 and the beer is cold and delicious!
The specials are affordable and amazing quality!

The food, the attention, the ambiance. Couldn‚Äôt be more perfect. It really worth the price.

P.D. You really have to give it a try to the ‚ÄúMagret de Pato‚Äù, is just magic in a pan.
This was a nice little gem that we stumbled upon. The food was amazing! The service was excellent.
We sat down but nobody came to take our order and we left

Incredible place!
Amazing food, stunning attention and service!
One of the best place ever!
I‚Äôll repeat it without thinking!
The truffle pasta and the meat a must have üëåüèª!

I was told this pizzeria was super delicious, and it was right!!!
I was alone and ordered ‚Äúpizza de las casa‚Äù and a ‚Äútinto de verano‚Äù, it was a fantastic meal, and even there was only one pizzaiolo in the kitchen and the restaurant was quite full at the moment I arrived, the service was quite fast.
Really good experience!
Will come back üòé
Awesome services and foods but summer red is a bit disappointing
Great visit, lovely pizza and fantastic service from staff.
Great vibes. Great service. Very friendly and fun staff. Great gluten free pizza options!
Just wanted to confirm for any tourists that the restaurant is closed for the summer and reopens on the 27th of August 2024, as you can see on the website‚Äôs reservations page

For me this is the MUST STOP place during el rastro walking for sure, all their tostas are so tasty and there s so many to choose from I couldn‚Äôt yet try them all, but eventually I will! Great price over quality, and lovely treatment by a forever smiling host, don‚Äôt be afraid of the line, it goes fast! Highly recommended

I was lucky to arrive a few minutes before the crowds started! Delicious food and efficient service.
Also affordable!

Having tried several "tostas" spots around the Rastro Market area, this one stands out as my absolute favorite. Be prepared for a long wait in line, but it's definitely worth it. Make sure to have extra napkins handy because the toasts are generously loaded and juicy. The Russian salad one is particularly amazing.

Solid, no nonsense¬†sandwiches for a fair price close to El Rastro.¬† You can get it to go or at the bar(which gets busy on¬†Sundays!). It's a family business, and a couple of the family members are funny and hilarious, which adds one more star to my review :)
Came at 1pm on a Saturday afternoon. No lineup. Got the octopus tostado which was good

This was the worst food I‚Äôve ever eaten in Spain. Even the tourists do not deserve this food and service. The food was cold, bland and old. They also seem completely oblivious serving this disgraceful food. Places like this need to be called out. I do not leave many bad reviews but I had to on this occasion.

This place could be a typical tourist tapas restaurant. However, it is pleasant, and the food is of good quality. I must say that the highlight of this place was the waiter‚Äîa Brazilian guy with an incredible level of professionalism and charisma. He was attentive to all customers equally, offering exceptional service. We were impressed by his kindness, thoughtful suggestions, speed, and sharp memory. If I owned a restaurant, I would definitely try to steal this employee!

Very cozy place in a cool neighborhood. Cheap prices for drinks and great food.   Both indoor and outdoor seatings with appetizers with sangria.

And the sangria is quite strong too and really good so we came back.

Can highly recommend üôãüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

The salmon salad was great with almost as much salmon as salad. Very impressed.

Service is where this restaurant stood out. The food was pretty decent and the location was central. The easy-going and fun demeanor of the waiter made it shine, however. Definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in Madrid for a bit longer.

We bumped into this little place while strolling around the centre of Madrid. We stopped for dinner and had an amazing time from the beginning to the end! Service was quick and attentive. We ordered several tapas style dishes (though portions were quite big!) and all of them were so tasty & flavourful! I particularly loved the red pepper dish with tuna on top - delicious! We appreciated the ham starter they brought us with our drinks as well! Overall, a great experience! I would definitely recommend visiting this place when in Madrid - you are going to have a wonderful experience!

Talk about a fabulous traditional Madrile√±o dining experience. The hustle and bustle of the dining room, surrounded by history. I wanted my first time having ‚ÄúCocido Madrile√±o‚Äù to be authentic. Malacat√≠n delivered. My husband and I each had ‚ÄúNuestro famoso Cocido Madrile√±o.‚Äù It‚Äôs 25‚Ç¨ / Persona and no you can‚Äôt share one. Be prepared for the massive portion, so go hungry. I have pictured all the various foods that come with the order. You basically create the stew of your choosing or put everything in the broth at once, which I believe is the true way to eat it. It was divine üòã

One of the best meals we had during our trip to Spain. The restaurant is very authentic and has such a long history. Luckily we made a reservation in advance and when we arrived around 7pm all the tables were booked. The stew was simply great with a lot of dishes and generous portion. I can‚Äôt have enough of it, will sure come back next time we are in Madrid.

This is one place you must visit to live the whole traditional food experience from Madrid. Cocido Madrile√±o at its best, perfect traditional atmosphere and the legacy of a 100+ year old restaurant. Booking a table is difficult as there‚Äôs many people looking for one, but you can do the line for a place at the counter (aprox 40 mins) and live the same experience plus asking nice tapas and tasting the Cocido Madrile√±o. Don‚Äôt miss this place!

Great service considering not everyone in Madrid speaks English, but our waitress spoke at least Spanish, English and French. She explained everything on the menu and especially the highlight, the "cocido", one of the traditional dishes of Madrid, a very rich soup made from broths along with chickpeas, potatoes and of course a selection of different meats. We also tried the oxtail which was very tasty. A few good wines are also available. Definitely make a reservation or you might be upset.

We were seated at a "quick meal" area (did not reserve for lunch), so this review is based on that. Food was ok. Nothing spectacular. Simple fare for a quick lunch. Decor has a lot of character - Church out my photos. Service was friendly although communicating in English was a challenge. Prices point was reasonable. Overall it was an ok experience.

We got there at 8:19pm on a march friday night and already there were about 10 people lined up.  Pretty much everyone that got there by 8:25pm or so got a table as they do have a rather large seating area.  You can preview the menu outside their front door while you wait.  Two of us had the fancier 32E 2 course meal, and another had the more simple 16E 3 course meal.  For apps we had the house made croquettes, battered eggplant, and cooked chard (actually tasty).  Comes with rather dry table bread.  For mains my T bone steak had a nice crust and had decent seasoning, but for a steak barely 1.5 cm thick, the insides were almost raw.  The quality of the steak was also quite poor.  Lamb chops were very thin (under 1cm) but tasted good and were cooked all the way thru.  My wife had the tripe dish served stew like but it was way overcooked and mushy (I like a bit of chew in my tripe).  The fries were hot but not quite crispy enough for my liking.  For dessert we had a cooked banana with whipped cream and chocolate.  Wine was the bottle shown in my photo, which tasted like a cheap red wine that I would use for cooking.  Overall a quick and hearty meal with large portions and affordable, but don't expect expertly prepared dishes to come to your table.

A part of me didn't want to leave this review because I don't wish this place becomes touristy and lose it's charm. So if you're going just going quietly without sharing all over the Internet.

The restaurant has many 3-course-meal packages to select and each of them has many choices. The local food served were tasty. The waiter are very attentive, although they don't speak very good English, but they're very friendly.

My wife and I had a dinner with 36 euros, that's very cheap isn't it?! Too bad we didn't have second chance to come back and taste other menu during our trip.

Arrived at 3pm, seated by 320pm. Noticeable patronage by return customers. Tasty food at reasonable prices. Stopped accepting customers by 430pm.  Grilled John Dory was good, so was fried anchovies, potato stew, and pork ribs, but the double eggs with ham and fries came with soggy fries. Creamed rice and apple cake were nice, but creamed custard tasted bland

It was a very cosy warm dining experience with a starters, main and dessert and a glass of wine all at only 16 euros per person! The food is okay but the experience , the vibe was amazing despite the staff speaking only limited English. Their homemade custard is a must try!!

A little local secret that has a lot of return customers. Excellent menu del dia at ‚Ç¨16 for local patrons. Truly value for money. A good experience for travelers who want to try a typical yet generous menu del dia.  Wide options from starters, to main, and then dessert.  Great attention from Joan and all the service team.

Great experience! They were very helpful with the food selection and drink selections!
We had the Lamb Shin and the Monk fish, both were really good! The lamb was so tender and most! ü§§ü§§
The wines were fantastic and as usual, very affordable!
Going back for lunch to try the ox tail and other items!

If you're a serious foodie, you might want to consider my opinion

The tripe stew (callos a la madrile√±a) was stellar and a must try. It's not just tripe theres also pig skin and tendons all for a great collagen mess. All were reduced to mad sticky goodness and for someone who loves tripe, this is the stickiest stew I've had. Yes it's on the mild side but it goes w the free olives. Also, because it's so full of collagen it's really quite surfeiting after half a plate and I recommend you share this dish

Rice pudding had a nice aroma from orange zest and good crunch from the sugar but otherwise it was average

On the other hand, the eggs are really not it for the price. Yes it's good, it's tender and there's a nice aroma from the olive oil but there's no way you should pay 15‚Ç¨ for eggs and chips. That's crazy and the taste wasn't memorable

The oxtail stew was also good but not great. They got it to be very tender and fall off the bone, but it's not cooked in a sauce and so it's quite mild.

They were super nice to share a slice of jamon w me. It's got good complexity

If you come, come for the tripe stew which is a must try, and don't take other risks. Maybe the jamon only if u must

The food and services were very good. We ordered a stew oxtail and a roasted suckling pig. The oxtail is excellent. The suckling pig had crunchy skin. The waiter is friendly. Just a bit longer than usual wait for the suckling pig. Overall experience is great. Recommend.

There‚Äôs nothing better than stepping into a place where you can truly experience traditional food. After a long time, we finally went back to Casa Lucio, and I have to say, it was refreshing to get that comforting, home-cooked feel. The food was light, fresh, and flavorful, and the dessert had just the right amount of sweetness to finish the meal perfectly.

It had that homemade touch that‚Äôs hard to find. When I go back, this is definitely a place I‚Äôll revisit.

I def give this a 8/10! üßÄüç∑ü¶êüá™üá∏
Classic spot, excellent food all around. Service is great and you definitely have to try huevos estrallados and rabo de toro!

We spent our final night in Spain at this restaurant and it was amazing! The view is breathtaking! The food was really good, wine was excellent and the service was top notch! We had reservations for dinner so we sat ‚Äòinside‚Äô but the walls weee glass so it didn‚Äôt obstruct our views at all and we were protected from the cold and wind.

We went to the terace roof top - the view on Madrid is amazing, however you should pay for the entrance ticket 5 EUR, kids 4 EUR, small kids free.

The bar itself is really nice, nice view, furniture, music.

Menu has a limited choice. If you are with kids probably nothing they will eat. Prices are quite high - small Coke 5 EUR.

However service‚Ä¶OMG‚Ä¶if management of staff reads this please remind your members of staff to be somewhat polite to customers and be less arrogant as they work there.

I have never been to this rooftop, I think it is a hype place to be in Madrid. Gorgeous for pics.

I don‚Äôt think there are any changing tables for babies.
The view is SIMPLY THE BEST in Al of Madrid. The drinks are good, the service is good, the food is good... Bit the view is spectacular! Most make a reservation via their WhatsApp.

A very attractive bar restaurant in a prime area in central Madrid.
The food offer was good and surprisingly cheap for the overall offer and quality provided.
I have a mixed fried veggie roll of sort which was excellent. My wife had a salmon and salad plate, which she was very happy with.
I was pleased the way they served cafe con leche I.e. put the milk in in front of us so we could control how much milk was added.
It is somewhere we would go back to.

I loved this place! Two important notes to take !!! Very windy , they don‚Äôt offer blanket and heaters don‚Äôt work, its actually very cold and windy, dress properly, there is entrance fee of $6 Euro per person to go up there, cocktails are more expensive around $13 euro each, they don‚Äôt have actual main course , they offer small size snacks , 7-8 items but they are yummy , service is really fast as they come and leave fast due to wind and cold weather, but i definitely recommend it , amazing vibe good music perfect view! 100% it‚Äôs worth it

Marcelo is the best, great experience
Fully recommended
Marcelo is the best bartender!
Beautiful views and a super pleasant atmosphere. Laila, Kenya, Cristina, Emma‚Ä¶ all wonderful, we will return

We love this terrace, in the heart of Madrid. The views are wonderful, incredible cocktails, we met it thanks to the GEX experience team Cristina and Edu, spectacular treatment. And highlight the work of the mixologists and waiters, Kenya, Laila, Rosita and Emma. A TOP SITE.
An oasis in the center of Madrid, unexpectedly, has been a success. Rooftop with unbeatable views. Marcelo has prepared us a fantastic cocktail and always with a smile, highly recommended!!
Fun in the sun with my number one. Lovely terrace with delicious cocktails. Great vibe on a sunny Sunday afternoon. Arrive around opening (3pm on Sunday) for a prime table.

I recently visited La Terraza de Oscar, and our experience was made truly memorable thanks to our fantastic waiter, Andres. From the moment we sat down, Andres was attentive, warm, and incredibly knowledgeable about the menu. He recommended a few cocktails that turned out to be perfect for the mood and the beautiful rooftop setting. Andres was patient and friendly, answering our questions with genuine enthusiasm, which made us feel very welcomed and appreciated. His service was prompt but never rushed, and he made sure we had everything we needed throughout the evening. It‚Äôs rare to come across such dedicated and personable staff, and Andres truly elevated our experience. Highly recommend a visit ‚Äì ask for Andres if you can!

Really nice place to watch the sunset while the others are overbooked. We got there at 8ish and we could get a table for 4.
Had to remind one of the waitresses many times about the bottle of water we had ordered.
Sth to improve. There were only 4 things to order to eat.

On my last night in Madrid, my friends and I came here (a few days ago) to grab a few drinks, enjoy a great view of the city, and watch the sunset. We came here before the evening rush, so we did not have to wait, and we stayed in the lobby before they opened, so we skipped that part. The service was alright, and the drinks were so good and strong! It was worth every euro, especially with the matching view. I highly recommend this place during your visit to Madrid.

We are on the terrace on October 30, 2024, it had rained yesterday and we sat on the sofa and everything was wet, and we got our clothes wet. It seems that they never check and clean the terraces, it has been terrible. Never come back

Relaxed rooftop bar and restaurant with great views of Plaza Callao and Los Cuatro Torres. You will be charged 12 euros per person upon exiting the elevator and given a receipt with a QR code. You can then use this as a voucher towards whatever you spend at the bar. Nice to meet up with friends without music blasting.

Nice rooftop i Gran via. Entrance 12‚Ç¨ with drink and you choose to stay inside or outside. Drinks were good but the Hugo was a bit watered down. In the complex you can definitely go and have a calm and relaxed evening
Great spot and wonderful views.  DJ on roof bar.  It was cold up there but it was early hours and Winter so to be expected.  Restaurant on 10th floor served lovely food & we had great service

Nice and cute place with separate bar on the top with a nice view. You have to pay ‚Ç¨12 ‚Äûdeposit‚Äù for entrance which you can use at the bar and get drinks.
Food was delicious too. The slow cooked veal cheek is a must have, it‚Äôs so tender!

Great view and great food.
An experience that you need to try when in Madrid.
I recommend making a reservation in advance.
Food: starters were great (burratta, octopus). Main dish (fish, ribs) was average. Terrace view great. Service poor (group of 10 and no attention, we had to refill wine ourselves)

Such a good place!
I mean look at this view‚Ä¶

We couldn‚Äôt stay long because it was windy and cold, but we will definitely come back!

Perfect for drinks while seeing the sunset.

we had to wait until we could have our table, the atmosphere was actually pretty good. I don‚Äôt know if it is because there were lot of people but it took time for our waiter to come. When it was time to eat, they have given us the bread ( which we didn‚Äôt order) which was pretty good BUT we had to pay for it ??? They didn‚Äôt even ask if we wanted bread or not ?

The rooftop was full but it was good vibes, there was music, lot of people were dancing. We had fun.

Would skip on this bar/restaurant if you‚Äôre in Madrid.

Upon arrival we waited another 20 minutes for our table. We were finally seated and ordered our food and drinks. It took 30 minutes for our appetizers to come out (bread was very stale, but apps were okay) and another 40 minutes for our main dishes (which were cold and not great).

Service was extremely slow - felt like they forgot about us and prioritized other tables. It would take long for servers to get back to us (for water, sauces, removing plates). Would not recommend. Has a nice view from the rooftop bar though.

The restaurant and the rooftop are great, one of the best we visited in Madrid. It has stunning views over Gran Via, but the food was absolutely awful. The service was not good also. We reserved a table for the rooftop and when we entered they told us thar you must go and eat in the restaurant then you get access to the rooftop bar, while our primary goal was to go up and drink cocktails. We weren‚Äôt hungry at all.

Incredible view, interesting interior design, great food and service. 6 stars!!
Cristian and Patricia make sure breakfast is fantastic.  They were great with the kids and made them feel welcome in a top level restaurant where kids are often out of place.
Views from the terrace are great.
Even overheard us talking about a birthday and brought a small surprise without us asking.

We will return!

Food was great. Atmosphere is really nice and lively. It was strange to get charged a 12 euro service charge to eat there. I wish I knew it went to the staff. Glad it goes to the great waiters and waitresses.

We had a fantastic dinner at Dani Brasserie in Madrid, on the rooftop of the Four Seasons Hotel, where we were booked for a couple of days. The food was amazing, and the staff were very friendly and professional. Our waiter, Rabbi, was excellent he took great care of us, helped us choose the best dishes, and his recommendations were perfect. It was a very special evening that added to the overall wonderful experience of our stay, and we highly recommend it!‚Äù

The terrace and a views are just breathtaking! But rather recommend to go there for a drink and maybe a tapas because the food was not great. I had ravioli with a truffle cream witch was okay but nothing special, but my friend ordered lobster pasta and was very disappointed - pasta was dry and not saucy as all, couple of shrimps on top and a tiny piece of lobster‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt recommend if.

Roof top bar on the 4 seasons hotel. View is great, nice atmosphere and not overcrowded. Don‚Äôt come here if you expect to save money. The prices are a bit high, but that‚Äôs absolutely fine if you looking for a spot that is not overcrowded and where you don‚Äôt need to queue. Cappuccino was 11 euro.

One of the coolest place in Madrid for a cocktail and rooftop atmosphere. Great service also even during the holidays in May.

Food is not the best, but we loved it there.

This Hotel Vinci, with a spectacular entrance, has a very cool terrace with a "party van" where they prepare your cocktails.

The prices of the mixed drinks are usually around ‚Ç¨12 or ‚Ç¨15, like in the rest of the places, but the soft drinks and beers are excessive... don't drink a non-alcoholic beer, it's not worth it!!!
A charming and relaxed rooftop, perfect for enjoying a few drinks and delicious bites. Vibrant atmosphere, good music and an ideal environment to disconnect.

The letter is not very extensive. The place is cozy and quiet. We were having dinner and it was just us in the living room. The correct service. I think I will return because being in the middle of Gran V√≠a it is an oasis of tranquility

Totally recommended!!! A terrace very well decorated in every sense.
The cocktails are very original and well prepared, the staff who serve at all times are very charming and friendly.
We will return without a doubt

All Tourists: listen to this review.   THIS IS A TOURIST TRAP.  Took over 40 min to get 1 draft beer.  Horrible service and no redeeming features.  View isn‚Äôt what the website makes it out to be, and you will be taken advantage of.  Good luck ordering and receiving a drink here.  Better bring a book.

Fantastic hotel. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. The bar was cute. The gym was fully furnished and incredibly clean.  Did not eat in the restaurant but it was very pretty. The hotel as a whole is very beautiful. Walking distance to many things.

Wow, Wow what a hidden gem!!. This roof top bar was brilliant with a fabulous Vibe and great views of the sunset. Get there early so you can get the best tables. We didn't eat but the drinks were good and three glasses of Cava were 18 Euros with some complimentary nibbles.
Drinks are a bit expensive, but if you're able to get there for sunset it is quite spectacular! The hotel staff are sweet as well and you can usually access the terrace for free!
Very rude staff, completely ignored us. Don't recommend

Fantastic view of the city, particularly at the sunset, but the service was incredibly slow, and our aperol spritz was terrible. Together with the drinks, we received gummies üò± instead of chips or savoury snacks!!! I would not return there.

My local friend was showing me new places to try in Madrid. And he took me there to have a drink. It's an amazing rooftop bar and restaurant in the city. The location is very central. Only a few minutes away from Sol. The place is so beautiful. It has a great view over Madrid in addition to an amazing garden and a waterfall.  The service was excellent and the drinks were amazing. The prices were good for the location. I highly recommend it.
We were at rooftop bar. Beautiful views, quick and friendly service. We did not order any food just drinks. Place was perfect to relax during our stroll on grand via.

It's for the view - Simply Wonderful !
Min cover charge of ‚Ç¨5 perfectly reasonable.
Pricey on the cocktails but terrific views and a multi level roof top bar with a pool!

My new favourite bar in Madrid. All of the cocktails are unique and thoughtful. The staff are super friendly, fluent in English, and intuitively strike the perfect balance of ensuring you‚Äôre served but leaving you to relax at the same time. We overindulged and tried nearly the whole cocktail menu and don‚Äôt regret a thing. Worth every cent!

Great atmosphere and location, amazing smiling bartenders both the guy and the girl. Drinks were excellent and i had the chance to try them at Sips in Barcelona as well.  I‚Äôll definitely come back if in Madrid again.
Great experience, super friendly and supportive team, location is very good. Certainly recommend and would come back
We came here for drinks and it was absolutely fantastic experience. The interior is just right, trust me!

Fancy and stylish cocktail bar, perfect for a date or an hang out spots with friends or business partners. The design is fancy but curated and light. Cocktails are very well done and don‚Äôt miss the fun element with their interesting cup shape or unusual presentations. Will definitely be back

Posh and luxurious bar in The Madrid EDITION. The drinks were great and the service was fantastic. Lacked atmosphere but it was early in the evening when I was there and I know they have DJs that come which would enhance the atmosphere! Cool spot!

Very nice room with a very good ambiance. A DJ with soft music and excellent cocktails.
The waiter attending us was great and we had a super experience !
I recommend !
Cool, cozy and boozy cocktails. This punch rooms brings the vibes in the best way possible. The DJ spun some dope beats too. This cocktail bar blends in well with the Edition in Madrid!

Absolutely great concept. Cosy atmosphere, original cocktails prepared with lot of attention and served into punch jars. Cherry on the cake extremely attentive waiter taking time to explain everything and sharing his passion. Really a great moment.
the place is really cute but very instagramy, so if thats not your vibe.. also the bathrooms were not good for selfies
Can get quite busy during peak times but the drinks, food and friendly service is top notch.  The atmosphere is great especially when DJ‚Äôs are spinning.
Incredibly rude service, whilst also being aggressive to our group. If you are looking for a roof top bar whilst staying in Madrid or a place to host an event, I would recommend going somewhere else.

Perfect night!
Great service, food and atmosphere, will definitely come back
Great food and atmosphere! Fun match night! Amazing tacos.
Great vibe yesterday, what a match!

Terrible Experience ‚Äì Avoid at All Costs!

We visited Azotea Forus Barcel√≥ as a group, expecting a nice dinner with drinks, appetizers, and main courses. Unfortunately, this turned out to be one of the worst dining experiences we‚Äôve ever had.

We ordered tartare (both steak and salmon) as an appetizer, but all we could taste was mustard. Almost immediately after eating, we started feeling unwell. Even before we had finished our appetizers, the staff rushed to serve our main courses and began clearing plates while some of us were still eating.

The main courses were even worse. The so-called ‚Äúpizza‚Äù had barely a drop of tomato sauce, making it completely dry and tasteless. The quesadilla consisted of nothing but dry chicken‚Äîno seasoning, no sauce, nothing. The pasta was the only thing remotely edible, but that‚Äôs hard to mess up.

When they came to take our plates, we immediately told them the food was terrible. Instead of addressing the issue, four staff members, none of whom spoke a word of English, became visibly annoyed and defensive. We tried to find a solution, requesting a partial discount due to the awful food, but we were left waiting for 20 minutes with no response.

Using Google Translate, we attempted to explain our concerns politely. However, the staff refused to listen, remained arrogant, and even threatened to call the police while glaring at us. After 40 minutes of frustration, we gave up and paid the full bill for the worst food and service we‚Äôve ever experienced.

As if the experience wasn‚Äôt bad enough, four out of six people in our group vomited after leaving, and three ended up with food poisoning.

This place is a disaster. Terrible food, rude and unprofessional service, and zero accountability. Do yourself a favor and stay far away!

STAY AWAY from the eggs Benedict. They don‚Äôt know how to make them. We came in for brunch and most of us ordered eggs Benedict and we didn‚Äôt even touch them. They served us raw eggs and it was absolutely disgusting. I don‚Äôt know how someone can actually send something like that from their kitchen to customers. Such a disgrace and we each had to pay 21‚Ç¨ ‚Ä¶ there were 10 of us.

Fantastic Roof top place - awesome for a laid back brunch, dinner or drinks. Service is good, but could be improved. The staff need to be more attentive. Food is good, the brunch menu is really good and very well priced. Good place for kids too. It isn't as open as other roof top places in Madrid, and maybe that's why it isn't as crowded. We booked in advance and were given our table immediately.

DO NOT GO HERE IN THE WEEKENDS. We got the WORST food ever. Drinks were fine. Service ok, really rude towards the end. Starters were ok but CRAZY amounts of mustard. Main dishes were trash and overpriced. Asked to not pay for the pizzas and quesedilla‚Äôs which were almost barely eaten. Most plain pizza‚Äôs/quesedillas for that price. Our friend got sick so we tried to come with a solution. They threathened us in the end by calling the police after saying it was not possible that we didnt like it and they were NOT thinking with us. The food was so bad I had to write my first review ever (and probably last)
Amazing avocado toast. Very tasty coffee. Good scenery. Affordable menu. Only negative is that the staff didn't speak much English and there isn't much of a view as expected.

Amazing rooftop!
El Jardin isn‚Äôt about the view‚Äîit‚Äôs all about the vibes. The atmosphere is lively and inviting, perfect for a relaxed evening with friends. The drinks are top-notch, with a creative selection that caters to all tastes. What really stands out is the staff: super friendly and attentive, making you feel right at home.

If you‚Äôre looking for a rooftop with great energy, excellent cocktails, and amazing service, this is the spot. Highly recommended!

El Jard√≠n de Diana is the perfect spot to unwind with family and friends while enjoying Madrid's night sky. Located on Gran V√≠a, this rooftop bar offers a relaxed atmosphere, an affordable menu, and stunning panoramic views of the city. The menu features a range of Mediterranean and Spanish-inspired dishes, from tasty bar bites and grilled meats to refreshing signature cocktails.

For those who don‚Äôt drink alcohol or have allergies, El Jard√≠n de Diana also offers a fantastic selection of mocktails. These non-alcoholic beverages are just as creative and flavorful, with vibrant, fruit-forward drinks and refreshing herbal infusions. Whether you‚Äôre there for a casual evening with loved ones or a special occasion, this charming spot provides the perfect setting to relax and enjoy the beautiful views.

Jard√≠n de Diana in Madrid is a stunning rooftop gem! With breathtaking views of the city and a stylish ambiance, it‚Äôs the perfect spot for drinks and relaxing moments. The cocktails are expertly crafted, and the menu offers delightful options to complement the experience. The attention to detail and friendly service make it even more special. Highly recommend for anyone seeking a memorable evening in Madrid!

The rooftop bar is giving. You have options to stay inside but still you can see the view and also outside with the amazing view and atmosphere. The service is also very good, one of the waiter, Dennis accommodated us really nice and showed us the perfect spot for us to see the view.

The hotel is really nice and in a good location. The terrace is nice with decent views. The food is good but the service can improve. I tried the explorer menu and the gnocchis were tasty, especially the sauce and the waffle was delicious! Freshly made and crunchy on the outside. Reminded me of a churro.

We had been able to experience my partners birthday at this rooftop, and I cannot explain how much we enjoyed it!

All the waiterss had been absolutely amazing, and they truly made our night with their kindness.

They sadly did not had any coctails tonight, however, I can recommend Aperol Spiritz, that was absolutely perfect:)

The view (but especially the sunset) was truly amazing, and absolutely took our breath away.

I truly recommend this rooftop, if you want a great view at Grand via :)

Really nice rooftop where you only pay what you consume, no entry fee!

It does get very busy sometimes so one of the times we went (Saturday evening) we had to wait in line for a while.

Nice atmosphere with music, string lights, and decorations.

The waiters in general are nice, smiley and friendly but on more than one occasion the service was a bit slow, even to pay the bill we had to ask a couple of times as they kept forgetting to bring it over, and it was what seemed a relaxed evening.

One downside was that if you‚Äôre not in the covered area of the rooftop (under the tapestry) it does get a bit cold if there‚Äôs some wind, the heat lamps were mainly under the shaded area.

Cocktails where always good when I went with friends, we never tried the food but it smelled great.

Apart from these two disadvantages I recommend this place, prices are what they are, but you‚Äôre also paying for a cocktail on a rooftop in Gran Via, so it‚Äôs understandable.

Filter for recent reviews!!! If this is, skip this place and try somewhere else! We waited 45 minutes (about 10 were ahead of us) to get up and then got no service for another 15!!! I literally had to stand up to get our servers attention (apparently they were short staffed)‚Ä¶ finally took our order but would not take our food order because he said he couldn‚Äôt (I guess with his device)‚Ä¶. Okay great, more time to wait with not even our food order taken! Then out of five drinks they only brought out my vermouth, ten minutes later, came another three and another ten minutes later the fifth drink!!! This is an absolute DO NOT Do when friends are trying to enjoy a rooftop and drinks together‚Ä¶ then when the ‚Äúloaded‚Äù nachos came, let‚Äôs just say, they were not loaded‚Ä¶. Pretty much just the chips on top had the good stuff, other than that you are just eating plain Doritos lol! It was a disappointment. This all being said the drinks were tasty, but we wouldn‚Äôt go again.

In the Madrid centre, it is a nice rooftop, not too complicated to reach where reservation is recommended but not needed. We didn't reserve and waited about 10' to go up.
The place is nicely arranged and decorated. In summer there are sprinklers spraying a nice mist to alleviate the heat. Personnel are kind and service is swift.
The cocktails we had were really good!
The view is nice, and prices are average.
Recommended

good rooftop bar, nothing special. the view is nice and the drinks are good and cheap. the vibe is more laid back and i liked the comfortable couch seating. they had a good selection of drinks to choose from and they were pretty good. for free entry + good drinks + comfortable seating + nice view: this bar is worth it.
Best find of our 2 month trip in France and Spain!  Fantastic views, food, service. Great recommendations from Sebastian. If you are in Madrid, definitely try this place!

The view is amazing!
Great service and atmosphere.
Delisious food.
You can eat and after that drink coctails in the bar with DJ live music plaing.
We've visited the Sky bar and restourant 2 times during our stay in Madrid.

This restaurant in Madrid is amazing! It was my first time there, and both the waiters and the food were outstanding. I ordered the tenderloin steak, and it was incredibly delicious. The view is also spectacular. I highly recommend it!
An amazing restaurant with a beautiful terrace! They have delicious spicy salmon rolls , other dishes are really good too. Prices are not that high for the class of the places

One of a nice rooftops to visit in Madrid! I would recommend to go there during the day as well as during the night to see a great view from the top! They make nice drinks up there! Might happen that the place will be super coursed and you will not get a place to sit, you might even not enter there as you need to wait for the elevator to go up and‚Ä¶ if you want to be sure you have a place I would book it in advance or give a try very late at night.
Terrible. Says they are 24/7 and they are only open during summer. They are closed! But they don‚Äôt tell you that. Save your uber and taxi dollars!!

Very nice place to relax and drink a beer. There's beds by the pool and it has a nice atmosphere üòé

Non-guests can only stay on certain days when it's not full (I'm not a guest and thought that's fair enough)

The Sky Roof Top Terrace sits on top of the NYX hotel and includes a cosy and small roof top bar with super friendly staff and good cocktails. If the weather is good, you can probably also have a refreshing bath in the pool. The rooftop feeling is good, the view however is just ok, since the bar is located at the 8th floor - one can mainly see the Torre Picasso.
Absolutely perfect
Good place to have something to relax but without views and somewhat small. Normal-high prices (star glass ‚Ç¨5)

A Must-Visit Breakfast Spot in Madrid!
The panoramic view of the city is simply breathtaking, making it an ideal spot to enjoy your morning coffee. But it's not just the view that makes this place special. The menu offers a wide selection of tasty and healthy breakfast options. What sets this coffee shop apart is their commitment to keeping prices reasonable without compromising on quality. So, if you're in Madrid and looking for a breakfast spot that ticks all the boxes - great view, exceptional service, tasty healthy food, and reasonable prices - make sure to visit this hidden gem.

There are many choices for food and drink. You can have hamburgers, pizza, tapas, steaks and many more, but the ambiance isn't great. Too many people, the tables don't get cleaned and the staff is rude. As I couldn't find any of the staff, I had cleaned my own table leaving the dishes at the stall they had and the waiter thanked me and told me that he would do it. Although, when I left later one dish at another table that wasn't clean for the staff to pick up, he came to me and reprimanded me in Spanish. If I did something wrong, I don't think that, as a client, I deserve to be scolded. It is a behavior that you don't get in my country (Greece) and in general nowhere where you are a client.

We had cocktails at "one cocktail baby". Maria was the most amazing! Truly taking her time to go through all the steps to make  a great cocktail. Can't  speak highly enough for her.   Top of dept store. Again Maria is the best!

This place is Spain‚Äôs answer to Eataly. It‚Äôs on the roof of this fabulous department store where you can shop for gourmet food items and choose from about 10 different little restaurants with their own specialties. I went to the one with different meats. For an appetizer I had croquettes with 3 different flavours. All were excellent. My lean cut of beef was cooked medium rare to perfection and finished with fleur de sel and came with roast potatoes. I drank an excellent rioja to go with this meal.

For dessert I moved to the gelato place and had mango and limone gelato. So flavourful!

Before I left, I caught the beautiful sunset over Madrid from the outdoor rooftop eating area. Beautiful! This place was full of people of all ages enjoying the food.
Fantastic views of the city  from the top of El Corte Ingles. Has an outside terrace and a great atmosphere, plenty of choice of shops, bars and restaurants.

Outsiders not welcome

As Americans spending some time in Madrid, we were offended and disappointed by a hotel chain that has always surprised us with its extreme customer service in every corner of the world: Four Seasons.

This weekend, taking advantage of the fact that we were passing by the Four Seasons Hotel in Madrid, we decided to go in and have a coffee. From the beginning we felt unwelcome:

- They took a long time to serve us, we had to call someone to come and get us.
- The waiter came and the first thing he asked us was the room number of the hotel, we told him we were not staying there and he quickly changed his attitude.
- He brought us the American coffee and tea we had ordered. It was to be expected that because of the place (and the price, almost 30 euros) they would be served with the appropriate teapot and a pitcher of water for the Americano. But no, everything was served directly in the cups. By the way, the smallest American coffee I have ever had.
- As soon as we finished our drinks, the waiter came over and asked us if he could take everything away, as if he was in a hurry for us to leave.

So that's what we did, we left with the idea of never going back to that place again. Such an attitude and service made us think that maybe the hotel cafeteria is only for guests, but then they should say so from the beginning.

An unfortunate experience in a hotel chain that is known for its elegance and kindness. Sincerely, anywhere in the world except except in Madrid.

El Patio, the lobby bar of the Four Seasons Madrid

The majestic and chic lobby bar was once the operations courtyard of the Banco Espa√±ol de Cr√©dito.

Now it is a luxury place for meetings, see friends, enjoy an Afternoon Tea or at this wonderful Christmas time a Festive Tapas Experience.

The Tapas experience is an interesting journey with various classic Spanish tapas and flavors of Spain, presented on a Etagere.

Exactly what you can expect at Four Seasons. Great service and food.

One interesting thing is that there is a Hermes shop next to it, and if you sit at corner seats, you got the view of the happenings where people spend tens of thousands of Euros there..

Wonderful experience for drinks and surprise desserts. The bartender German was so friendly and welcoming, he surprised my husband with desserts for his birthday and made wonderful drinks. In addition he gave us local recommendations to try while visiting!

The wine list was not current which caused the sommelier to run a marathon back and forth to the wine cellar. The wine service was accordingly slow but the staff made up for it with several complimentary and delicious tapas and food items. Overall, a lovely experience and an illustration of how great service can make up for a problematic occasion. Kudos to the staff and management training, a good testament to the Four Seasons brand. I switched hotels based on this experience.

Wow! Want authentic local cuisine with m star quality and service with paying an arm and a leg and making a reservation months in advance then this is the place to go. The food, service, and extra courses were amazing! This really made our trip to Madrid memorable.
Wonderful quiet atmosphere with live music from the piano. Service at a very high level. Very distinguished waiters, cuisine worthy of Michellin stars.
Loved the atmosphere, the great welcome, the presentation of the meals and amability of the staff. They make you feel really comfortable and accomodate all of your needs with great succes!

Great experience! We ordered the croquettes, the stew, an omelette, and the tagliatelle. All were great. The stew is a lot bigger than you think! Came in a large pot, enough for 3-4 people. The restaurant gave us two free appetizers, both were very tasty and delicious. The waitresses were very professional, friendly, and spoke English! Highly recommend!
From the moment we were welcomed to the departure, the service from all the staff was exceptional. The food was perfectly executed with some creative twists. Really a hidden gem in Madrid!

A taste of traditional Spain at this place near the Royal Palace. Reserve a table in the salon for a 2PM lunch. This place gets very, very busy, so be prepared for a bit of hectic action. The Regalitos de Torito are fantastic. Everything on the menu very good. Also, for the price, you get a good value.

Beautiful traditional eateries located near the Royal Palace. Very traditional tapas menu with fantastic freshly cooked food. The staff are very welcoming and friendly. Very traditional place you could easily just come for drinks or tapas but I would highly recommend both, we loved it. The wine choices are excellent try the house wine first you probably will be very happy.

(One thing to note, the food is so nice but if you are used to UK tapas portions, you will find the portion sizes here about twice the size of at home so be careful not to over order. That said, they are so kind, the staff will package up food if you want to take away).

The traditional tapas was one of the best I tried, the portion was huge and luckily the waiter stopped us from over ordering. The staff is also very polite and friendly. Overall a very nice dining experience!
A tapas restaurant the Royal Palace of Madrid. The place has a very delicious octopus menu and great view of Santa Maria  cathedral.

Currently construction around the outdoor seating area is a bit distracting but this place is nice and close to the cathedral. Staff was busy but friendly. Food was good. Steak is wonderfully presented and medium well. Cuddle fish has lots to share and cooked well.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Manolita Chen a sushi Asian fusion restaurant that truly exceeded my expectations. From the moment I stepped in, the ambiance was inviting, with a modern yet cozy decor that seamlessly blended traditional Asian elements with contemporary design.The menu is a delightful fusion of classic sushi offerings and inventive dishes that showcase a blend of flavors from across Asia. I started with the miso soup, which was warm and comforting, setting the tone for the meal. The highlight, however, was the sushi. The fish was incredibly fresh, and each piece was crafted with precision. The signature rolls, like the monolita roll and Thai fried rice, were a perfect balance of texture and flavor.What really stood out were the fusion dishes.
Our server, CELINE was knowledgeable, attentive, and clearly passionate about the food they were serving. Whether you're a sushi purist or someone looking to try something new, this restaurant is sure to impress. Highly recommended!

This is our favorite restaurant to order from, they always serve fresh, delicious, and warm food at home. We hope to dine in as well one day. Duck gyozas, miso soup, and pad thai are the masterpieces. Shrimp popcorn is the only food we didn't like. They also have Japanese beers and sake! The box is highly recommended!

I‚Äôve got a total of three times yesterday. The food wasn‚Äôt so good but I‚Äôll give them a chance because maybe the chef wasn‚Äôt there but I think it‚Äôs the best pad Thai in Madrid the Wagyu sliders are incredible the dessert I did not like so much I had like that chocolate one it‚Äôs like it‚Äôs maybe too gourmet for me, the drink was good. They didn‚Äôt have the cotton candy. It was a little too sweet not tangy enough but I‚Äôm gonna keep going here I liked it.

The restaurant boasts a very nice ambiance and stunning interior design. Its location is also great. The food was truly exceptional; I highly recommend trying the cheesecake and shrimp popcorn. The service was top-notch, although some staff members didn't speak much English. Overall, it was a nice experience, and I would definitely go again.

the place was exquisite, it‚Äôs calm since there aren‚Äôt a lot of people that time, the food was incredible especially the sashimi mix & the korean tacos. i recommend this place if you want to have a little bite and have a peaceful afternoon. ü•Ç

Awki Nikkei is a MUST in Madrid!  Amazing fusion of Japanese & Peruvian flavors.  Fresh ingredients, creative dishes, and a vibrant atmosphere.  The service was top-notch, friendly and attentive.  Highly recommend the ceviche and the sushi rolls.  A truly unique and delicious dining experience.  Five stars!

I came her for dinner and it was absolutely delicious. Definitely one of the best Peruvian spots in Madrid. The ceviche was great, the level of acidity and spiciness was perfect. I would‚Äôve preferred actual pieces of sweet potato instead of a pur√©e but it was still good nonetheless. The sushi I tried was delicious, my favorites were the tuna nigiri and the maki acebichado. My friends enjoyed their lomo saltado and the chicken chaufa. (I didn‚Äôt try them) My main critique is that the food took quite a while to come out but the great flavors made up for that so it‚Äôs not that big of a deal. We also tried the tres leches suspiro lime√±o for dessert. The tres leches was nice but the cake didn‚Äôt taste homemade. The suspiro was delicious. Definitely coming back.

I eat a tremendous amount of Peruvian food all over the world; this place is one of the best and most authentic second only to Peru.
Their ceviche is fresh and sauce is made to order, absolutely fantastic.
Try the Pulpo Bao bun or Anticuchos.
Writing the review after a couple visits and must attest they‚Äôre consistent.

Peruvian wine with good acidity goes well with the meat dishes. Try the anticucho. Food was solidly good, love the sudado de pescado. Fish lovers must try. Muchas gracias Jorge and Mafer for the very warm and hospital service. Had a great conversation with Jorge on the recipes. Highly recommended.

My favourite Peruvian restaurant in Madrid. Wonderful food, excellent service (cant remember his name but the guy who handled the reservation via whatsapp and who served me was super friendly), and really nice atmosphere. The tinto de verano and the lomo saltado were delicious. I‚Äôm definitely going back when visiting Madrid.

The food was better than expected, but I‚Äôve never been in a Michelin-guide restaurant where customers are allowed to punch in the table and chant. We are next to a table of 8 holigons, and they were allowed to do anything they wanted. I mean we were in a RESTAURANT, not a bar or pub. Although we warned the waiter and he told his manager, he did not care about us (probably because we were going to pay for only two and they were going to for eight). What a wasted experience! I just feel sorry for the chefs who achieved to serve such amazing plates, as their efforts are ruined by such a poor restaurant management.

I had heard this place was good but it surpassed my expectations. We had the tasting menu. Everything was a party to our senses. Our waiter , Mario , was very professional and knowledgeable. Great value!
Amazing tasting menu.  Very creative cuisine.  Helpful friendly staff.  Cozy space.  Fair pricing.   The Michelin Bib Gourmand is well deserved!

Beautiful place with excellent service and amazing food. Grilled octopus, pork cheek and steak tartare with grilled bone marrow are absolutely outstanding! They knocked me off my feet along with a delicious Basque cheesecake. See you next time Sisapo!

Incredibly positive experience in this restaurant. A five stars in every aspect, and in every dish we tried. Really fair price vs top quality (keep that team Sisapo!)
The staff is not only friendly but truly helpful and honest with the recommendations. We found nuances really well taken care in every dish.
We tried: ensaladilla, vieira (amazing!!!), ceviche, carrilleras (wow!) and chocolate coulant.
A super must place in the city, we'll be back soon

As Chinese people, we‚Äôve tried quite a few things, but we‚Äôve never had oxtail noodle soup like this before. We were surprised by the intensity of the broth‚Äîso delicious! The other dishes also won us over. The chef is incredibly kind‚Äîa clear recommendation!

Great way to end my Madrid mini break ! Great food and great company with dry nice staff and amazing food ! We had the ceviche of corbina, cauliflower with kimchi sauce, duck with a pancake style wrap, noodles called Jackie chan is not Bruce Lee , the chilli crab, nigiri with sardines and eels, all delicious !

One of my favorite hidden gems in my area! I‚Äôve been coming here for years now, it is small and cozy and has very friendly staff. The must here is definitely the duck roll pancakes! Also the steamed open duck dumplings and pork Xiaolongbaos. The owner has a wine passion and offers an extensive wine list. During my last visit, I had a wonderful young eco red blend from Montsant. I‚Äôd highly recommend this place! - just off the busy main street, next to plaza Espa√±a.
Very nice place. Pork dim sum was amazing! Red curry and Wonton very nice but not so great as udon üçú we will come back here definitely.

I absolutely loved this place.
We tried most things on the menu and weren‚Äôt disappointed with a single dish. The waitress that served us (I didn‚Äôt get her name) was also absolutely fantastic and added to our experience

Very nice little industrial-chic restaurant, with cute outdoor seating. The food was off the charts good, especially the chicken skewers. The rabo de toro pad thai was a trip, a very successful fusion of two cuisines - and those two dishes are some of my favourites!

They also have their own cocktails, so of course I had to have one! I only tried the You & Me and it was really delicious, bitter and a little sweet.

PS: If you can't help but wonder why the place is called what it is, then make sure you pay a visit to the restroom.

We had the six dish taster menu. The duck salad and "carabinero" dumplings were the stars of the show. The restaurant is nicely decorated and the bar is classy with good cocktails - the piscos were on point üëç. Service was good - they helped solve an issue with a voucher we had - but things were a tad rushed all in all. The restaurant takes booking for two sittings on busy nights, so allow yourself time to enjoy your experience here.

From the drinks to the food, passing through the desserts and the great environment and staff.
Amazing crab dumplings, curry, ceviche and spicy fish, very very good.
It's trendy and cool, with a great vibe. If you don't like lively places, chose another place, because it's crowded and full of music.
It's medium range, with plates to share with your friends. A must come and repeat for sure!

Very good place for a chill Asian Fusion food.

Very tasty and fairly priced if you get the discount from the reservation at The Fork.

Amazing service and ambiance.  The food is just off the charts good.  The only problem being how to narrow our order to something reasonable for our servers sake.  Nothing disappointed on the palate; presentation and preparation were executed to perfection.  For all my travelers, please stop and try this Spanish and Asian fusion menu to remind you how good things can be when we blend two cultures with distinct culinary identities.

Good things:
üçä Seabass in Bilbao style was amazing.

üçä Welcome appetizer was amazing!!!

üçã The iberico pork came with interesting and yummy sauce.  The service was pretty effective and very professional.

What can be improved:

‚ô° We ordered mille-feuille for dessert and it was really disappointing. The waiting time was long. The dough was hard, dense like a hard, thick puff rather than light. The cream was also hard and blandly sweet [ plus there was something taste like egg stood out too much...I don't know what it was but it reduces the sweet scent of the dish]. Personally, I felt like it lack of contrast of texture in the mouth. The ice cream that served with this dessert was pretty nice.

This fusion restaurant is situated on the flat floor of the five-star Marriott Hotel. According to its website, the menu is crafted by a two Michelin-starred chef. The staff is very welcoming and provides detailed descriptions of the dishes in both English and Spanish.

We tried the Nigiri de steak tartar crujiente, Tartar de salm√≥n con aguacate, and Solomillo de ternera a la brasa con verduras salteadas. All the ingredients were fresh, and the flavors met expectations, though they weren‚Äôt particularly outstanding. For dessert, we ordered the Flan de caf√© con helado de toffee y sal and Coulant de chocolate y pistacho con helado de violeta.

This restaurant is a solid choice for tourists or business dinners, offering a cozy ambiance. However, the food doesn‚Äôt fully justify the price. That said, it‚Äôs worth a visit if you take advantage of The Fork‚Äôs special offer‚Äîour total came to 77 EUR, including drinks and bread.

A Mixed Brunch Experience at Q√ö by Mario Sandoval in Madrid

Q√ö by Mario Sandoval, situated inside the JW Marriott in the heart of Madrid, near Plaza del Sol, offers an intriguing dining experience with a notable connection to the renowned two Michelin-starred restaurant, Coque. However, during our brunch visit, the restaurant left us with mixed feelings. Hopefully, a regular dinner or lunch gives its best.

Location and Ambience:
The restaurant's location is undeniably convenient, especially for tourists exploring the lively heart of Madrid. The modern and tasteful decor creates an inviting atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for a leisurely meal.

Food and Menu:
At Q√ö, the brunch is organized as a set menu, which includes a variety of dishes and small pastries. While the quality of the ingredients used in the dishes cannot be faulted, our overall dining experience fell slightly short of the high expectations set by Mario Sandoval's culinary reputation.

The brunch menu, priced at 65 euros per person, offers a range of options, but the standout elements were the small pastries and desserts. The pastries were excellent and the desserts were arguably the highlight of the entire meal. The inclusion of jam√≥n from the buffet was a nice touch, adding a traditional Spanish element to the meal.

Service:
Where Q√ö truly excels is in its service. The staff was impeccably professional and courteous throughout our visit. They contributed significantly to the overall positive aspects of the experience.

Value for Money:
Considering the location, the quality of ingredients, and the overall dining experience, the brunch menu at 65 euros per person can be seen as a fair offering. However, it teeters on the edge of being slightly overpriced, especially when compared to the diverse dining options available in Madrid at similar or even lower price points.

Final Verdict:
In conclusion, Q√ö by Mario Sandoval is a suitable choice for those seeking a flavorful brunch in a convenient, central location. While the quality of ingredients and the dessert section do not disappoint, the overall experience may not fully live up to the reputation of Mario Sandoval and his two Michelin stars. The restaurant's modern decor and excellent service are notable highlights, but for some diners, the pricing may make it more of an occasional treat rather than a regular haunt. It may not be the top choice for brunch enthusiasts in Madrid, but it certainly offers a unique culinary experience with a touch of elegance.

We ate at QU since it is a part of the JW Marriott.  The restaurant itself was nice.  You couldn‚Äôt see outside for the Madrid atmosphere, but people couldn‚Äôt see inside which has a private effect.

As for the dinner, it was good. I got the cow rib with roasted vegetables.  The vegetables were properly seasoned and the rib was cooked perfectly.  My wife got the mushroom rice with sweet potato fries and she also enjoyed her meal. For dessert we both got the pannacotta and it was a bright and vibrant dish with just the right amount of sweetness.  We‚Äôd eat there again.  NOTE:  This review is for dinner only, not breakfast offered in the morning.

Pork Flank with pear and vino tinto sauce. This was one of the most amazing dishes I have ever had. The pork was tender, light, with little fat. The pear was the perfect compliment to the pork flank in a perfectly unexpected way.
I came here for a quick dinner after travelling in but I wish I had been able to get the full experience with drinks, and set menu but unfortunately time didn't allow. Everything I had was fantastic. Would recommend and if you can, take the time to experience everything the restaurant has to offer.

(The dark chocolate with orange that is provided at the end is amazing too)

Servers weren‚Äôt friendly at all
Food and atmosphere was great!!
But the wait staff didn‚Äôt seem interested in serving us - walked away without saying anything, seemed to have forgotten one of our meals and I had to ask about it and they didn‚Äôt communicate back to us - waited about half hour between receiving one meal and getting the second.
They really soured the experience here.
This place was amazing! The food was delicious! Every dish we tried was bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection. The atmosphere/ambiance was perfect and service was excellent. Highly recommend!

This charming little restaurant is nestled in the heart of Madrid, just a stone's throw from Puerto del Sol, on a lively and vibrant street that makes you feel truly alive. It's a nice spot to unwind. We enjoyed the burrata and chicken tinga tacos, along with a few cocktails. While the place offers both Spanish and Mexican cuisine, I'd recommend sticking with the Spanish dishes‚Äîthey‚Äôre far superior. The cocktails were decent, and the service was excellent. Definitely worth a visit. Open pretty late.

My family and I came for cocktails and tapas, the cocktails were delicious, my porn star martini was one to remember, Andre y Nuria were incredible. Andre was our waiter he spoke fluent English to me and fluent Spanish with me husband. The restaurant is really modern and we will be returning soon. Such a wonderful Sunday afternoon and a lovely time spent with my family!! Wishing them all the luck for the future ü•∞‚ù§Ô∏è
Burrata salad was good. Croquettas were too greasy ‚Äì only little shrimp and lots of breadcrumbs, I did not like it.

Went for a casual dinner with my wife.

The service was good and the dishes were all served on time.

The Sushi was decent but nothing special to be honest. It was priced at a point of a high-end restaurant at 16-18 euros per roll, which wasn't really worth it.

For this price, there are much better options.Value for money 4/10.

Will probably try other spots before coming back.

We had a lunch there with no high expectation, but we ended up loving every bit of it. We ordered too much food actually, because we thought the portion would be smaller (like what you usually get from a cool aesthetic restaurantüòÖ) Service was good, fast, and friendly. We will definitely come back again.

I booked the table with the fork app which gave 50% of discount for most of the menu. I tried there many sushi options, also sashimi and delicious starters. All of them were great quality. Yummy michelada - if you like micheladas you should try it in Sakale. On the top of the great taste the plates' composition is outstanding. Very kind service. Interior decor makes nice atmosphere. Big plus for this place to be open in Sunday evening/ night which is not common in Madrid.

Incredible service, incredible ambiance, incredible margaritas (however they could be more consistent in which glasses they are served!)

This is a nice, consistent place for good sushi at a reasonable price. Super lovely location and the guys running it are professional, nice and super flexible.
The sushi rolls were all delicious (do yourself a favor and order the fantasy rolls!) and the nachos were‚Ä¶ well a novelty - they are fried rice crackers with salmon, tuna and tomato and onion, unusual but absolutely delicious!

The restaurant idea is good but some things can be improved. The dishes were tasty and original but the sushi cut was really clumpsy with thick and really thin pieces. Also we found everything overpriced for what you get.
The service was decent, I would even say a bit unfriendly. Moreover, toilets were really dirty and I couldn‚Äôt find neither soap nor paper to dry the hands.
Nice concept but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend if you want nice sushi.

Food is fine, we did the all you can eat menu and our first dishes came out quick. But after we placed our 3rd round of orders our food took forever to come out, after 30 mins we asked the waitress and she finally reminded the kitchen. This was a little disappointing, especially with the limit of 1.5hr seating time. Would probably not come back!

Portions are also very small.
The buffet is awesome, food is delicious, service is top notch , Carlos one love! He said he will punch us if we order and don‚Äôt eat, so we ate everything. Vibe 10/10

The whole experience is just so satisfying, we chose the buffet all you can and it was the best decision, the food is amazing and the service is so kind and helpful i just have to recommend this place!

In Italy, we often enjoy all-you-can-eat dining, so we were surprised by how different the experience is here. You can place as many orders as you like, but each order is limited to a maximum of six items. If you leave any plates unfinished, you‚Äôll be fined 3‚Ç¨ per plate.

The maki rolls were smaller in size, but the quality was excellent. This high standard applied to every dish we tried. Their wonton queso was insanely delicious and quickly became our favorite!

We highly recommend this place.  üíï
Excellent sushi and wine - we will be back.  Best of all was our server Carlos;  welcoming and personable- the best!

An Unforgettable Dining Experience at Delito Madrid

My visit to Delito Madrid was nothing short of extraordinary. From the moment I stepped in, the elegant yet relaxed ambiance set the stage for a truly memorable evening.

What really stood out was the impeccable service. Carlos, our host for the night, was nothing less than spectacular. His warm demeanor and deep knowledge of the menu made our experience feel personal and special. He took the time to recommend dishes and even shared interesting stories about the origins of some of the ingredients.

Now, let‚Äôs talk about the food‚Äîit was divine. The scallops were a masterpiece. Perfectly seared, with a delicate hint of kimchi that added just the right amount of heat and tang. Every bite melted in my mouth, and it was clear that only the freshest ingredients were used.

The highlight, however, was the seafood platter. The octopus was tender and flavorful, cooked to perfection with just the right smoky char.
Delito isn‚Äôt just a restaurant; it‚Äôs an experience. The attention to detail, from the beautifully plated dishes to the seamless service, made me feel like a valued guest. Whether you‚Äôre a seafood lover or just looking for an exceptional meal in Madrid, I can‚Äôt recommend Delito enough. I know I‚Äôll be returning on my next trip to this beautiful city!

The food, wine and service were impeccable. The owner helped with our wine choices, gave us lots of info about the food and how it was prepared. The croquettes were the best in Madrid. And the most impressive dish was the octopus, so tender, perfectly prepared!
Very good food. The portions are quite big. The  Croquettes are delicious üòã
Great value. Food was outstanding. Best octopus I‚Äôve ever had. Very cool owner who helped us with wine choices and gave us some of his secret recipes. Your secrets are safe with us my friend!

Incredible food, great service, though I was travelling with a Spanish speaker which helped as our waiter didn‚Äôt speak much English. This restaurant is only 8 months old and I suspect will become more popular very soon - we didn‚Äôt need to book, but I‚Äôd book next time I come to Madrid. Would recommend to anyone purely for the fun and showiness of the food, especially the scallops and the smoked octopus (which were both delicious). Restaurant could be bigger but that‚Äôs part of its charm. Overall no complaints from me, 10/10!
This wine bar was absolutely worth visiting. Wine was fantastic and artisan cheese was awesome.

A hidden gem of a wine bar! Great wine selection, knowledgeable staff, and best of all, it feels like being in a children‚Äôs colouring book. One of my favourite places in Madrid and one that people don‚Äôt know about as yet!
Incredible experience. Amazing and delicious tapas, remarkable wines and super high regards for the owner Antonio. Will visit again when we are in Madrid again.

Amazing place for wine with a very unique, light atmosphere. Tapas are included with the drinks.
The words "Just one more!" were uttered many times.
Also good prices!

The environment is unique. I haven't seen such a singular decoration  in a long time! They offer a good selection of beers, great vermouth and a wide range of wines - all of them served with quality tapas. Food was mouth-watering. The 'jabal√≠ en salsa' was second to none and the lobster p√¢t√© was just incredible. Prices were reasonable and the service was friendly and attentive. They only want people to have a memorable time.  A place to come back without a doubt!

We went here to get wine in bulk for family back in the US. This store also has a great selection of reasonably-priced wines. The owner is so kind and helpful! He speaks limited English but it did not stop him from explaining all the wines that we were interested in. He even poured us a glass each of sherry! He talked about wines of all prices and was honest and thoughtful. We loved the experience and would recommend for anybody who wants wine!

Lovely wine, sherry, vermut, and probably liquor shop (I was there for the vermut). LOVELY owner who knows everything about every single product that he sells. He can describe to you the flavor notes, etc. Also has tins of sardines and tuna. Be mindful of the hours: 12-14 and 18-20:30.

Visiting Madrid looking to purchase some good wine, I wondered into this quaint charming wine store. I was welcomed by the charming and knowledgeable man in the store early about 11 AM 10/18/22. I let him know I was looking to take some decent wine back to the states for my picky sister (Napa wine lover). He recommended several selections and gave me the background on the wine regions and how they were produced. I ended up purchasing 4 different selections. The store prices are very affordable (compare to USA) and they had a huge selection of Spanish wines. I highly recommend visiting this location for great wine and fantastic service.  Thank you again for your recommendations and friendly service.

Ruben was so much fun to hang out with.  I was looking around Spain for a very special wine and he had it there for me at a great price.

A special spot for unique and rare Spanish wines, cheese, olive oil, and the little cakes in the window are perfect with a coffee in the morning.  I will stop by next time I'm in Madrid.

We had an incredible experience here with Ruben. He was very accommodating and kind, and spent so much time with us explaining the various regions of sherry. He even let us try a few of the bottles he had open! I highly recommend coming here.
Great little place for a nice glass of wine with something small to eat on the side. Excellent prices too. The wine list offers a lot of variety.

My husband and I recently visited Kaskais and loved every moment of it! The staff and owner were attentive and provided excellent recommendations on both food and drink! The burrata was fantastic as was the jamon and bao! We had a wonderful chat with the owner and he even gave us some a few recommendations for other restaurants in other parts of Spain! We have already told friends to visit this hidden Madrid gem!

After many bars and restaurants that we were disappointed with in Madrid, we came to this lovely place. Pleasant service with an attentive and kind staff, really tasty and successful dishes such as light and fun bread with sardines next to the wine, a varied cheese palette and gyozas. The only thing that needs improvement is the waiting time for dishes
3 nights in Madrid and this place absolutely stood out the most! Great wine selection, delicious tapas & the service was exceptional. Counting down the days to visit again!!!

Really cool wine bar close to the Opera square. Wine list had options from different regions of Spain, very friendly staff, the tapas were amazing and they have a large terrace. We were in a big group and had a tasting with the owner (Raul) which went really well. Highly recommended! üç∑

I recently had the pleasure of attending a wine tasting, and it was an experience to remember! The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the wines we sampled were fantastic. What truly made the experience exceptional, though, was our host. Energetic, knowledgeable, and engaging, they created a fun and interactive environment. His passion for wine was evident, and they provided insightful information about each selection while keeping the group entertained. I left feeling not only more knowledgeable about wine but also thoroughly enjoyed every moment of the event. Highly recommend!
I went to a tasting event last night. Great information about different Spanish wines, delivered in a fun way by Sigfredo. We all had a wonderful time. Ended up buying 2 bottles. Highly recommended

I came here on a whim and it went WAY beyond my expectations. Luke is funny, engaging, extraordinarily knowledgeable, and more than generous with his time. I could not have asked for a better experience. If you want to learn about wines from Spain, you HAVE to come here. 5+ stars from me!!!

Nice little place. We went there before closing at about 9pm and had 1hr to try some wines. This was our way of doing a wine tasting and went quickly through 4 wine types - loved the Albarino and even got some to take out.

Servers were very knowledgeable and warm cracking jokes along the way.

Our knowledge of Spanish wines is now tremendously higher thanks to our visit to Madrid & Darracott.  If you are new to trying wines of Spain, perhaps first time travelers to Spain as we are, consider booking a tasting at M&D.
