A guided tasting of 3 wines (with generous pours) and lots of information about wine regions of Spain will be provided.  The tastings are in small groups (10 or fewer guests) so definitely book ahead online, by phone or of course in person if you're nearby.  Questions are encouraged and welcome and thoroughly answered.
We were beyond satisfied with our experience and highly recommend you take advantage of a tasting with M&D.

I was worried at first because there were some promoters trying to get us to go in(and I never trust promoters since they obviously have ulterior motives to promote something) but I am glad I caved in to their persistent attempts. This cocktail bar is super imaginative and well decorated. My friend and I stayed at the bar and got a few drinks and we had such a great conversation. The ambience helped with that. The crowd inside is a bit older but if you go there with someone you are already familiar with, you will be fine. Something I have to mention is that the state of the bathroom was great! Bars and clubs here in Spain tend to have their bathrooms in the worst condition so I was grateful that this bar maintained it so well. One con about the place was that the downstairs dance floor was EMPTY! My friend and I felt like dancing after a few drinks and we went to check it out and immediately came back up because there were only like 2 people dancing. I think the crowd is just older so they are less inclined to dance. If you want to party, this is not the place to go to. If you want a chill night with fun drinks and good conversation, this is the perfect place! The bartender (Sara?) was also super attentive and very professional. I would say that this is a less touristy and just as high quality as salmon guru and bad company 1920. It just depends if you want a more youthful hip crowd(salmon guru) or a speakeasy experience(bad company 1920) If you are just basing it on drinks, then Lovo cocktail bar is a good place to go to skip the lines and tourists.

Very tasty cocktails and good service.

Unfortunately the music upstairs were too loud that we couldn't hear anything at first. After changing the table it got better, but they should adjust the volume of some speakers that are placed too close to some tables.

the place to go when in Madrid. the vibes are immaculate, the music amazing, the staff great and the cocktails are pure experiences. The menu makes you take the risk of trying something new, and the result is to fall in love with every single drink. one of the best nights of my stay. shoutout to John Carlo, the absolute best!!!

This bar is a must visit when in Madrid! They have 30 unique cocktails to choose from, each with its‚Äô own elaborate presentation. Our bartender, Marie, was amazing, it was so lovely to chat with her and the drinks she made were wonderful. Will definitely come back!

Marie, the bartender at Lovo Bar in Madrid, offers an exceptional experience. Her warm and attentive service enhances the bar‚Äôs inviting atmosphere, making our visit memorable. Guests frequently commend her helpfulness and sweet demeanor, noting that she significantly contributes to the overall enjoyment of the venue. Marie‚Äôs dedication and the bar‚Äôs innovative approach to mixology make Lovo Bar a must-visit destination in Madrid. Ôøº Ôøº

As someone is still trying to understand natural wine, this was exactly the wine store I needed to visit.

The owners were superb, welcoming me as if I was a local.

I heard all about the natural wines in Spain, some of the history behind them and their creators. And I walked out the door with a few of the local natural wines under my arm (to take back to Australia).

Cannot recommend enough if you‚Äôre looking for Spanish natural wine!!

this store is excellent. the owner is wonderfully nice and helpful. i loved visiting here when in madrid to get my natural wines.  the prices are so much better than the states! love you spain. i hope she doesn‚Äôt mind the photo, i had to snag one.

A gem for (natural) wine lovers! Fantastic wine selection from both Spain and elsewhere (great ones from France and Argentina too). Owners are lovely and really knowledgeable - great to hear the stories behind the bottles! Highly recommended

What a wonderful little wine shop! Was given extraordinary and honest guidance to choose a wine that fit what I was asking for. If you're in Madrid and looking for a bottle of Spanish wine to take home for yourself or a gift, do yourself a favor and stop here. Wide selection of traditional and some not so traditional wines, just fantastic.
Amazing store with a great selection and the owners were so friendly and gave many great recommendations for our stay in Madrid!

Lovely restaurant, close to Puerta de Alcal√°. Spectacular wine list, great sommelier, nice atmosphere, nice people.
Food is also amazing, good Spanish dishes with fresh ingredients.
Dessert unbelievable.

First time here but will never be the last time. I fell in love with this place when I entered. They serve good wines and good food, I ordered a black risotto with baby squids and a foie gras for my friend, just amazing can be described.
The dessert is very special, highly recommend this place.

Wow what a place to celebrate my birthday! The atmosphere was cosy, calm, romantic and amazing. The food was delicious and the wine selection was impressive. I even received a free dessert with a sparkler which I thought was very considerate and an added bonus to the evening. Our waiter Augustin was amazing and the customer service was good, I do wish they would be more attentive and top up our glasses of wine, they only did it once throughout the night. Nonetheless a great place to wine and dine. A reservation especially on the weekends is a must. Would definitely come back!!

Wine tasting started off nicely, but the server/manager got busy and clearly forget we were there.  No check in on how things were going and ignored us until I mentioned we were being ignored. 45+ minutes with zero attention.

Too bad since the place is nice and the wines in the flights were well considered.  Maybe we caught them on a down day, understaffed, or with a needy table that demanded all their attention.  Even so, what should have been a fabulous tasting for >90‚Ç¨ for two people, left us frustrated and disappointed.
We have not tasted food, because came for the couple of glasses of wine, but atmosphere and wines selection were just perfect! Thank you!

This place is straight out of Wes Anderson‚Äôs movies!

But looks is not the only thing that appeals here - the selection of natural wines is well curated and there‚Äôre usually several opened bottles on offer. The vibe is nice slash cool, you‚Äôd really want to stay longer.

Small snacks and desserts, all reasonably priced. Easily the best natural wine bar in the area!

Just a piece of advice: pickled onions and Cornichons don‚Äôt go too well with natural wine (they are served as a little antipasti with your drink).
Knowledgable service, great selection of wines by the glass, tasty cheese, cool place
My most favorite wine bar I‚Äôve been to in Madrid. Lovely ambience, amazing service, and the wine‚Ä¶.. the best. Everyone should try this place out:)
Great bar with a fantastic atmosphere! The bartender was incredibly friendly, and the wine selection was top-notch. A perfect spot to unwind!

An amazing little corner on Calle La Palma at the Conde Duque end. There are a few little bodegas springing up around here, and this is certainly one of the best. Great wine and nibbles in a beautifully redesigned cosy nook. The wines are carefully selected and cover a variety of tastes, from traditional Spanish whites and reds (try the godello ;-)) to natural wines from Madrid and beyond, as well as a range of sherries. The waiting staff is warm and welcoming - Anita is delightful. Friday and Saturday evenings can get very busy, so enjoy best during the day when the crowds dwindle.

Great wine bar with a cozy, intimate vibe‚Äîperfect for a date or a meet-up with friends. The music playlist was spot on, and the size of the place made it feel personal and welcoming.

The apple crumble was delicious, and I loved the cozy decor. It‚Äôs in a great location, and I‚Äôd definitely come back, especially in the evening. I was tempted to buy some of their cute merch, so maybe next time!

So happy I finally got to visit this spot.

Had a wonderful experience here! I highly recommend. A very lovely natural wine bar with an intimate atmosphere and wonderful service. Rachel, our server, was knowledgeable about the wine menu, while also giving great suggestions. She was attentive, friendly and funny. Definitely one of my new favorite spots in the city!
The best wine bar in my life, the atmosphere is something incredible and wine is so good!!

Wine,  service and the atmosphere in general are just perfect.
Unfortunately food was pretty disappointing, small portions, not justified by the price and neither from the taste.
I will definitely be back, but only for wine.
Incredible place to go in Madrid. We had a great experience! Good wines, good food and very nice atmosphere! Everything was delicious! We'll be back for sure!

I'm surprised with the negative reviews. I had a great time here. I went back three times in three days tasting many different by-the-glass wines: cavas, blancos and tintos.

As to be expected, quality is a function of price. I tasted a really excellent Valdeorras Reserva which at ‚Ç¨16 is 3 times the cost of their regular tintos (and 3 times the cost of a bottle of Campo Viejo in El Corte Ingles, but I would not touch that) but it was served in a proper bigger glass to savor all its complexities. I couldn't finish a bottle anyway so it was a deal for me.

When I went back the next time, I asked for tintos that were similar in quality to the Valdeorras and they recommended me two Ribera del Dueros which were excellent too. Next I asked for their "good" blanco and it was similarly excellent.

I'm Asian with an Asian face and I was not discriminated or anything. And yes, you could eat your pintxos on their desk if you asked them.

Really horrible service from a very unpleasant, arrogant man, who when asked for a menu said "I am the menu". He insisted that none of their wines were "natural", despite us seeing many natural wines in their display. They should really think about hiring staff with proper wine knowledge, who treat their customers with respect instead of contempt.
They have a huge selection of wines, and you‚Äôd have a difficult time choosing a bad one. Their bottle prices are a bit high, but a better deal than the individual glasses.
Thank you Igermo for fantastic service, knowledge and suggestions of wine for Madrid and our travels. You have been the highlight of our trip in Madrid.

It's nice that they let you taste before you buy but I don't think they quite understand what your taste in wine is. Anytime we described what we liked, they gave us something very different ( something okay but not what we were looking for). In our experience, the more experienced the sommelier, the better they can match your taste in wine.
Excellent place for having a drink and high quality tapas! I'm also a part of the wine clubüç∑and highly recommend joining for those interested in quality for price üòÅ
Lovely staff, great atmosphere, great tapas and wine. Came here alone and felt welcomed
I went to an event. They have vermut de grifo and serve bruschettas with different toppings. The owner is really nice and welcoming.

What a great experience with knowledgeable staff. They accepted a foreign stranger (myself) and made her feel at home. The wine selection is excellent, and if you‚Äôre keen on trying different reds or whites, this is the place. If you‚Äôre interested in more than the board (on display) they offer a great wine selection. I highly recommend this place as a visitor visiting Spain for the very first time.

This is my favourite wine bar in Madrid! They have great small plates and a constantly changing list of interesting wines for great value, and the service is friendly and personable. Highly recommended!

Excellent Italian food. The menu consists of traditional dishes which are freshly made by using the best products. We had caponata, lasagna, pizza and cannolo siciliano. All of them were excellent and served quickly. The staff is very kind and attentive.

We arrived super early to this spot (thanks to our jet lag). They still sat us right away and brought complimentary tapas. The truffle pizza was delicious. The server was very friendly and gave us some great travel tips. We were really impressed to see him serve other customers in English, Spanish, Italian, and a few words of Japanese. He created a very welcoming atmosphere that clearly keeps people coming back. Highly recommend!
Great place for a nice dinner with friends! The wine list is huge and the staff is great at recommending wines based on the customers‚Äô preferences and taste! The food is delicious!
Great food with perfect wine pairings thanks to the very knowledgeable waiter.
This place is the best, great food and wine and the servers are super friendly. You won't regret spending an evening here!

The atmosphere is great, nice service and menu is limited. Wine goes from soft to strong in the menu. I think the strongest pne has 19% alcohol. We tried them all and left drunk. It was really nice in flavor. Also you can smell the oldness of the bar and rust once you are in. The way they take your order is really unique. Definitely must to visit

Easily one of my favorite spots in Madrid, and one of the most unique. They have five sherries on deck (served from the barrels) and a simple but amazing list of tapas to pair them with. Highly recommend pairing the "fino" or "Manzanilla" sherries (these are the lighter ones) with a side of mojama (cured tuna). The palo cortado, amontillado and oloroso are all very interesting, but very pungent, so ask for a taste before ordering one.

This old school spot has a strict no-photo policy, so follow the rules and enjoy your stay at this Madrid institution!
Been coming here for years during my tourist visits, nice selection of sherries, rustic atmosphere, and always crowded. Don't try tipping as they'll refuse to take it.

On a walk home after dinner came upon this shop and decided to stop in for sherry. Loved the ‚Äúno cameras‚Äù signs everywhere, clearly they are trying to ward off the instagram influencer masses and it works. It seemed like a meeting place for friends.

Sherry/manzanilla was about 2 euros, with a few different options. They also brought you olives and peanuts and had a few snacks for purchase. They don‚Äôt accept even small tips. Paid in cash, wasn‚Äôt sure if they even take a card.

You can sort of imagine not much has changed in a 100 years in this place. Seemed like a special little place. Service was good, they track your tab using chalk on the bar.

Went here yesterday. I had read about it online and was excited to go with my friend. The sherry and the tapas are cheap and nice but the service was horrible. An older bar man who looked at me without any expression whatsoever and expected me to know that was my invitation to order and then a young woman who was unbelievably rude because I tried to order two portions of salchichon in Spanish and I guess I didn‚Äôt get it quite right. Totally ruined the experience and I wouldn‚Äôt recommend going here if you are a tourist. They seemed quite jovial with the other clientele-all of whom were Spanish.
Amazing vegan tapas brunch. We loved the mushroom mixto croissant, both egg dishes, and the salad with parm. We came for the breakfast buffet. For sweets they are intense but so good.

Didn't like that the restaurant required a 30 Euro deposit to reserve a table for 7 people. The service was  slow. It wasn't the server's fault he hadn't been properly trained to answer some basic questions about the dishes. The atmosphere was very nice, comfortable, and a place you can have some good conversations without a lot of noise.
The food was very tasty, just not very generous portions; we would have liked a little more for the mains that cost ‚Ç¨15-17 each. We especially liked the Parmigiana di Melanzane and Flautas de Patata.
Although the mango "crumble" wasn't what you'd expect, the desserts were good, at ‚Ç¨8 each, higher than the average, but I guess that's necessary when they're only using plant-based ingredients.

I would say this is the best place to eat vegan that I have been in my life. If some of your friends say to you they don't like vegan food bring them here.
And they are pet friendly!!

The burger was one of the best I have ever had since going vegan 5 years ago. The mole was amazing. The potatoes were perfectly salted. Truly the best vegan food I have found in Madrid after 4 months of being here. I went around 1pm and easily got a table by myself. The service was friendly. Will definitely be back
Delicious food and nice staff. I didn't realize that the egg I was eating was actually tofu. They absolutely nailed it.
If I am charge bread seperately, I would like to upgraded it higher. Other than that it was perfect diner.

A very varied menu where you want to try everything. As a starter we had some very original 'croquetas' (aubergine, honey & goat's cheese) and a portion of Andalusian fried squid with 'alioli' (but not enough alioli). For mains we shared a 'pica√±a' steak which conveniently came in two pieces. We had a misunderstaning over an accompanying sweet potato or fries and ended up with both! For dessert we continued to share: an excellent mousse made with Peruvian chocolate.

They are still experimenting with wines from Argentina and we had a couple of glasses of a good full bodied red from Mendoza.
The service was efficient and friendly and, as we live nearby we'll be back to try other appetising dishes from the menu.
Juan, our server, was extremely nice and attentive to detail.  Food was exquisite and fast serving, good portions. My sister and I shared a mushroom Ravioli and a Chicken Parmigiana with salad.

Such a wonderful experience! The service, atmosphere, and food were all tremendous! We couldn't have been happier with how well we were treated and how tasty the food was!

Perfecto!

The host was super friendly and welcoming. Unlike other places in the area. As we were not accepted in the places nearby because we were not looking for food. (Only drinks).

The atmosphere is amazing. The kindness of the host towards my little daughter made a huge impact.

My fianc√© and I ate here on our first night in Madrid. It was an amazing start to our trip! The location was great, with a huge terrace seating area next to a lovely & peaceful plaza. Our server was phenomenal! I wish I‚Äôd asked for his name because he was so helpful, spoke perfect English, and gave great suggestions (like the Avantum Roble red wine). The food was a bit more expensive than a lot of the other restaurants we ate at the rest of our trip, but we felt that the quality was worth it.

The food was excellent. Our last supper in Madrid and it was awesome! We ordered the rigatoni and the marinated salmon with a side of seasoned patatas bravas. It was all very flavourful! This restaurant was definitely a good pick as the customer service on point, the ambience wonderful and not too busy as it's not on a street that attracts alot of foot traffic. Pleasant dinner experience for sure!
5 stars but would have given it 6.  This was a great restaurant in all aspects.  The waiters were very nice, the food was excellent and the terrace right in one of the best places in Madrid..
We spent New Year‚Äôs Eve here and the food, service and atmosphere was amazing. The owners join the party and they had a DJ turning the restaurant to a dance floor at midnight.

My family of 4 went twice to Amici‚Äôs. It was my favorite meal in the city. The Burrata is insanely good and the Tacos Peking Duck are insanely good. All of the food that we ate here was delicious. The octopus was a little salty the first time we ordered it but the second time was perfect. Our waiter both times, German, was extremely friendly and attentive. Highly recommend

Very good, similar to a fine dining tapas experience. The ordering per mobile phone was bit challenging as the menu did not have the english option, but the staff was so friendly and helped us a lot. We have tried a mixture of world kitchens fusion with Spanish cuisine. Atmosphere was also very lovely and well decorated. If you are a tourist or local does not matter, I can totally recommend it!

Great food (Roast chicken burger was amazing, I could've eaten 2 or more). Lily and Laura were fantastic (they spoke Spanish, I spoke English) but it all worked out great !!! I like that you can take all the time in the world, sitting / eating / drinking / chatting - repeat.
Would definitely visit again when in Madrid. If you haven't been yet, then you MUST !!!

Should you feel like trying a tasty novel experience, then this is the place to check out.
The concept, the service and the food won't let you disappointed.
Before proceeding you will need to be sufficiently comfortable ordering all your food and drinks from a digital menu and will need to make sure you bring a mobile device, with a decently charged battery, with you.
Only time will tell if this could be a possible scenario of tomorrow's restaurant.
Wow, I didn't expect the food to be so delicious. Also, the ambience is really hip. Definitely worth visiting it.

We have stumbled on it by accident and were very glad we did. It was rather different experience to our usual dining but definitely recommend. Our waiter Ivan was amazing and super helpful. Definitely will go back .

The rating is overhyped. Just the one I ordered, the scrambled eggs taste horrible, too salty. Becon is not is in really good quality, overcooked. The pancake is also a bit over cooked, the coffee tastes too bitter‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt understand where the rating came from to be honest‚Ä¶

What a delightful find! We were staying nearby, and the lines for another breakfast restaurant a block or so away were so long that we went here instead- and we could not have made a better choice!

The giant stuffed bears were a really cute touch, and bears are even featured on the very cool glassware. The food was delicious, and the service was speedy and super-friendly!

Food is just as expected, very tasty, and full of proteins. There is also a good choice for all kind of preferences.
The protein shakes are also perfect.
And matcha and coffee are on top too!
Nothing to say on the food üòÑ
Service is also very good, very smiley people, and kind!
The atmosphere is also perfect with soft music, people are not speaking loud - perfect place to work from or simply have good food!!
Will come back!

I loved this place and visited twice in my short trip to Madrid. Very unique decoration and vibes. Food and service were super good. Staff were kind and smiling. They explained to me the menu and were so helpful.
Coffee was super good too.
Cozy and calm place for brunch. Food was served pretty fast and I could discuss how to change the dish according to my diet. Nice, polite and smiling staff.

We visited this Madrid bistro twice on a three night trip. We didn't book and drop ins were welcome and accommodated. It had a great menu, with plenty of options for an adventurous diner, as well as someone more set in their ways! And it was super value with an offer of a set price for three courses that was very attractive. The food was delicious and the portions generous. The wine menu had lots of Spanish options and was well priced. I'd recommend D Diego to anyone visiting Madrid.

Can‚Äôt rave enough about this place! We stumbled upon it by accident, and did we strike gold! The food is absolutely incredible, homemade, tasty, and the portions are just right. Amazing experience from beginning to end. The duck confit and the meatballs are particularly incredible!

Loved my squid ink squid with rice.
Egg omelette with chips and sausage isn‚Äôt what I asked for and a bit ghetto or teenager food.

Service was overwhelmed with 7 tables.
Local place as such my poor so my poor Spanish was a bit hard to communicate.

This is a classic Madrid restaurant, with a wide variety of dishes - we've been here several times and are always happy with the food, as well as the great service. Best to get a reservation so there is no waiting. The onion soup is fantastic, as are the alb√≥ndigas!

We would like to thank Hernando for his hospitality and making us feel so welcomed. He really took his time suggesting dishes he thought we may like and made sure our dining experience was pleasant. Very homey restaurant with authentic dishes. We will definitely visit again when in Madrid.

I was expecting something good from the pictures.

First, they serve a bad meat as picanha. Don‚Äôt fool people. If they know what‚Äôs picanha, they will get upset.

Food take quite long to arrive.

The frying happens in the same place as the bar, so there is a strong smell of frying and you will smell like that.

It‚Äôs not properly Brazilian, the flavors are ‚ÄúBrazilian inspired ‚Äù. Don‚Äôt expect to eat local Brazilian food
The Coxinha was really nice. The frango was okay to me. The service was prompt and the atmosphere was casual.
Brazilian paradise close to Gran V√≠a and close to the heart of every single customer that enters it. Amazing service, tasteful food and great drinks. Nobody should miss it!

Found this restaurant in the back streets of Gran Via while doing some shopping. It‚Äôs a great hidden spot to grab a drink, have lunch or dinner, they accommodate bigger groups too. The place is modest but fulfills your every need, Diego who runs the place is very professional and courteous. We had the dadinhos de tapioca which were the star item, highly recommend! We also opted for the picanha meat and grilled chicken breast; they were great and the portions were generous. Definitely worth a try!

The food was delicious, I love it :)
My friend also loved her chicken plate. It is one of the best restaurants in Madrid. The place is cozy and they have a very friendly staff.
